column5: GROUNDFLOOR IN WESTERPARK + WIFI and a comfy bed
column6: Feel at home alone or with max 4 persons during your visit in Amsterdam in this ground floor well located apartment, 5 - 8 minutes walk to the center and its cultural venues and we are well serviced by public transportation. A fine base to explore Amsterdam, Haarlem and Zaanse Schans. Cab can be arranged from the airport. Lots of restaurants in the area and the Westerpark at about 100 yards where festivals and Fashionweeks are held.
column7: Sometimes you can book for one night if available in between 2 bookings and if so you can always send a mail and ask. The apartment offers a living and a bedroom, kitchen and a small bathroom.  It is on the ground floor so no stairs with your suitcases. The center is about 8 - 10 minutes walking to the Noordermarkt. Central Station is a bit further and about 25 minutes walk and 8-10 minutes by bus. In the apartment you will find: • FREE WIFI  • A kitchen with a dishwasher, microwave, four ring cooker, coffee machine, Senseo (no Nespresso), toaster, juicer and fridge • No need to climb the stairs • Also a big closets and comfy bed • And the stack of information they got before arrival • What guests liked less is the small bathroomarea • And no real garden then just the Westerpark itself • a child friendly apartment  • King size bed for 2 + sofa couch for 2 • Extra closet for clothes • A hairdryer, an iron and board • Clean towels, sheets, pillows, duvets • Bike rent nearby (50 steps) •

column11: A standard check in is between 15.00 - 22.00 but if possible we are flexible; just know that after 22.00 pm we will charge an extra 10,- euro's.
column12: If you want you can have a cab to pick you up@ Best to send a mail to Ruud Leenhoven and I will send the address after booking. Public transport you have 2 good options: 1. Bus 397 to the Rijksmuseum and then tram 5 till the last stop or 2. Train to Central Station and then bus 21. The train has sometimes problems because of the tunnel so inform yourself or check the monitors before buying the ticket. You can buy a regional ticket (valid for all buses and trains and trams in Amsterdam) on the airport. Do this before leaving the airport and you have bought yourself an extra glass of wine during dinner....
column13: The whole house is yours during the stay
column14: During your stay I will help out where needed.
column15: House rules You are very welcome in my house and I hope you (and your friends) will take good care of everything I have put in for your comfort. NO SMOKING indoors and and please play tv, radio or music on a normal level and  normal hours.  Check in and out is mostly flexible but a good communication is essential.
column25:
Born in Makassar and lived in Singapore for 7 years as a child on the Tannamera Road; lived in Israel in a kibbutz and I love music, books, walking, travelling, theater and to meet people from all over the world. 
My way of travelling ....... 
I used to work in a theater and still go too often...
I love hosting and tell my guests a lot about Amsterdam, the city I love so much.

column6: My home is in a quiet alley just behind the Dam. You'll be in the middle of everything but still enjoy a good night sleep. With a spacious living room, open & fully equipped kitchen, extra large bathtub, separate shower you'll be very comfortable.
column7: A modern 90m2 one-bedroom apartment with all comforts. Large living room with fully equipped open kitchen, bathroom with rain shower and large bath, bedroom with electric shutters for darkness and silence. A balcony with a lounge corner.  The location is literally 50 metres from the Dam Square, the center of the center of Amsterdam, from which everything is at walking distance. (or biking distance!). You can walk to the Anne Frank house, the Noordermarkt, de boutique shops in the Jordaan, the Central Station, the Waterloo square, Rembrandt square and so on. Also, there is public transport connections to everywhere.  Because I work abroad a lot (I work as a film director), this seemed like a great way to rent out my place when I'm not there. It's really a super comfortable house and quiet even though it's in the middle of the middle of Amsterdam.     Please contact me if you're interested. I'm really flexible in terms of check-ins and timings.  Best, Willem The whole apartment, no shari

column11: If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Please note, to bring this amount in cash since it goes straight to the Host for the late hour. Hopefully you can make it before the late fee deadline, but this way, we can accommodate you even if you don't. Thanks for understanding! There is a cat living in this apartment, but he will be on a holiday as well when you arrive. He will not be there!
column15: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we may have to charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. --------------------------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check
column25: I'm from Amsterdam. I work as a film director for features, commercials and music videos. I travel a lot for work, so Airbnb is great way to share my place when I'm gone.

column10: The Canal Building is located on the corner of the Keizersgracht and the Negen Straatjes (the nine streets) area, intersect the main canals between the Leidsestraat and the Jordaan district, and are dotted with great restaurants, cafés, art galleries, jewellers, boutiques and vintage stores. With an exceptional array of styles, trends and prices, this area is truly a shopper’s paradise. Spui tram stop is a 5-minute walk and offers easy access to Amsterdam Central Station and lively Leidseplein. The Amsterdam Museum is 10 minutes’ away walking. The area offers variety of restaurants and traditional Dutch pubs. You are in a walking distance to most of the city's popular attractions. Shops, restaurants, trams, bike rental and all you expect from a city trip you will find right here.

column12: Here is some other information that can be useful for you when deciding on booking my flat or already have!   Museumplein in Amsterdam 2.7 km This pretty square always crowded with people features a large park bordered by impressive museums, including the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum is 15 minutes by tram.   Dam Square in Amsterdam 0.7 km Amsterdam's lively Dam Square offers you sights such as the Royal Palace, a neoclassical artwork and former home of the Dutch Royal Family.   Windmills at Zaanse Schans 11.6 km Visit and get to know more about these traditional operating windmills, a real must-see attraction of this village near Zaandam.   Schiphol Airport is less than 20 minutes away by train. By renting out this flat, it can easily reach the rest of the city by public transport and it is 5 minutes walking distance to the Dam

column7: Beautifully furnished and very spacious apartment situated in a safe district of Amsterdam. The apartment is a combination of modern, industry and classic design but more important it is a comfortable apartment. It is centrally located, in a quite street which brings you in 25 minutes to Schiphol Airport and with use of rented bikes minutes away from the cities main attractions: the famous Vondel Park, Anne Frank Museum, Madam Tussauds. column7: This is a cosy and well decorated apartment at a great spot! We spent a lot of time in thinking of the perfect interior for this apartment. It is along the Amstel, only few minutes by bike from the city center. To us, the Amstel is the greatest spot to live, especially in summer. It is a little more quiet than in the heart of the center, but you can easily walk to the Utrechtsestraat (one of my favourite shopping/dining streets in Amsterdam). The apartment has free WIFI, a bath, two sunny balconies, a beautiful view, a lot of light and well located for public transport.  Our favourite coffee places in the neighbourhood are: Beter en Leuk ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) Coffee Bru ( (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Our favourite terrace in the neighbourhood is: De Ysbreeker along the Amstel ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) A great place for coffee, breakfast, lunch, drinks and dinner. column13: - Wireless internet - private bathroom and toilet - private terrace - coffee and tea in the room - small fridge with free drinks - tourist information - 360 view
column15: We try to welcome you and say goodbye anytime, but it's not always possible to be there. When you have any questions during your stay, just knock on our door or give us a call. The room is private so you can get in and out.
column16: Check in after 14:00 Check out before 12:00 Ofcourse you can leave your luggage at the boat, when you arrive earlier. And if the guests before you check out early, you even can check in earlier,  when the room is cleaned, and vice versa.    We always welcome you and show you in when we are at home! Breakfast is not included but on walking distance you can have breakfast everywhere, or buy some food in the local supermarkets and bring it to the room and serve it on the terrace! On saturday morning,from 8:30-9:30 there is a bakery at the end of the Silodam with fresh crossaints! Don't throw paper in the toilet, but in the trashbin next to it! Let us know if you need anything, we live downstairs
column25: Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands
column26:
Eltjo works as an event producer and just started his own company in organising special tours in Amsterdam.
Liselore en is setting up a bussiness with handmade kids clothes from Bali. We have 3 boys, in the age of 6, 5 and the little one is 15 months. 

In 2013 we bought the boat " The Calidris". The main reason to live on a boat was to stay in the city, but still had enough space and above all, freedom. It feels like a little community in this street, because the boat people hang out together, help eachother and know eachother well.

We are very happy to live in such a special place in Amsterdam, enough space, nice views, but still connected to the city! We like cooking together, traveling with our 3 boys, designing our home, making boat trips. 

In 2014 we started our B&B. Where you sleep now, it used to be the captain's cabin. We immediately removed the stairs, so we do not miss the space at all. It as always a dream for me to run a little boutique hotel. Nowadays we don't run a hotel, but a pittoresque B&B, which we really enjoy. It is fun to meet people all over the world who mostly have a great time at our boat. When you would like to see how houseboat-people live just knock on the door and we will show you around!

Enjoy your stay!

column10: Rivierenbuurt literally translates to ‘River neighborhood’. It's name stems from the fact that most of the streets here are named after rivers in the Netherlands. This neighborhood was developed in the 1920s for Amsterdam’s middle class. It was part of architect Hendrik Petrus Berlage's ‘Plan Zuid’, and was considered quite an architectural wonder in those days. Even today, architecture buffs find their way around the many examples of Amsterdam School architecture. The homes here are larger than in other inner-city neighborhoods, with spacious apartments, often on one floor, big enough for families. Just before WWII, many Jewish refugees lived here and it’s here where Anne Frank spent her years before she and her family went into hiding.
column12: Closest Tram/Bus Stop: Victorieplein (5 minutes walk) From Victorieplein you can take:   Tram 4 to Amsterdam Centraal, Dam Square, Rembrandtplein, Redlight District, Heineken Brewery Tram 12 to Leidseplein, Museumplein, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, de pijp Bus 65 to Amsterdam Zuid Train Station Bus 62 to Amsterdam RAI Train Station

column10: The neighborhood is vibrant and hip. There is great restaurants and bars walking distance away and you are 20 minutes walking from De Hallen, which houses a beautiful food stall hall, a cinema and little boutique shops. There is also an outdoor market close by. 20 mins public transport to center. 10 minutes from Anne Frank house. Rembrandtplein and Leidseplein (the main squares) are also very close by as well as Museumplein where you will find the museums. The cute area of the Jordan full with boutiques and little traditional Dutch cafes (Bruin Cafe's) Is also walking distance away. The street is predominantly professionals or young families. It is a very safe and clean area.  There is parking spaces on the street but you must pay the meter.
column12: There is tram stops close by the house that will take you to the center in 10 minutes. Trams are regular and reliable.  It is also recommended to rent a bike as everywhere in Amsterdam is reachable in a short time, by bike. There is bike rental stores close by the apartment. There is great restaurants and bars are walking distance from the apartment. It is very easy to get to/from the airport, just take the train from the airport to Sloterdijk Station and from there the tram 12 to de Rijpstraat.

column25:
Hi guys! 

My name is Carli! I am from Scotland but have been living in Amsterdam for 6 years. I love to travel, half of my family are from Malta so I have lived and worked there for a while before I went travelling around Europe. It was in those travels that I discovered Amsterdam and fell in love with this city. I just knew I had to live here.

My two other passions in life are good food/cooking and hiking in some of Hollands beautiful parks, forests and beaches.

Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicult
column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.

column25:
My name is Yvonne, a 24 year old woman from Amsterdam. 
I love to travel and to see more of the world and experience new cultures. 
My profession is theatre management and i have worked for the Dutch Dance Festival and Over het IJ Festival. Also i worked for a few smaller companies. 
I like to meet new people and i am very open to everyone. 

I have traveled to:
China, Malaysia, Singapore, Egypt, Europe and will be traveling in South America. 

I like to read books, go on hikes, watch exciting series and listen to lots of music and discover new things, new food, new cultures, new people and so on! 

When i stay in your apartment i will be very neat, i like to clean up and keep your home tidy and clean. No mess around me ! :)

Iambnb is taking care of everything while we're away.

column25:
Hi,

Meet our Rental Valley team, we host this property for it's owner. We bring beautiful locations and guests together, so that you can explore the area from an authentic and safe homebase without any hassle.

It is our top priority to make sure our properties are always sanitized, cleaned, and disinfected prior to guest check in. During this time we are committed to ensuring our guests feel confident in their stay and would like to inform you that our housekeeping checklists meet cleaning standards. Please reach out with any questions regarding COVID-19 and your stay.

We will contact you directly from our Rental Ninja system with further details about your check-in and stay, keep an eye on those emails!

If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us.

See you soon!
Team Rental Valley

MY MOTTO: Life is too short to do useless things. Go, see, learn, enjoy, meet, experience, share and care.

ABOUT ME: Cheerful, happy, enjoying life, sharing, caring, sporty, thoughtful. Enthousiastic and interested in the world around me. Good laugh and full of useless facts. Bit quiet in the morning hours.

MY INTERESTS: I have a continuous interest in learning about sustainable, self-sufficient, balanced and responsible ways of living.
I love good food and good conversation, love dancing, being outside and being active. My most precious time of the day is watching the sunset.

LANGUAGES: Fluent in Dutch and English, medium in Spanish, French and German.

column15: General house rules apply to the apartment: - No loud music, noise or other nuisance in the apartment - No smoking in the apartment or in the common entrance - No drugs - No house parties, no persons permitted in the house except for the people who have booked (after midnight) - For the loss of keys, we charge 20% of the security deposit - CLEANING: We will take care of cleaning so no need to vacuum or mop the floor but please make sure that the dishes are done and the garbage has been put out on the street on the last pick up day (see information book in house) or dumped in a trash container outside) -If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Thank you for understanding.
column25:
Hi, my name is Ellen and I would like to introduce you to my friendly apartment! 
The apartment is situated in the East of Amsterdam in a nice and quiet residential street, quiet enough to provide a relaxing stay but very convenient if you want to access the evening and nightlife that Amsterdam has to offer. 
It was originally built in 1981 and recently renovated in 2016. It maintains a classic Amsterdam character whilst providing for all modern living needs. 
The east of Amsterdam ('Indische buurt') is on the one hand a gentrified area where you'll find lots of lovely coffee places and restaurants, shops, parks and a cinema, and on the other hand the authentic multicultural neighbourhood with lovely small eateries and the market. The atmosphere is lovely and you won't be overloaded by tourists, like in the city centre. 
The trainstation (Muiderpoort) is around the corner, only 25 minutes by train from the airport. Public transport: train: 8 minutes to Central station, trams to Leidseplein (15 minutes), museumquarter (20 minutes) etc. 
I hope you will have a lovely stay and enjoy being in Amsterdam!

column10: from (URL HIDDEN) "Apartments in De Pijp are a popular option for those who are looking to rent in a central location, while retaining a "neighbourhood" feel. De Pijp is a lively district which is located close to the centre of Amsterdam and also offers plenty of its own attractions. The area is renowned for its friendly bars, bustling pubs, and cosy live music venues. As one of Amsterdam's most culturally diverse areas, De Pijp also boasts an impressive range of dining options (including some legendary Moroccan restaurants), while its legendary Albert Cuyp market sells everything from clothing to bikes and fresh groceries. The residents are a lively mix of students, young working professionals and "old Amsterdammers" – all of whom offer a warm welcome to new faces! Apartments for rent in beautiful traditional Dutch houses Behind closed doors, the streets of De Pijp hide some of Amsterdam's most charming rental apartments. The architecture in this neighbourhood is based on traditional

column25:
Hello, 
I am happy to welcome you to the beautiful, historical Amstel Townhouse in the lovely De Pijp neighborhood of Amsterdam. The house, which was built in 1893, is overlooking the calming Amstel river and Lutmastraat street, one of Amsterdam's architectural attractions. The house also has a lovely gated garden. 
I hope you enjoy your stay and I will be there in person to assist you with making your stay as comfortable as possible. An assistant is there to help me keep up with communication as well so all your questions and booking inquiries can be answered as fast as possible. 

Welcome to wonderful Amsterdam!

Safe travels,

Wouter

column10: This neighborhood is made of little islands that are connected by bridges. This gives it a very authentic feeling and it feels cosy. Also this neighborhood is great for just walking around as it is very photogenic. Great location: one street out of the city centre, one block away from the masses. Lovely authentic area: surrounded by water, canals and islands. Lively bars and restaurants around the corner. Close to Jordaan. The Jordaan is a famous district in the center of Amsterdam. Originally it was a working-class neighborhood, but now the Jordaan is one of the most expensive locations in Amsterdam. Most of the streets and canals are named after flowers and trees. It is a cosy neighborhood with many traditional cafes, art galleries, modern art and specialty shops and restaurants. Many houses have inner courtyards, the courtyards were built by rich people for elderly women. There are 3 markets in this district; the Noordermarkt, there is a market at the Westerstraat and at the Lindeng

Amsterdam's Jordaan is probably the most famous neighbourhood in the Netherlands.  The Jordaan is nothing but highlights. Maze-like streets offer hidden courtyards, cafés (traditional but also trendy), art galleries and pleasantly noisy neighbours. One also has access to some of the more scenic outdoor markets in the country. In particular, Noordermarkt h
column10: Amsterdam's Jordaan is probably the most famous neighbourhood in the Netherlands.  The Jordaan is nothing but highlights. Maze-like streets offer hidden courtyards, cafés (traditional but also trendy), art galleries and pleasantly noisy neighbours. One also has access to some of the more scenic outdoor markets in the country. In particular, Noordermarkt has a flea market on Monday mornings and an organic farmer's' market on Saturdays. There are many more modern, trendy bars around Noordermarkt and along Westerstraat and Rozengracht. The side-streets that run south of Westerstraat have recently developed into a strong culinary district with some of the city’s more highly regarded restaurants.

column6: A small beautiful modern appartment with terrace and roofterrace in lively and cosy Eastside of Amsterdam. The popular neighbourhood offers a lot of nice restaurants, bars and shops. The Amstel kanal is only 1 minute walk away. Ideal for a couples.

column15: DO'S & DONT'S It's a quiet place so please stay in harmony with the building and apartment. -Respect the neighbours, so when entering the house please don't scream or do anything that can provoke complaints -No personal belongings allowed in the main hall or staircase. Only in the private area in front of the apartment door -No house parties  -Nobody is allowed accept the people who booked the apartment. If you are planning this please do let me know so I can decide if I can make an exception  -Smoking is only permitted in the outside areas -Don't take any personal belongings from the house -Please try not to damage anything -Don't wear high neeld heels in the house or any shoes that will create noise or damage to the floor -If extra cleaning is needed due to extreme abuse of the building these costs will be confiscated -If you want to turn on the heater in the bedroom make sure nothing is on top of it - Please turn off the lights and turn down the central heater when leaving the apart

column6: We are Erjen & Heleen and we live in a beautiful apartment on the ground floor with a nice & sunny garden. The neighborhoods 'the Baarsjes' and 'Bos & Lommer' are lively, but the apartment is quiet. Perfect for your visit to Amsterdam!
column7: Our 60m2 apartment has a bedroom (140x200), a kitchen, a bathroom and a living room. Also, we have a second bedroom which we currently use as our storage room. However, if you want to stay with 3 persons instead of 2, it is possible to make use of this room as a second bedroom. We have a spare matrass (120x200) available. Both the kitchen and the two bedrooms give access to the garden. Concerning the time for checking in (12pm) and out (11am) we can be flexible if notified in advance.
column8: We are Erjen & Heleen and we live in a beautiful apartment on the ground floor with a nice & sunny garden. The neighborhoods 'the Baarsjes' and 'Bos & Lommer' are lively, but the apartment is quiet. Perfect for your visit to Amsterdam! Our 60m2 apartment has a bedroom (140x200), a kitchen, a bathroom and a living room. Also, we have a second bedroom which we currently use as our storage room. However, if you want to stay with 3 persons instead of 2, it is possible to make use of this room as a second bedroom. We have a spare matrass (120x200) available. You can make use of all the rooms and facilities in our apartment. The only part which you will not have access to is the atelier in the garden. We want you to feel at home during your stay in Amsterdam and enjoy our beautiful city as much as possible. Feel free to reach ou
column10: The apartment is located on the border of the two vibrant and upcoming neighbourhoods 'De Baarsjes' and 'Bos en Lommer', in between the two parks 'Rembrandtpark' and 'Erasmuspark'. There are several bars, restaurants and local shops just around the corner at the lively 'Mercatorplein', 'Bos & Lommerplein', and the 'Jan Evertsenstraat' as well as the 'Jan van Galenstraat'. 'De School', a recently opened venue for food, sports and underground clubbing is only 300metres away, next to the swimmingpool 'Het Mercatorbad'.  When traveling by bike, bus or tram it will only take you 15 - 20 minutes to get in to the famous Jordaan-area, the Westergasfabriek, the Foodhallen, the Ten Kate Market, the Vondelpark, the citycentre or Museumsquare.
column12: Public transport is available at walking distance. Several buses and trams can take you to wherever you want to go within Amsterdam. The closest trainstation is Amsterdam Sloterdijk, but there are good connections with Amsterdam Zuid, Amsterdam Lelylaan and Amsterdam Centraal as well. If you want to experience Amsterdam the way the locals do (it is also the fastest way to explore Amsterdam); you can a rent a bike e.g. at the Mercatorplein (walking distance).
column13: You can make use of all the rooms and facilities in our apartment. The only part which you will not have access to is the atelier in the garden.
column14: We want you to feel at home during your stay in Amsterdam and enjoy our beautiful city as much as possible. Feel free to reach out to us in case you have any questions on the apartment, the neighborhood and/or the city.
column15: It is not allowed to smoke in the apartment or to bring pets. Smoking can be done in the garden.

column6: Welcome to my 2 bedrooms apartment in a peaceful location in the trendy neighbourhood of Amsterdam Oost! In a modern building, this 2 levels 81m2 apartment is very cosy and comfortable.
column7: It is my own flat where I live the rest of the year with my daughter :) I am a visual artist so it is decorated in a simple but personal way mixing vintage and modern elements. The eye-catching part of the apartment is the open living room and kitchen on the top floor + balcony. It is very bright, spacious and cosy :) My kitchen is well equipped, it is a very lovely room to be in, open and light :) The main bedroom has a super good quality bed of 160 x 200 cm and the other room has a one person bed of 90 x 200cm (it is my daughter's room so it also has a lot of toys :)))

column10: The district of Javaplein is very animated (but the flat is quiet :) with many hip bars, the Dappermarkt market, the Flevopark park at the end of the street, nearby the Eastern islands (Java, Borneo, KNSM) very interesting architecturally.
column12: 15 min by tram or bike from the centre (Waterlooplein, Rembrandtplein) Central station is about 20 min direct by bus 22 (stop Molukkenstraat). tram 14 & 7 stop in front of the building (stop: Soembawastraat)
column14: I am either in my studio in Amsterdam or travelling but always reachable on my cell phone, as well as friend/contact in Amsterdam :)
column15: You will access the entire apartment, we hope you will feel at home! I arranged the apartment with a personal touch and care, with is an extensive collection of books about art and architecture: feel free to browse through :) but we kindly ask you to respect our private belongings. The apartment is definitely child-friendly, with a child bedroom and the possibility of having a baby bed and stroller. It is a NON-SMOKING apartment in all the rooms: NO WEED NO DRUGS (tobacco only allowed on the balcony) Party are not allowed, as it is a quiet building.  Please leave the flat clean and tidy as you found it :)

column6: This is your home away from home. Our apartment is a true gem, designed with lots of love. It's light & spacious, nearby a beautiful park, supermarkets and shops. It's a quiet & peaceful place, only 10-15 min away from city center. You will love it!
column7: Our apartment is beautifully designed, spacious and light and has a white wooden floor. It has a spacious but cosy living room, a living kitchen and a yoga room if you want to relax after a busy day in Amsterdam.  Our kitchen provides an oven, a dishwasher, an espresso coffee machine, a watercooker, blender for your morning smoothies, fridge and a lot of kitchen tools. There is a cosy dinner table for 4 persons.  The livingroom is excellent for relaxing and reading with it's beautiful blue sofa and the vintage carpet. And if this is not enough place for relaxing just use our yoga room (with a mat) for a deep relaxation. On request there is also a possibility to use an inflatable bed for a 3d person in the yoga room.  There is free high speed WIFI, and you can also use our little music system. The bedroom is white and minimalistic and has a double bed (1.40m by 2.00m). We ask you kindly not to use our walk-in closet as we will leave all our personal belongings there. We will create a pl

column10: Bos en Lommer in Amsterdam West is a buzzing neighbourhood. It's a nice mix of trendy places with traditional Turkish and Moroccan restaurants and groceries. There are several trendy and cosy café's and restaurants: Het Wilde Westen, Hartje Bos, Mozaïek or Terrasmus and Buurman & Buurman are just few to mention.  The apartment is next to the Erasmuspark and also close to the trendy Westerpark with it's Sunday Market. Both parks are great for a morning run or a relaxed sunny walk. Just around the corner there are supermarkets, a biological grocery, several yummy bakeries, drug stores and shops with Moroccan, Turkish and African groceries. Whatever your heart needs.
column12: The apartment is situated in Amsterdam West, in Bos en Lommer. By bike it is only 10 minutes to Jordaan or the city centre. There are several trams and busses that bring you within 10 minutes to the city center. For example: bus 21 to Central Station, bus 15 to train station Sloterdijk that connects directly with Schiphol airport, tram 14 to Dam square, Rembrandtplein or Artis Zoo and tram 7 to Leidseplein. PARKING! The apartment is close to the P+R located at the Bos en Lommerplein. Parking in a P+R car park costs only € 8 per 24 hours - with a maximum parking time of 96 hours. This fee includes FREE public transport to the centre of Amsterdam for a maximum of five people. If you are staying longer then 96 hours we advise you to pay and leave the carpark within the 96 hours, and then enter the carpark again, so you can enjoy another 96 hours of parking!
column13: You can use the whole apartment except the walk-in closet. We will create a place for your clothes and belongings in the yoga room. Also we will provide you with towels and bedlinnen. You can use everything in the kitchen (tools, food and spices) but please try to leave everything clean and to use it with respect.
column14: If you stay at our apartment we will not be there but if you have any questions, you can reach us any time by email or sms.
column15: We live here and we love our apartment. That's why we ask you to treat it with the same respect as we do and leave it in the same condition as when you arrived. Please use water, gas, electricity wisely and think of the environment.  No smoking is allowed in the apartment!!! You can smoke on the balcony. We kindly ask you to respect our neighbours so please try to keep the noise down, especially when entering the complex.  No parties!!! We ask you kindly not to use our walk-in closet as we will leave all our personal belongings there. We will create a place for your clothes and belongings in the yoga room. Thank you! Please do not accept any mail packages from the mail man, only the house owner is allowed to do so. No additional guests are allowed without approval. If you loose the key or accidentally take it with you when checking out, we have to charge €100,- for replacing the lock and making new key cuts.
column25: Born in Sarajevo. Grew up in Berlin. Living and working in Rotterdam with my boyfriend and our lovely dog. Yoga studio manager. Graphic Designer. Yoga teacher. Sun-lover. Art-lover. Nature-lover. Vegetarian.

column7: Enjoy a spacious and bright apartment with big windows so you could enjoy great sunrises and sunsets. East side of the apartment has a marina view with a lake, floating houses and boats.  Master bedroom windows are on the east side which makes it easy to wake up as sun goes up.  Sitting area, kitchen and dining room are united creating whole lots of living space. Balcony is big too so you could enjoy having breakfast or drinks outside when the weather is good.  Kitchen has all necessary appliances and cutlery, so would be a good fit for people who love to cook. There's also a teapot, microwave oven, oven and induction stove.  Bathroom has a shower cabin, a bath and a sink with a mirror. Toilet is separated from the bathroom. It's very quiet in the apartment due to double glazing and you could barely hear any noise from outside. The neighbourhood is located on artificial island and half of the windows are overlooking beautiful marina with floating houses and boats. Beautiful sunsets are

column7: It's a ground floor apartment, including a garden. We have 2 bedrooms. There is a open kitchen area with the dining space. A coffee machine and coffee is always available to make sure you start the morning good!

column5: Comfortable House for Family with Small Children
column6: The house is near the center of Amsterdam and Central Station, the trendy NDSM-wharf and nature reserve Twiske. The house is ideal for young families. Besides trips to the busy center of Amsterdam, you can choose to relax around the house. The neighborhood is very kids-friendly, with a playground  in front of the house. Parents will enjoy this clean, newly built house because of the spacious, fully equipped kitchen, cozy mini garden and relaxing bathtub. Besides, parking is free.
column7: A warm inviting living space with  bamboo flooring and funiture of all ages: chique antique cabinets and kids-proof couches and dining chairs.   The well equipped kitchen enables you to make a delicious meal.  Prepare favourite recipes from home or (why not try a little) Dutch cooking with local spices from the nearby convenience stores and supermarkets.  Small children will enjoy the toys and the various playgrounds in the neighbourhood. Kids and parents will enjoy a swim in the canal besides the house.  Of course there is wifi to relax and stream a movie.

column10: Amsterdam North has  it all. Very close to the city centre, by car, bike, bus or ferry, and still the look and feel of a village. Visit the former industrial NDSM Warf that often is the stage for festivals and art, and also montly the biggest flee market of Europe is hosted in one of the old shipyards. But the NDSM Wharf is also a place full of nice restaurants like Noorderlicht,  Bistro Noord, Loetje, IJ-Kantine  and the best urban beach: Pllek.   Amsterdam North is one of the coolest neighbourhoods of Amsterdam. Visit  Café de Ceuvel a circulair creative hotspot. The Noorderpark is great to relax and play. Film museum EYE  has not only good films, on sunday morning movies for the little ones, but also a beautiful view from the terrace.
column11: Please be informed that the neighbourhood is very child friendly and full of small children. Please keep in mind to be quiet during the evening.
column12: Visit by car, cab or public transport. When you arrive from Central Station take the (high frequent) bus to Molenwijk. It is possible to use our bikes, including a cargo bike for children under conditions. Please do not hesitate to inquire.

column5: Quiet and inviting apt in "Old South" (Oud Zuid)
column6: Welcome to our home in one of Amsterdam's most popular areas! Soak up the warm atmosphere in our renovated apartment in a lovely and tranquil area in classy "Old South". Public transport (tram and bus) within 2min walk. We live within walking distance of the Vondelpark and the museum district is 10 min by tram. Great variety of restaurants and bars around the corner. Small Saturday market just one street away. A perfect choice for your stay in Amsterdam. We're looking forward to welcoming you!

column25:
Hi! My name is Zsa Zsa. I was born in St. Maarten (carribean) and grew up in The Netherlands. I work at a luxury 5* hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. Traveling, for fun, for culture or for work has always been one of my passions.
With my French partner I enjoy good food, wine and while traveling I always search for unique little places within a destination.  
I would enjoy offering my hospitality to you when visiting Amsterdam and share with you Amsterdam's special places for you to create unforgettable memories!

column7: Our newly refurbished 120 m2 two floor apartment is a cosy home for families, couples or smaller groups. On the top floor we have a spacious and light living/dining area. Perfect for eating and hanging out with the whole bunch. We love to cook and have a fully equipped kitchen. You can hang up the hammock to have the best spot to read a book or hang up the swing for lots of fun. From here you have easy access to the rooftop terrace, so you can have breakfast or a barbecue with stunning views over the city.    The lower level holds three bedrooms, bathroom, separate toilet and laundry room. The master bedroom has acces to the large balcony and is situated on the quiet garden side of the building. It has a walk-in-closet for your comfort. One bedroom with lovely balcony is equipped with a bed that can easily be transformed into a kingsize bed. The other bedroom has a double bed. column10: Although the centre of Amsterdam is so close, don't miss out on the highlights of this neighborhood. This characteristic 19th century borough is the latest hotspot and you can find some of the best bars, restaurants, shops and cultural highlights.  There are so many nice places to eat or go for a drink, you would not have to leave the neighborhood at all to go out every night. To go out and dance, local favorite Hotel Arena is really close.   The Dappermarkt was voted best market in the Netherlands, so you better get your cheeses and delicacies there. Then go for a picknick in the Flevopark, where you can join the neighbors for a barbecue on a sunny day. Or even take a swim in the lake. The park has a lovely distillery where you can choose from over 40 liqueurs and gins to enjoy. There are several city beaches closely.   The area actually has too much attractions and activities to name them, no matter if you are a fan of culture, the outdoors, shopping, partying or active holidays. We
column11: Our apartment is on the 3rd and 4th floor, accessible with typical Amsterdam style steep and narrow staircase!
column12: Our house is ideally located in a lively neighborhood and only 10 minutes from the centre. A train station, trams and buses all within a block take you anywhere. You can get to Central Station in 5 minutes by train. But try exploring Amsterdam like the locals do: by bike. The bike rental is around the corner.   Train station Amsterdam Muiderpoort is 5 minutes walking. From Schiphol a direct train takes you there in 30 minutes.  If you arrive by car, make sure to park outside of Amsterdam. Paid parking is applicable within the city.

So for great restaurants and culture you are at the right spot in this part of the city.
column11: We have a lovely pair of cats and they need to be fed on a daily basis to keep them happy. Very, very happy.
column12: Getting to the apartment is easiest done by Bus (from Central Station take bus 32 to 'Buikslotermeerplein' and hop off at 'Purmerplein') or by cab, which will cost you around 20 euros. column15: - Our home is only suited for families, couples and business trips. - Please respect the house and the neighbourhood: quiet time after 9 pm. - Check in after 15PM/ Check out before 11 AM Early check-in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) (only when available) Late check-in between (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) (only when available) - Let us know your estimated time of arrival ánd departure as soon as possible. - No smoking inside  - No loud music	 - No parties - No drugs - No guests In case of breaking one of the rules you will be charged with a penalty of €200 per broken rule.
column25: Hallo I am Adrie. With my teenage daughter I live in a nice, residential area in the North part of Amsterdam. I am excited about renting my dear apartment to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam. This part of Amsterdam is like a village in a big city were children can play in the street and our cat can walk freely in and out the house into our garden. We enjoy to live in this friendly street and go to work/school on our bicycles in the city centre. You can also take the bus to the city centre in 10 minutes. We hope that you will enjoy your stay in our house a much as we enjoyed staying in Airbnb-houses from other families in Rome, Paris and New York.

Living room & Kitchen The kitchen comes with a wicrowave  oven, a large fridge and freezer, a five burner gas stove and a tea and coffee maker (coffee and tea are available for your convenience). Lots of pots, pans, glasses, dishes, cutlery etcera is available so feel at home and use whatever you need! The living room has a beautiful wooden kitchen table with 4 convenient chairs, a large sofa and a Smart TV with Netflix! There is superfast WIFI for you to enjoy throughout the whole house.  Bedroom In the bedroom you will find a queensize bed (Auping, 2,10 x 1,60) and two (brand-new) single beds (Ikea, 2,05 x 0,80). The apt. is 68 m2 and consists of 2 large rooms, a convenient bathroom (with bathtub, separate shower and a second toilet) and a huge, sunny terrace.  Living room & Kitchen The kitchen comes with a wicrowave  oven, a large fridge and freezer, a five burner gas stove and a tea and coffee maker (coffee and tea are available for your convenience). Lots of pots, pans, glasses, dishes, cutlery etcera is available so feel at home and use whatever you need! The living room has a beautiful wooden kitchen table with 4 convenient chairs, a large sofa and a Smart TV with Netflix! There is superfast WIFI for you to enjoy throughout the whole house.  Bedroom In the bedr
column10: The location is very central. You can reach every city highlight by foot, bike or tram in 10 - 15 minutes. It is located in the trendiest street in hip & happening 'East'. Many great bars and restaurants are literally just a few steps away. Be sure to check out Louie Louie, Bar Bukowski, de Biertuin, café Kuijper and Milo (amongst many others). You can also find lots of supermarkets, a shopping center, a daily fresh market (the world famous Dappermarkt) and lots of specialty shops at walking distance.  It is also located directly next to the Oosterpark which is great for your Sunday morning work-out! Downstairs from the apt. there is a famous traditional Chinese massage salon. Great for a relaxing massage after all the sightseeing!
column12: Three trams stop directly in front of the house: - Line 9 brings you to Central Station and goes straight through the center (via Waterloo square, Dam square, Flower Market, Jordaan) - Line 7 brings you to Leidseplein (Leidse Square) - Line 3 brings you to Rijksmuseum and van Gogh museum Muiderpoort Station is just a five minute walk away and has a direct train (only one stop = 5 minutes) from Central Station. This is the quickest  way to reach the apartment when you arrive. There is also a direct train from Schiphol Airport to Muiderpoort Station. Ofcourse, the nicest way to see the city is by bike! There is a rent-a-bike right in the street of the apt.
column13: You have accesss to the whole apartment and the terrace. The apartment and the terrace are at the first floor.
column14: You can reach us easily. We live in the neighbourhood. We are local and have lived in Amsterdam all of our lives. We can give you great advice and tips about sightseeing, transportation and the best places to have dinner and drinks.
column15: Please note that smoking (weed and cigarettes) is strictly forbidden!  No loud music and noise after 10 p.m.!

column10: I'm in a very nice part of Amsterdam; The East! Walking distance from the Amstel station, so very easy to reach.  Ethnically diverse and strikingly spacious, Amsterdam East is known for its wide streets lined by monumental 19th-century buildings, as well as its vibrant cultural mix. With plenty of opportunities for shopping, eating and drinking, the area boasts an exciting selection of trendy clubs, traditional Turkish bakeries, Surinamese supermarkets and Middle Eastern lunchrooms as well, of course, as the beautiful Oosterpark and the majestic Tropenmuseum. Amsterdam-Oost (Amsterdam East) is a vibrant, multicultural neighbourhood not far from the city centre, and is home to the beautiful Oosterpark and the majestic Tropenmuseum. This green neighbourhood is known for its wide streets with monumental 19th-century buildings, the finest of restaurants and an exciting cultural offering. Wibautstraat is where you’ll find the cooking pioneers Restaurant C, for example, and the lively Volksh
column12: Arriving at the airport, follow the train signs. There are yellow vending machines where you can buy a ticket. Depending on your arrival time, you take the intercity or sprinter to Central Station or Amsterdam Zuid or Amsterdam Bijlmer Arena. From Central Station you take metro 51, 53 and 54, from Amsterdam Zuid you take metro 51 and from Amsterdam Bijlmer Arena you take metro 54. They all go to Amstel Station, where you get out. It will take 30 - ­45 minutes including the walking to my place. From Amstel Station, you walk to my place (650m) in 6 minutes. Walk to the front of the station hall to the side where there are shops. You take a left and cross the station square. Walk straight ahead towards the restaurant Dauphine. Go to the right and then to the left (Wibautstraat). Cross the Wibautstraat at the traffic lights and go to the right after the canal, then turn left to Hofmeyrstraat. By taxi: arriving at the airport, you follow the taxi signs. Once in a cab, it will take about 20

column15: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we may have to charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. -------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check-in: - The check-in

column7: When we bought this lovely 100 year old apartment, we rebuilt the space to our own unique style. We are always busy collecting cool one-of-a-kind objects to make our place even more beautiful. The apartment is situated on the 3rd floor, which makes the living space very light and a great place to hang out. We have a sunny balcony on the southern side and no buildings in front of our house, so a spacious view on the street. We recently changed our apartment with a nice stairs going up to the attic room where is the bedroom and has acces to the back of the house with a very nice terrace.

column10: Besides the park and market, our neighbourhood offers a lot of bars, good quality restaurants, (organic) grocery stores and boutiques within walking distance from the apartment. It is one of the most multi ethnic neighbourhoods in the city centre of Amsterdam.
column11: We own a dog, so if you have a strong allergy for dogs, please let us know and we can discuss if our place is suitable for you to stay. OUr dog never enters the bedroom though, and we do not have carpet but wooden floors. There is one rug though.
column12: Although De Pijp has a lot to offer within walking distance, you will have a great connection to public transport. Rijksmuseum, Van Goghmuseum or Anne Frank House is about 20 minutes by tram. Any other location in the city is reachable within 30 minutes. There are several bike rentals around the block. If you arrive by plane, you can be at our place within 30-40 minutes by train/tram. Of course taxi's are available at the Airport as well.
column13: We offer our apartment as a whole, so yo will be able to make use of the whole apartment. The staircase is a shared one, like almost everywhere in Amsterdam, so you might meet one of our neighbours when going out or coming home.
column14: While you stay at our lovely place we are probably on holiday, but we can stay in touch via cellphone, (Hidden by Airbnb) or email. You can always call us when needed.
column15: As we offer you our private house, we hope you will treat it as your own. Please respect the neighbours when playing music and by not making too much noise on the staircase. (Amsterdam houses can be noisy)

column6: Welcome to our home, welcome to 'Oost'!  As one of the most loved districts of Amsterdam, popular for its hip bars and restaurants, 'Oost' also has two beautiful parks for you to stroll around in and has a very fine mix of vibrant streets and lots of quiet and peace in our busy city.  Our apartment has the same fine mix of vibrant colors and tranquility and we invite you to enjoy your stay in Amsterdam in the bright 73m2, 2-bedroom apartment we call home!  More info below :)
column7: Hi! Welcome in our bright, fully furnished 2-bedroom apartment in Amsterdam-East ('Oost'), a lovely area full of cafes and restaurants, with quick and easy access to most of the tourist and local sights our city has to offer. There are excellent metro/bus/train connections to anywhere in the city – or..  be a Dutchie for a day and rent a bike.
column8: Welcome to our home, welcome to 'Oost'! column10: Our neighborhood is called the ‘Dapperbuurt’, famous for it’s regular market the Dappermarkt (mo-sa). The neighborhood is part of the district ‘Oost’ and is located on the border from City Center, Oosterpark-area and the very pretty Indische-buurt. It's full of life, bustling during the day hence to the market  but very quiet at night – and on Sundaymornings . It's also right next to three of Amsterdam’s best nature spots Oosterpark, Flevopark and the famous Artis Zoo and her botanic gardens (Hortus Botanicus).
column11: Verdict: Be welcome in our home. Wake-up in our comfortable home, have breakfast on the south-side balcony, watch the vendors set up their stands on the Dappermarkt, get on your bike, drive through the Oosterpark straight into the city center, and enjoy!  If you have any further questions, don’t hesitate to send us a message.  Doei doei,  Harmen & Sophie
column12: The tram lines at the end of our street, or just around the corner, take you anywhere really quickly during the day, and early in the night. It’s just 16 minutes to Leidseplein or 12 to Rembrandtplein. Otherwise night busses frequently stop in our area throughout the night (Though you'll probably find yourself within walking distance from home most nights anyway). Also, your arrival from the airport is smooth and easy with a train station (Muiderpoortstation) in a 5min. walking distance. From there it’s just 25 minutes to Schiphol airport, or 6 minutes to Amsterdam Central Station.
column13: Our apartment is all yours to use, as long as you keep in mind that we would like to find it in the state we left it. So please be gentle with it ☺  You’ll find a spacious living area, in a semi-open space with the kitchen and partly indoor balcony. This main room is accommodated with comfortable couches and seats, a big diner table and some green-leaved friends. The kitchen is fully equipped with a big stove/oven, a dishwasher, micro-wave and big fridge.  There are two bedrooms for you to choose from; they both have cozy double beds, writing desks, and some closet space and free clothes hangers. (Try to figure out which room is who’s.. Is it Harmen’s or Sophie’s?)  (Optional is the sleeping couch in the living room of course)  The bathroom is equipped with a shower, sink and a washing machine. You’ll also find some fresh towels there, drying racks and space to store your toiletries. We have a separate toilet, with a small sink and something to read!
column15: - Please keep the noise down, especially when entering the complex. After all, you share the building with other people living there. All in all: we kindly ask you to respect your neighbours; - We guarantee a clean house when checking in. When checking out, please leave the apartment closely to the same state as it was provided to you, in order to avoid double cleaning charges; - No music after 22:00; - No additional guests allowed without approval; - Make sure to turn off the lights, heating and gas nozzle when it is not needed - the environment will be happy =) ; - May the bad luck occur that you loose the key or accidentally take it with you when checking out, we have to charge €100,- for replacing the lock and making new key cuts.
column25:
Hi!

I'm Harmen (26, Dutch) and I’m living/studying/working in Copenhagen. 

I love music & arts, and enjoy a little spin on the racing bike once in a while.

column10: Great food shopping and restaurants: lobster, turkish, vegan, thai, indonesian, pizza, bagels, coffee. 5-10 min walk to these parks: Erasmus, Westerpark, Rembrant. column10: This apartment is located in the City center! Walking distance from all important attractions. It only takes 5 minutes to reach Dam Square and main shopping street of city 'Kalverstraat'. There you can find all the stores of the main shopping brands! Within 7 minutes you will be able to reach the '9 straatje' shopping area. This area is known for its unique shopping boutiques and cozy Cafe's. At Central station, you will be able to take the train directly to Schiphol airport or the tram to other parts of the City. After a 15 minute leisurely stroll from the apartment, you will be able to reach the Leidseplein or the Anne Frank House in the historic 'Jordaan' District. Here you will a find various restaurants and cafes to relax and enjoy the iconic canals of Amsterdam!. At the 'Leidseplein' you can enjoy a nice coffee at the cafe's or a cocktail at clubs surrounding the square. In other words, this apartment is perfect for your stay in Amsterdam! You never need to take public transport

column15: Please be aware that this is a residential building. In order to maintain a good relationship with the neighbours and other guests, kindly respect the following rules and pass those on to your fellow travelers (Website hidden by Airbnb) It is forbidden to smoke and/or to use recreational drugs in the apartments including the balconies! According to the current law, softdrugs may only be purchased and used in coffeeshops. Failure to comply to this rule will result in a € 500,- fine and you might be asked to leave the apartment and will be liable for additional cleaning costs. (Website hidden by Airbnb) It is also illegal to cover the smoke detector(s). This disrupts our fire alarm system and causes a safety hazard. If the fire alarm system is set off by this, by smoking, candle burning or anything else, caused by the guests, you will be charged with a € 500,- fine and you might be asked to leave the apartment. ●  If damages occur, the costs will be deducted from your security deposit. column6: Our house (a bungalow of 140 m2) has all the comforts you need and is located in a green, peaceful neighborhood in Amsterdam Southeast, an 8 minute walk from the metro, which brings you to the center of Amsterdam in 15 minutes.
column7: Our light and spacious living room with conservatory looks out over the big sunny, private garden (70 m2). Our big dining room table (seats 6 people) is a lovely spot to have a sunny breakfast and/or dinner. The living room also contains 3 comfortable couches, a large bookcase (with Dutch and English literature as well as children’s’ books) and a nice TV (Netflix!).  Our house is a bungalow and accessible to wheelchairs. In the large kitchen you may find everything you need, such as a dishwasher, a Quooker, a microwave oven and a 6 burner stove with double oven. The master bedroom has a king size bed and a walk-in closet. Room Two can be used by 2, maybe even 3 people. We have a big airbed, suitable for one and a camp bed for a baby or toddler (both including bedding). This room can easily fit 3 adults if you bring your own extra airbeds. Our bungalow is child friendly with lots of toys (since we are grandparents :)) and we have two high chairs you can use. The bathroom is very modern

column10: Amsterdam Southeast is a unique area with a very diverse, multicultural population. Our bungalow is situated in the green area called the Bijlmerweide. Within 5 minutes of walking, you’ll find yourself in a nature reserve called Diemerbos. During the week there are markets throughout Southeast, with many exotic products and a lively atmosphere. From July 16th to August the 5th the famous Kwaku summer festival will be held every weekend in the Nelson Mandela Park nearby. This festival is famous for its music, football, great food and drinks and unique atmosphere.
column11: Our bungalow is located near nature reserves such as the Diemer Bos and the Gaasperplas. Perfect places for walking, hiking and cycling. We have two bicycles you can use (one gentleman’s and one lady’s). Beautiful old places like Weesp, Muiden, Abcoude and Ouderkerk aan de Amstel are near. And don’t forget the villages and places around the IJsselmeer, like: Volendam, Edam and Enkhuizen!
column12: Our house is located within a few minutes of metro station Ganzenhoef. The metro will take you to Amsterdam Central station in less than 20 minutes. At the edge of our neighborhood you will find the bus stops for buses that bring you to IJburg (new district with interesting architecture), for example, and the Dappermarkt in East (lively market). From our house you can access the Amsterdam Ring Road and motorway in 5 minutes. There is free parking in our neighborhood and you can also use our garage.
column13: Our whole house is at your disposal, except for one room, where we keep our private items. But we’re sure that the room won’t be missed. You will have the house to yourselves when you stay here, but we will be there at your arrival to welcome you and show you “the ropes”. We can also pick you up from the airport or train station when you don’t come by car (small fee). We will keep in touch by phone and/or email and since we are staying in Holland, we can come “to the rescue” within the hour, if you need us.

column5: 4 bedroom apart. Great for families! Close to RAI
column6: Spacious and bright apartment, 4 bedroom apartment in Amsterdam Old-South (200 m²) next to the Beethovenstraat. Shops and cafés are just around the corner. Museums, Vondelpark at walking distance. The apartment has three floors with  two sunny balconies facing south and a fully equipped kitchen. Very suitable for families with children, but also for business travel or small groups of friends.
column7: Spacious and bright apartment in Amsterdam Old-south next to Beethoven Street . Apartment spread over three floors with two sunny south-facing balconies. Great for families with children. Spacious living room with fireplace, dining room with open kitchen fully equipped with 2 ovens, stove, dishwasher. 4 bedrooms and 1 bathroom with bath, shower and double sink. The apartment is located in the Beethoven neighbourhood in old south. Near all the shops and a short distance from museums, concert hall, Vondelpark and Zuidas business centre. Tram 5 has a direct connection to the center. The apartment is on the second, third and fourth floors. The bedrooms are suitable suitable for both young and older children, but also for adults (3 bedrooms equipped with double beds). The presence of children stuff (games, books, lego..) in the apartment makes it very suitable for families with two or 3 children who want to enjoy the city.

column10: Old-South is a quiet but lively neighbourhood, only ten minutes from the lively city centre (bike or tram). The tram stop is only 1 minute away (and as we we are located in another street there is no issue with noise). There's a good Supermarket (Albert Heijn) just next door open 8-22hrs every day except Sunday (10-20hrs). There are two bakers just round the corner, a nice Starbucks, a "Le Pain Quotidien" and if you want to treat yourself about a 10 minute walk you will find a true french artisan baker "Le Fournil" and right next door one of Amsterdam's finest cheese shops L'Amuse.
column11: Minimum stay 3 nights (2 nights on request).  If you stay for  a week or more, we can arrange a  special deal.
column12: If you like cycling and are accustomed to cycling in cities, the bike is the easiest mode of transport. From our house it's only 7 minutes to the Van Gogh museum and the a couple more to the city centre. One a nice day, you may even fancy taking a stroll. Grab a latte and a croissant just round the corner and venture into town. En route, you can also hop onto a tram (make sure you have a valid travel pass or buy on in the tram).  If you generally prefer public transport, then just 100 meters from the house you can find the tram number 5. The tram takes you into the town Centre to Central Station (25mins). Tram 5 goes via the Van Gogh Museum, Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum and Leidsequare.  Amsterdam South Station, which has an excellent connection to Schiphol Airport, is only five minutes by tram 5.
column13: Private access to entire appartment situated on 2nd, 3rd and fourth floor.
column14: We will not stay in the appartment during your stay, but will make sure there is someone at hand if needs be.
column15: No pets, no smoking inside, ideally no shoes inside although we understand that is not always possible, respect the neighbours with regards to noise.
column25: Hello dearest visitors, we are Kirsten, Nick, Liam (11), Fay (10) and Kate (7). We are a Dinglish (Dutch-English) family living in the old south area in Amsterdam. We are passionate about travelling, other cultures, good authentic food and the outdoors. As hosts we hope that we can add to your experience here in Amsterdam, not only through our appartment, but also by prodiding you with the tips and advice that are relevant to your tastes (restaurants (suitable or kids), clubs, concert venues, parks, shops, attractions for kids, musea, galleries etc). Between the two of us we speak Dutch, English, French and German fluently. Between us we do ok with Italian.

The city center is easy to reach with public transportation or by bike (15 minutes).
column7: We have a two floor apartment. column10: In the neighborhood there are plenty of parks (with swim opportunities), supermarkets, shops, bars, restaurants and more.
column12: The city center is easy to reach with public transportation. Across the street there is a bus station (Bus #18 taking you straight to Central Station) You are also a 5 minute walk from the Metro Station (Postjesweg) going to main train stations and down town.  In a 12 minutes walk you reach the train station Lelylaan, from which you are at Schiphol in 6 minutes. By bike, everything is close and provides a great way to explore the city. You can rent bikes at the Mercatorplein (7 minutes walk).
column14: If there are problems or questions we will be available via email and telephone. In addition, family and friends live close to solve any acute problems.

One bedroom with a bunk bed and bathroom with shower is also to be found at the main floor. On the second floor (actually 5 floor of the building) Is one double bedroom/suit, second bedroom and bathroom with bathtub. column10: We love our neighborhood because of its closeness to amazing dining, well selected wine store in our building and restaurant George (French bistro) just around the corner. You will also find two  well sorted grocery stores within 5 minutes walk.  Beautiful Vondelpark is one block away where you can enjoy a morning walk or run (one lap is 3.3km). The airport bus stops just 700 meters from the apartment (Haarlemmermer station)  which only costs 5 euro per person.

column5: Cosy apartment | 2 bedrooms & a balcony | Jordaan
column6: Light and cosy 2 level apartment right next to the Anne Frank house, 10min with tram/bus from Amsterdam Central. In a quiet street with shops around, it consists of 2 bedrooms, living and balcony in the south. A perfect central location for your stay.
column7: A newly refurbished 2 level house in the middle of the famous Jordaan area. Surrounded by canals, museums like Anne Frank's House, tasteful restaurants, bars, trendy shops, and much more around the corner. From this house, every spot is walkable, otherwise a bike rental and the canal boat stop are around the corner.  The house is only 15 years old with good isolation and in a quiet street, you will find complete peace and quietness inside.You can stay here with max 4 persons, making use of the 2 bedrooms with 2 double beds. Furthermore, it has a comfortable livingroom, a nice kitchen that's fully equipped and a newly refurbished bathroom. This apartment has also a very nice balcony on the south for  fantastic whole day sunny with a beautiful view of the Westerkerk.  Perfect for an unforgettable stay in Amsterdam!

column10: The central location of the apartment is a big plus. You can walk to nearly all the sights. It is conveniently located near the Central Station, 9 Streets, Damsquare and the Red Light District. Walking distance from the 9 little Streets in the area Jordaan. You can find designer boutiques, art galleries, gift and fashion shops and many bars and restaurants for a coffee, lunch or dinner. It is part of the Amsterdam Canal District that is on the Unesco World Heritage listing. Also close to the apartment is the Noordermarket that you can visit on a Monday or Saturday. It's one of the best markets in Amsterdam (besides Albert Cuyp Market) and you can combine it with the best apple pie in the restaurant Winkel 43. The apartment is also walking distance from the main museums around the city: Anne Frank House (5min), Het Grachtenhuis or Amsterdam museum (15min), Museumplein with the Van Gogh, Stedelijk, Rijksmuseum or Vonldelpark (30min by walk).
column11: Normal check-in and check-out times: Check in before 7pm Check-out before noon
column12: From amsterdam central station - 15/20min by foot. Nice walk around the canals - or tram 13 ou 17 for 2 stops. Get out at westermarkt then 5min walk (Total 15min) From Schiphol airport - train Schiphol - amsterdam central (15min) then follow instruction above  By car - Park at the parking P+R Sloterdijk (1€ Per day +  around trip ticket to city center for  2,5€) - take  the tram 19 Stop at marnixstraat (15min) - walk 10min (Total 30min) Make sure you do the same trip back with the same ticket otherwise the special price at P+R parking for 1€ per day will not work. You can find more information online  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
column13: You will have access to the whole apartment. It's all yours during your stay in Amsterdam.
column14: At check in we will welcome you in the apartment, give you the keys and  we'll guide you through the house, to make sure you will instantly feel at home. We can give you information about the neighbourhood and the rest of the city. After that you can always reach me for questions or suggestions.
column15: We hope you feel at home and enjoy your stay. We do have some house rules:   • Smoking in the house, inviting people or using (soft)drugs is not allowed • In Amsterdam we live close to our neighbours, so please respect that by making not to much noise, we ask you not to use the balcony after 10pm at night • Please close windows and lock the doors before you leave • No parties, gatherings or business activities without our permission • Respect the authentic interior of the house • You will receive two sets of keys. Losing one of the keys will cost you € 30,-. • There is no safe, leaving valuable belongings at the apartment is at own risk • No pet (cats, dogs) • If giving a bachelor party would be the purpose of your visit to Amsterdam, we kindly ask you to look for another place to stay.   We thank you in advance.
column25: A frenchy living in Amsterdam and enjoying this city very much. I love traveling, this is my passion. So making it easier for other travelers to find a home aboard is my contribution !

column5: Stylish & Modern Penthouse LOFT @ The Vondelpark!
column6: This bright & spacious, recently renovated loft with 2 bedrooms and a sunny balcony is located at the top floor of a former school building. At walking distance from the Vondelpark & public transport. Ideal for spending memorable time in Amsterdam!
column7: Enjoy your stay at this amazing, spacious and recently refurbished loft, with its unique location at a former school building. The bright living room invites you to kick back and relax after a long day of sightseeing. The kitchen is fully equipped and connected to the balcony. Next to the living room there's a bedroom with a sofa bed and a sink. Upstairs you'll find the bedroom with a double bed and the bathroom with shower.  Please note that the loft has an open floor plan. Because of this, the loft is brighter and feels even more spacious than it already is. APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS: • Former classrooms refurbished by interior architects • Bright and spacious living room • Balcony • Fully equipped kitchen • Bathroom with shower • Free WiFi • Great location near the Vondelpark and public transport • The building features an elevator/lift

column15: A lot of effort has been put in the apartment to make this a nice, peaceful, clean and tidy place. We expect our guests to treat the apartment in the same respectful way as we do. Therefore, we kindly ask you to respect, and agree on the following house rules: • No additional guests, or visitors are allowed without our approval. • Quiet hours are between 10 pm – 8 am. • Be considerate of the neighbors at all times. • House parties are strictly prohibited. • Smoking and/or drug use is not allowed inside the apartment. • We don’t allow third party bookings, without consulting us upfront. • In your first airbnb message, please tell us what your favorite color is (just to ensure us that you actually read the house rules ;))  We want to be as transparent as possible about the apartment and the details of your stay.  If anything is unclear in the listing, or if you have any doubts, don’t hesitate to contact us before making a reservation. We want you to have a great stay, and that you know w
column25:
Hi! We are Eva & Kobe, and you're more than welcome to stay at one of the fabulous apartments and homes we manage while the home owners are on holiday. 

We strive to offer you a pleasant and memorable stay in our home town: Amsterdam. We love to share the hidden gems with you, and we can provide you with all the information you need to get the most out of your stay. 

As we were awarded the 'superhost' status on airbnb, we can assure you that we will do our outmost to make your stay truly amazing. Please feel free to have a look at our 800+ reviews!

Our core values are similar to the ones on which airbnb is founded, hospitality & live like a local is what's is all about. We are flexible, always available and will welcome you in person, show you around and answer all of your questions.  Exceptions with us offering a self check-in can be made during 2020.

Combined with the fact that our standards of cleanliness are very high, you can certainly expect our properties to be 110% clean. All our high quality bath- and bed linen are professionally cleaned and ironed.  

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or special requests. We'll be happy to assist you! We would be delighted to host you during your stay in Amsterdam!
