column10: The best neighborhood of the Netherlands: Museumplein district is known as the best neighborhood of Amsterdam, located in Amsterdam Old South. Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum, Concertgebouw and Vondelpark are within a couple of minutes walking distance. 10 minutes walking and you'll be at the Leidseplein, the main area for dinner, drinks and dancing. 15 to 20 minutes walking and you'll be at the largest conference center called the RAI. Dina-Perla Lodges is located in Amsterdam Old South, the best neighborhood of the city - perhaps of the Netherlands, 20 seconds away from the Museumplein and the famous concert hall, called Het Concertgebouw. Five to ten minutes walking and you'll be at the Leidseplein, in the center of Amsterdam. There, you'll find all shops, restaurants, cafes, clubs, theaters and so on you'll be looking for, including the Hardrock Café, American Café, the Stadsschouwburg and the Melkweg music hall. The same goes for the multicultural, artistic and youthful area called
column11: Dina-Perla Lodges is compliant with the 1.5 meter economy. Have a look at the pictures to get an impression, even though the quality of the pictures differ. You will still feel the heart of Dina-Perla Lodges. Please, only book when you are 100% sure, so that you don't need to cancel. As a small business owner, the implications of cancellations are massive. Great thanks for your understanding. Just nice to share my books: Living gracefulness, a guide to work on yourself - Dutch, English, French and Spanish learning materials available. Exodus from the lighthouse, an autobiography only in Dutch. Finalizing a third book in English. You can also find me on LinkedIn, T, Goodreads and Hebban.
column12: To travel to Dina-Perla Lodges: From Schiphol: you can take a taxi and it will bring you here in 15 to 20 minutes. Or, you can take the red bus with number 397 and jump off at the stop called Museumplein. You could also take the train to Amsterdam Zuid Station and take tram 5, or to Amsterdam Centraal Station and take tram 12 and 24. From Amsterdam Centraal Station: take tram 12 or 24 and jump off at the stop called Museumplein / Concertgebouw. From Amsterdam Zuid Station: take tram 5 and jump off at the stop called Museumplein / Concertgebouw.
column13: Dina-Perla Lodges complies with the latest local regulations in Amsterdam, including: Maximum 40% and 61 square meters is available for guests, thus a private bedroom, shared bathroom, shared toilet and of course the halls/stairways to access the spaces. Dina-Perla lives here as well and owns the building. As a small business owner, she does everything that has to do with the business. Dina-Perla hosts maximum four guests.
column14: Want to play the guitar or piano?  You will be staying in a shared home hotel in which personal growth and mind building are at the core of who I am. Yoga mats, books and teachings are some examples of that. I enjoy hosting at Dina-Perla Lodges and am looking forward to meeting you. I love meeting new and inspiring people from abroad. As born, raised and everything in Amsterdam, I know everything there is to know about the city. It is my pleasure to provide a few do’s and don’ts, musts and nice haves and so on at the check-in. You’ll tell me more about the purpose of your stay and I will make sure you’ll have all the information you need. Make yourself comfortable. This is your home during your stay. Note that Dina-Perla is a small business owner and that time on a daily basis is extremely limited, with everything that comes along with it. Thank you for your understanding.
column15: Guidelines and information Thank you for choosing Dina-Perla Lodges. An authentic shared home hotel for maximum four guests in the museum district of Amsterdam. Dina-Perla Lodges has 750+ reviews with an average rate between 4.7 and 5 stars, from 2016 until now. Grateful to have hosted so many wonderful people and to have brought the world to me. •	Due to the current market situation, the average ratings and the impact the corona virus has on small business owners like myself, flexible check-ins will be be discussed and possible. Also, with everything that is going in the world right now, I spend massive amounts of money and time on hygiene and cleaning. Please respect that. Great thanks for your understanding. •	Important update from 1th January onwards: the Dutch / Amsterdam laws have changed, which means that the tourist taxes are going to be 10% of your entire stay. For example: if you booked a stay for €100, tourist taxes will be €10 extra. The prices in the system are excluding t
column25:
Dina-Perla Lodges is the best and safest option for accomodation in times of global panic, instability and health crisis. Yes, it is totally possible to travel to the Netherlands and to visit Amsterdam.

Dina-Perla Lodges is a high class location in the museum district of Amsterdam, literally seconds walking distance from the beautiful Museumplein, where the great museums are located and central to wherever you want to go. You will be in the best neighborhood of the Netherlands. 

Dina-Perla Lodges brings people from around the world together within a couple of square meters. Just to name a few categories: solo women, employee, business and art travel. You will experience an authentic Amsterdam shared home hotel which has a warm, serene and safe atmosphere. 

The building is almost 200 years old and a great example of Amsterdam architecture and building style, including original ornaments on the ceilings, fireplaces, large windows and long stairways. In short, Dina-Perla Lodges is here to stay and to contribute to history. Experience for yourself! Let's have a great time.

Dina-Perla always knew that she wanted to open up a shared home hotel. It was her plan long before hosting and digital platforms became in vogue. As a small business owner, she does everything herself, with great passion and dedication. She has a permit and is compliant with the Dutch laws and regulations. 

Have a look at the pictures to get an impression, even though the quality of the images differ. You will still feel the heart of the shared home hotel. 

Also nice to share my books, as personal growth is the central theme at Dina-Perla Lodges:

Living gracefulness, a guide to work on yourself - Dutch, English, French and Spanish learning materials available.
Exodus from the lighthouse, an autobiography only in Dutch.
Finalizing a third book in English. 

You can find me on LinkedIn, T, Goodreads and Hebban.

You can store luggage all day with us if you fly or leave late.  -what is the arrival time of your flight? -what is the departure time of your flight? Airport to apartment From Amsterdam Schiphol airport you buy tickets in the yellow NS machines to Amsterdam Rai Station (NOT to Central Station!). Trains depart from platform 3 on ,11 and ,24 and ,41 and ,54. You need to take the train to Hilversum or Almere. Amsterdam Rai Station is just 8 minutes, two stops. From Amsterdam Rai station you walk (13 min) to Dintelstraat 18. Alternatively: same train (5 min, first stop) but you get out at Amsterdam Zuid station and take bus 65 (10 minutes) to a stop called Scheldestraat. Than walk 3 minutes to Dintelstraat 18. column10: This is a nice neighborhood with basic shops around the corner and also some nice restaurants.  The Westerpark is a 5 minute walk an you can walk all the way throe it to the city centre. Neighborhood  Restaurants  Café Pistou  Admiraal de Ruiterweg 404 This is a really nice place to eat! The meat they serve is organic. It is not cheap but not really expensive ether.  This is a 5 minute walk. Go outsight turn right and right again at the end of the street (Bos en Lommer weg). Turn right at Admiraal de Ruiterweg, You will find Pistou at your right hand. column12: You can get to the city centre in about 30 minutes  by food, in 10 by bicycle and also in 10 or 15 minutes by tram 12 which leaves a 3 minute walk from our apartment. It runs until midnight. The train station Sloterdijk is a 15 to 20 minutes’ walk, or 5 minutes by tram 12.

column15: Neighbors and shared stairways We have a good contact with our neighbors and we like to keep it this way. This is an old house, especially the stairways are noisy, so be quiet  on the stairs late at night and early in the morning.  We are slowly rebuilding it, every time we have a little money we continue the work. But it is already a really comforteble house!  We love to live in it, especially  since it's a really light and sunny house. Also we are not the tidiest people on earth, but of course  it is clean, so pleas feel comfortable and take anything you need. If you take normal care about our stuff and something, like a cup does brake, no problem.
column25:
Hi,

Lovely for a couple, suitable for 4 people. Please note that there is only 1 bedroom where 2 people can sleep. Furthermore there is an air bed in the living room where 2 people can sleep.
column7: The entire house is very practical in use and has a spacious feel to it. Big windows from floor to ceiling and light coming in from both sides of the house make sure all day light beams through the house. You can open the kitchen door or bedroom door to access the garden, which is equiped with BBQ and fire basket. The bedroom and bathroom are very neat. The kitchen was installed in february 2015 and has all the desired equipment.

column10: The Staatsliedenbuurt is a very rustique area right in between Westerpark (check (URL HIDDEN) with the imfamous jazz/rock club Pacific Parc (do go there! things usually start kickin' off at midnight), and the hip Jordaan area, where the Westerkerk and Anne Frank house are located.  This means you have access to all sorts of leisure, from sports in Westerpark, to bars, restaurants, coffee bars, coffeeshops, cinema (At The Movies located on Haarlemerstraat is the oldest cinema of the Netherlands), while Central Station is just 10 minutes by bike, bus or tram. In case you want to do groceries, search 'Albert Heijn' or 'Dirk van der Broek' in your maps app. Both take 5 minutes by bike or 10 minutes walking. By all means check out cafe Tripel on Lijnbaansgracht 161 for Belgian beers (Monday and Tuesday you order food for 2, pay for 1), cafe de Struik on Rozengracht 160, de Bloemenbar on Handboogstraat 15 and the beforementioned Pacific Parc on Polonceaukade 23. Preferably in that order if y
column11: If you make use of the BBQ and/or the fire basket, make sure you have the fire extinguisher readily available in case something goes wrong. Please try to be careful with wall, floor and utilities. In case something does break please let me know a.s.a.p.
column12: You can take bus 21 on van Hallstraat right around the corner, which will take you to Central Station. Or you can take tram 10 on the van Hallstraat (next to Westerpark), which will take you around the outer canal ring from West through South to East. At any point you can get off and reacht the city center in 10 minutes walking. I do recommend renting a bike from Rent a Bike, Starbikes or MacBike. Be careful of Dutch cyclists. To you we all look suicidal. When someone creams Hallo! at you, they're not greating you, they're telling you to get out of the way ;-) Taxis are availalbe all throughout the city center. It shouldn't cost more than 15, max 20 euros to get pretty much anywhere (unless you want to go from West to East) Good luck out there in the jungle :-)
column13: Guests have access to all areas except the garden shed.
column14: If I'm not abroad I will be in Amsterdam. I will gladly help you with any requests. You can find all relevant information about Amsterdam in the guest book and the Lonely Planet Amsterdam, which will welcome you with a bottle of wine upon arrival
column15: Staying in the apartment with more than 4 people at the same time will result in a €20.500 fine from the city. It will lead to immediate eviction from the apartment. Furthermore, any (financial) damages for breaking the house rules will be forwarded to the person who booked the property. City officials sometimes come by the apartment in person to ask questions. In case this happens during your stay, do NOT open the door or talk to them. Contact me immediately by phone and do not provide them with any information under any circumstance. Don't answer the door to any strangers or talk to anyone about the rental agreement. The fine for receiving a complaint from neighbours is €6000. It doesn't matter whether there is anything to complain about. When neighbours complain and the city confirms there are tourists in the apartment, I will receive a €6000 fine. Therefore it is not allowed to talk to anyone about the rental agreement. Please respect the neighbours and keep the volume down to norm
column25:
I'm a self employed Corporate Social Responsibility consultant. Things I enjoy are sports, music, traveling and visiting concerts/festivals.
I like to travel cheap but I welcome my guests with more class than I personally look for when I travel :-)
Life motto: life is a mirror. Be greatful, high spirited and positive and the world will threat you the same.

column7: My studio is located in one of the most lively, fun, and culturally diverse neighborhood in Amsterdam!  You can find plenty of cafes/bars/restaurants around, and there are 3 supermarkets within 3 min walking distance and 1 open-market (Monday to Saturday) 5 min walk away. You can walk to all the major attractions from my apartment and enjoy the wonderful old city view. It's 5 min walk to centrum; 10 min walk to Museumplein(Van Gosh, Rijks, Stedelijk), Vondelpark, Leidseplein, Anne-Frank huis..etc.   The studio is (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ), located on the first floor of the building, and it has all you need for your short stay in Amsterdam (a fully equipped kitchen, a bar table, a working desk, a living room, a double bed, a closet, a bathroom, iron&iron board ...etc.). There are also two outdoor chairs and a picnic basket available if you feel like sitting by the canal and enjoy a drink/picnic out on a sunny day!

column13: * From Schipol airport - take airport express bus 397 to Amsterdam and get off at Elandsgracht (30-40 min), and it's 5 min walk from the station.  * From Amsterdam Central Station - take tram 13 or 17 and get off at Kinkerstraat/Bilderdijkstraat, and it's 1 min walk from the tram stop.

column10: The Neighborhood (in walking distance): 'Volkshotel' at Wibautavenue is the place to be. There is a huge rooftopterras, DJ's, yoga, but off course also drinks, bites and live music. 'Bar Buckowski' is hot, especially friday in the afternoon. All the locals come to this place for after work drinks. Lots of goodlooking people. The same goes for' Hesp' at the Amstel. In the sun, at the water, loads of people come there (also by boat) to enjoy each others company. Youngsters also play petangue here. Good fun! And last but not least: 'De Biertuin' (beergarden), countless different beers in good atmosphere, with huge terras. Oosterpark is perfect for a walk when you don't want to be runover by joggers. And recently it had a complete make-over, so its beautiful to wonder around. In early summer there are also events (music festivals). Canals! The famous Amstel, from where you can hop on a boat, is only a few minute walk from the apartment. Explore the city by boat, it's even more amazing from
column11: The apartment is officially situated in 'Oost' (but also very close to the citycenter). Oost is a really nice and lively neighbourhood. If you want to get to know the real Amsterdam (apart from all the touristic places), this is the perfect spot to experience the city.

column10: Oud Zuid is central: on one end you have Amsterdam’s nightlife and culture square Leidseplein and on the other Amstelveenseweg that is developing into a true culinary boulevard. And throughout the neighbourhood, a new bar seems to pop up every week. But for residents, firm favourites remain Vondelpark’s Vondelpark3 and Blauwe Theehuis. The Vondelpark remains Amsterdam’s most densely populated place-to-be whenever the sun shines. Besides this it’s nice to live near one of the greatest overviews of Western Art in the world. Two of the main museums, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. For big shopping streets you can go to the PC Hooftstraat, Jacob Obrechtstraat, Cornelis Schuytstraat and Beethovenstraat.

column5: Private room in lovely city apt.
column6: The private room in our spacious apartment (107 sqm) is on the second floor of a quiet street near the Vondelpark. The house is part of the Amsterdamse School movement, that has roots in Expressionist architecture. The interior is light and modern.
column7: Our house is typical Amsterdamse School. The style has roots in Expressionist architecture, borrowing elements from the Jugendstil (Art Nouveau) and Art Deco design aesthetic, and the aim was to create a total architectural experience – so designers paid great attention to both the interior and the exterior of each building.  Due to the socialist ideals of its founders, the Amsterdam School style was often applied to housing estates for the working class, government institutions and schools. Many examples of this style can still be found in Amsterdam today, with some of the finest examples just around the corner of our place.  Inside we try to keep it simple but cosy. A combination of natural materials vs industrial details. The floor has an epoxy grey layer, which gives the house a modern look. The private room is well equipped. There is a nice sofa bed (with topper), which makes a comfortable double bed. Also, there is a smart TV, which you can connect to Netflix, to watch all your f

column25:
Hi! We are Alexander & Caroline.
We are with four: there is also a girl of 12 years old called India and a relaxed little girl called Nova. We joined Airbnb because we think it's one of the best ways to travel around the world. It's great to be able to share our home with people that feel the same way!

column5: Amazing apartment with balcony in trendy East part
column6: This lovely second floor apartment is situated in the trendy East part of Amsterdam. The apartment consist of a cozy balcony at north and a french balcony at south. The light livingroom is perfect to relax after a day in the city. At the back side of the house you find the calm and romantic bedroom at the front side a smaller bedroom with convertible bed.  With nice modern bathroom and kitchen. Only 15 minutes from centre. Please respect our non smoking policy also on the balcony,
column8: This lovely second floor apartment is situated in the trendy East part of Amsterdam. The apartment consist of a cozy balcony at north and a french balcony at south. The light livingroom is perfect to relax after a day in the city. At the back side of the house you find the calm and romantic bedroom at the front side a smaller bedroom with convertible bed.  With nice modern bathroom and kitchen. Only 15 minutes from centre. Please respect our non smoking policy also on the balcony, You have full and private access to the house during your stay. For the rental of my house I asked Lindy and Minou to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you. The east part of Amsterdam is an amazing trendy neighbourhood with a lot of things to do and with muliticultural cultures. For example nice hip restaurants and bars and specifically the popular Dappermarkt right around the corner. But
column10: The east part of Amsterdam is an amazing trendy neighbourhood with a lot of things to do and with muliticultural cultures. For example nice hip restaurants and bars and specifically the popular Dappermarkt right around the corner. But also with Artis, our nice Zoo, the Hortus with lovely flowers and plants ánd the Tropen Musuem about different cultures around the world. And last but not least, within 15 minutes you are in the city centre.
column11: Late check in fee between 20:00 - 00:00 €30
column12: From Amsterdam Central Station you can take the train to Station Amsterdam Muiderpoort. From there it is 5 minutes walk to the house. Other public transport close to the house is tram 7, 14 and 3.

column15: - Our home is only suited for families, couples and business trips. - Please respect the house and the neighbourhood: quiet time after 11pm. - Let us know your estimated time of arrival ánd departure as soon as possible. - No smoking inside and outside - No loud music	 - No parties - No drugs - No guests In case of breaking one of the rules you will be charged with a penalty of €200 per broken rule.
column25: Hello I am Ruud. Together with my girlfriend Kimberly I live in the nice East part of Amsterdam. We are excited about renting our dear apartment to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam.

column6: Amsterdam Oost is booming. Quiet, relaxing green area, near the centre. The trainstation Science Park is a 3 min walk (retour is 4.40 Euro pp). The train will bring you within 8 min to the city centre. By metro (9) is also possible this is a 10 min walk and within 15 min you are in the centre, this is retour 3,10 Euro pp. There is a large supermarket (AH) and some other shops quit near. Only 5 min away. The adres is Helmholzstraat. The apartment has a big sunny garden (On the South).
column7: The appartment is about 75 m2 The Garden is 8 bij 11 m There is a bathroom and the toilet is separated. The living room is devided in two places between the two places are nice see through doors. From the kitchen and the living room you can enter the garden/terras.

column10: There is a big park nearby (Flevopark) you are allowed to barbeque there if you like. There are many sportfields and several shops (supermarket AH, liquor store, greengrocer, bakery, fitness, hairdresser, bank, toy store, fishmonger, drugstore etc.) quite near. Just a 5 minute walk.
column12: By car you drive at the A10 and take exit S112 or S113. If you come from Schiphol just take the train to Central station (20 min) and from there you need to take the train to Science ParkYou (6-8 min) then you can go to the apartment by foot. Only a 3-5 min walk. If you want to go to the City Centre you can travel by Metro (9), subway at the Amstel Station or by train (Science Park) wich is only 3 min walk. A retour costs 4.40 Euro pp. and it takes you about 6-8 minuter to arrive at Central station.

column5: Fabulous apartment in buzzing area in Amsterdam
column6: In one of the most upcoming regions in town: Old West, near "De Hallen".  Very near to the centre (Jordaan, MuseumSq, Dam), by bike &/or tram.  Fantastic location, for tourists and maybe even more for locals. Apartment is in amazingly good shape.
column7: The apartment is spacious: almost 60 m2. There is one very big living room, where you can walk and dance around. On both sides there's a balcony, on the south/west-sunny side a very big one. In summer it's recommended that you lie yourself down there on a mattress.
column8: In one of the most upcoming regions in town: Old West, near "De Hallen".  Very near to the centre (Jordaan, MuseumSq, Dam), by bike &/or tram.  Fantastic location, for tourists and maybe even more for locals. Apartment is in amazingly good shape. The apartment is spacious: almost 60 m2. There is one very big living room, where you can walk and dance around. On both sides there's a balcony, on the south/west-sunny side a very big one. In summer it's recommended that you lie yourself down there on a mattress. During your stay the place is all yours. You can use everything you like; please be gentle and kind for everything - the apartment will give you back your love and value your presence. During your stay I'll be there to help you with any sort of questions. If I'll not be around, I'll give you name and number of another most reliable and friendly person. The Dutch call this area Oud-West (“Old West”), but now it's more commonly known as "De Hallen". That's because there’s a complex na
column10: The Dutch call this area Oud-West (“Old West”), but now it's more commonly known as "De Hallen". That's because there’s a complex named De Hallen (“The Halls”), which is a centre for media, culture, fashion, food and crafts. It contains a cinema (“Filmhallen”) and a big market place where you can find every sort of food (“Foodhallen”). Previously this building was the centre where electric trams were restored. De Hallen is a 2-minute walk from the apartment. Just downstairs you go to the right and  you keep going to the end of this street (Elisabeth Wolffstraat). There you immediately enter the complex.
column11: In the meantime the photos in the ad have become slightly out of date. The bed has become much bigger (1.80x2.00m), the tv much newer (Philips Ultra HD) and on the wall you suddenly can see photo art. And last but not least, you'll surprised how cool and big the new couch is. In other words, your stay hopefully will give you even more pleasure.
column12: Because of the central location of this place the public transport is amazing. The bigger street here (down to your right) is called De Clercqstraat. When you go to your left you’ll find a tram stop. This stop is called De Clercqstraat/Bilderdijkstraat and is a transfer place. Lines that are passing here are the 12 (to for example Museumplein), 13 (Central Station) and 14 (Waterlooplein).

column15: During your stay I'll be there to help you with any sort of questions. If I'll not be around, I'll give you name and number of another most reliable and friendly person.
column16: The apartment is on the 1st floor. Please be kind to the neighbour below you with shoes, footsteps and maybe loud music. Also please at all time be aware of closing the water tap... On the 2nd floor sometimes you yourself will be hearing foot steps or some music, but I can assure you that that never will be too loud.

column6: Nice and very spacious family home with sunny garden and big grass field in front of the door. It has everything you need for a great stay in Amsterdam. Very close to the lovely Amstel River, Amsterdam RAI, Amstelpark and Beatrixpark. Easy accesible.
column8: Nice and very spacious family home with sunny garden and big grass field in front of the door. It has everything you need for a great stay in Amsterdam. You do not have to share this apartment with others. Iamb&b will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and if you like in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance. The metro goes right around the corner at Amsterdam RAI, as well as tram 4. Tram 4 will get you to the city centre in approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Normal check-in and check-out times: Check-out  11:00 am. Check-in  before 21:00 pm. Check in after 21:00 is possible but it costs an additional of 20,- euro. For other in- and check-out times please contact me.

column5: Design loft with sunroom and garden in trendy area
column6: I am pleased to present you my (82 m2) loft with a glass sunroom outlooking the garden. I have personally designed and decorated my loft, which is a fusion of Ibizian, Moroccan and Scandinavian design. The loft is equipped mostly with design furniture. Eyecathers are the sunny glassroom, gastronomic kitchen and bathroom with massage shower. My place is ideal for those who love design, zen-like relaxation, gastronomy and are looking for a tranquil place in a very trendy area.
column7: The apartment has recently been renovated and contains all kinds of luxuries. You can open the doors of the glass sunhouse and enjoy your lunch in the sun. The design bathroom contains a massaging shower, please be sure to use that ;-) The kitchen is equipped with high-end cooking materials, utensils and wine glasses.

I know this comes naturally for almost all of you, but occassionally I have had guests with different "standards".  Thank you for your understanding and kind cooperation.  1.	SMOKING. Smoking in the apartment is prohibited. We are non-smokers and live in the apartment ourselves. You can smoke in the garden though. 2.	NEIGHBOURS: please respect my neighbors and don’t make any large noise, especially after 11PM. The house is almost 100 years old – and despite the renovation – still not so well insulated for sound. You can use the small speakers I have provided. It is prohibited to bring in any large sound systems. 3.	NO PARTIES OR EVENTS: It is prohibited to use the loft for parties or events. 4.	DOORS: Please lock both the upper- and central lock when you leave. Please also always close the doors to the terrace when

column6: Flying to Amsterdam for a city break? This luxurious 100 m2 house has a great location - 20 minutes to the airport and only a 15 minute bike ride to the city centre. It accommodates 4 persons and offers a great 1st floor with open plan kitchen and living room.
column7: This light and spacious luxurious house is spread over 3 floors. The overall decor and furnishings are modern and contemporary. The first floor is an open plan lounge, dinning and kitchen area of 50m2. The high specification kitchen contains a dishwasher, oven, microwave and hob with extractor fan and houses all the appliances you need. The freestanding island is a perfect place to eat your meals and chat as you cook. At the other end of the lounge are double doors which open out onto a big  balcony. The second floor has 2 double bedrooms and a luxurious bathroom. The bathroom houses a jacuzzi bath and a separate built in steam shower with mood lighting and radio.

column10: Supermarkets, a pharmacy and various green grocers are all within a few minutes walking distance. The picturesk Rembrandt Parc and the Sloterplas lake are both within walking and/or cycling distance which are ideal for outdoor activities (running, swimming and picnicking). If the need arises the OLVG West hospital is also close by and has a 24 hour pharmacy.
column12: Amsterdam is the perfect place to explore on a bicycle. If needed, we can offer 2 adult bikes and 1 kids bike for rent. Any optional bikes can be rented in the bike shop at a 5 minutes walking distance. The house is ideally located to the airport (20 minutes) and only a 15 minute bike ride to the lively and attractive city centre. However, if you feel more comfortable, the metro (Postjesweg) is a stones throw away, as is bus 18 and tram 13 to Central Station.
column14: I'm frequently travelling. If I'm not around my 2 friends Kate and Douwe, who live 200 meters from the house, are available for check- in and out and any questions.
column15: As you are staying in a residential area, please mind the neighbors. The house is very well isolated, so playing music and having a great time is no problem when all the outside doors are closed. But: please keep it down after 22:00 and make sure to close the balcony doors after that time. Sound can carry a long way in the communal garden and people try to sleep at that time.
column25: I'm located in Amsterdam but travel frequently. I love hosting and meeting new people and making sure they get a great impression of my hometown.

column5: Large penthouse with roof terrace near Vondelpark.
column6: The luxurious penthouse is stunningly designed with four bedrooms, two bathrooms and a large roof terrace overlooking Amsterdam. It is fully equipped with all necessities and more to make sure it feels like home away from home.  The apartment is ideal for families and sleeps a maximum of 7 persons. No parties allowed and strictly non smoking. Located close to the Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum, van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk Museum and has shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance.
column7: Stunningly designed two floor apartment with a large roof terrace. The apartment is very light, is in a great location close to shops, Vondelpark and museums and within minutes of the city centre. Very suitable for families with children. There are four bedrooms where a total of 7 adults and 2 children/toddlers can sleep.

column10: The apartment is located in Oud-Zuid which is one of the boroughs of Amsterdam. The Museum Quarter (Museumplein) with the Stedelijk Museum, Van Gogh Museum, and the Rijksmuseum, belongs to Oud-Zuid. Oud-Zuid is home to Amsterdam's most luxury shopping street -- the PC Hooftstraat -- which features high-end clothing (Chanel, Gucci, Hermés, Louis Vuitton), jewelry (Chopard, Cartier) and specialty (Mont Blanc, Henckels) stores, as well as several boutiques selling more luxury labels. The Van Baerlestraat features chic names like Pauw and Vanilia. Beethovenstraat, along the eastern border of this neighborhood, boasts a row of women's, men's and children's chic shops. Don't miss Cornelis Schuytstraat and its trendy boutiques and home stores for a special Dutch outfit or gift. The Cornelis Schuytstraat  is known for its high end and stylish stores, with owners who specialise in exclusivity and trendy goods. With its hardware and grocery store, this is certainly not a street that is 'a dime a

column6: I've just fully refurbished the loft into a very light & spacious place. Inspired by the design I've found on my travels, there's lots of nice details to enjoy - from an Italian take on Melville's Moby Dick to a warm & inviting living. You're a short walk away from the Jordaan and its canals (without the discomfort of a mouldy old flat) and the trendy Westergasfabriek and Westerpark are nearby for you to relax and unwind. As is typical in Amsterdam, the loft's on the 4th floor without a lift.

column10: We are located inside the Amsterdam ring, at 30 minutes by bus from the city center and even closer to the big recreational area "Het Twiske". Yes, there are cows at a walking distance from home, and several beaches close-by. You can enjoy all the delights of the capital during the day and still relax in a cute, almost hobbit-like environment at night. However, the fancy NDSM area is not far from home, with its cafés, venues, exhibitions and busy festival programme.
column11: Adventurers, activists, wanderers, vegans, Burners, hippies, polyamorous people and all lovely weirdos, welcome! Complimentary organic tea and coffee are available all day.
column12: There is a free parking option right in front of our house, where space is almost always available.  There are also 2 bus stops close by that will take you to the North / South metro line, where you can travel to Central Station or the Museum square in about 30-40 minutes.  If you rent bikes, you can park them in front of the house.
column13: * Besides the bathroom and toilets, you are welcome to use the kitchen for breakfast and meals, provided that you leave it as clean as it was found. Feel free to pick mint for your tea. Remember to lock the door when you get back in.
column14: Our schedules are very flexible. Depending on how busy we are when you come, we may enjoy a cup of coffee with you and be available for tips and friendly discussion. column25:
My partner Ben (Dutch, 32 year-old) and I (French, 34) live together in our beautiful B&B in Amsterdam North. We enjoy the company of people from all sorts of backgrounds, and especially like connecting with those that walk on alternative paths.

We like dancing at (non-commercial) festivals and events, cycling in the surrounding countryside and stuffing ourselves with delicious vegetarian food. In addition to being your hosts, we work as freelance translators. Sonia is passionate about nature, sustainable food systems and social justice. Ben is studying integrative psychotherapy. On top of this, and as you can guess, we have a big interest in psychedelics.

column25:
Hi, we are Wendy and Bram,

We are a team of professional hosts established by travelers just like you. We believe in sharing homes. Wherever you are, it is delightful to explore and discover an unknown city from an authentic home. 

On behalf of home owners we advertise their properties through our airbnb profile and support them by offering you a pleasant stay. 

When you book your holiday with us, you can be confident of a memorable stay and an experience through the eyes of a local. We are more than happy to share our knowledge, give you the best insider tips and recommendations about Amsterdam.

If you have any questions, holiday wishes or simply want to have a chat, then feel free to contact us any time. We always reply within an hour!

We look forward to being your host! :)

column6: Want to stay in a historical houseboat in Amsterdam? Then this is your perfect opportunity! Close to the City center in 'Oostelijke Eilanden' area of the City.
column7: This historical boat is perfect for a couple who want to enjoy a relaxing stay in Amsterdam. The whole  wooden interior is still in perfect mint condition and was built in 1922. You will have a private room on the rear end of the ship. This is a private area where you will find the cabin and captain's house with two single beds! There is also a separate toilet and shower available. You will share the shower with the owner of the boat. He lives on the front end of the boat. There are some really steep stairs, so be careful when you are a bit less fit. Especially elder people have to be very careful with taking the high stairs! HOUSEBOAT HIGHLIGHTS *PERFECTLY LOCATED! (only 8 min from CITY CENTER) *Historical houseboat with original wooden interior! *FAST & FREE WIFI *Outside deck I'm sure you will enjoy your stay at my place.

column10: This homeboat is located at  Wittenburg, one of the Eastern Islands in a former harbor quarter . From the 17th to the 19th century, seagoing vessels were built here for the Admiralty and the East Indies Company. Within walking distance you will find the beautifully restored 17th century sea warehouse of the Historical Nautical Museum, Het Scheepvaartmuseum.  The Science Museum 'Nemo' is just to the left adorning the bay with it's distinct bathtub design. Amsterdam Zoo better known as Artis is two canals further and an excellent destination for adults and children alike. Amsterdam's very own "Het ij" brewery sits at the crossroads of two nearby rivers with it's iconic windmill. Just beyond Amsterdam Zoo is the 'Hortus botanicus' botanical garden for those interested in rare plants Amsterdam isn't known for. Onward is the Waterloo square market that's frequented by locals and tourists alike, and then it's on to the city centre with all it's amazing attractions! Truly this location offers
column11: I want to welcome you into a clean and cosy home! Please inform me of your arrival time beforehand, so I can make the check in go as smoothly as possible!
column12: Public transport is right around the corner! You can take the bus or tram at the central (rail)station to the Kattenburgerstraat or Piet Heinkade stops. You can rent bikes near the central station at Starbikes. This is a bike shop of very nice people at the Ruyterkade143, (Website hidden by Airbnb) . You can park your car in "Parking Centrum Oosterdok". It is near the central (rail) station: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Less expensive is the large parking lot on the east side of Amsterdam called Park + Ride Zeeburg, near IJburg, exit S114, next to entrance Piet Hein tunnel. P + R Zeeburg has two terrains next to each other: Zeeburg 1 and Zeeburg 2. You can park cheaply here and then also cheaply by public transport to the center of Amsterdam and back, if you make use of the P + R scheme.

column5: Stylish, Cozy & Happy Apartment in De Pijp
column6: This apartment is straight from a magazine. Sunny, colorful & cozy, the place is located in the hip area of De Pijp. It's in walking distance from most of the major attractions in Amsterdam. You will love the restaurants & cafes in this neighborhood! The apartment is cozy, with a fully-equipped kitchen, modern bathroom and bedroom with queen size bed & a lovely balcony!
column7: The different rooms in the apartment are well divided. There's a comfortable couch in the living area, which invites you to just relax after a long day of walking or maybe just to spy on the neighbours :). Next to the couch there's a perfect spot by the window, ideal for people watching and daydreaming.  For extra coziness you can always turn on the gas fireplace! It's like magic :) The couch can be converted into a full-size & comfortable bed. The curtains in the living room provide  good sun-blocking so no need to worry about waking up together with the sunrise :) In the living room you will find the dining area and the open kitchen with a beautiful kitchen island. The kitchen is fully equipped so feel free to use it whenever you need!  Next to the living room, you can find a small hallway and a colourful bathroom (toilet only). The bedroom is specious and has a queen size bed equipped with an extremely comfortable mattress. For the not-so-morning people (like me :) ) all the big win

column10: The Pijp is one of the best neighborhood there is. Wander through the park and into the Large and famous Albert Cuypstraat Market. Stop for coffee and brunch at one of the many cafes in the neighbourhood. There are new boutiques popping up all the time. If you have enough of the neighbourhood you are in the perfect location to wander further through to Museum quarters, Leidseplein and on through the Jordan. Approx. 20 minutes from centre. Here is a list of some of the attractions within walking distance; Sarphati Park, Albert Cuyp market, Heineken Experience, the Museum district (Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum & Stedelijk Museum), Leidseplein, Rembrandtplein nightlife areas (entertainment area), the famous floating flower market and much more.

column5: Studio with garden near lovely Westerpark!
column6: If you are looking for a very convenient place for 1 or 2 with everything you need for a great stay in Amsterdam, this is your place. It is a charming studio with a town garden (16m2), newly renovated bathroom and separate toilet. You will have a real comfortable bed. It is located in a quiet street in trendy and authentic Westerpark-area, near nice restaurants, the great Westerpark en cultural venues. The charming Jordan and Dam Square are easy accessible! The B&B does not offer breakfast.
column7: Are you a cultural entrepeneur and coming to Amsterdam for a venue in Westerpark? To the Denim Days, the Cinekid Film Festival, the award Ceremony of the World Press Photo, international events on (serious) gaming, BMX, e-biking?  Or for the monthly Sunday (art) Market? Westerpark is famous for it’s cultural events, and you are welcome to join. column10: Westerpark is a lively and trendy neigbourhood with a mixture of people: young families, students, single households and old people of different backgrounds. The park is nearby and combines nature and culture; a cinema, a jazz club, restaurants and (arts& crafs) markets. By bike it takes 7 minutes to get to Dam sq. The Jordaan - with the Anne Frank House and the canals - is around the corner. Supermarkets, various restaurants (take away and eat in), a cycle shop, a butcher, flower shop and drug store are around the corner.

column6: The apartment is located in the very populair Old West part of town. The area offers great shopping and dining possibilities. In the vicinity of the Vondelpark and the Food court "De Hallen". 15 minutes walk to city center and the famous canal area.
column7: The one floor apartment on the second floor of the building dates from 1905 and shows the beautiful characterictics like ceilings decorated with ornaments, stained glass doors and mental pieces. On the back side there is a small but lovely sunny balcony, with view on a monumental Luther's building. The kitchen offers all you need to prepair a chef's meal. The apartment is very child friendly and has all the facilities for children in the age of 0-3. Important note: the beds for the children are also for the age of 0-3. If you have children of an older age we can offer an airbed. The two bedrooms are separated by a curtain in the door opening (see pictures). Free wifi available.

column10: The Brederodestraat is a side street of the J.P. Heijestraat, which is a street full of nice shops, coffeebars (with breakfast options), cafes, restaurants, take aways and a supermarket. Around the corner you find the beautiful Vondelpark. Walking into the direction of the city using the Kinkerstraat will lead you to a small food market and the populair indoor foodcourt "De Hallen", which also offers a cinema and trendy shops.
column12: Tram # 1 and 17 stop around the corner of the apartment. Both options will bring you to Central Station via the Leidseplein (#1) or via the Dam Square (#17).

column25: I am Jeanette, working as HR manager. I live in Amsterdam with my girlfriend Inge and our twin Fons and Sieger. Inge works at Rijksmuseum as curator of education. We enjoy the area where we live because it invites us to go out for dinners, walks in the park and boat rides into the city. We travelled a lot and can't wait to see our boys getting bigger to show them around the globe.

I love green (and oxygen ;-)) so the apartment is filled with gorgeous plants. Bonus: I may have the best bed in the world (no kidding. It's a kingsize memory foam mattress that's called CLOUD for a reason. You'll be sleeping on a cloud.). Plus, the apartment has a HUGE balcony (roof terrace) on the southern side. The apartment has both a rain shower and a bathtub and ofcourse, a separate toilet. Note: the second bedroom will be closed unless you insist on using it, in which case let me know and I'll see if I can arrange this for you! column10: IJburg is a nice new build Amsterdam suburb mostly populated by families. It has his own small cinema and all kinds of restaurants and cafe's. On walking distance you can find a shopping centre with a bakery, supermarket, butcher, fresh fish and pharmacie / drugstore. The Amsterdams beach IJburg has the most popular city beach of Europe according to a recent survey from the BBC. It is calles 'Blijburg' (Blij = Happy). A place to sun, swim and chill, lovely for summers. On sundays in summer there is a nice flea market situated on the beach. The eastside of the centre of Amsterdam is close and offers way more places to eat, drink and dance. The 'Dappermarkt' is a nice market in east. Tram 26 is on 3 minutes walk. There you enter and within 12 minutes you are in Amsterdam City Centre Central Station. You do not have to hurry, because this tram leaves every 6 minutes.

column7: We have a really lovely and charming house of 190 m2 built in the 1953 in a very popular and quiet neighborhood, near the centre of Amsterdam. It's on an old dike, has a big garden (120 m2) and has a beautiful view to the IJ Canal. The house has four floors. There is a large spacious light living room with open kitchen, 5 bedrooms, a bathroom with bath-tub and a separate toilet.  It has all the comfort you need to feel at home right away and enjoy your stay in Amsterdam: super fast free wireless internet (WIFI), three TV's and DVD player with a selection of (kids) DVD's, a washing + drying machine, dishwasher and oven, tea and coffee making facilities.  For families it is an excellent house (we have games and toys). But also people without children will love our light and spacious house. And in the summer you can enjoy the garden which has the same size as the house. No need to bring any extras. column10: Schellingwoude is a former village in the Dutch province of North Holland. It is located in the municipality of Amsterdam, on the northern border of the IJ. In order to stop the land loss caused by the Zuiderzee (a sea), farmers started around 1200 with the building of De Waterlandse Zeedijk. On this dike the village Schellingwoude was founded. That’s why the living room and kitchen are below streetlevel (ánd far below sea-level…). So the history of our street goes back to the 11th century.

column10: Family-oriented, Bos en Lommer has a very young and a multicultural population with the commercial street Bos en Lommerweg and the outdoor market on Bos en Lommerplein forming the heart. Individual sections have a strong sense of community. Bos en Lommer is remarkably close to the city centre but its own centre is formed by the outdoor market on the newly renovated Bos en Lommerplein. There is also plenty of green. In particular Erasmuspark (2 min walk) is a popular picnicking and barbecuing spot. While the eastern section has retained its authentic architecture, much of the newer developments show much promise: the Collage complex for 200 apartments won a major architecture prize, as well as the residential complex Nieuwe Akbar which won a prize for the reuse of an old building. column10: Betondorp is a pretty and small village in the city of Amsterdam, situated in the eastern city part Watergraafsmeer. It is quiet, bright and has a distinct style. It is also the birthplace of the famous soccer-player Johan Cruyff, and a few Dutch famous writers and actors grew up here. After a busy day in the city, it can be a calming experience to take a walk through the neighbourhood. Moving more to the city center, you'll find lots of coffee, dining and shopping opportunities in Watergraafsmeer and Amsterdam East.
column11: Floors and ceilings in the older houses in Amsterdam are thin. This is also the case for my place. So please consider the neighbours and take off your shoes  when appropriate.
column12: A tram ride with tram 9 to the city center will take around 15-20 minutes. The tram stop is a few minutes away. A bike-ride will take the same amount of time. column10: Amsterdam Oud-Zuid (Old South) is argued as the best neighborhood of Amsterdam, so don't be surprised when you encounter Dutch celebs. It is just a 2 min walk from the the Royal Concertbuilding, the Van Goghmuseum, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. Other great Amsterdam attractions are all just within 5 min available: the Vondelpark, Leidse-square entertainment area, Albert Cuyp famous street market and of course the Amsterdam canals. Once you step on the train at Schiphol station it only take you 24 minutes to get to our doorstep.
column12: Trams 5, 3, 12 and 24 stop just 1 min walk from the apartment.  Tram 5 will take you to central station and on the way stops at Leidsequare, the Anne Frankhouse and the Dam-square. In the other direction it goes to Amsterdam South Axis business district and the South Station from which the airport Schiphol is a 6 min train ride.  Trams 3 and 12 can take you to the east and west parts of Amsterdam. Less touristy but not to be missed (Albert Cuyp market, Amstel river, Hermitage museum and the Artis zoo).  Tram 24 goes to central station as well and can take you to the Heineken Experience or to the Olympic Stadium in the other direction.
column13: Guest will have access to every room and both balconies during daytime.
column14: During your stay we will be happy to explain or even show you all the facilities of Amsterdam. If needed the guests can make use of our bikes.
column15: Smocking is preferably done outside on one of the two balconies. To consider the neighbors parties are not allowed and we urge our guests to keep quiet in the stairwell. And pets are not allowed.
column25:
My name is Charles and I have been living abroad for about one-third of my life. I recently came back to Amsterdam from Tanzania and at the moment I work for a start-up which focusses on 100% green energie. In my spare time I make bikes and love to out in the nature. 

Obviously I like traveling and my most favorite destination is without doubt Afrika, were I was raised as a little boy. Therefore I speak a little French. 

I live together with my nephew and two friends of mine. We decided to rent out one of our empty rooms since we could use some extra income to upgrade the house. We renovated the room ourselves and the bed and bookshelf is made by us. 

Therefore we do pay a lot of attention to the quality and hygiene of our house and we expect our guests to do so as well.

See you soon?!

One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stel
column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.

Please check the availability 2 days before your check out date. If the apartment is available we offer a late check at 14:00 for an additional charge of 20 euro.

column10: Just around the corner you will find multiple cosy bars and restaurants, coffee places, a bakery and supermarkets. The lovely Vondelpark is situated within 3 minutes walking. The tourist attractions Leidse Square and the Museum Square can be reached within 10 minutes walking. If you feel like exploring Oud-West on a deeper level, just 5 minutes from our home there is the old famous Ten Kate market and the new and trendy The Hallen; in this historic former tram depot you can find an indoor food market, film, fashion, crafts and architecture. One of Amsterdam's most popular cultural hotspots.
column12: The apartment is located on walking distance from the city centre and places of interest such as the Vondel Park, Leidse Square and Museum Square. The nearby tram stop Rhijnvis Feithstraat (tram line 1) is available within 3 minutes walking and provides a direct connection to the city centre and Central Station Amsterdam. The other direction is train station Lelylaan, which allows a direct connection to Schiphol Airport (6 minutes). Transport by bicycle is most common in Amsterdam. In the direct surroundings of the apartment there are several bike rental companies located.

column10: Celebrated as a promising cultural hub, Oud-West mixes fresh with the established. The farmers’ markets, specialty groceries, bakeries, butchers, restaurants, bars, gelaterias and Foodhallen guarantees food is wherever you go. Elisabeth Wolffstraat is an escape of its own with wide sidewalks, tree-lined streets and a diverse community.  Favorite hangouts:  -  Bar Spek for lunch and people watching -  Berry Amsterdam for a wifi-free coffee -  Ten Katemarkt for a bustling farmers’ market -  De Hallen for local goods and arthouse cinema -  Café Panache for an atmospheric dinner
column12: Four tramlines (7, 13, 14, 17) are a five-minute walk from our apartment. These go to Amsterdam Center, East and West and connect with other tramlines. Schiphol Airport is 30 minutes by public transit. Walking or biking gives you the full experience. Anne Frank House, for example, is 20 minutes by foot, 8 minutes by bike or 11 minutes by tram.
column13: You have access to the entire apartment, its amenities and the added comforts of coffee and tea. Preparing breakfast (or any meal) is easy with our kitchen equipped with a microwave and oven.
column14: I am reachable over Airbnb/sms/email/phone and available to discuss the apartment and Amsterdam over a coffee. As I am working full-time, my in-person availability is nights and weekends. Able to provide advice on where to go, what to eat and what’s going on if desired.
column15: Dear guest, please treat our apartment and neighbors as if they were your own :) -  Smoking can be enjoyed on the back balcony, but is not allowed in the apartment, stairway or immediately outside the apartment building. -  Partying is best done in the bars and venues of Amsterdam, not my apartment. No parties, events or loud music are permitted. Please keep noise to a minimum between 22:00 (10pm) and 09:00 (9am). -  Drugs (including marihuana), animals and unregistered guests (aka strangers) in the apartment are not tolerated. Amsterdam has coffeeshops and the Artis Zoo for that sort of activity. -  Be gentle to our furniture, appliances and treasures. Our kitchen sink is very sensitive and will clog if food or loose tea goes down the drain. Same with our shower.
column25: Ever since leaving Los Angeles, I’ve been on the move. First to study industrial design at the Rhode Island School of Design, then to Copenhagen, New York, Boston and now Amsterdam. These days I am a creative strategist, traveler and sailor. My dream is to circumnavigate the world by sailboat and share those experiences on video.

column10: This part of Amsterdam has something for everyone. The neighbourhood has an authentic late 19th century Amsterdam vibe with boutiques, shops, gyms, bars, and a food market. Within 500 meters there is a wide variety of restaurants for any type of budget. Excellent coffee and tea are being served at virtually every other 50 steps.  The renowned museums are only a 12 minute stroll through the lovely Vondelpark away. And in cases where walking isn’t the best option, public transport and taxis can be found just outside the apartment.
column12: To get to the apartment is quit easy because of it’s accessible position in the city. You can travel from Schiphol airport to our location with public transport in about half an hour. It will safe you the taxi ride. When you come by train from the central train station, it’s only one tram you have to take. We are situated close to a highway exit, which makes it easy reachable by car. Parking in the direct neighbourhood can sometimes be difficult and expensive.  When you plan to get to us, we will provide customized information and help you find your way.

column7: There are little ground floor apartments as spacious as this one in Amsterdam. This 100m2 space with high ceilings (2.5 - 3.2m) is fitted with large sky lights that fill the living room with daylight. The apartment is perfectly suited for couples who like to experience a city as locals. In the morning you can enjoy your coffee in the sun in front of the house. Straight out the door you'll find the canals, major sights, boutique shops, restaurants and café/bars. If you're feet are tired of roaming the city, the apartment is perfect to recharge yourself for the evening & night. If you want to enjoy the nice spring/summer weather of Amsterdam - do not hesitate to fire up the BBQ in our garden or to take the carry-on BBQ to the Vondelpark to enjoy a picnic among the locals. Our living room/kitchen is the piece the resistance of our apartment. The space and lighting gives you a feeling of freedom which is ideal for breakfasts or afternoon relaxing. You are more than welcome to use our fully

column10: De Pijp is vibrant and very much on its way up. As can be expected of an area that is centred on the nation’s most famous outdoor market: Albert Cuypmarkt, near to the Heineken brewery. This Amsterdam neighbourhood is famously diverse with over 100 nationalities represented. While still the best neighbourhood to choose from a wide selection of ethnic food, more high-end bars and restaurants have come on the scene to service students and young professionals. Further east along De Pijp there is the Van Woustraat, a former fast food strip, there are now several of the city’s more highly regarded restaurants. But perhaps most representative of the area is Bazar, a former church on the Albert Cuypmarkt that has been reinvented as a funky North African café/restaurant.

column25: I have been living in Amsterdamfor 25 years now. Studied history of art at the University of Amsterdam and graduated in 1997. Then I left my city for 3 years to work in Mexico as a tourguide. Came back in 2000 and worked as a national guide throughout Belgium and the Netherlands. Since 2005 I'm a parttime teacher and guide, a great combination. I still love to travel but if the weather allows it is we take our small boat and enjoy the canals of Amsterdam or the outside area. I love to stroll, taking a terrace, drink a wine with friends...I love my city!!

column5: The city center & nature @ your fingertips
column6: We love to welcome you to our warm, comfortable & spacious home in the safe and child friendly neighborhood Elzenhagen, an area located in the 7th most hip neighborhoods of the world, Amsterdam-North.  With the brandnew subway near our house you're only 5 minutes away from Amsterdam Central Station. So you can enjoy the vibrant city of Amsterdam and the relaxing and peaceful atmosphere of our home and the Dutch countryside at the same time.
column7: DE RUIMTE The house has:  - one sleeping room with a big double bed  - a spacious attic room with a big double bed. The space has a high rooftop. With plants, books, magazines, a digital piano and big bean bag it is a great place to relax after or before a day in the busy center. - one children's bedroom with two beds, a children's bed (lot's of great toys) and a 1-persons bed - one room with a sofa bed for one person,  - a comfortable open kitchen space with a toaster, fridge and freezer, dishwasher, oven, water heater etc. We hate staying in apartments on holiday where there aren't even any basics to cook with, like salt and olive oil, so the kitchen is stocked with all the usual larder fare to help yourself to if you're cooking in. Plus freshly ground coffee and all sorts of teas.  - attached to the kitchen is a large dining table with place for seven people. If needed a special trip trap chair for the little one.  - livingroom with two sofa's, books, a nice powerful bluetooth speak
column8: We love to welcome you to our warm, comfortable & spacious home in the safe and child friendly neighborhood Elzenhagen, an area located in the 7th most hip neighborhoods of the world, Amsterdam-North.  With the brandnew subway near our house you're only 5 minutes away from Amsterdam Central Station. So you can enjoy the vibrant city of Amsterdam and the relaxing and peaceful atmosphere of our home and the Dutch countryside at the same time. DE RUIMTE The house has:  - one sleeping room with a big double bed  - a spacious attic room with a big double bed. The space has a high rooftop. With plants, books, magazines, a digital piano and big bean bag it is a great place to relax after or before a day in the busy center. - one children's bedroom with two beds, a children's bed (lot's of great toys) and a 1-persons bed - one room with a sofa bed for one person,  - a comfortable open kitchen space with a toaster, fridge and freezer, dishwasher, oven, water heater etc. We hate staying in apart
column10: Our home in located the picturesque district 'Elzenhagen', with houses build in a very typical Dutch Zaanse style. It is perfectly located, with close by on the one hand central Amsterdam and on the other Waterland, the typical Dutch countryside. The charming villages and tranquil surroundings of neighbouring Waterland region make it a perfect destination for exploring by bike. We will lay out two lists for you. One with our favorite places to visit in the center of lovely Amsterdam and one with our favorite spots in Amsterdam-North, the 7th most hip neighborhoods of the world, according to (URL HIDDEN)  "Amsterdam North has an industrial feel and became one of the coolest neighbourhoods over the last years. More and more hotspots are popping up!"
column11: The house equipped for a family with children, and because this fits perfectly with our neighborhood, we deginetly prefer guests 30+ with children and no students at all. Please keep in mind before booking, thanks!
column12: There is a free parking space available.  The center of Amsterdam is:  15 min by car (tip: take an Uber for about €20); 18 min by bike; 5 min by public transport (to central station).  The countryside, Waterland or Zunderdorp, are just between 8 and 15 minutes away by bike or car.
column13: You have access to the whole house and the garden. The whole apartment is for you and is not shared with anyone else.
column14: We should be able to meet you in person to let you in, show you the apartment and answer any questions. Sometimes, due to your arrival time and what we're up to, we won't be able to meet you personally and so will arrange to leave the keys at the neighbors to collect. You can us by phone or on airbnb at anytime during your stay.
column15: We love it if our guests enjoy our home as we do. We expect that our guests treat it with care and respect.  Leave it behind proper: we don't expect you to wash the windows ;) but we do expect you to put the dirty dishes in the dishmachine, to pick up the sheets of the bed, to close the door properly behind you everytime you leave the house and preferible a 'no shoes inside' policy (just to keep it nice and clean). That kind of things. It is a family neighborhood. For big time partying you need to go out :)
column25:
Hi, 
We're a couple with a 10 year old boy. We work in the creative industry.

We love our home and like you to experience that too, we want you to feel at home. 

We strive to offer you a pleasant and memorable stay in our hometown Amsterdam. 

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or special requests. 
We would be delighted to host you during your stay in Amsterdam!

Sinds een paar jaar woon ik samen met mijn vriend in Amsterdam. Onlangs zijn we verhuisd naar een prachtig appartement en dit willen wij graag delen met andere reizigers, omdat we het zelf ook heel leuk vinden om in een vreemde stad in een leuk huis te verblijven in plaats van een hotel. /

Since 2013 I live with my boyfriend in Amsterdam. Recently we moved into a beautiful apartment and we want to share with other travelers as we ourselves find it nice to stay in a strange city in a nice house instead of a hotel.

column5: Museum Square hotspot, sunny, view on the water
column6: With a great view on the water, the apartment is located right next to the museum square, in the hearth of Amsterdam and few step away from the popular area the Pipe. Nearby are many shops, supermarkets, restaurants and cafes/bars and of course not forgetting the Albert Cuyp market. Within walking distance are all the popular museums (Stedelijk, Rijks, Van Gogh) as well as Vondel Park, Leidse Square etc. There is a very good accessibility by public transport. A place to be and enjoy Amsterdam!

Zo bent u razend snel in hartje Amsterdam.

column6: Very light and Large Duplex apartment on 3rd and 4th floor in walking distance (5mn) to Westerpark and Jordaan. It has a fully equipped open kitchen and living room. Upstairs 2 bedrooms with 1 king and 1 queen. Single bed can be added for 1 child.
column7: This is a large 125m2 light apartment on the 3rd and 4th floor.   Third floor has a living area, and an open kitchen with a bar to sit. The fourth floor has an open space + 2 bedrooms with a King and a Queen.  The Bathroom contains a separate shower and a bath tub.
column8: Very light and Large Duplex apartment on 3rd and 4th floor in walking distance (5mn) to Westerpark and Jordaan. It has a fully equipped open kitchen and living room. Upstairs 2 bedrooms with 1 king and 1 queen. Single bed can be added for 1 child. This is a large 125m2 light apartment on the 3rd and 4th floor.   Third floor has a living area, and an open kitchen with a bar to sit. The fourth floor has an open space + 2 bedrooms with a King and a Queen.  The Bathroom contains a separate shower and a bath tub. Access to the apartment is on the second floor. There is a small separate storage on the 4th floor that is not accessible. If you need any help tips to get around or find good restaurants. Give me a call I am happy to help! West (Westerpark) is an up and coming neighbourhood. The park is around the corner. This is the place the locals go to for the popular Sunday Market and is great for running in the mornings or spend a sunny afternoon. The Jordaan neighbourhood is a 5 minute walk
column10: West (Westerpark) is an up and coming neighbourhood. The park is around the corner. This is the place the locals go to for the popular Sunday Market and is great for running in the mornings or spend a sunny afternoon. The Jordaan neighbourhood is a 5 minute walk and a great walk towards the Anne Frank house (15mn).
column11: Standard Check-in times are from 3PM Check-out 11AM. Renting bicycles to get around town is great. please put them in the bicycle parking to the right of the building not in front.
column12: Its easy to get around. Public Transport (tram and bus) is a 5 mn walk. The city of Amsterdam is full of bike rentals which I can really recommend!  TIP: Download the 9292 app for door to door instructions for all public transport. Parking: Advice P+R Bos en Lommer (exit S105 from West, S104 from North) Read more about it on the iamsterdam website! /visiting/plan-your-trip/getting-around/parking/park-and-ride. Parking in a Park + Ride (P+R) car park costs only €1 or €8 per 24 hours – with a maximum parking time of up to 96 hours (subject to exceptions).  The P+R rates are calculated as follows: Enter on weekdays before 10:00: €8 for the first 24 hours, then €1 for subsequent 24 hour periods Enter on weekdays after 10:00: €1 per 24 hours Enter in the weekend: €1 per 24 hours THERE ARE RULES: Condition of P+R: onward travel to city centre zone by public transport To be eligible for the discounted P+R parking rate: You must travel into the city centre zone using your OV-chipkaart or P+R G
column13: Access to the apartment is on the second floor. There is a small separate storage on the 4th floor that is not accessible.
column14: If you need any help tips to get around or find good restaurants. Give me a call I am happy to help!
column15: Houses in Amsterdam are not sound proof. This is a residential area so please be considerate and do not make too much noise after 11PM. Other tip is not wear high heels inside the apartments. Pets are not allowed.
column25: I'm Ono and I am enjoying life in Amsterdam with my wife and two kids (9 and 11). I play hockey in the weekends and if I find the time we visit Artis (zoo) or one of the many museums in Amsterdam. When the sun is out also Westerpark has some hidden gems.

column6: This spacious nice family house is 15 minutes away from the city centre, with four bedrooms and spacious livingroom with access to garden. The Northern part of Amsterdam, where this house is situated, is a calm area and close to hotspots and centre.
column7: This house is perfect for family's or two couples. With the garden to relax and the spacious livingroom you have many ways to chill out after a day in the centre. At ground floor you find the modern open kitchen and access to the garden. At first floor you find the first bedroom with double size bed and two child bedrooms. At the attic you find another nice double size bed, the other half of the attic is play ground for the children. The parking is free in this area!!
column8: This spacious nice family house is 15 minutes away from the city centre, with four bedrooms and spacious livingroom with access to garden. The Northern part of Amsterdam, where this house is situated, is a calm area and close to hotspots and centre. This house is perfect for family's or two couples. With the garden to relax and the spacious livingroom you have many ways to chill out after a day in the centre. At ground floor you find the modern open kitchen and access to the garden. At first floor you find the first bedroom with double size bed and two child bedrooms. At the attic you find another nice double size bed, the other half of the attic is play ground for the children. The parking is free in this area!! You have full and private access to the house during your stay. For the rental of my house I asked Minou and Lindy to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you
column10: The Northern part of Amsterdam is a really nice area to stay when you like a bit calmness and also want to be close to the city centre: within reach by 15 minutes. North is the upcoming neighbourhood of Amsterdam and itself has many hip and trendy bars, restaurants and other nice visits like Eye Film museum. Especially the NDSM area is hot at the moment. And, from this side of Amsterdam you can easily go to visit other villages around the city, like Durgerdam, Volendam and Marken.
column11: We share the house with a cat, who will NOT be at the house during your stay. But be aware when you are allergic.
column12: Bus stop at walking distance brings you directly to central station (15 minutes). Large bus station also at walking distance bringing you to city centre and interesting villages around Amsterdam like Volendam, Broek in Waterland, Zaanse Schans.  With taxi/uber also withing 15 minutes in city centre.
column13: You have full and private access to the house during your stay.
column14: For the rental of my house I asked Minou and Lindy to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you.
column15: Please respect the house and the neighbourhood. No smoking inside, no loud music, parties or drugs. Let us know your estimated time of arrival ánd departure as soon as possible.  We charge €30 for late check ins after 8.00 PM.
column25: Hello I am Ralph. I live in a nice, residential area in Amsterdam. I live here with my two sons. Every now and then we leave the city for the countryside. When we are out of of town we are excited about renting our dear apartment to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam. It's a relaxing place, with a Sunny garden and a nice comfortable feeling. We hope that when you stay here, you will feel at home. We love it here, and we hope you will too.

column7: The apartment is near all the popular hotspots in Amsterdam. The Museum square and the Leidse square are within walking distance and the Vondel Parc is right across the street. column11: At this moment the balcony is being fixed. That means there will be construction workers that need to enter the house in the morning. I can imagine this can cause inconvenience so please be aware of this before booking!
column12: The apartment is only 20 minutes away from the airport. Tram 1 to Amsterdam Central station is available right in front of the building.
column13: We have 1 big room with a double bed and matrass on the floor and another bedroom with a double bed. You can use the kitchen (we will have coffee &tea for you), living room, bathroom and all the appliances that we have. There will be a set of towels for you to use. There is no hair dyer.
column14: If we're able we will meet you to give you the key. Otherwise we have another solution for this. And if you like I could answer any questions you might have.
column15: Please respect our home and our neighbors and no loud music after 10pm. Smoking is not allowed within the apartment, we have 2 balconies where you could smoke. column5: Discover Amsterdam's beauty from a great location.
column6: This easy going part of town is the excellent fall out base for your stay in Amsterdam. The neighbourhood is charming and quiet. The apartment is welcoming, cozy and clean. Located at an arms length from Central Station where you can find all public transport that will take you to all of your inner and outer city destinations. In walking distance from the apartment there is 't Ij Brewery, Artis Zoo, several museums, and public transport to take you anywhere you want to go. See you soon!
column7: The apartment building is from 1994, so rather new for Amsterdam standards. It is built on a small island where east meets the centre.  Playfully in between a yacht club and a small park with a canal running through. The interior space is really cozily and playfully designed by Regina herself. We think you will enjoy the apartment!

Playfully in between a yacht club and a small park with a canal running through. The interior space is really cozily and playfully designed by Regina herself. We think you will enjoy the apartment! As guest in our apartment you have access to your room, W.C., bathroom, kitchen, balcony and laundry room. Wifi is free There is space for your clothes in the mirror closet i
column10: Quiet and friendly neighborhood. We have 2 supermarkets to attend to your beverage and food supply. There's a great butcher and 2 really good fish shops! A lot of tasty restaurants around to indulge on within arms length from the apartment.
column11: We have two cats, one really friendly Siamese and a more nervous one. They are both very kind and have never hurt anybody. We live 2 stories up and the building has very wide and easy to climb stairs.
column12: Walking distance from our place there is: Brouwerij 't Ij, 10 minutes  Cafe Roest, 10 minutes Scheepvaart museum, 10 minutes Nemo Science museum, 15 minutes Micropia molecular museum, 15 minutes Artis Zoo, 15 minutes Hortus Botanicus, 15 minutes Waterlooplein flea market, 15 minutes Public transport:  5 minutes walking from our apartment you can take "tram 26, tram 10 and bus 22"  Tram 26 goes direction Ijburg, or in the other direction to Central Station. Tram 10 goes to Van Hall straat and is the tram you need to take to go to the Van Gogh museum, Rijks Museum, Heineken brewery, Jordaan and Vondelpark. Bus 22 comes here from Sloterdijk Station and is also passing by Central Station on it's route.
column13: As guest in our apartment you have access to your room, W.C., bathroom, kitchen, balcony and laundry room. Wifi is free There is space for your clothes in the mirror closet in your room. In the kitchen you may use the oven and stove. We have reserved a place in the fridge especially for you .  Feel free to make coffee or tea anytime. There is a sunny and cozy corner in the kitchen where you can enjoy your meal or drinks. In the bathroom there is organic liquid soap and shampoo available for your personal care. You will get your own wash basin and there is space reserved to store your toiletries in the bathroom.
column14: We will gladly inform you to our best knowledge of where you want to go and how you should get there. If you need any tips or have any questions you are more then welcome to ask us.
column15: - Smoking on balcony, accessable from the kitchen - Feel free to use our kitchen - There is space in the fridge for you - Our neighbours are very kind people, so please be polite with them and keep it down in the neighborhood and staircase from 10PM until 8AM
column25:
Regina was born in Belo Horizonte, Brazil and moved to Amsterdam sometime ago.
She is a masseuse and mainly works for spas and hotels. 
I, Eric am Dutch and make and perform music for a loving and living.
I have been living in Amsterdam for around 20 years now.
We love to travel in Asia, South America, everywhere really!
First foods that springs to mind are: Italian, Indian or Thai if you find the right spot it can all be amazing!

Some great restaurants, only 5 min. walk away like Italian Gallizia (Javastraat, great wines!), Dutch/French Wilde Zwijnen en Thai Tiger, both Javaplein. If you want to shop, visit the Dappermarkt (daily) or Oostpoort. If you want to go to the city centre, its only 15 min ride on the bike which you can rent at the Muiderpoort station or at Stayokay Zeeburg.
