column6: The spacious apartment (approx. 90m2) is perfectly located, at the border of the popular neighborhood De Pijp on the city centre side, in between the Heineken Experience and the Rijksmuseum. The apartment gives an amazing view from the spacious living room (loft feeling) and the sunny rooftop terrace. The place is great for couples, on walking distance of everything you need! Explore tons of restaurants, shops (the popular P.C. Hooftstraat is very nearby), museums, the Vondelpark and much more.
column7: The apartment is located on the third and fourth floor of a characteristic house.  Private entrance (not shared) on the street side. You will find the spacious living room and kitchen on the third floor. The view from there is amazing. You can even see the top of the Rijksmuseum from the kitchen! The bathroom and double bedroom are located on the fourth floor. The bedroom gives access to the sunny and private rooftop terrace (including comfortable lounge set) on the south side of the building. You can enjoy the sun from 13:00 until sunset.  The apartment is fully equipped with a flatscreen TV, wireless internet, dishwasher and many other kitchen equipments. The bathroom has a separate bath and shower. Perfect public transport connections around the corner. Make yourself feel at home and enjoy your stay!

column6: A 70M2 bright apartment located in the nice "Baarsjes" area which is very close to the Vondelpark and the city center. A perfect place for a couple to chill out and explore Amsterdam! Chill out on the big sofa, have a drink on the balcony and sleep in a king sized bed after a long day of sightseeing. On arrival I will show you all the best placed around. I look forward seeing you.
column7: The apartment is situated on the first floor and has its own front door. The living room is spacious, relax and very light due to the big balcony doors. The sun hits the balcony round 15:00 and it a great spot to enjoy some well deserved drinks after a long trip. You can chill out on the huge sofa while you watch a movie on the flat screen TV or play your favorite Spotify playlist. The living room also contains the big dining table where you can enjoy your meal. The bathroom has a comfortable shower but also bath if you really want to chill out. The kitchen is separate and is fully equipped. For all your basic needs you can find two supermarkets (Lidl & Jumbo) and a nice coffee place within 1 minute walking distance. The bedroom has a king sized bed (180m x 210m) with a great matrass. The bedroom is situated at the back of the building and it’s very quiet at night. In the morning you can open the balcony doors and enjoy your breakfast in the sun.

column10: The Baarsjes was built in the 1930’s. The apartment is located in a quiet street but the area is really booming in the last few years. Many cool clubs, bars and restaurants have opened within a 10-minute walk. I’m more then happy to tell you where you can find the really nice places.
column11: Freshly made up bed with towels will be waiting for you upon arrival. I want to welcome you into a clean and cosy home!
column12: From Schiphol airport to my sofa can be done within 30min! You just have to take 1 train tand hop on of the the many trams. I will tell you what to do when I get your arrival times. The Vondelpark is just a 3-minute walk and many trams stop around the corner. They will take you to the Canals, Leidscheplein, Museum Square and the lovely Jordaan area within 10 minutes. Or you can rent a bike nearby and discover the city in the best way:)
column13: The whole apartment is accessible to you including my MacMini to play your Spotify music or to check your Netflix on the big flatscreen TV.
column14: I'm happy to help you with finding the way to my apartment and to provide you with information to make you find all the hotspots. You can always reach me by phone or email if you would need any help.
column15: 1. No smoking and no drugs at all 2. No pets 3. No loud noises after 22:00 4. No parties. If you like to party I can show you all the best places:) 5. Leave the apartment as you found it:)
column25: We are Thijmen and Jori and happily living together in Amsterdam. During our absence we welcome guests into our great apartment so they can use it as their base to discover Amsterdam. We like to help our guests with tips about what to do, where to eat and where to go out at night. See you soon!

column6: Family home surrounded by green despite its central location in an area with buzz. Three level division ensures privacy. A sunny pavement invites playing for kids. The area is close to universities, trains, parks, museums and restaurants.
column7: Our three level 1930 home was fully renovated by architects in 2014: On the first level of our apartment is an open and spacious kitchen with a sunny balcony, a large living room situated at the South, and a toilet. The second level consists of three bed rooms, two of them with access to a balcony, a bathroom with heated floors, large bath and rain shower, a separate toilet, and a washing room with dryer and washing machine. The third level is a large bedroom and working space, and a roof terrace with eating space and city view.

column10: Watergraafsmeer is a child friendly and centrally located neighborhood. The area is quiet, with unusually little traffic, and lots of green. We live close to several playgrounds, parks, sport areas, swimming pools, museums, the zoo, hip restaurants and cafes.
column12: The house is two minutes walk to buses and five minutes a train station. It is 15 minutes on bike from the most centrally located square of Amsterdam. There are plenty of (paid) parking spaces just outside the house.

column25: I am a researcher and mother of three. I love running, cooking, eating, reading, hiking and watching soccer. I immigrated to Amsterdam from Denmark ten years ago for love. My husband is Dutch. Our favorite occupation is to walk and bike around the city to explore the way it changes. We also have a vegetable garden just outside the city center that we visit every week and use for cooking every summer. We love travelling particularly since we got kids. Through their view the most boring places become amazing adventures.

column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. The apartment is located in a vibrant neighborhood. The Jan Pieter Heijenstraat is the place to be with plenty of shops, restaurants and bars.  The Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc, and a completely renovated tram depot: the Foodhallen, an indoor food market a must see when in Amsterdam. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby. Dam Square: 3km Central Station: 3.7km Museumsquare: 2.1km

column7: This small but cozy apartment has a living room with a couch and two comfortable chairs from which you can read a book or watch tv or a dvd. There is a big window overlooking the streets. The bedroom has a double bed and a closet where you can store your clothes. From the bedroom you can enter the balcony, where you have a view over the terrace of Podium Mozaiek, an international theater and cafe in a former church. You can also enter the balcony from the kitchen. The kitchen is basic but has everything you need: stove, electric oven, microwave, refrigerator, coffee machine, kettle, toaster, blender and a  washing machine. There is a small bathroom with a toilet, sink and shower

column10: There are a couple of supermarkets, grocery shops, bakery's, restaurants and lunch places at walking distance. There are a couple of parks in the neighborhood. There is a small park (Erasmuspark) just a few minutes walk from my apartment. It's a nice place to hang out on a sunny day. Also close by is Westerpark, a very nice park with a couple of restaurants, cafe's and nice spots to go out during the night. In the summer there are also a couple of festivals at Westerpark. It's my favorite park in Amsterdam!
column12: I always travel by bike or public transport. Very close to my apartment (less than 2 minutes walk) there are different trams and buses to catch. Tram 14: takes you to the east side of Amsterdam via Westermarkt, Dam Square, Spui, Rembrandt Square, Waterloo Square, Artis and Flevopark. Tram 12: one way takes you to train station Sloterdijk in a couple of minutes. From there you catch the train to Schiphol, Haarlem, the beach at Zandvoort or other places. The other way takes you to Overtoom (next to Leidse Square and Vondelpark), Museum Square, Ceintuurbaan (next to Albert Cuyp) and train station Amstelstation. Bus 21: takes you to Westerpark (but you can also walk to Westerpark) and Central Station. If you travel via Schiphol, it's easy to get to my place. There is a direct train from Schiphol to Amsterdam Sloterdijk and from there you take tram 12. It's only 4 stops to my apartment. If you are planning to get here by car, be aware that parking is very expensive. There is a park and ride

Fortunately times have changed! It now can easily house 3/4 persons. There is a spacious morden garden at the back of the apartment, ideal for young children or relaxing in the sun. Apartment  • Interior: a modern classic mix, sophisticated homely feel.  • Layout: 100m2, two bedrooms, open dining room - living room and kitchen, bathroom and separate toilet  • Beds: 1 double bed, 1 bunk-bed for two younger ones  • Facilities: kitchen equipped with full appliances, free Wi-Fi, we provide our guests with towels and bedding

column10: The area is called 'Gold West' instead of Old West due to its quality of life and closeness to almost every touristic attraction. In fact, the Anne Frank house, Van Gogh and Rijks museum, Leidseplein, Concert hall, Vondelpark is all within max 10 minutes walking distance. There are many high quality restaurants and cafe's only 2 blocks away. Despite the fact that the bustling area of the Leidseplein is only 5 minutes away, the area is very quiet and located in a one way street. We love it because of the fact that we don't need a car in the weekend and can do everything on foot. There is a lovely cafe (cafe l'Affiche) on the corner of the street at the Canal with a big terrace where you can have lunch in the sun or have a beer or wine in the afternoon and evening. In the 'ten Catestraat' (400 m) there is a daily, typical Amsterdam, market where you can buy everything you need. A big supermarket and small specialty stores (fish, vegetables, fruit, bread) are all within 100m.

column10: It's a unique space (a two story corner house with a garden in/near the city centre is kind of rare), located in a unique neighbourhood: Disteldorp was founded in 1917 to provide housing in a war-afflicted and overcrowded city (also because of Belgian refugees). The situation in the city centre was unhealthy so they created these 'garden villages' in the North to give the poor a better place to live.  Now, Amsterdam North is rapidly turning into the hippest neighbourhood of Amsterdam, with lots of creative start ups settling here, many places to have food and drinks, shop for vintage, visit warehouse parties and the newest edition is Adam Tower (next to the spectacular EYE museum) with a brand new club, restaurant, viewpoint etc. In short: a bustling neighbourhood where there is still space to breathe and some non-conformative rough edges to enjoy. The Brooklyn of Amsterdam.

We are staying close by so you can always reach us with any questions. I will be also happy to give you tips about the neighbourhood and the city. De pijp neighbourhood is the most lovely and cosy part of Amsterdam. There are countless cafes and restaurants around. The famous Albert Cuyp market is just around the corner. column11: The stairs are typically Amsterdam city center stairs and therefore most, not used to these kind of stairs will call them steep.  We are planning for a renovation beginning of next year.
column12: There is a tram (line 16), only 100m from the studio, which will take you to the Central Station in a 10min ride. From Central Station to get to our home, this is the best tram option, line 16 and get off at Albert Cuypstreet. The area is very well connected with several bus and tram lines around the corner, to take you anywhere you want in town. There are multiple bike rentals around with bikes for around 10 EUR a day to rent. We are surrounded by canals, so we Always advise to take a boat trip to experience magical Amsterdam from the water!

column6: In one of most loved areas of Amsterdam by Amsterdammers,  our house sits on a peaceful 1920's Berlage designed street with things to do in all directions. 5 min walk North, South, East, or West you'll be in hip bars, great restaurants, huge parks, or walking along the Amstel river. Close enough to the tourist hustle and bustle city centre (2 metro stops to Waterlooplein), right in the middle of the crozier cafe-life, park-life, and nightlife that makes Amsterdam a top liveable city.
column7: Our house has direct street access (its own front door). Directly up one flight of stairs you will find the living room, toilet, kitchen, and small balcony on the first floor. The bedrooms and bathroom are on the second. There are two bedrooms, one with queen size bed, the other with three single beds (200 x 80 cm). If needed, a 2nd two persons bed can be arranged. As we have 3 kids ourselves, this house is great for families with children (lots of toys, a slide, and a baby (Website hidden by Airbnb) no need to lug too much kids stuff).

column6: "One of the 25 Coolest Hotels in the World" - Forbes Hi there soon-to-be local! We are Zoku and we’d love to be your award-winning home-base in the centre of Amsterdam. We focus on providing a home for business travellers from innovative and fast-growing companies worldwide. Zoku is a relaxed place to live, work and socialize with like-minded people while getting wired into the city.
column7: The 24m2 Zoku Loft sets new standards in the intelligent use of space. As a living/working hybrid, it can be easily adjusted to become cozy, business-like or something in between. In a regular hotel room or studio apartment, the bed always dominates. At Zoku, a big kitchen table serves as focal point. Use it to work across time zones, host dinner parties or gently rest your head after making a deadline. You decide. Then feel free to change your mind. The same goes for swapping the art on your walls, after which you can enjoy the view from your comfy Muuto design furniture. The elevated sleeping area, with super comfy king-size bed, can be screened off for visitors. Stylish sliding doors can also hide away the bathroom’s spacious shower and the fully equipped kitchen is capable of pumping out the perfect espressos in the morning and the tastiest of pastas at night. The Zoku Loft also features plenty of storage space for your suitcases, as well as an alcove desk complete with office supp
column8: "One of the 25 Coolest Hotels in the World" - Forbes Hi there soon-to-be local! We are Zoku and we’d love to be your award-winning home-base in the centre of Amsterdam. We focus on providing a home for business travellers from innovative and fast-growing companies worldwide. Zoku is a relaxed place to live, work and socialize with like-minded people while getting wired into the city. The 24m2 Zoku Loft sets new standards in the intelligent use of space. As a living/working hybrid, it can be easily adjusted to become cozy, business-like or something in between. In a regular hotel room or studio apartment, the bed always dominates. At Zoku, a big kitchen table serves as focal point. Use it to work across time zones, host dinner parties or gently rest your head after making a deadline. You decide. Then feel free to change your mind. The same goes for swapping the art on your walls, after which you can enjoy the view from your comfy Muuto design furniture. The elevated sleeping area, with
column10: Zoku is very conveniently located in the Eastern Canal District, in the heart of Amsterdam. On arterial "Weesperstraat", the building is easily accessible by car, bicycle and public transport (only a 3 minute walk to metros, busses and trams!). Being 10 minutes away from the Central Station by metro and 15 minutes from the city's business districts, the "RAI" and the "Zuidas" (South Axis), it's truly a hub from which any important location in the city can be easily reached. Zoku is also within cuddling distance of the city's main cultural, entertainment and shopping areas. Wish to explore the city the Amsterdam way? We have bikes for rent that will give you the freedom to roam wherever you want, whilst blending in with the locals. Our Sidekicks know all there is to know about the city's hidden gems and local places-to-be. Just give them a little nudge, they love to pass on local knowledge!
column11: Zoku, which is Japanese for family, tribe or clan, facilitates global living and working for the traveling professional. Zoku is a new category in the hotel industry: a flexible home/office hybrid, also suitable for long stays, with the services of a hotel and the social buzz of a thriving neighborhood. You can live, work, relax and socialize with like-minded people – while getting wired into the city.
column12: FROM THE AIRPORT Option 1) At Schiphol Airport, take the train to Amsterdam Central Station (this is also a stop for trains going towards Amersfoort or Lelystad Centrum). From Central Station take Metro 51 (direction Westwijk), Metro 53 (direction Gaasperplas), or Metro 54 (direction Gein) to the Weesperplein Metro Station. From there it’s a 3-minute walk to Zoku down Weesperstraat, direction Waterlooplein. The trip will take you around 30 to 40 minutes. Option 2) At Schiphol Airport, take the train to Amsterdam Zuid station (this is a stop for trains going towards Weesp, Utrecht Centraal, Amersfoort Schothorst, Almere Oostvaarders or Enschede). There, take Metro 51 (direction Centraal Station) to Weesperplein Metro Station. From there it’s a 3-minute walk to Zoku down Weesperstraat, direction Waterlooplein. column13: Why do we think you will really like our award-winning concept? - Meet like-minded people & get wired into the city through community events and with help from our sidekicks - Enjoy a drink on our rooftop terrace or Greenhouse - You can relax in our lively café/bar & cozy Living Room - Enjoy our honest food, served fast from our daily changing menu in our restaurant. - Get productive in our collaborative co-working spaces
column14: We replaced traditional hotel staff with Sidekicks who are globally centered yet rooted in the local scene. They will connect you to all of Zoku’s services, as well as our network of inspiring people, places and things.
column25: Zoku is a re-invented apartment hotel brand facilitating global living and working. A place you can call a second home, even on your first visit. Zoku creates a new category in the hotel industry: a hybrid between a home and an office with the services of a hotel topped with the social buzz of a thriving neighborhood. Zoku is suitable for people who live and work in a city for a period of between five days and three months. Zoku offers the travelling professional a global nomad’s home base through a smart loft (private areas) and social spaces (communal areas) to work, sleep, play and live in. Zoku gives the mobile professional time and space to customize their own living- and working area, meet peers, enhance their business network, live an asset-light lifestyle and generally have a good time.

column5: Relaxed and light main-floor apartment with garden
column6: A comfortable apartment on Amsterdam’s ‘Westelijke eilanden’ , an unique quiet part in the city center of Amsterdam. Together they form a pictorial neighbourhood with plenty of places where you’ll be surprised by its absolute beauty.
column7: A fully self-catering apartment, fully furnished with modern facilities. The apartment offers a bathroom, bedroom, spacious living and dining area and a fully equipped modern kitchen. A Nepresso machine, KitchenAid, slowjuicer, free linen, washing machine, tumble dry machine and a hi-speed WIFI connection are all included. Its wide windows and beautiful wooden floor give the apartment a warm and bright atmosphere. The living room is furnished with a big L-shape 6-person sofa and flat screen TV. The living room is made up of a fully equipped kitchen with a dining table.  In the back of the apartment you'll find the spacious garden on the south side, that means there is sun! In the garden you can hang out in the hammock or enjoy a good BBQ session.

column10: The best way to explore Amsterdam is by bike (like all locals do). You can easily rent a bike closeby my place; +-15 min. Dam Square / Central Station Within walking distance you can enjoy Westerpark which is a great place to hang out with nice weather and the "Jordaan" neighbourhood. Jordaan is famous for its picturesque canal views and streets, cozy restaurants and boutique shops ("9 straatjes" / The 9 small streets) and where the Anna Frank museum is situated.
column12: Around the corner (2min walk) there is a tram stop (# 3) which makes a circle around the city and stops for example at Vondelpark, PC Hoofdstraat (luxury shopping street) and Museum Square. From this line you can also easily transfer to other tram lines.
column14: What can I offer you: - 60m2 - main floor ( no stairs! ) - spacious livingroom with a big comfortable sofa - spacious bedroom with 2-pers bed - bathroom with a very relaxed shower - fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, oven, etc.  - washing machine - tumble dry machine  - nespresso coffee machine (and cups) - slow juicer - free internet/wifi - a save and popular neighborhood in the citycentre - local transport around the corner to whole city - tourist information, maps etc. - when possible a free pick-up from central station - free parking on other side of "IJ" water (5min walk + 5min free ferry to "Distelweg") On arrival you'll find a map with tips for clubbing, restaurants, to do stuff etc.
column15: Niet geschikt voor huisdieren Geen feestjes of evenementen No partying or noise especially in between 11.00 pm and 7 am We expect you to respect the other residents in the building.
column25: I am a passionate traveller who has visited all 7 continents and almost 100 countries.  I really enjoy living in this city and i would like to share my excitement about Amsterdam with others. I recently bought an apartment in a very nice location and i would like to give other travellers the opportunity to experience the local life when they visit Amsterdam.

column5: Majestic monumental family home - Free parking!
column6: This characteristic, spacious and well modernised family home is located at a fabulous dyke in the hip North part of Amsterdam. The cosy livingroom, superb open kitchen with dinning area garantees a one in a lifetime experience. With 3 roomy sleepingrooms and a beautiful bathroom ánd sunny garden.
column7: You immediately fall in love with the house. Very authentic ánd well modernised, with great space inside. You never want to leave the pleasant open kitchen with dinning area. Directly connected with the livingroom but closing the door gives directly privacy. With a separate livingroom in the basement with direct acces to the lovely and privat garden. Very suited for families up to 6 people.

column10: Declared by the citizen of Amsterdam themselves as one of the most beautiful streets of Amsterdam. The dyke with all characteristic dyke houses is a view you never forget. On walking distance to one of the well known bar/restaurant with its terrace directly on the water. The dyke is part of the hip North Amsterdam with all new and upcoming cultural initiatives and restaurants. A very special part of the city. With bike or bus only 20 minutes away from the city centre.
column11: Taking care of the two cats Mollie and Boef is part of the deal. The cats are very nice and fond op people. The can get in and out the house by theirselves. One of the cat needs 2 times a day a medicin, easily to feed.
column12: It only takes 18 minutes to get to the house by bus 32 departing from Amsterdam Central Station. From busstop Wervershooftstraat you walk within 3 minutes to the house.  Also by bike the city is easy to reach in around 15 minutes. From the house you cycle to one of the free (24/7) ferries. You can take your bike on the ferry. The bikes can be rented at several places all over the city.

column6: Located on the lively Albert Cuyp market, this luxury apartment is perfect for enjoying a visit to Amsterdam. It's comfortable, well equipped, nicely decorated and in the middle of Amsterdams most fun neighbourhood -De Pijp. All the cities highlight are within walking or public transport distance. The apartment has  a Queen sized bed, a huge (sleeping) couch, a home cinema set and a nice and clean bathroom. You won't be disappointed!
column7: I only rent my apartment out occasionally to trustworthy people with positive reviews :)
column8: Located on the lively Albert Cuyp market, this luxury apartment is perfect for enjoying a visit to Amsterdam. It's comfortable, well equipped, nicely decorated and in the middle of Amsterdams most fun neighbourhood -De Pijp. All the cities highlight are within walking or public transport distance. The apartment has  a Queen sized bed, a huge (sleeping) couch, a home cinema set and a nice and clean bathroom. You won't be disappointed! I only rent my apartment out occasionally to trustworthy people with positive reviews :) I will be available most of the daytime and evening, during your entire stay. For emergencies but also for advice on the city. (in my opinion) De Pijp is by far the best area of Amsterdam. It's filled with bars and restaurants, it's in the middle of the city centre right next to the Amstel river. It has the Albert Cuyp Market, Sarphatipark and it's minutes away from the canal belt and central station. Also it's a very safe area. There are many tram, bus and metro stops

The kitchen is fully equipped and with fridge, freezer, dish washer and two ovens. There is one bedroom with two double beds, on request an infant bed and a changing table for baby’s. There wil be space to place your clothes. Next to the bedroom you find the spacious bathroom with double wash table, shower and bath.  Also there is an area where you can work, lend a book or dry and iron your laundry. Beside there is a washing machine and dryer. In the hallway there is a separate toilet. Wireless wifi in the whole apartment

column10: As I described at my listing my place is situated in Amsterdam West, which is a very upcoming area in Amsterdam. Much less touristic than the city centre or de Pijp for example, but it has a much better atmosphere(according to me:)) In my guidebook you'll find lots of nice cafe's to go for a coffee or beer and some restaurants in the neighbourhood. If you're looking for some type of restaurant, just (Hidden by Airbnb) me and i'll let you know(if i know). I know sometimes while travelling you're looking for your 'own' food...:-)
column12: I'd recommend to rent a bike to go around the city, like we people from Amsterdam do. It's the easiest way to get around and see the city in the meantime!  Public transport is very nearby, at the beginning of the street(50mtr). Tram 17 takes you to the city centre or central station. Bus 15 goes from the train station Sloterdijk to train station Amsterdam Zuid(south)and bus 18 goes to Amsterdam central as well(another route, takes about the same time as tram 17).  If you go back home by plane; take tram 17 to train station Amsterdam Lelylaan and from there the train to Schiphol airport. A map of the public transport  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  and more information about day tickets etc. (Website hidden by Airbnb)  For taxi's i'd recommend installing apps like Uber or Abel(Dutch cheaper version of Uber)

During your stay, we will be there to help or assist you with anything since we live in the same building. The young, the old, students, artists, and families have all chosen to make De Pijp their home. This neighbourhood is just outside the actual centre of Amsterdam, which makes it a pleasant place to live.  De Pijp has hundreds of fantastic cafés, restaurants, coffee shops and bars. And what would a visit to Amsterdam be without a trip to the famous Albert Cuypmarket, which is just around the corner (literally). It has hundreds of little market shops and you can get the best dutch street food there, like stroopwafels, poffertjes and dutch 'snackbar' snacks. The Sarphatipark is a small (it stretche
column10: The young, the old, students, artists, and families have all chosen to make De Pijp their home. This neighbourhood is just outside the actual centre of Amsterdam, which makes it a pleasant place to live.  De Pijp has hundreds of fantastic cafés, restaurants, coffee shops and bars. And what would a visit to Amsterdam be without a trip to the famous Albert Cuypmarket, which is just around the corner (literally). It has hundreds of little market shops and you can get the best dutch street food there, like stroopwafels, poffertjes and dutch 'snackbar' snacks. The Sarphatipark is a small (it stretches for two blocks) green park in the middle of De Pijp area and is one of the nicest parks in Amsterdam. Perfect to get some sun and have a picknick with some beer & wines with friends on a sunny day. The park is at the end of the street on which the apartment is located.  Within a 5 minute walk, you are at one of Amsterdam's biggest attractions, located in De Pijp, the Heineken Experience. Defin

column10: Quiet neighborhood, just 10 minutes by bike from Leidse square, Rembrandt square and museum quarter.  Just around the corner you find the Maasstraat with quite a few nice places to have breakfast, lunch and diner. There are bakeries, a butcher and general household shops as well as an ATM machine. Here you can also catch tram 4 which goes straight by all nice and famous areas of Amsterdam like Albert Cuijp Market, Rembrandt Square, Dam Square, Keizersgracht, Prinsengracht, Leidseplein and ends at the Central Station. Or take tram 12 going to the Rijksmuseum, Concert hall, Van Gogh Museum and the luxurious shopping street "P.C. Hooftstraat".
column11: The apartment is very centrally located but in a quiet neighborhood. So you can relax, have a good night sleep but within 10 minutes you'll be in the middle of the vibrant life.

column25:
Hi I'm Lily! An enthusiastic young woman who loves life and wants to get the most out of it. Apart from having a good time with friends, enjoying wine, good dinners and healthy lunches, hanging out in our beautiful city and it's parks, I
of course like to travel as much as possible! Therefor I easily understand the needs of others with the same urges ;-) 

My studio is comfortable and I'm always willing to help if advice is needed. In case I'm abroad myself, I'll make sure there's an equally skilled and kind person that will represent me and who'll also be available for questions.

I hope you feel welcome and maybe see you soon!

column6: Our flat is located on the River Amstel right behind vibrant Rembrantplein.  Bars, coffee shops, restaurants, and public transport are just a few steps away. Our cozy apartment has huge windows that let in tons of natural light. We love it here.
column7: Our space is located super central on Rembrandtplein. Around us there is TONS to do. Unlimited amount of bars, cafes, coffeeshops, restaurants, markets, and so on (there is even a bar and coffee shop directly next door to us). Once you step outside our doors you will be surrounded by canals and beautiful scenery. Just a short walk over the bridge, is the famous waterlooplein market which is a big outdoor bazaar, best for the second hand clothing and full of general bric-a-brac. Traditionally oldest and most interesting market of Amsterdam, Waterlooplein has been during the last decennia’s connected with the youth culture. A big outdoor day market; 300 stands; new and second hand clothes, old military uniforms, old books, video’s and DVD’s, electronics, curiosa, and tons of other fun souvenirs.

Once you step outside our doors you will be surrounded by canals and beautiful scenery. Just a short walk over the bridge, is the famous waterlooplein market which is a big outdoor bazaar, best for the second hand clothing and full of general bric-a-brac. Traditionally oldest and most interesting market of Amsterdam, Waterlooplein has been during the last decennia’s connected with the youth culture. A big outdoor day market; 300 stands; new and second hand clothes, old military uniforms, old books, video’s and DVD’s, elec
column10: Rembrandtplein is one of the busiest squares in the city, at least when it comes to nightlife and clubbing. Other attractions nearby include the Pathé Tuschinski, a modern cinema housed in a classic building that has been a theatre since 1921 and the largest interactive video screen in Europe that dominates one side of the square and can be interacted with using Bluetooth mobile phones. The main attraction for Rembrandtplein, however, is the nightlife happening in the many clubs, cafés and bars. The house is walking distance to many museums, art galleries, cafes, canals, restaurants, outoor markets, etc. It truly doesnt get more central than this!
column11: We have a full kitchen available for use. Cooking can be done on the stove. We also have a little oven, microwave, and fridge with small icebox. Blender, kettle, and french press is also available for use :)
column12: We are surrounded by public transportation. Only a 10 minute walk to dam square, or 15 minute walk to central station, or if you prefer a 1 minute walk to most major tram lines, bus stop, and metro station.
column13: You will be renting a private home.

column15: No smoking inside, outdoors only. Please no loud parties, and be respectful to our neighbours and home :) Also, no pets please!

column7: Enjoy your stay in Amsterdam in this cosy, stylish and modern home. You won't have to sacrifice comfort for style! Then there's the trendy bedroom fitted with a box spring, that'll make you want to snooze just a little longer in the mornings. column6: If you are looking for a stay in a typical Amsterdam canal house, look no further. This unique canal house was built in 1620 by a VOC captain. Totally renovated in 2014 this house combines an authentic and cozy feel, with modern sophistication.
column7: Comfortable entrance on street level, with a small hall and entrance to the living room with fire place. The big kitchen with SMEG oven, wine fridge and all possible amenities is situated in the light souterrain that gives access to the back patio. This is a closed area where kids can play outside. On the first floor is a bedroom with bunkbed for two kids, a walk in closet and bathroom. On the top floor you find the master bedroom, with open bath. All rooms have a view to the canal, a famous old bridge, the Entrepotdok and the Maritime Museum. Yes, it's a beautiful view!  The area is quiet and friendly. Across the water you will find a number of restaurants with outside terrace. You can walk to the Maritime Museum, Science Museum Nemo, and the Artis Zoo within 5 minutes. You can hop on a canal boat just 200 meters from the house. The hustle and bustle of the city center is close by but still this feels like a nice residential area. If you are visiting the city with a family, you will t

column5: Light, cozy & peaceful apartment close to center
column6: Our lovely home  is situated in the trendy neighborhood de Baarsjes in Amsterdam West, close to the center. With many restaurants and cafes and all the major sites 10 minutes away, it's a perfect spot to enjoy the local life of Amsterdam. We offer a cozy apartment for two adults and idealy suited for a couple with a young baby.
column7: Please feel welcome in our light, cozy and peaceful home located in the vibrant neighborhood de Baarsjes, near to the city center. The total apartment is 58 m2 and is ideal for a couple or a family with a baby. We have a baby bed available (up to 2years). The apartment is on the third floor (so, no one above your head) and uses communal stairs with the neighbours on the 1st and 2nd floor.  It was built in the 30’s and still has some unique traditional features, including stained glass and a chimney.  The apartment has an open, spacious feel with a large bedroom located at the back of the house next to a 6 m2 private balcony (sun from 7 am – 2 pm) looking over a courtyard with plenty of trees and birds. The living room is cozy and light with flat screen television (including Wifi, cable television, all major international stations, Netflix, Apple TV and Apple Lightning AV Adapter). column10: De Baarsjes is a lively and vibrant neighborhood in Amsterdam West. It has many restaurants, bars, galleries & shops. The trendy Hallen-complex with its cinema and food court is a 5 minute walk away. Our house is situated in the Geuzen-quarter and surrounded by trees and  a canal. This makes it a relatively quiet & peaceful part of the neighbourhood. The Rembrandtpark, the Vondelpark and the Westerpark are all a max 5 minutes bikeride away and good for a run in the morning. Supermarkets and local shops are all on walking distance and there are many take-away restaurants around. All major museums, the red light district, Rembrandt & Leidsplein Square are within a 15 minute bike or tram ride.
column12: One minute walk to the tram stop wich takes you to the center and to the Anne Frank House, Dam square and Central station in a few minutes. Schiphol Airport is a 20 minute taxi drive away or a 35 minutes by public transport.
column13: You enter the house via the communal stairs and your private apartment on the third floor.
column14: We are availlable by phone for questions and help when you need us, helping you to make the best of your stay.
column15: Because our house is situated on the third floor keep in mind that there are other people living in the building. Please consider this and also the rooftop is not for use.
column25:
My name is Antoinette Nausikaä and together with my partner Gertjan and our baby Lotus I live in our lovely home in de Baarsjes in Amsterdam. Myself I am a visual artist and Gertjan is a.o. a zen teacher. Both of us have a special interest in Asian culture and art. We like to travel to faraway places, meet people, make books and art. 
Even though we love to leave and explore the world, coming home to Amsterdam and our neighbourhood the Baarsjes is always a feast!

column6: A beautiful big house on a quiet dike in Amsterdam and only 5 minutes from the centre. There is a garden at the water side in front of the house and a big garden behind the house. At the ground floor there are doors to the roof terrace. Free parking!
column7: Country-style decor, a lot of wood and a relaxed atmosphere. A luxurieus bathroom with a separate shower and a jacuzzi. The second bathroom only has a shower. column8: A beautiful big house on a quiet dike in Amsterdam and only 5 minutes from the centre. There is a garden at the water side in front of the house and a big garden behind the house. At the ground floor there are doors to the roof terrace. Free parking! Country-style decor, a lot of wood and a relaxed atmosphere. A luxurieus bathroom with a separate shower and a jacuzzi. The second bathroom only has a shower.  In the basement there is a beamer with a large screen and a PS4 which you can use for watching films or playing a game. In the garage there are four bikes you can use. Always lock them if you go somewhere. In the attic we have al lot of toys like playmobil and lego and puzzles so you don't have to carry it. The house has four floors. Ground floor: if you enter the house there is a little hall and a toilet. Next to the living room we have an open kitchen. In the kitchen you' ll find the fridge with small freezer, a dishwasher, a gasstore with eight gashobs, an electric oven, a hot ai
column10: As you maybe know, Amsterdam North is an upcoming district with new restaurants opening up and international companies moving in. From our house you can easily go to the centre of Amsterdam (5 minutes by car, 8 minutes by bike), you can easily go to the country side (to hire a boat or to cycle and see a lot of typical Dutch villages and a lot of nature (5 minutes by bike and you are in the middle of the nature). For example the Waterland tour will take you almost exclusively by scenic paths across a nature reserve. Through centuries old picturesque villages, past countless brooks and waterways and straight through green pastures. And of course there is also a lot to do in the Amsterdam Noord district:   Creative & active Amsterdam Noord is an inspiring and vibrant part of Amsterdam with unique architecture. Until the 1980’s a large part of Amsterdam Noord was used as a shipyard. Currently you will find many creative agencies and cultural entrepreneurs on these premises. The NDSM Wharf
column12: From the central train station of Amsterdam there are several ferries which go day and night to the north of Amsterdam and back. During the day they go every five minutes. By night they go every 10 minutes. Alle the ferries are for free. By car there is of course a tunnel. The connection by bus is also very easy. There are several buses to the centre. From our house to the nearest ferry (buiksloterweg) it is only eight minutes by bike. You can take the bike on the ferry.
column13: The house has four floors. Ground floor: if you enter the house there is a little hall and a toilet. Next to the living room we have an open kitchen. In the kitchen you' ll find the fridge with small freezer, a dishwasher, a gasstore with eight gashobs, an electric oven, a hot air oven and a grill. In the basement you will find the second bathroom (only shower) with toilet, a chillroom with beamer and large screen and a PS4. And of course a big corner sofa to chill. An utility room with a second fridge, a large freezer, a micro wave, a washing machine, a dryer, an ironing board and iron. First floor: three bedrooms (one bedroom with a double bed, a luxurieus bathroom with jacuzzi, a shwower cabin and a (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Attic: a toilet and a large room with a sofa bed for two persons (2 meters by one meter eighty cm. column10: This apartment is located on a nice and quiet street in one of the most bustling neighborhoods of Amsterdam. De Pijp is brimming with fantastic (typical Dutch) cafés, restaurants, coffee shops and bars. Of course, a visit to Amsterdam wouldn’t be the same without a trip to the famous Albert Cuypmarket, flanked by over 100 shops. If you wander down Albert Cuypstraat and Ferdinand Bolstraat, the main streets in de Pijp, you'll find many exotic and authentic Syrian, Moroccan, Surinamese restaurants, to name but a few, and a typical Amsterdam pub is located on almost every corner. Also in abundance are the Islamic butchers, Surinamese, Spanish, Indian and Turkish delicatessens and grocery stores. Here is a list of some of the attractions within walking distance; Sarphati Park, Albert Cuyp market, Heineken Experience, the Museum district (Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum & Stedelijk Museum), Leidseplein, Rembrandtplein nightlife areas (entertainment area), the famous floating flower market and
column11: For your comfort, we will provide you with fresh made up beds and towels upon arrival. We will always provide a map of Amsterdam, some brochures and a list with some personal (local) recommendations.
column12: There is a tramstop in two minutes walking distance, and parking places in front (paid parking). Just a short tram ride (10min) of Central Station or Amsterdam South Station, taking you into one of the most cosmopolitan and vibrant districts of Amsterdam.

The apartment is situated in the lively neighborhood 'Oud West', this area is popular among locals. You can find various restaurants, cool
column10: The apartment is situated in the lively neighborhood 'Oud West', this area is popular among locals. You can find various restaurants, cool bars, a supermarket, a night shop, several ATM's and nice stores just around the corner. The famous Vondelpark is just a 1 minute walk, here you can enjoy a nice walk, a pick-nick or some events (during the summer).  The city centre is just a 15 min. walk.
column12: Access to and from Schiphol in 20 minutes by train or taxi. Public Transport There are three different tram stops within a 2 minute walking distance from the apartment. There is a direct connection to the Leidse Square (5 min), the Central Station (15 min) and Station Lelylaan (10 min), from where a direct train departs to Schiphol airport.  Walking Walking distance to Vondelpark (1 min), to Leidse Square (15 min), to Jordaan (20 min), to Museum quarter (10 min) and to the shopping area 'the 9 streets' (10 min). Biking Cycling is a fun, efficient and an easy way of getting around Amsterdam. With bicycle rental shops all over the city, it's quite simple to pedal away.  Car There are many parking spaces in the area, but please note that it's paid parking (€ 3 per hour).
column13: You have access to: - Wireless Internet (free and fast) - T.V (Upstairs/downstairs) - Microwave/oven - Towels/ linen - Washing machine - Iron - Coffee/ Tea (free) - Fully equipped kitchen - Renovated bathroom - Toilet upstairs/ downstairs - Nice neighborhood!!!
column15: I expect you to treat my apartment as if it's yours, please respect the lives and rhythm of our neighbors. 1. Please, no parties in the apartment and no music after 23:00. 2. No SMOKING! in the apartment 3. No pets 4. Check-in after 3 pm.  Check in can be flexible as long as there are no other guests. Luggage can be dropped of between 9 am and 3 pm.  5. Check-out at 11  6. No unexpected guests without prior notice.  7. We will provide you a set of keys.  When leaving the house please lock the house door and the front door of the building.  If you loose a set, we will charge €100,- for replacing the lock and making new key cuts.  8. Please turn off all lights, heating and power when leaving the house.
column25:
We are a family, born and raised in Amsterdam and we love to travel around the world!

My parents are the official owners of this apartment and they live around the corner. They are living in this neighborhood for more than 35 years and  have three daughters, one of them is living on Ibiza and the other two live in Amsterdam. 

Since we all live very close, we are easy to reach in case you need something. We are happy to give you some tips and advices so you can enjoy Amsterdam to the fullest.

column12: Paid street parking. 1 min walk to tram stop at Hoofddorpplein. Tram 2 takes you in 5 min to Museum square, in 7 min. To Leidscheplein and in 12 min. To Dam square. We have two bikes which you can use for free, please park them securely locked, using the locks we provide you. :-)
column13: Access to all rooms of the apartment.
column15: No smoking, no partying in the house. Please treat our home like you would treat your own house. :-)
column25:
Happy couple with two young boys (born in 2015 and 2017).

column6: This light apartment is situated in hip and happening east side of Amsterdam. The apartment has everything you need to make you fall in love With Amsterdam even more. It's only 15 min away from the city centre and there are lots of places to rent bikes around here.
column8: This light apartment is situated in hip and happening east side of Amsterdam. The apartment has everything you need to make you fall in love With Amsterdam even more. It's only 15 min away from the city centre and there are lots of places to rent bikes around here. The apartment has everything you need to feel at home. There's one living room with a kitchen, which has a large dining table so you can even cook at home like a real local. The master bedroom is so nice and quiet, you'll forget you are in Amsterdam. And you can sleep all day if you would prefer. The other room has a sleeping sofa which you can make easily in to a comfortable bed.

column25:
Hi, I'm your host at Makassarstreet. Whatever brings you to Amsterdam, I’m sure you’re going to love it here. The city is beautiful, there is so much to see and so many people to meet. The apartment is located perfectly, nearby city centre and several parks. But you can find enough to do even closer by. Be like the locals; hang out at the Javastraat or stroll down Flevopark. Ride your bike and drink wine all day. Do what makes you happy! The best tip I can give you is just to be. You’ll have the best time, for sure. 

I'm happy to make you feel at home.

column5: Sunny spacious designer home with Dutch breakfast
column6: Wonderful spacious apartment in classic 1920s architecture in the Baarsjes. Perfect for a couple, or a couple of friends to explore Amsterdam from. Sunny during the day, cosy and quiet at night, close to the center of town, and with nice cafe's and restaurants just around the corner.   A spread of Dutch breakfast foods will be available to you, so you can experience the magic of chocolate sprinkles, flakes, in all possible colors.
column7: The apartment is on the fourth floor (lots of light!) in a quiet street.  The large living room has a lot of mid-century modern furniture, such as the large teak dining table, comfortable Ingmar Relling Siesta chair and Leolux couch. Connect to AirTunes over WiFi, or the speakers directly to play music. The cozy bedroom has a queen bed (and phone charger, in case you forgot yours) a chair and hooks for your clothes, and mirror. The recently renovated kitchen has all you might need, besides the breakfast foods, there are many coffee makers, a superfast kettle, microwave/oven, and a dishwasher. In case you want to cook there are many herbs and spices available. The bathroom has a shower, toilet, sink, and floor heating.  A washing machine can be found in the recently painted hallway. Access the  8m2 covered balcony overlooking the gardens in the courtyard  from the kitchen and living room.

column10: The Baarsjes has some great small shops, a well stocked bio-hip cornershop, amazing food at Fa. Speijkervet, and you're at walking distance of food&cultural hotspot The Hallen, the Vondelpark, and many other places. The neighborhood has been designed by the "Amsterdamse School" movement, an expressionist movement with social ideals. You'll find many classic Amsterdamse School buildings (such as "het Sieraad", and housing block on the Witte de Withstraat) literally around the corner, or can see the 'skirt architecture' at play in the building & the street.
column12: A 12 min tram-ride from Central Station - 10 min tram rides to Dam Square / Leidse Square for shopping, drinking, and dancing, the Museumsquare with the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, and Stedelijk Museum, the Anne Frank house & more.  As everywhere in Amsterdam; you're in biking distance of wherever you'd want to go.
column13: The entire apartment will be available to you.  For the second bedroom, a large inflatable bed can be supplied upon request. (Please note: 2 guests max)
column14: I'll leave you an array of the many breakfast foods that Holland has to offer - from chocolate sprinkles in dark, or white chocolate, multi-colored sprinkles, appelstroop, speculoos, dark chocolate spread and much more that makes the Dutch breakfast famous and amazing.
column15: No smoking inside, no parties & please treat the house as you would your own.
column25:
I´m a designer. Living in Amsterdam. 
I love art, design, technology, architecture, 
On the weekends and vacations, I climb rocks which takes me to see many great places across the globe (though it's been limited to Europe/the US so far)
When I'm not away - I'll be cooking stews, baking cookies, or enjoying my new hammock.

column5: Family house with garden in centre
column6: We love the charm and old details of our  more than 100 years old house. The house is spacious, comfortable and and all the major attractions can be reached by foot: only two minutes to Leidschesquare and Vondel Parc, 5 minutes to famous Museum area
column7: Our house has a large kitchen and dining room where you can prepare nice meals. Our house is suitable for a family with two or three children. We have a garden where you eat and where the children can play. We have a comfortable living room where you can relax with the entire family.  The ground floor has a toilet in the hall. We have three bedrooms on the first floor. . Two are large and one is a small  one. The master bedroom has a comfortable double bed and open doors to a balcony. The room has a sink as well. The second large bedroom has a comfortable single bed and a good guest bed with a good matrass that can be pulled from under it. The third smaller bedroom has a comfortable bed as well. The first floor has a bathroom with a shower, a bath and a toilet.

column10: We think Amsterdam- old west and particularly ' the Helmer area' is the nicest area of our city. It has nice shops and restaurants, the streets are spacious and its population is divers.  All the major attractions can be reached by foot: only two minutes to Leidschesquare and Vondel Parc, 5 minutes to famous Museum area and the 'Nine streets' and Dam square is only 10 min walking.
column11: We have a very friendly cat. We request you to give it some dry food twice a day.
column12: You can park your car in the street. Parking fares are quite expensive however. If you have a car and intend to stay for some days, we advise to park your car outside the city in a parking. Within Amsterdam your do not need a car. Walking and biking is the best way to explore Amsterdam.
column13: You can use the entire house, as long as everything is returned the wat you found it.
column14: We will be on a holiday ourselves during your stay. We ca be reached for questions by phone.
column15: if you're coming to Amsterdam to party you've picked a great city to do so. Unfortunately, just not at our place. Though we're sure it won't come to it, serious complaints of unruly behavior will unfortunately result in you being asked to leave. Not good for you. Not good for us. Being a family home, we also have a no smoking policy (although you are welcome to smoke in the back-garden). We kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used and put any dirty towels in the hamper. It helps us get through our cleaning process quicker and allows us to keep cleaning costs down for you and future guests.
column25: I am 48 years old and live in the centre of Amsterdam. My wife and I have a daughter of 12 years old and a son of 14 years old. I like all kinds of music, visiting concerts, the theatre and museums. I also love to cook.

column10: The apartment is located at the southend of the Old-South neighborhood, which is known to be the more upper-class neighborhood of Amsterdam. The services in the area are great (grocery stores, all kinds of restaurants, bars, bike rental) and the Vondelpark is just 3 minutes away. You are also very close to the Amsterdam Forest which is great if you wish to escape the city's vibe.  Leidseplein (city centre) is about 10 minutes by bike or 10 minutes by tram. Same goes for Museumsquare.
column12: There is a tram/bus stop only 2 minutes away. The closest train station is Amsterdam Zuid. From there it is about 10 minutes by train to Schiphol Airport. If you are coming by car, there is parking space in the street (paid from Mon-Sat, 9am-11pm, free on Sundays) or you can use the guarded parking garage about 5 minutes away.
column13: You have full access to the entire apartment, including the two private balconies.
column14: If you would like recommendations for stuff to do in the city or places to eat and drink, please let us know, happy to help!
column15: Please take into account that this place is located in a peaceful borough with a lot of families with (young) children. column25:
Passionate about travelling and would love to see more of the world! I have been to South-America, Fiji, Australia, Southeast-Asia and lots of destinations in Europe. Together with my boyfriend I did an around-the-world trip last year, but while he has a job now and I will start my Master in Economics in September, probably we have to stick to (long) weekends travelling for the time being. 

As for having us as guests, we are really relaxed, flexible and neat. We are active people who wish to see and do things more than hanging around all day. We really like to mee new people and be inspired and informed by them, however we also like to have some private time and space.

It is a residential area and I will have to kindly cancel your stay if neighbours complain.  Make sure you accompany the entrance door when you close and get up the steps silently, that is, not stomping your feet or talking loudly.  I am not a smoker myself, but I don't mind if you smoke, but only in the balcony. Be aware the door of the balcony is tricky to close. I am green-oriented and I would expect you to recycle. If you don't know where to throw your recycling rubbish outside, leave it up to me (on short stays).  In general, feel at home, respect the space and others. Have a nice stay!
column25:
I see myself as a world child and a life enthusiast. I am well traveled and I prefer jungle and beaches to mountain, although I am happy either way. 
I thrive on very simple things: conversation, music and the outdoors. 
For some strange reason I have a good brain for languages, therefore I love learning them. I speak a few European languages and I am having a go at the Asian ones lately. 
As a guest I like to go out of my way to make things better. As a host I expect my guests to feel at home and feel the vibe of the city. I live in a very special neighbourhood, very safe and very  friendly. You feel it as soon as you walk around. Careful! You may fall for it!

Parking ticket: € 21 per day from Mon-Fri.

column6: Located in the elegant, green and architecturally interesting area of Amsterdam called the 'Rivierenbuurt' a light and comfortable west facing studio apartment on the top floor.
column7: A small but well-appointed kitchen, and a comfortable bedroom. All windows are west-facing, providing lots of light and a wide view of the sky. When the windows are open insects can be kept out with fly-screens. Though the space is small it is light, airy and peaceful. A ceiling fan and dark blinds keep the bedroom cool. The bathroom has a walk-in shower, toilet and small basin.
column8: Located in the elegant, green and architecturally interesting area of Amsterdam called the 'Rivierenbuurt' a light and comfortable west facing studio apartment on the top floor. A small but well-appointed kitchen, and a comfortable bedroom. All windows are west-facing, providing lots of light and a wide view of the sky. When the windows are open insects can be kept out with fly-screens. Though the space is small it is light, airy and peaceful. A ceiling fan and dark blinds keep the bedroom cool. The bathroom has a walk-in shower, toilet and small basin. You will have access to the whole apartment. The apartment shares a common stairwell with our neighbours downstairs and at number 115, but has its own locking front door. None of the space is shared. I will be staying in the apartment directly downstairs while my mother is away. I will be available by email or you can knock on my door if there are any problems. The Rivierenbuurt is a quiet neighbourhood where families live. There are lo
column10: The Rivierenbuurt is a quiet neighbourhood where families live. There are lots of trees and open spaces with places to sit and enjoy the sunshine, and a lovely walk along the Amstel river is just around the corner. There are plenty of small shops and restaurants with terraces, as well as three nearby supermarkets. Easy transport links by metro or tram into the busy inner city are a 10 minute walk away.
column11: Guests staying a week or more can arrange to use the washing machine downstairs. There is space to hang clothes to dry on the landing outside the apartment, or there is a drying rack inside.  Because we are close to the river there are usually mosquitoes around in warm weather. There are insect screens on the windows to keep them out, and I have provided a mosquito net for above the bed.  As in all older houses in Amsterdam, there are mice in our block. However, keeping food stored away and keeping the kitchen clean means you are unlikely to see them in the apartment.
column12: To get around the city:  The apartment is a ten minute walk from tram 4, which will take you from Rai station to the Albert Cuyp market, Rembrandt plein, Dam square and Central station.  Also a ten minute walk away is tram 12 which goes from Amstel station, past the Museum plein and Overtoom, through the Jordaan area to Sloterdijk station.  If you wish to travel on the recently opened Amsterdam North-South metro you can walk 15 minutes to Europaplein where you can take metro 52 from station Zuid, past the Albert Cuyp market, into the city centre, through Central station and right to the north of the city in about 15 minutes.   Day or week tickets for public transport in Amsterdam (GVB) are available for a discount at stations or tobacco shops.  Amsterdam has excellent and cheap public transport. However, if you are brave and an experienced cyclist there are two bike shops nearby where you could rent bikes.  To get to the apartment:  Trams 4 or 12 will take you from all major train stat
column13: You will have access to the whole apartment. The apartment shares a common stairwell with our neighbours downstairs and at number 115, but has its own locking front door. None of the space is shared.
column14: I will be staying in the apartment directly downstairs while my mother is away. I will be available by email or you can knock on my door if there are any problems.
column15: No smoking anywhere in the house or out of the windows.  No drug use.  The stairwell is shared, so please remember our neighbours.  No loud music or parties please.
column25: A 30 year old serial student, currently in the last year of teacher training. Due to my various degrees I am always short of money at the end of the year. I like children, gardening and cooking, and currently have 24 fish and two guinea pigs which live with my mother.

You can enjoy the sun in the morning and afternoon at the terrace-boat that is in front at the Amstel. Magnificent views from basically everywhere in the boat. And please note: looking over the wide Amstel rivier, any weather is beautiful to watch.  You can use the electric powered 'sloep' as much als you like, easy to use, silent, it is just the best way to explore Amsterdam en enjoy each other. On the roof terrace there is sun all day, so you can also enjoy your diner there. Imagine long summer days sitting outside, relaxing, without neighbors close by. There are two floors, around 180 m2. column10: The neighborhood 'The Pijp' is super! Just outside the busy city center, but your car you van 5 minute walk to many bars and restaurants.  10 min walk to the Albert Cuyp market, the cosy cafe's en restaurants. Opposite our boat, on the other site of the Amstel, there are also some really nice restaurants (tapas, portugese 'girassol') and terraces on the boulevard.  Our home is very close to the Amstel station, 10 min walk, from where trains and subways come and go, and where a bike rent is located.  If you want to enjoy more greenary - follow the Amstel southwards, up until Ouderkerk and on the other side back - there is even a small ferry to help you cross the water to shorten your trip :-) Check out 'thuis aan de amstel' - on the 'top' of the amstel, also walking distance! On the Amstel side, towards de city center: The Hermitage, Joods Historisch museum, Waterlooplein. And of course, Artis! Our Zoo.  Well, there's so much to do, I could go on for hours ;-)  We will leave a house man
column11: If you want to you may use our electric boat to cruise the Amstel on your own. You can use the 'sloep' als much als you like, easy to use, silent, juist the best way to explore Amsterdam en enjoy each other. Please regard the traffic rules on the water as it can be quite busy on the Canals! We ask you to be careful and leave a deposit for using it. Please Note, that the house is available for more than 4 people for families only!
column12: From Schiphol: take the train to Amsterdam Rai (not to central!). here you can take tram nr 4 to Amstelkade, from there you walk by the Amstelkade/ Josef Israelskade in less then 10 minutes. From rai you can also take the subway (51) to Amstelstation, and walk from there. At the Amstelstation take the back entrance (at the hoge school, towards the Amstel river) if you leave. Cross the bridge en keep to your right, after a 10 minute walk you're there. tram nr 12 (vrijheidslaan), 4 (van Woustraat, going to the city center) and 3 (from ceintuurbaan). Check the app (URL HIDDEN) Parking is free on Sundays - and any day there is parking space for your can right in front of the boat.

column6: The perfect apartment for your stay in  Amsterdam! The apartment is located near the CITY CENTER on the same street as the  'ALBERT CUYPMARKT'. You'll find a stylish living room, fully equipped kitchen,  modern bathroom with  bathtub and ROOFTERRACE.
column7: The stylish living room is large enough to seat a whole family or a group of friends in the evening. Relax on the large couch with a book or watch a movie together. The master bedroom is fitted with a comfortable double bed and has a soothing ambience.  After a long day of exploring Amsterdam enjoy a warm and relaxing bath or shower in this modern bathroom.  The kitchen has plenty of space so you can let loose and cook until your heart's content in this well-equipped kitchen. Tired after a long day of sightseeing? The roof terrace is the ideal spot to spend some quality time with you and your loved ones while enjoying the warm sun. column10: This apartment is located in the exclusive ' de Pijp' neighborhood close to the Amstel river! On the same street as the famous outside market 'Albert Cuypmarkt'. There you can enjoy snacks and dishes from various countries in the world. A perfect way to enjoy the different cultures living in the city. A short distance from the apartment you will find Sarphatipark. A nice and cozy park perfect for a relaxing stroll or a picnic in the summer! Only 5-minute tram ride from the world renowned 'Museumplein'. There you can find the 3 biggest museums of the city! 'Van Gogh museum, 'Stedelijk museum' and the 'Rijksmuseum'!

column12: Convenient public transportation is right around the corner and will take you anywhere you need to go. column5: Private basement studio in the Jordaan area
column6: This studio is situated in the heart of Amsterdam in the lively and charming Jordaan district, nearby the amazing canals, the Nine Streets and the Noordermarkt. The Jordaan district is thé place to be if you are in Amsterdam.
column7: The space is small and cosy but comfortable throughout and perfect for relaxing at the end of a day out exploring the city. The studio would be perfect for a couple, with or without a baby or a solo tourist or business traveller. The ceiling height is quite low (1.80 m) so it may not suit very tall people. The small studio has a double bed, a wash basin and a free-standing bath. In the front there is a dining table. The private toilet is at the entrance at the top of a small flight of stairs. There is no kitchen, but there is a kettle.
column8: This studio is situated in the heart of Amsterdam in the lively and charming Jordaan district, nearby the amazing canals, the Nine Streets and the Noordermarkt. All of this in combination with the lovely place gives you a real experience of the historical ambiance of the
column10: The apartment is truly in one of the most sought after areas of Amsterdam. The Haarlemmerdijk, one block away, has been voted the best shopping street of the Netherlands many times, due to its amazing mix of vintage, design, flower and boutique fashion shops and many hip coffee places. Amsterdam's oldest cinema, The Movies, is also located there for an old school cinema experience. The Westerpark, which hosts lots of cultural events and concerts and is only a 5 minute walk from the apartment  The ferry to the NDSM area, in the Northern part of Amsterdam, one of the city's new hotspots leaves a 10 minute walk from the apartment, through the pituresque Bickers island, with its tiny canals and old warehouses (and surprisingly a children's farm). And of course, the Jordaan area with its beautiful Brouwersgracht, Noordermarkt and lots of tiny winding streets full of hidden courtyards is a must see. Furthermore, the Jordaan offers many more traditional tourist sights such as the Westertoren,
column11: Le chauffage peut être réglé avec un thermostat indépendant, qui se situe au rez-de-chaussée à l'entrée. Utilisez uniquement le réglage «Auto» et «Continu», c'est-à-dire le mode manuel. En mode "Continu", vous pouvez modifier manuellement la température.
column12: The central station is a 10min walk from the house. From this main station you can take trams, buses, subways and trains to almost anywhere in Amsterdam and in the Netherlands. Trains to Schiphol leave every 15 minutes and take about 20 minutes, to get there. Trams towards Leidse Plein and Museum Plein leave a few minutes from the appartment. But the best way to get around Amsterdam is by bike. Bike rental can be found a few blocks away on the Haarlemmerplein.
column13: You have access to broadband Wi-Fi and there is enough storage space. Towels and linen are included for the whole period. All of this in combination with the lovely place gives you a real experience of the historical ambiance of the oldest part and Amsterdam!

column15: When leaving the building: - Lock the front door - Turn off all the lights on the ground floor At night - Lock the front door - Turn off all the lights on the ground floor On departure: - Open the window fully - Bring the thermostat back to the ground floor, and change the thermostat setting to "Continu", setting the temperature to 17 degrees. - Lock the studio door - Turn off all the lights on the ground floor - Lock the front door - Put the keys in the masterlock box

column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

column6: This great little apartment is just perfect for couples and situated in popular Oud West. It's just minutes walk away from Vondelpark, shopping, food and transport and everything you'll need. It's on the ground floor and is cosy, quiet and relaxing.
column7: Our apartment is approx 60 m2 and situated on the ground floor with a small private garden approx 40 m2. It's in a typical Amsterdam building in a quiet part of the trendy 'Oud West'. The apartment's easily accessible to and from the city, airport and the best tourist attractions Amsterdam has to offer including Vondelpark (a stone's throw away) and Leidseplein. Canals and Central Station are also easily reachable. We're fully furnished here and well equipped with all basic necessities including a comfy bed, sound system, wifi and all basic necessities. The open plan kitchen includes utensils, crockery, dishwasher, oven, fridge and a microwave. The bathroom, although compact, is separate to the toilet and contains a shower, basin and heated towel rail. The use of towels is included and fresh linen will be on your bed ready for your arrival!

column10: Oud West is a cool, trendy neighborhood with a village feel and a real melting pot of different cultures, nationalities and ages. It's full of great cafes, bars and restaurants on your doorstep, Vondelpark is nearby for a stroll and a chance to people watch, and you're close to the main attractions Amsterdam has to offer.
column11: We'll leave a bit of information about the locality, how to get around and of course the wifi password!
column12: The #1 tram goes along Overtoom (toward Central Amsterdam or west) and the nearest tram stop is 3 minutes walk away (or you can walk there in about 30 minutes, though a bike is always recommended in Amsterdam!) We can answer any questions you have about public transport or renting a bike.
column13: You'll have your own entrance on the ground floor. There's no shared entry or stairs here - unlike the vast majority of apartments in Amsterdam!
column14: You'll have the whole apartment to yourself, but we'll be contactable if need be!
column15: This apartment is best suited for professional couples or similar, and not suitable for sleeping more 2 people. While you're welcome to have guests visit you while you're here, this is NOT a party house and you need to respect our neighbours with regard to noise. Common sense applies. No smoking inside but it's okay in the garden outside. No pets allowed. Please respect the apartment and garden as it would be your own and leave it in a clean state. Cheers!
column25:
My partner and I are kiwi born but have spent 10 years living and travelling the world. We love to visit new places and experience new cultures. 

We now live in Wellington, New Zealand with our daughter Indi.

column5: Centre  Apartement in a quiet location
column6: It is wonderful to share a nice place with others. I offer an apartment of 28 m2 on the first floor in my cozy house in the centre of Amsterdam. It is located in a quiet street very near to the beautiful museums of Amsterdam:  Rijksmuseum,  Van Gogh, Stedelijk museum, Foam and the Hermitage.  All within 10 minutes walk. The Anne Frankhuis is about 15 minutes walk. The canals are around the corner. The neighborhood is full of restaurants, pubs, nice shops and the famous Albert Cuyp market.
column7: Het appartement heeft een kleine slaapkamer, een woonkamer met een kitchenette en een fijne badkamer. In de keuken zit een magnetron, een ijskast en geen kookplaat.

column5: Dykehouse + garden close to centre + free parking
column6: This lovely dykehouse offers a lot of space and privacy with its 4 bedrooms, modern open kitchen and 2 bathrooms. The large garden has sun full day and offers you the joy to relax after a day in the city. The garden borders on the Vliegenbos-forest. Within 15 minutes by bike/bus in city centre.
column7: When you open the frontdoor of Nieuwendammerdijk you enter a very pleasant dykehouse on an ideal location to discover Amsterdam. On the street level floor you will find the main bathroom with shower and bath, a first toilette, a minor bedroom with a single bed and the master bedroom. The view from the high quality doublebed in the master bedroom is astonishing green: trees where ever you look . The small foot-lane behind the house that is longed by all these trees  is  leading to a small forest in the middle of town: the Vliegenbos,  more than a century old and the oldest forest in Amsterdam, mainly composed of beautiful elms. Going down the stairs on the street level floor you will reach the living and dining room and the spacey and well equipped kitchen on the garden level floor. From this room you reach the 100 m2 garden which is orientated on the south. From sunrise till about 19.30 there is sun in the very green garden. From the garden you can directly access the Vliegenbos and th

column10: Quiet residential and green area in hot Amsterdam North.  Close to the city center where you find the famous canals and musea,  but also close to the grasslands of the Waterland. The old fishermans villages Volendam and the former ile of Marken are nearby. (20 minutes by car or bus)
column11: We like you to take good care of our 2 lovely cats. They only need some food and attention and they will be hapy!
column12: Bus 32 and 33 you can take to go the Amsterdam Central Station.
column13: You have full and private access to the house during your stay.
column14: For the rental of my house I asked Jolanda and Rob from Home2host to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you.
column25: Hallo I am Ellen and together with my family I live in a lovely dyke house in the hip and upcoming Northern part of Amsterdam. I am excited about renting my dear house to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam.

column5: New renovated spacious and light house city centre
column6: Just totally renovated house in the city center. 140 m2 Really quiet and light house on two floors, 5 min walk from Rembrand- and Waterloo square. Lots of good restaurants, coffeeplaces and shopping area. Big bathroom with bath and rain shower. Free wifi, TV . Sunny balcony on the south. View over the city. Possibilities for baby.
column7: Really spacious livingroom .Two big bedrooms, one bedroom with amazing view over the city.House is on the 3rd and 4rd floor. Also a baby room with babybed. Fully equipped kitchen. Washing machine and dryer. Clean sheets, towels and toilet paper will be provided. Sunny balcony on the south.
