column6: This canal house is built around the year 1905 and is completely renovated. Our loft is just outside the busy city center. We have 'De Hallen' (Food, film, fashion, crafts and architecture converge at this cultural centre in a converted industrial building), trendy Bars, Restaurants, Galleries, Bakeries, Supermarkets, Coffee Bars and Pubs all around the corner. Also the 'Vondelpark', the 'Ten Katemarkt', Anne Frank House and the 'Museumplein', with the 'Rijksmuseum' and more...
column7: Our Sunny Studio is a 50 square meters loft, a former design and construction studio. You still can find some typical details but the most striking is the high ceiling and the large windows which gives a romantic atmosphere. This lovely Sunny Studio located on one of Amsterdam's beautiful canals is on the ground floor and has a private entrance, a simple kitchenette (for making  breakfast), and a bathroom with separate toilet.

column10: Our loft is just outside the busy city center. We have 'De Hallen' (Food, film, fashion, crafts and architecture converge at this cultural centre in a converted industrial building), trendy Bars, Restaurants, Galleries, Bakeries, Supermarkets, Coffee Bars and Pubs all around the corner. Also the 'Vondelpark', the 'Ten Katemarkt', Anne Frank House and the 'Museumplein', with the 'Rijksmuseum', Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk Museum and the new 'Moco' are within walking distance.  And don't forget the "Nine Streets". A shopping area in between the Canals. You will find there all kind of shops, cafes and small restaurants.
column11: You have free and fast Internet access (Wired & WiFi). Cable Tv + Netflix and music equipment are all for free.
column12: The best way to move around Amsterdam is by foot by bike and tram. There is a bike rental shop around the corner  Although most places are in walking distance we have a few Tram Stops, 100 meter away from the Studio. So if you get tired walking you can take a tram. If you are traveling by car you can take advantage of the P&R parking. Very cheap parking option. You travel, from the P&R, by Tram to get to the Studio and also by Tram if you are leaving again. I will explain when the time gets there...
column13: We live above the Studio. You also have your own entrance and 100% privacy. We only meet when you check-in and maybe when you check-out. If you need help, with what so ever, text us and we will be around...

column5: Modern & stylish family home in great location!
column6: This modern and very stylish furnished home is the perfect place to stay with your family during a city trip in Amsterdam. The house is located in a quiet street in the heart of the trendy neighborhood De Baarsjes. This is a very friendly upcoming area with lovely restaurants, nice small shops and good coffee. All on walking distance from the city center with their historic canals (30 minutes by foot).
column7: The apartment is very light and spacious (150 square meters!). It was just renovated, so everything is fresh and new. There are two floors and it has a nice and silent garden on the back of the house. There is a modern open kitchen in the heart of the house, it is well equipped with stove, oven, microwave, etc. The living room is on the garden side, very light because of the big window frame. In the front of the house there is separated a room with TV, Netflix and PlayStation available. On the first floor there are 3 bedrooms, a bathroom with toilet and bath.
column8: This modern and very stylish furnished home is the perfect place to stay with your family during a city trip in Amsterdam. column10: Today, De Baarsjes is simply an inviting, community-oriented Amsterdam neighbourhood. De Baarsjes is remarkably close to the city centre. It’s not only minutes away from Vondelpark, but it also has its own green and rambling Rembrandtpark. Off the commercial shopping boulevard Jan Evertsenstraat there’s an open air market on Vespuccistraat. These days the area is home to trendy dining haunts such as Bar Spek, Radijs, an espresso bar Buon Giorno, an organic snack bar Natuurlijk Smullen and even its own club: Club 8.
column11: The check-in standard is set to flexible. Please note that if we have guests checking out on the day of your arrival, your guaranteed check-in time is 13:00/1PM. If you book last minute (on the same day, before 6PM), please note that the check-in time depends on the cleaning. We will do our best to make sure the apartment is ready as soon as possible!
column12: To get from the airport to the apartment you take the train to Lelylaan station and then take tram 13 (stop: Marco Polostraat). From there you follow the street, it's only a 2 min walk. To get from Central Station to the apartment you take tram 13 (stop: Marco Polostraat). From there you follow the street, it's only a 2 min walk. If you're staying for a few days there is the possibility to have a multiday public transport card. Or you can rent a bike at various rent-a-bike places just around the corner from our house (on the Jan Evertsenstraat).
column13: Our apartment is your home while you're staying with us, so please feel free to make yourselves comfortable!
column14: If I'm not able to welcome you myself I will make sure someone will be there to welcome you, show you around and answer all your questions.
column15: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we will charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. --------------------------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check-in: -
column25: We are a family living in Amsterdam and very lucky to be able to live on one of the best spots of Amsterdam, de Baarsjes, nearby the centre. The area is charming, young and quiet with lots of lovely bars and restaurants. We are looking forward to welcome you in our house and will leave you a map with the best spots in the area.

column6: City centre is not where you want to be. Enjoy the local life instead of the tourist life. East is it. Amazingly good bars around the corner, a park, 5min from subway and well, we have a crazy cat. She's quite fun to watch though... Enjoy your stay!
column7: Welcome to our lovely apartment. It's light and spacious. A couple of years ago we broke down the wall to our chef proof kitchen so there's more light, easy acces to the balcony and you can cook your meals whilst being part of the conversation. We own a very very comfy sofa, seriously, don't waste all your time here, it's a trap.  Our bedroom is in the back so you don't have to worry about city noise. The street is very quiet btw, so don't worry about that at all. Again, lots of space and again, the bed is very comfy, don't fall in the trap! Get out and jump in the canals!  We have a separated toilet and a lovely bathroom where each day starts with enjoyment.  Our kitchen. An Amsterdam chef used to live in this lovely apartment so if you want to cook, all tools are there. You can use all our kitchen appliances and for inspiration, try our freshly made tapenade, it's in the fridge.
column8: City centre is not where you want to be. Enjoy the local life instead of the tourist life. East is it. column10: East is where tourists become locals. Enjoy this part of town but remember, you're in Amsterdam, everything is close if you rent a bike :) Stay away from everything that's in the city centre. It's less fun then they make it look in the flyer.  Rent a bicycle! Seriously, it's the best way of transport in Amsterdam. Gets you everywhere within 20 minutes. Info on where to rent is available in the apartment.  Go to the beukenplein and drink G&T's in the Bar Bukowski. It's close and one of Amsterdam's finest bars.  Sunny day? Oosterpark is just around the corner. But maybe better, get on your bike and go to the city beach of Roest. Just a 5 min ride. Just search for 'Amsterdam Roest B.V.' on (Hidden by Airbnb) maps and you'll get there.
column11: Our kitty, she's adorable to watch, but you might wanna armor up if you came to cuddle...
column12: Like I said, everything is close in Amsterdam. Subway network is at the far end of the street. Tram network on the short end of the street. Some advice, don't buy separate tickets each ride. Buy a day or 3 day pass. And don't forget to check out!!! That will cost you. Or, rent a bike... Best way of transport.
column13: All is open and none is forbidden. Some areas are just less fun though. Like the tool closet. Not much to do there. Unless you need the vacuum cleaner because you tipped something over. Then you should be there
column15: We'll probably be on holiday but you can call us anytime. Our contact info will be in the apartment. In case of emergency, call Lolo. He lives around the corner and has a spare key.
column16: Mi casa es su casa and the other way around. We're very happy to stay anywhere in the world in great private owned apartments. It makes a holiday more warm and it makes us feel more at home in a new city. So we're grateful. Please be grateful too and respect our (personal) belongings! Thanks
column25: Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands
column26: I’m Michelle, 37 years old and living with my boyfriend in Amsterdam where I work in advertising. I love traveling, exploring cultures and cities and good food :)

column5: Romantic Apt. near centre with sunny roof terrace!
column6: De Pijp is the best place of Amsterdam! The neighbourhood is famous of its many bars and restaurants for lovely drinking and dinning outside. Very ''gezellig''!  What I love most about my place is the lovely roof terrace. Amazing for BBQ's and watching sunsets. The supermarkets are in 2min walking distance, as well as public transport taking you fast and safe everywhere you like to go in the city. Close to all major attractions: museum square, centre and 10min walk to famous Albert Cuijp market.
column7: Sunny, open apartment in popular area 'De Pijp': ❤  Private big roof terrace ❤ Sleeping-room with double bed  ❤ Living room with sofa-bed  ❤ Fully equipped kitchen: gas stove, oven, dishwasher, fridge, Nespresso  ❤ Easy reachable by public transport ❤ Romantic style  De Pijp area, famous for it's restaurants & bar's: ❤ Close to the city centre ❤ Beautiful city parks: Sarphati park, Vondelpark ❤ Museum square: Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh,  ❤ Famous Albert Cuyp market with traditional Dutch products Convenient for business trips: Close to RAI conference centre (15min walk) and business center Zuidas (10min by public transport).  My favorite place is the sunny roof terrace. I painted the wall red because I love the Mexican-style! The kitchen has all you need: everything there (herbs, tea, pastas) are free to use. Enjoy the cosy style, feel at home! I love to help you with all your questions about the apartment and Amsterdam. Want to know the perfect yoga spot or best restaurant?  Let me know! ❤

column10: De Pijp area is famous for it's vibrant vibe: the best bar's and restaurants in town. Most popular area for locals. Amazing places worth a visit: ❤ Brewery Troost (2min) ❤ Albert Cuijp market (5min walking) ❤ Sarphatipark (5min walking) ❤ Museum square (10min walking) ❤ Heineken experience (10min walking) ❤ Vondelpark (15min walking) ❤ City centre, red light district, Leidsesquare (10min by public transport)

column6: For a unique and great experience in the heart of Amsterdam, this is the place to stay! You’ll find yourself on the border of the canal district, the famous Jordaan and Leidse Square. The spacious room is very quiet and light, enjoying a nice atmosphere. It's accommodated with a queen sized bed. For more comfort there is a Nespresso machine, toaster, egg cooker, small fridge and television. It doesn't get any better..!
column7: The room is at the backside of the house, so you will not be kept awake by street noise. Getting peckish..? Order some food to enjoy in your room or go to a great restaurant nearby, there are a lot of options! The room is part of the apartment and is located between the Canal district, the famous Jordaan district and the Leidse Square. The neighbourhood is very cozy, with its canals and authentic canal houses. In the Leidse Square area, only a three-minutes-walk away, you will find many different restaurants, popular bars and nightclubs. The famous museums, theatres and pop temples (like Paradiso and De Melkweg) are very close by, just like various attractive parks. The beautiful Vondelpark, just a five-minute-walk away, is perfect for a nice stroll, a picnic, or an open-air concert in the summer. column10: Many houses in De Jordaan have inner courtyards, built by rich people for elderly women, which are lovely to visit. There are three markets; one at the Westerstraat, one at the Lindengracht and last but not least: De Noordermarkt, the oldest and most beautiful organic farmer’s market, everyon Saturday. Here you will find a range of tasty products and after shopping you can sit down to listen to an always surprising classical concert in the Noorderkerk. On one of the corners of the market, you will find Winkel, where you can try Amsterdam’s best apple pie with cream or you can enjoy a drink in one of the many characteristic small café’s around the square. Longing for a ‘serious shot of culture’? Nearby where you are staying, you will find the famous Museum Square where you can visit museums such as the Rijksmuseum, the Stedelijk Museum for modern art and the Van Gogh museum.
column12: The best way to get around is by bike, because the most tourist venues are really close to the apartment. Otherwise you can use the trams 1, 2, 5 and 17 towards Central Station and back.
column13: You share the main entrance to the whole apartment (which is spread over the 3rd and 4th floor with me, Kate). This luxurious room is there to be enjoyed exclusively by you, with a proper lock on the door. Make yourself comfortable as if you were at home!

Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are i
column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column6: Beautiful 19th century house in quiet pleasant  classy street next to Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum and the Conservatorium Hotel,  300 meters away from Vondelpark, one corner away from upmarket fashion street (PC Hooftstraat) .
column7: The apartment is located in a beautiful 19th century typical Amsterdam house. The neighbourhood is nice quiet and up-class.  a 5 minutes walk from the canals and next to all cultural highlights.  High and beautiful decorated ceilings, very light and sunny, original details like kitchen and woodworks. It's the home of myself and my two children. Two nice balconies. It's a well kept very large apartment 90m2, with the possibility of renting an extra  room on the next floor . (30 m2), which is the room of my daughter.  (with three extra beds, and a bathroom with bath and shower ). It's redecorated,  clean, charming, authentic, nice wooden floors throughout the apartment, but not modernized, so a simple shower and a very charming and functional kitchen, but it's a real house, so no brand new modern equipment. And no hotel-room feel.
column8: Beautiful 19th century house in quiet pleasant  classy street next to Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum and the Conservatorium Hotel,  300 meters away from Vondelpark, one corner away from upmarket fashion street (PC Hooftstraat) . 50-100 meters to tram 2,5,3 & 12, next to taxi-stand in front of the Conservatorium Hotel (our luxury hotelneighbours), Bus shuttle  (bus 197) to Schiphol Airport on the corner of our street. (the stop is called "Rijksmuseum").
column10: Most beautiful classy area of Amsterdam. Green, safe and clean. Nice big 19th century houses and quit streets with huge trees.  Calm, but very close to any entertainment you'd like. Perfectly located. very safe; my daughter (16) can walk home alone safely at night.  At a mini stroll away you will find; (2-7 minutes walk); Concertgebouw home of one of the best classical orchestra's of the world, Paradiso and the Melkweg (the small but legendary rock temples) Rijksmuseum (Rembrandt, Vermeer, `Frans Hals etc.) Van Gogh Museum (Van Gogh..obviously) Museumplein (nice huge green grassy square, where you can lay on the grass, cool your feet in the pond,  or throw frisbees) Stedelijk Museum ( modern art; Mondriaan , Gauguin, Picasso etc) Vondelpark ( Holland's most famous and very nice and safe park, rollerskating, biking, walking, jogging, lunch and outdoor cafes all around) Shopping Area ( all the big designers have their shops here) Restaurants and bars, not on our street, but 3 minutes awa
column11: We have a small rough wire coated dog, who will not be there off course, but if you are extremely allergic, it might not be the right apartment. You wont find dog hairs, but still.  You are allowed to bring your pet.
column12: 50-100 meters to tram 2,5,3 & 12, next to taxi-stand in front of the Conservatorium Hotel (our luxury hotelneighbours), Bus shuttle  (bus 197) to Schiphol Airport on the corner of our street. (the stop is called "Rijksmuseum").
column13: As in all Amsterdam houses, you have to walk steep stairs to get to the apartment. It's on the second floor. The apartment is completely private, with two private balconies. Two large living rooms, one bedroom, a kitchen with breakfast table.
column14: You will be received by my son, and he will be available for all your questions.
column15: It's a residential quit area with nice neighbours, so no loud noise is tolerated. So no bachelor parties, no extremely loud music,  no renters under the age of 25 without their parents. Children are very welcome and they don't need to tiptoe.
column25:
Hello I am Sasja, I am Born and raised in Amsterdam, Holland. I studied in Montpellier,France but ended up getting my master degree at the Amsterdam University in History of Art. I love my home town, but like to leave and come back again.

Since my 24th I have had businesses ( I started out as a traiteur & caterer, and later I roasted and imported specialty coffee). I have two grownup kids ( 19and 22) , a small Irish terrier, and a very big and social family whom I see often. Now I travel the world and enjoy life. We spend our time in our house in France, Amsterdam or the Dutch forests and we love to travel. I love to read, take big walks, bike around ( yes I am Dutch) , swim in rivers, seas and lakes, meet people and obviously see art and different cultures.

column10: The apartment is situated in the quiet part of the lively dapperbuurt, with it's restaurants, shops, parks, the zoo and several musea in the very divers eastern part of Amsterdam. You will find fancy coffee places, bars and restaurants, affordable and more exclusive, but also supermarkets and cheap grocery stores, here. You've got the most famous market of Amsterdam around the corner, where you can get everything you want for a good price. Tips for bars and restaurants (walking distance): 'biertuinen', 'brouwerij 't ij', 'wilde zwijnen', 'bar basquiat', 'louie louie', 'walter woodbury bar', 'bar bukowski', 'nelis' and 'boi boi'.
column12: Best way to come to the apartment is to travel to train station Amsterdam Muiderpoort. From there it's only a five minute walk. From Amsterdam central station you can also take bus 22 or take tram 9 or 14 to Diemen Sniep or Flevopark and exit at alexanderplein. Public transport is just a minute walk and takes you into the heart of Amsterdam quickly:  - 7 min. by bus to Amsterdam Central Station  - 25 min. by train to the airport (Schiphol)  - 5 min. by tram to Waterlooplein  - 7 min. by tram to Rembrandt Square  - 10 min. by tram to Leidseplein  - 12 min. by tram to Museumplein (Van Gogh museum, Rijksmuseum)

After all, you share the building with other people living there. All in all: we kindly ask you to respect your neighbours;  - No pets and/or children in the apartment  - Please do not accept any mail packages from the mail man, only the house owner is allowed to do so;  - We guarantee a clean house when checking in. column15: Our home is only suited for families, couples and business trips. - Please respect the house and the neighbourhood: quiet time after 9 pm. - We charge €30 for late check ins after 8.00 PM. - No smoking inside  - No loud music	 - No parties - No drugs - No guests In case of breaking one of the rules you will be charged with a penalty of €200 per broken rule.  The boat has a water pump. Therefore you are not allowed to throw anything else then toilet paper in the toilet! In case you cause damage to the pump by throwing other things in toilet you are responsible for the cost for the repair. Check out is at 11 AM at  the latest. There are several luggage stores in the city to drop you luggage and enjoy your last day, ie: •Luggage Storage at Spuistraat 110. •Drop&Go luggage storage at Prins Hendrikkade 86.

column7: The living room is remarkably light and has an open kitchen with the latest appliances. The bathroom has a rainshower and large sink and is large enough for two persons to brush their teeth at the same time. The toilet is separated from the bathroom.

Open kitchen and furnished with antiquities & art. You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others. Iambnb will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and if you like in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance. Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein fe
column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column10: De Pijp is vibrant and very much on its way up. As can be expected of an area that is centred on the nation’s most famous outdoor market: Albert Cuypmarkt, near to the Heineken brewery. This Amsterdam neighbourhood is famously diverse with over 100 nationalities represented. While still the best neighbourhood to choose from a wide selection of ethnic food, more high-end bars and restaurants have come on the scene to service students and young professionals. Further east along De Pijp there is the Van Woustraat, a former fast food strip, there are now several of the city’s more highly regarded restaurants. But perhaps most representative of the area is Bazar, a former church on the Albert Cuypmarkt that has been reinvented as a funky North African café/restaurant.

column8: The house is located in a quite street, with several semidetached houses. Its a three floor modern house (160 square meters) with lost of windows and sunlight inside.  The open kitchen is located at the ground floor attached by a small living room. From here you have acces to the beautiful garden.  First floor is a spacious living room with a big corner seat for relaxing after a busy day. Sunny balcony. Second floor has a big double bed bedroom, a bedroom with a single bed, another bedroom with double bed and a bathroom with shower and bath. Kitchen with all facilities, digital tv, wifi. Sun all day in the garden with lots of privacy.

column12: Living in the thriving northern part of Amsterdam brings you the perfect blend of tranquility and the vibe of the city. The house located in a rural area ( 5 minute bike ride to meadows) with the advantage that after a 20 min bikeride in the other direction (or 10 minutes by bus) you will be in the centre of Amsterdam. The ancient villages Durgerdam, Holysloot, Ransdorp, Marken and Volendam can easily be reached by bike or car.  If you take the bike to the centre of Amsterdam you can choose to take the ferry from the NDSM area. On the grounds of this old shipyard restaurants and culture have nicely mixed.  Directly opposite from Central Station, in ‘our' north, is the former Shell officetower. This has been transformed into a breeding ground for creative businesses and artists and nightlife. Also here is the brand new small hall of the worldfamous venue Paradiso: they have created their own northern department called “de Tolhuistuin". Next to this is also the big white building; the EY
column13: Families or easy going couples are preferred guests. No partysquad. Sometimes possible to het picked up from Schiphol AirPort.

column12: Parking is free. The bike takes you in 8 minutes to ferry Buiksloterweg, in 6 minutes to ferry Ijplein and 5 minutes to ferry Zamenhofstraat. The big shopping centre Buikslotermeerplein is a 5 minute bike ride away, with all the shops you could ever need. Noorderpark and Vliegenbos located close by.

column6: A unique opportunity to stay in your private hotel, situated only 350m from the famous Leidseplein! It's the perfect apartment for groups of 17: 5 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms and a cosy livingroom/kitchen to relax. Ideal for family/friends!
column7: The Mansion is situated in a great area called the Jordaan, one of downtown Amsterdam's most charming and authentic neighborhoods. The interior is stylish and modern. Kick back and relax with a good book or spice up your Dutch by watching some TV in the cosy living room. It's the perfect place to acclimatise after a long day of sightseeing. The equipped kitchen allows you to prepare your own meal and has a dishwasher! You can enjoy your meal in the connecting dining area, where you can sit at the big wooden dining table, with 16 chairs. All 5 bedrooms are very nicely decorated, each with their very own unique style, and fitted with comfortable beds, a mini bar, a television set, a safe and every room has its own en-suite bathroom. Even though you're located in a central area, the ambience is peaceful and quiet, making you want to snooze just a little longer in the mornings. HIGHLIGHTS: • Modern and light • 2 floors: ground floor and lower ground floor • Accommodates up to 15 guests • E

column10: The area is called the Jordaan, and is one of the best and most authentic areas in Amsterdam, perfect to spend your holiday. All the good things the city has to offer are within walking distance, making it very easy to get around. Any local would recommend you to take a stroll along the canals in the evenings. It's like a dream. The famous Nine Streets (9 Straatjes) are just a 2 min walk away. Here you can find all kinds of smaller boutique shops, cafes and restaurants. Leidsesplein entertainment square is only 300 m away. Elandsgracht, where you can find nice restaurants and supermarkets, is only 2 min walking. Museumplein, the area where you will find for example the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum, is a 5 min walk away.
column11: Feel free to contact us on Airbnb during your stay, if you have any questions about the apartment, or if you need any recommendations or tips on how to get around in the area and city. It's fully equipped with all the kitchen gear you need, including a dishwasher! column15: House rules  I kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: •	Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited with a penalty fine up to €150. Please respect this, I do take this very serious.   •	I will make sure that my place is clean, tidy and ready for you when you check-in. To avoid extra cleaning charges of €50 (per hour), make sure the apartment and/or complex is in a similar state when you leave!  •	If damages occur, they will be claimed via the resolutions center.  •	No additional guests are permitted to stay at the apartment than the number of people booked the reservation.  •	Please keep noise levels down at all times, especially when you enter the apartment and/or complex. Don’t forget that you are sharing the building with others. •	No music after 22:00hr. •	House parties are strictly prohibited.  •	Please remind yourself of the check-in and check-out times. Check-in is possible after 15:00hr, and check-out is possible until 11:00hr

column10: The area is called the Jordaan, and is one of the best and most authentic areas in Amsterdam, perfect to spend your holiday. All the good things the city has to offer are within walking distance, making it very easy to get around. Any local would recommend you to take a stroll along the canals in the evenings. It's like a dream. The famous Nine Streets (9 Straatjes) are just a 2 min walk away. Here you can find all kinds of smaller boutique shops, cafes and restaurants. Leidsesplein entertainment square is only 300 m away. Elandsgracht, where you can find nice restaurants and supermarkets, is only 2 min walking. Museumplein, the area where you will find for example the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum, is a 5 min walk away.

column15: House rules  I kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: •	Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited with a penalty fine up to €150. Please respect this, I do take this very serious.   •	I will make sure that my place is clean, tidy and ready for you when you check-in. Don’t forget that you are sharing the building with others. •	No music after 22:00hr. •	House parties are strictly prohibited.  •	Please remind yourself of the check-in and check-out times. Check-in is possible after 15:00hr, and check-out is possible until 11:00hr

The apartment is in a  quiet neighbourhood with many facilities nearby, close to public transport with about 10-15 minutes travel time from the center of Amsterdam.
column7: Spacious and comfortable living area which suits all expectations. Four decent and comfortable bedrooms. Two bedrooms are on the first floor joined by our living room and kitchen. The other two bedrooms are on the second floor, together with a fully equiped bathroom and roof terrace.

column10: Beautiful and quiet area while being close to the center. It takes 10-15 minutes by tram/metro to the center. In our neighbourhood there are many nice restaurants as well as pubs to in Rijnstreet as well as next to the Amstel. The Martin Luther King park is 100 meters walking from our home, where you can relax and sit down.
column12: Victorieplein is the closest stop to our appartment and is a 5 minute walk. From Victorieplein you can also go the other way, where Tram 4 will take you directly to Amsterdam Central, Dam square, Museum square, Leidse square.  Amstel and RAI station are close to the appartment as well, as Schiphol and Central station have good connectivity. This gives you the opportunity to easily go to other places outside of Amsterdam as well.
column13: As our guest you will have access to the complete two levels and all our facilities including:  dishwasher, washing machine, dryer and television (netflix and PS4). We also have a fully equiped kitchen with oven and microwave. Our roof terrace has a picknick table , sofa lounge set and bbq set you can use.
column14: If there are any questions or you need anything, we are always ready to help you! We have always lived in or closeby Amsterdam, so if you have any questions where you should go - we are always ready to help you! We have experienced it is the most convenient to make a Whats'App group for your stay. This way we can communicate clearly together while one of us can respond fast to any questions!

column10: Everything is nearby, within walking distance, but biking is also possible. Here's a short list: Museum Quarter with the Van Gogh Museum and The Royal/Rijksmuseum, the Heineken Experience, and Heineken square, Vondelpark, Leidse square, Albert Cuyp Market, Gerard Dou square, Sarphatipark, Anne Frank House etc etc. Live as a local and eat a delicious dessert at "De taart van mijn tante", have a drink at "De Pilsvogel" and dinner at "Bazar" at the Albert Cuyp market.
column11: The building was built in 1913 and completely renovated in 2013.  This characteristic steep stairs of Amsterdam are still intact, so its not wheelchair accessible for example.
column12: Almost all trams and buses pass through this neighborhood. But what makes the location of our apartment so great is that everything is within walking distance. From the The Royal/Rijksmuseum to the Leidse square to the Vondelpark. Street parking is available, but costs € 4 per hour!

column6: Typical Amsterdam apartment in de Pijp, just renovated: new kitchen, bathroom, dining room. With a French balcony on the front (morning sun) and a balcony on the back (evening sun). 2 person bed and wifi. More pictures will follow!
column7: I bought this place as a 'fixer-upper' and made it my own home. Feel the warmth of this typical Amsterdam apartment, with a personal twist. A romantic getaway!
column8: Typical Amsterdam apartment in de Pijp, just renovated: new kitchen, bathroom, dining room. With a French balcony on the front (morning sun) and a balcony on the back (evening sun). 2 person bed and wifi. More pictures will follow!
column10: Personally this is my favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam because it has everything you need, and its al more authentic than things around central station. But it is still close. There are 2 great restaurants just at my street corner (Paskamer&Reuring)!  Albert Cuypmarket just 5 min walk and also lots of bars, lunchrooms and a beautiful park just a 5 min walk away (really 5 min ;) But just far enough to have a quit night if you prefer sleeping :) This is what is said about this neighborhood the Pijp (on: I am (URL HIDDEN) Lose yourself for hours in Amsterdam’s lively Latin Quarter, with its colourful mix of cuisines, terraces and convivial cafés. From the beautiful landscaped gardens of Sarphatipark to the famous Albert Cuypmarkt street market, De Pijp oozes beatnik flair from every angle, and is has been popular haunt for creatives, students and bohemian spirits since the 60s.
column11: One thing to be reminded of: The apartment is on the 3th floor and there is no elevator! I have a cat, and if you are here, she is staying with a friend, but if you are allergic, I would recommend renting another place.
column12: Trams and busses close by and also between train stations 'Amsterdam Amstel' and 'Amsterdam Zuid' (both just 1,5km away). From central station (3km) take tram 4! And there is a bike Rental just 1 min walk! In winter, you get a discount when you tell them my name! (It is between 10-15euro, depending on how many days you want to rent them). I would advise doing this instead of the hop on hop of busses. You get to see much more!
column13: Kitchen has everything you need! With free coffee and tea of course. But also smoothie maker, oven stove etc.
column15: No smoking please! And no extra people than I'm not aware of. Otherwise: Just treat my place like yours and I feel that things will workout fine :)
column25: My name is Marit, I´m a psychiatrist and I live in Amsterdam for 8 years now. I love to meet people from foreign countries and learn about their habits and culture! And once in a while I rent out my place. And since I normally actually live here, I specifically try to let it not be like a hotel but let people have the real Amsterdam experience like locals know this great city!

column7: Our amazing apartment is located in the local and quiet neighborhood of Oud West. The neighborhood has lots of great cafes, restaurants and bars whilst keeping a relaxed and friendly vibe. You'll be staying right next to the popular street the Overtoom with all the amenities you need and within 2 minutes walk of the lovely Vondelpark. The apartment is shared with 2 really great young professionals who will be more than happy to give you some great tips of what to see and do! column10: The apartment is also ideally situated for you to explore Amsterdam from:  -A great supermarket just around the corner on the main street (Albert Heijn)  -Many tasty restaurants and bars just a short stroll away.  - 2 minute walk away from the famous Vondelpark. - 5 minutes walk from nice bars & restaurants and many shops  - 10 minutes walk Rembrandt Park. - 5 minutes tram to the vibrant Leidseplein, one of the great nightlife spots with loads of bars, clubs & restaurants -Short 15 minute walk to all the main museums such as the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum.
column12: In Amsterdam it's really easy to get around. There is a tram stop just 1 minute from the apartment, with a tram line that goes to Central Station. In the neighborhood there are many places to rent bikes so you can explore Amsterdam like a local!

column12: Amsterdam isn’t that big, so getting around is fairly easy. Trams are around the corner which lead to central station. So the distance from my apartment to central station is 15 min.  The center of Amsterdam (if you want to go to the canals) is around 10 min by bike or tram.

column6: Our apartment is situated in the city centre, near the zoo (Artis) and Waterloo square. It is a nice quiet area, within walking distance of the lovely Oosterpark. The apartment is light and spacious and can accommodate 2-3 people.
column7: The apartment has 2 big rooms, 1 small room, a kitchen and shower. The apartment is light and spacious and has a small sunny balcony. It accommodates 2 people, or three if you use the sleeping couch.  Breakfast is not included, but you can use our kitchen to cook yourself a lovely breakfast, with delicious coffee! Wifi is available.
column8: Our apartment is situated in the city centre, near the zoo (Artis) and Waterloo square. It is a nice quiet area, within walking distance of the lovely Oosterpark. The apartment is light and spacious and can accommodate 2-3 people.
column10: Our neighborhood is very quiet, with big trees in the street. It's right next to the University, with bars and restaurants at walking distance in the Plantage neighborhood or Beukenplein. The zoo (Artis) is around the corner. The lovely Oosterpark is a 1 minute walk from the apartment, in summer there are fun concerts and events held in the weekends.  All the big attractions are easy to reach by bike, on foot or public transport. If you book with us we will provide you with a map with tips for restaurants, bars, shops, nice area's and clubs.
column12: The apartment is very easy to access via public transport, 3-5 minute walk from the metro (stop Weesperplein) and trams 10 and 7 stop right in front of the house, tram 9 and 3 are at 2 minute walking distance. From Amsterdam central station you can take the metro (3 stops, takes you 5 minutes) and get off at Weesperplein, or take tram 9 and get off at Alexanderplein. There is payed parking in front of the house.
column13: You have access to all our rooms and the balcony.
column14: We will not be present ourself's, as we only rent out our apartments during our holidays away. But we will make sure one of our friends or familie members will provide you with the key and all the information you need (wifi access code, tips for your stay and information on the apartment).  You can contact us via email for any questions you have.
column15: - No smoking! - No pets - Treat it like its your own home - The neighbors have young children, so no late night parties in the apartment. But of course you are much encouraged to enjoy the Amsterdam nightlife in the city.
column25:
I am a recently graduated medical doctor. I am working as a doctor in the neurology department. As a medical student I started using air BnB for my holidays, but I wasn't able to rent out my student room. Now I moved into a lovely apartment of my own, I am finally able to return the favor and offer people a stay in a real local house and experience the city as if you were living here yourself.
I am living with my boyfriend, who is an industrial designer.
I love traveling, music, ice skating and wondering around the city by bike or foot.
I have been living in Amsterdam since I started studying, so I know the city very well and am still very much in love with Amsterdam ;) and love to show it off to other people!

column6: Our beautiful houseboat is located in the center of Amsterdam near to all main attractions. the boat is modern, comfortable and spacious and has two decks with furniture. the extra room can be a bunk bed room or a fully equipped nursery for a baby.
column7: Our house is a large houseboat in the centre of Amsterdam. Houseboats are typical Amsterdam. While sitting in our house or on the deck, you can see boats passing by or enjoy the ducks. What makes our house boat so special, is that it is new, styled and large (95 m2) compared to other houseboats. The most special is that while being so central, being so close to the water makes you feel like you are the only one there. Our bed room has a double bed and gives a nice view on the Da Costakade canal. The kitchen is equipped with dish washer and Nespresso machine and it has a large dining table. The doors to the terrace can be opened from the kitchen. During the summer the sun shines on our kitchen terrace until 3 in the afternoon and couple of hours later the sun shines on the side terrace. We love living on this unique houseboat in Amsterdam with our 2 children!

column10: The Hoofddorplein neighbourhood is a lovely and safe neighbourhood where many young families live. A 10 minute walk from the Amsterdam forrest, a 5 minute walk from the Rembrandtpark and a 5 minute walk from the Vondelpark make it a green location perfect for a Sunday stroll. The main museums are 8 minutes by tram and the Dam is only 18 minutes away by tram. In our street there is a very good restaurant called Helder, the staff is super friendly and in spring/summer there is a lovely sunny terrace outside. For the best breakfast and ice coffee go to Drover's dog just around the corner - this is my personal favourite place in the neighborhood. For the best coffee and sweet treats go to Caffenation where super friendly and slightly eclectic Belgians run the place. The area is packed with restaurants and cafes, but Van Mechelen on the canal is a favourite. The local supermarket Deen is a two minute walk.
column12: From Schiphol Airport: take the train towards Lelylaan Station, from there take bus 63 to Hoofddorplein, from Hoofddorpplein it's a 3 minute walk to the accomodation. In total this journey shouldn't take longer than 20/30 minutes.

column6: Ever wanted to stay in an amazing apartment close to the City Centre of Amsterdam? This lovely place is located in a fanastic neighbourhood, the  brimming district Amsterdam Oost!
column7: This characteristic and modern apartment is located in lively and creative district Amsterdam East. This area is a melting pot of great startups, innovative bars, cafes, lunch/breakfast bars, restaurants, shops and nightlife! Famous hotspots close to the apartment are the lovely city park ‘Oosterpark’, and the open market ‘Dappermarket’. The Dappermarket is the second largest market of Amsterdam, with lots a fresh foods but also with flee stuff. If you are interested in museum you have ‘Tropen museum’, the Hermitage museum and ‘Scheepsvaartmuseum’ in East. The famous ‘Grachtengordel’ of Amsterdam is only a 15 min away by public transport from the apartment!  However, you can also decide to stay close to the apartment and visit one of the oldest Zoo’s in Europe- Artis Amsterdam Zoo. You can go to have lunch, drinks or dinner and wines at many places like; Louie Louie, Rum Baba, Biertuin, Studio K, Smokin Barrels, Maxwell, and way more. Or you can have some cocktails @Bar Bukowski, close

column6: My recently renovated cosy Amsterdam apartment has everything you need for a great stay in this beautiful city! The apartment is situated in a friendly and quiet neighborhood and at the same time extremely convenient and close to Amsterdam's main attractions.
column7: The Space The apartment is recently renovated and therefore brand new, clean and bright!  It is a 50m2 apartment consisting of a living room and open kitchen which can be separated from each other by glass doors. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need (dishwasher, fridge/freezer, oven and microwave, cooking equipment but also herbs, oils etc you can use). There is 1 cosy bedroom with a double bed. Of course freshly made linen will be available for you! It is possible for a third guest to sleep on the big sofa. The bathroom is comfortable, spacious and brand new with a washing machine, and clean towels will be provided to you.  Last but not least, the apartment has a lovely balcony to enjoy afternoon and evening sun! A relaxing and comfortable sunbed is available.
column8: My recently renovated cosy Amsterdam apartment has everything you need for a great stay in this beautiful city! The apartment is situated in a friendly and quiet neighborhood and at the same time extremely convenient and close to Amsterdam's main attractions. The Space The apartment is recently renovated and therefore brand new, clean and bright!  It is a 50m2 apartment consisting of a living room and open kitchen which can be separated from each other by glass doors. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need (dishwasher, fridge/freezer, oven and microwave, cooking equipment but also herbs, oils etc you can use). There is 1 cosy bedroom with a double bed. Of course freshly made linen will be available for you! It is possible for a third guest to sleep on the big sofa. The bathroom is comfortable, spacious and brand new with a washing machine, and clean towels will be provided to you.  Last but not least, the apartment has a lovely balcony to enjoy afternoon and evening sun
column10: The Neighborhood The neighborhood is peaceful, cosy and quiet, away from the busy city center hustle but very close by. It is close to numerous attractions. It is walking distance to the lovely Vondelpark (an ideal summer hangout spot), Museumplein (museum district with the famous Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and Stedelijk Museum) and PC Hooftstraat (luxury shopping street). Also the Olympic stadium and Zuidas business district are around the corner.  The streets around the apartment offer everything you need: a lot of nice cafes and restaurants, a bookshop, bike rental, supermarket, pharmacy and Saturday market. With public transportation it is only 10 minutes to the city center/canal area (Leidseplein, 9 straatjes, Spui etc.).
column12: Getting Around There are multiple bus and tram stops within walking distance of the apartment. Busses/trams leave every 5 minutes.  From the airport, the apartment can be easily reached by public transportation within 20 mins with a bus stop just around the corner (bus #197). Also the train station 'station Amsterdam zuid' is very close by. From the Railway Station 'Amsterdam Central Station' it is best to take tram #16 (towards 'VU Medisch Centrum') that leaves in front of the central station, and get out at the stop 'Valeriuspleín'. The tram ride will take about 20 minutes. From there it is just a 3 minute walk to my apartment.  A really useful app for getting public transportation information in the Netherlands is 9292ov. It's free and available in English, and you simply enter your departure location and destination and it gives you all available routes and times.
column13: Guest Access You will have access to everything described above, including fresh towels and bed linen but also complete kitchen equipment (including stored foods, as long as you replace it :)).
column14: Interaction with Guests A nice booklet will be available for you in which I listed my favorite places in the neighborhood and Amsterdam in general. Also, you will get my phone number so you can get in contact whenever needed.
column15: House Rules Please treat the apartment as if it is your own and kindly respect the following house rules: - Please keep the noise down, especially when entering the complex and walking the stairs. After all, you share the building with other people living there. All in all: we kindly ask you to respect your neighbours;  - We guarantee a clean house when checking in. When checking out, please leave the apartment closely to the same state as it was provided to you;  - No music after 22:00;  - Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited. The penalty is a fine up to €100,-  - No additional guests allowed without approval;  - Make sure to turn off the lights, heating and gas nozzle when it is not needed - respect the environment;  - No house parties;  - Check in and check out times always in negotiation.  - May the bad luck occur that you lose the key or accidentally take it with you when checking out, I have to charge €100,- for replacing the lock and
column25: Hi! I'm Caroline, 28 years old and living and working in Amsterdam. I love to travel and meet new cultures, and of course to make guests feel at home in my apartment!

column12: Amsterdam is best accessible by bike. There is a big bike storage to lock your bike on the ground floor. And the nearest tram stop is a mere 5 minute walk, next to the City Zoo. This tram will take you to Amsterdam Central Station in 10 minutes.
column13: The apartment is located on the second floor, accessible with a staircase or elevator from the ground floor to the courtyard.
column14: I will most likely be in Amsterdam during your stay so you can always contact me with any questions!
column15: We respect our neighbours peace&quiet like they respect ours, therefor please no loud parties.
column25:
A social worker in his late twenties who loves running, conversations&good food and books. I love the city of Amsterdam and have been living here all my life. 

Since I live with my girlfriend it's nice to Airbnb my home a few days of the month. it's really nice to meet new people and helping to experience Amsterdam and have a great stay!

column5: Spacious family home in beautiful Amsterdam
column6: Enjoy seeing Amsterdam from the a less "touristy" perspective.  Our home is nestled in the beautiful Rivierenbuurt. You’ll love our home because it's very spacious, family friendly and our neighborhood is quiet but still centrally located. Two major tram stops are within a 2 minute walk, as well as the Maasstraat; a lively street with eateries, cafe's, bakeries and shopping! Museumplein, Rembrantplein, Albert Cuyp Market & Dam Square are all accessible from the nearby trams 4 & 12.  Welcome!
column7: Enjoy a private entrance and large open living space.  Let this be your home away from home where you and your family can unwind after a day of touring.  Grab some tapas and a bottle of Rosé from the grocer and picnic in the Anne Frank park behind our apartment.  A nice way to enjoy the extended daylight of summer.  The city center is only 8 minutes away by either tram 4 or 12, both located close to home.  Bike rental is also possible on the lovely Maasstraat (only a 5 minute walk!)

column10: What I love about living in the Rivierenbuurt is how green and spacious it is.  Built in the 40's it has a very art-deco feel to it and was built with families in mind....The lively Maasstraat with it's many eateries, the relaxing Anne Frank park, Beatrixpark with it's winding trails and wading pool for kids, Amstelpark with it's beautiful gardens, huge playground, train ride and bi-weekly top scale food & local merchandise market (Puur Market).  Amsterdam is so much more beautiful than just it's unique rooftops & canals.  Here you have the opportunity to take in what I love about this city and keeps me here year after year.
column12: There is street parking in front as well as long term parking a short tram ride away.  Bike rental is available from Black Bikes on the Maasstraat, only a 5 minute walk.  Almost in front of the apartment is Tram 12 which brings you directly to Concertgebouw, & Museumplein where you'll find Rijks museum and the Van Gogh.  A 2-minute walk to Tram 4 will have you in the city center in 7 minutes.
column13: Guests will have access to the entire apartment and are welcome to use the Wifi & Netflix.  We are happy to provide coffee, tea and some basics like butter, jam and spices.  If you are staying longer term, there are clear instructions on how to use the washer/dryer for laundering your clothes.  There is a hair dryer on each floor.
column14: We will not be in town to assist you personally however we have two people who are available should you need help.  There names and contact information are provided in the welcome packet.  Please know though, that we are always available for texting or phone calls.
column15: Check-in is at 3pm, and check-out is by 11am. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. No smoking - We kindly ask that guests only smoke on the balcony. No illegal activity No pets No overnight guests who are not part of the advanced, airbnb reservation WITHOUT PERMISSION from host      *any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on our airbnb profile and must sleep in the room of the airbnb guest Use kitchen freely but please clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight.
column25: Well, you're looking to rent our family home so I'll tell you about us as a family.  I  am an American from New Hampshire and my husband is from P.E.I in Canada.  We met here 12 years ago and have two super fun kids ages 7 & 5.  My daughter loves the idea of someone coming to stay in our home for their holiday in Amsterdam.  She in particular is very expressive of her love for living here and how much there is to do.  (I think she got that from her Momma.) We love the idea giving someone a warm homey experience as they explore this beautiful city and the surrounding areas.

Waterlooplein is a square in the centre of Amsterdam in the Netherlands, near the Amstel river. The daily flea market on the square is popular with tourists. The Stopera city hall and opera building and the Mozes en Aäronkerk church are at Waterlooplein. Waterlooplein is a stop on the common part of Amsterdam Metro lines 51, 53, and 54. Tram lines 9 and 14 and the Museumboot water taxi also stop at Waterlooplein. There is a taxi stand and parking garage.

column5: Luxe studio, private entree, 3 km/10 min. from CS
column6: New and luxe studio (32m2) with it's own entree and private bathroom. Kitchen (Nespresso machine etc, fridge). High quality sleeping couch (2 sec. from couch to bed). TV, Chromecast. Washer & dryer. Terrace with evening sun. Splendid view of the Buiksloterdijk. Center/CS at 3 km. Uber/taxi to ferry (CS): 6 min. (ca. €7,-). E-bike rental in our street: 10 mn. by bike to the ferry (CS). Metro (2 stops to CS): 17 min walk/4 min by bus. FREE parking. Enjoy lively Amsterdam, stay in our quiet area.
column7: The studio 'Coubertin' is located next to our house. You have your own private entrance. It's a great place, 12 min. by Uber from Amsterdam Central Station (CS) via the (free) ferry / or 2 stops from metro Noord (15. min. walk or 4 min. by bus) and located in a green and quiet area. Studio Coubertin was built in november 2019, with an own entrance on the ground floor, where you find a luxury bathroom (rainshower & handshower, toilet), hall with washer and dryer, and (mind you: somewhat tight) stairs to the first floor.  The living area has a chique oak floor. The ceilings are extra high (3 meters), giving the apartment a spacious feeling. The kitchen has everything you need for breakfast (Nespresso machine, cappuccino maker,  toaster, egg boiler, fridge).  The sleeping couch is of great quality: just pull the back and turn it in 2 seconds into a great bed (140 x 200) with mattress and topdek mattress.  Large television with digital TV and Chromecast. Off course there is WiFi.  Couberti

column7: The bathroom is spacious, bright and tidy. It has a neat shower, toilet and sink.  At the rear of the apartment is an original, well-kept kitchen with granite counter tops, turquoise kitchen cabinets and refrigerator with four burner stove.
column8: Nice and bright 1-bedroom apartment (41 sqm) located in a trendy neighbourhood in the east of Amsterdam. It has a spacious balcony and beautiful large communal courtyard. At the rear of the apartment is an original, well-kept kitchen with granite counter tops, turquoise kitchen cabinets and refrigerator with four burner stove. The apartment is very close to Beukenplein with lots of trendy cafes, restaurants and coffee bars. Two supermarkets at 2 minutes walking distance. Trainstations Amsterdam Amstel and Amsterdam Muiderpoort are both close. to the apartment. Tram 3 stops near by and there's also a metro station at 8 minutes walking distance. Parking spaces are almost always available in the street.

column6: My one-bedroom apartment is located on the famous Dapper Market and you find anything you need (like public transport) on a walking distance. column8: My one-bedroom apartment is located on the famous Dapper Market and you find anything you need (like public transport) on a walking distance. The apartment has an open kitchen, comfortable living, bedroom with one bed and bathroom with nice rain shower! Also the city center is just 15 minutes away by bike or public transportation. You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others. Iamb&b will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and if you like in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance. Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here.
column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.

column10: The Pijp is located directly south of Amsterdam's city centre and it is part of the borough 'Amsterdam-Zuid'. Most street names in the Pijp are named after Dutch painters, like Jan Steen, Frans Hals, Ruysdael and Vincent van Gogh. The most famous and busiest street market of the Netherlands, the Albert Cuyp Market, is in the Pijp. It is open six days per week and attracts a lot of tourists. The former Heineken brewery is also a popular tourist attraction. Next to the former Heineken brewery is the Marie Heinekenplein, which has a lot of bars and cafes, as well as the near Gerard Douplein.
column11: Freshly made up beds and crispy towels (one per person) will be waiting for you upon arrival.
column12: To get from Schiphol to the apartment take the train towards Amsterdam Zuid (South) and transfer to tram line 5 to Roelof Hartplein and after that it's just a short 15 min walk to the apartment. From Central take tram line 5 to Roelof Hartplein and after that it's just a short 15 min walk to the apartment.
column13: Guests are invited to enjoy the whole apartment. Make yourself at home!
column14: If you have any questions about the apartment or if you need recommendations or neighborhood tips, please feel free to contact us during your stay.  We're always happy to help!
column15: House rules  We kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: •	Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited with a penalty fine up to €100. Please respect this.  •	No additional guests are permitted to stay at the apartment without prior approval by the home owner.  •	Please keep noise levels down at all times, especially when you enter the apartment. Don’t forget that you are sharing the building with others. •	No music after 22:00. •	House parties are prohibited.  •	Please remind yourself of our check-in and check-out times. These are after 15.00 and before 11.00 respectively. •	For a check-in time after 20.00 we charge €20 extra. •	We will make sure the house is clean and ready for you when you check-in. Please leave it in a similar way when checking-out in order to avoid extra cleaning charges. •	Lost keys (and those you accidentally take with you once you’ve gone home) will be replaced for €100. •	Please do not accept packages in the ma
column25:
Hi All,

I'm Ed Peerdeman (27) and together with my girlfriend Iris (23) we're living in Amsterdam (De Pijp). I'm currently working as an Investment Advisor in Hoofddorp and Iris is working in Amsterdam as a Social Nurse. We both live life to the fullest. We love to meet our friends, socialize and eat/drink anywhere in our beautiful city. There are so many nice things to do in Amsterdam and the atmosphere is indescribable and phenomenal. You have to experience it yourself to understand what i'm talking about. Furthermore we both do love traveling and that's also the reason why we occasionally would like to rent our house via Airbnb.

column6: This apartment is situated just outside the city center in a more quite area. The well-kept garden at the back and the broad canal in front gives it a relaxed feel. It is very light and sunny. Perfect base for one or two guests.

You'll have the entire apartment Either I or my friend who lives in the house next to me will welcome you and be able to offer assistance should you need it during your stay. This worker's area was developed around 100 years ago in cooperation with the famous Dutch architect Berlage. It has recently become been a favorite for young people to live in since it still had relatively affordable housing and is less clogged than the center. With it have come many nice (coffee) cafe's and restaurants, quaint places like the Cat Cafe as well as cheap but delicious Turkish bakeries. Close by are the 'De Hallen' which has something for everyone; a large food market, movie center and art galleries. Popular waterside places are 'Radijs' and 'Edel'. A tram or bike will take

column15: No smoking inside please but you can use the garden off course. Please don't place any liquids close to or on my piano. Although I have a dog I prefer you don't bring one yourself since it is 'his' home. Respect the neighbours, no load noises after 10/11 pm.
column25:
Like many people that live in Amsterdam I wasn't born there, but grew up in another famous Dutch city called Delft. After university I moved to Amsterdam and enjoy it so much I stayed there. Most of my 22 years here I lived in the area I bought this apartment in called 'The Baarsjes' which is a type of fish.

My main job here is in IT and besides that music is a major part of my life; studied classical music (theory) and am a trained classical singer (baritone). I also play the piano and clarinet. 

I speak Dutch, English, German and some French. It's hard for me to speak to you in Italian or Spanish but beware, I do understand most of what you are saying ;-)

About six years ago, when a neighbor came by with a pack f puppies, I immediately yelled that I AM NOT A DOG PERSON. A few days later I bought the dog and every day I am amazed how wonderful it is to share your life with a dog.

When I travel myself I prefer to stay somewhere where I can cook my own food, not because of a strict diet, but I enjoy shopping for food at local markets plus it's a relaxing activity for me. As for destinations, I tend to stay within Europe so I can take my dog with me. Since I have a dog I walk a lot and I love to take long hikes in thinly populated areas and camping in the wild.

column5: Cozy in hip location! Fit for art!
column6: A cozy apartment in the heart of Indische Buurt, the quickly growing multi cultural neighborhood in Amsterdam Oost. Well within the ring and super connected with the entire city. Great variety of cafe's, restaurants and parks nearby. The apartment has 2 bedrooms - the first bedroom is a sleeping space, the 2nd has been converted into an art studio. The living room has a sofa bed that sleeps 2.
column7: The apartment consists of a cozy bedroom, spacious living room and a small art studio. The bathroom is a little on the small side. The toiled seat requires a good spread, or to sit on the side of it. The shower is nice and comfy. There's a wonderful balcony that can be accessed from the living room and kitchen. The kitchen is cozy but stocked with all you need.
column8: A cozy apartment in the heart of Indische Buurt, the quickly growing multi cultural neighborhood in Amsterdam Oost. Well within the ring and super connected with the entire city. Great variety of cafe's, restaurants and parks nearby. The apartment has 2 bedrooms - the first bedroom is a sleeping space, the 2nd has been converted into an art studio. The living room has a sofa bed that sleeps 2. The apartment consists of a cozy bedroom, spacious living room and a small art studio. The bathroom is a little on the small side. The toiled seat requires a good spread, or to sit on the side of it. The shower is nice and comfy. There's a wonderful balcony that can be accessed from the living room and kitchen. The kitchen is cozy but stocked with all you need. You are free to enjoy all spaces of the apartment! Feel free to enjoy yourself and make some art in the art studio, without having to be concerned about making a big mess (so long as it's within reason). Additional amenities: *Printer *Vac
column10: The neighborhood is very lively and up and coming! It's multi cultural and colorful, with parks, cafe's, restaurants, excellent public transportation and plenty of bike parking (which I highly advise you rent for your stay!)
column11: Our next door neighbors are really nice, but have fights between themselves. They will smile at you and say hello, but you will likely hear them shouting at each other when they are fighting. Our downstairs neighbor requests that no loud noises be made. Don't act like mice or tip toe for him, but do please take into consideration the thinness of the floors and ceilings.
column12: The place is right next to Javaplein! It's excellently connected with public transportation and easy to get from here to any other place in the city.
column13: You are free to enjoy all spaces of the apartment! Feel free to enjoy yourself and make some art in the art studio, without having to be concerned about making a big mess (so long as it's within reason). Additional amenities: *Printer *Vacuum cleaner *Microwave *Toaster *Ice cream maker (let us know in advance if you'd like to try and make some ice cream, we will make sure it's cold and ready for you :) )
column14: I will be renting the place out mostly during vacation, and if I won't be here it would be best to reach out to me by email as I can't promise to have phone contact. I will be renting a single bed here from time to time as well, during which time I will be present and happy to help with anything needed.
column15: Please do not wear shoes inside the house. Slippers are advised. The floors and ceilings are, in true Amsterdam fashion, old and thin. Please avoid obscenely loud music or noises at night. If you're bringing your pet, make sure it will not shed on the couch or bed, and not do it's business inside the house or on the balcony. Smoking (both tobacco and marijuana) is okay on the balcony, but please do not smoke inside. If you're staying for a long time, please water the plants occasionally! Be respectful of our home and possessions. Please tell us about yourselves, your group and your plans for your stay, knowing about the people staying in our home is important to us. Include the word "flamingo" in your first message to indicate you read the house rules.

column25:
Hello people :)

Well I am George, I am originally from Brazil but I live in Amsterdam, this gr8 city, for  many years! 
What you get: a nice and clean private  room. The bath room is right in front of your room and the comfortable kitchen is just beside it. There's a nice balcony where you can sit to enjoy the sunshine, smoke a joint, if you like it :). You have a lot of comfort and privacy. 
More about me: I am very relax guy, I like smoke weed sometimes, partying :) ... but I have a health life style too, sporting and eating healthy.
Like to give you info and tips about places to go, if you need it, and I like you to feel at your home and I am sure you will ;)
I am just starting here and so this is my first text. On the future I hope I can do it better. You are from heart welcome to stay in my place.
Oh! The coffee, tea in the kitchen is free. You may buy your own groceries and cook your own breakfast any time you want. No restrictions about the time to go in and out of the house. You get your own keys to the apartment. If you like stay awake all night in in the room or make food in the middle of the night, you may!!! It doesn't bother me! 
Looking forward to welcome you in Amsterdam. Have a nice trip! :)

Cheers, 
George

P. S.: The flat is very near the city center. With bike 10 minutes to Dam Square. And it's very relax and save neighborhood. Supermarkets, restaurants and the public transport is just around the corner. And it's also easy to just walk to the city from here.
The room have a big bed, as you see on the pics. Can be for one person, two guys, two girls or  a couple. Every one welcome ;) . Clean sheets and towels are included.

The apartment is situated the heart of the Pijp, just around the corner of the famous Albert Cuypmarket. This streetmarket is open 6 days a week and offers all the fresh produce (and other products) you desire.  Just a few streets further you’ll find the Sarphatipark. The area is green and child friendly, but only 10 minutes away by bus or bike from all the things Amsterdam has to offer. This neighborhood (Noord) is on the list as one of Europes most trendy neighborhoods, so has a lot to offer. Read more: (URL HIDDEN) Close by are the woods and the little old villages and farmer areas. Great for biking. And we also have some nice restaurants, bars, parks, play fields and a shopping area where you can find (deli-)food and your grocery's. Our house is currently being renovated, and almost finished. You can reach us easily from Central Station via tram that stops right in front of our door. Park Suite is compact and complete - it contains a petite pantry, design shower, toilet and your own balcony facing quiet garden courtyard!

column5: Stylish & spacious apartment in the centre
column6: The apartment, 3 floors, has all the comforts of a modern house. The light coming in is beautiful. Attention to detail and comfort, industrial/urban and situated in a quiet street in the green, cultural district called "The Plantage". It is a 5 to 10 minute walk to the very centre of Amsterdam, yet quiet and serene.
column7: With its 3 bedrooms it is both suitable for a couple or a family (baby, toddler, child, adolescent).

column10: We love this area because you can walk out of the door and find within one minute: our favourite restaurant De Plantage, for breakfast and lunch Dignita Hoftuin and NewWerktheater (also for dinner on Thursday and Friday-evenings), the best ice creamshop, Coffee Company espresso cafe, the lovely Artis Zoo, the Hortus Botanicus, nice parks to have picknicks at the canal and the beautiful Portuguese Synagoge. I am happy to share you with you all my personal recommendations to make your stay as enjoyable and authentic as possible. De Plantagebuurt, at the east side of Amsterdam's city centre, is one of Amsterdam's greenest and prettiest areas, next to the Amstel River with its skinny bridge and the Hermitage Museum and also a 10 min. walk from the Waterloopplein, the Utrechtsestraat and the famous neighborhood the Pijp  with the University of Amsterdam opposite of the street (convenient for conference visits).
column11: No smoking in the house.
column12: Easily accessible from Central Station, a direct tramline 9 or metroline. The Metro station Weesperplein is a 5 min. walk. But of course the best way to explore Amsterdam is riding a bike, which you can rent nearby. Or just walk, lots of highlights are around the corner.
column13: The apartment has a spacious bright living room with a well equipped kitchen, a masterbedroom with a comfy kingsize bed and small sofa, a bedroom with a twopersons bed, a room with a cot, a dressing-room and a wonderful two-sink bathroom with a strong-pressured shower and a bath.  Of course there is also free WIFI available for you. The apartment is in a historical house from 1890 and was entirely totally renovated last year so everything is new and suitable for a couple or for a family with children.
column14: We are always available by phone or email for questions & helping out with problems and will always try to give a reaction within 24 hours! Looking forward being you're host! Sincerily, Jelle & Julia
