column5: Cosy room in ap. next to windmill in Amsterdam
column6: Our spacious apartment at the edge of the center of Amsterdam is beautiful and homely and has a great view over a gorgeous windmill and a local brewery on one side, and a courtyard, canals and the famous Dappermarkt on the other. The room is cozy and has a sunny balcony.
column7: The apartment is divided into three "half-floors". The spacious living room is on the first floor, the bathroom, toilet, kitchen with balcony and your private room on the second. Our bedroom is located on the top floor of the apartment and is not meant as guest-space. The room is located on the courtyard side of the apartment so it is quiet at night and has a sunny balcony.
column8: Our spacious apartment at the edge of the center of Amsterdam is beautiful and homely and has a great view over a gorgeous windmill and a local brewery on one side, and a courtyard, canals and the famous Dappermarkt on the other. The room is cozy and has a sunny balcony. The apartment is divided into three "half-floors". The spacious living room is on the first floor, the bathroom, toilet, kitchen with balcony and your private room on the second. Our bedroom is located on the top floor of the apartment and is not meant as guest-space. The room is located on the courtyard side of the apartment so it is quiet at night and has a sunny balcony. You are welcome to use all rooms and balconies, with the exception of our  bedroom. We will be there in person or on the phone should you need us. The apartment is located at the East edge of the center, right in the middle of some famous landmarks. In front of the building there is Brouwerij 't IJ, a local brewery brewing quality beers since 1985 i
column10: The apartment is located at the East edge of the center, right in the middle of some famous landmarks. In front of the building there is Brouwerij 't IJ, a local brewery brewing quality beers since 1985 in a an old municipal bath house. You can go for a tour in the brewery or just enjoy their beers and home-made Dutch cheese in the pub or large terrace right under the biggest wooden windmill of the Netherlands. On the other side of the apartment is the Dappermarkt (visible from your window), one of the oldest markets in Amsterdam and seen as a colorful connector for harmonious mingling between cultures. Fittingly, behind the Dappermarkt is the Tropenmuseum, a museum of cultures. On yet another side of the apartment you can visit Artis Royal Zoo, the oldest zoo in the Netherlands, and combine it with Micropia, the only museum in the world revealing the world of microscopically small life. In addition to the local brewery, there are many nice pubs, restaurants and coffeeshops located in
column11: Our apartment is part of a building that houses mostly families. We therefore expect our guests to be respectful of our neighbor's rest, and peace and quiet. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets. Smoking in the apartment is not permitted. However, feel free to smoke on the balcony. Please read and respect our house-rules.
column12: There are several ways to get to the apartment. Right next to the building there is a tram located that will take you to the hotspots in the center in about 5-10 minutes, and goes all the way down to some great spots in Amsterdam West. There is also a bus that can take you to Amsterdam central station in under 10 minutes. There is a train station located at a 10 minute walking distance. Of course you can also always take a taxi if you prefer. Lastly, there is a hop-on, hop-off bus stop right under the building.
column13: You are welcome to use all rooms and balconies, with the exception of our  bedroom.
column14: We will be there in person or on the phone should you need us.
column15: My apartment is part of a building that houses mostly families. I therefore expect our guests to be respectful of my neighbors' peace and quiet. So please, reserve only if this fits your plans for the visit. Additionally, this should be obvious, unfortunately it was not for some guests, no sudden additional guests. When in doubt, please communicate with me and I will help you to the best of our ability. Finally, please inform me of your planned check-in time at least a few days in advance (or when making the booking if it's last-minute) and tell me something about yourselves and your travel plans since it would make sharing my apartment more pleasant.
column25: I'm a master studies graduate from the University of Amsterdam with a degree in cognitive science. I like traveling, coffee, craft beers (brewing myself on occasion), climbing, martial arts, and to read a good book in the sun (with a preference for the late Terry Pratchett). I prefer dogs to cats and I do not smoke.

The living room is an open area with a comfortable living, a large dining table, a fully equipped open kitchen and doors to both balconies. The kitchen has a refrigerator, stove, oven, dishwasher, Nespresso, water boiler and all can be used ofcourse. The bedroom is on the quiet backside of the apartment and has a big double bed. When weather permits you can have a nice breakfast on the balcony on the backside of the house facing the gardens. The apartment has balcony doors at both the front and back side of the house which make the living bright. We have a small French balcony in the front, while the balcony in the back looks out on the typical neighborhood gardens. Perfect for couples.

column6: Our place is centrally located in Amsterdam Oud-West. An area with a laid back attitude and home to a cool mix of independent stores and many restaurant hotspots. With less than a 10 min walk you are in the Jordaan (really beautiful!). But why walk when you can cycle? You can use our 2 bikes :) The tram stop is a 1 min walk away and there are connections to Dam square (10min) and Central Station (10 min). You will have the apartment all for yourself.
column7: Our apartment is located in Oud-West, the most vibrant neighborhood in Amsterdam. Within 3 min walk there are some nice bars and good restaurants. The populair food market 'de hallen' is 10 min walking. Vondelpark is only 15 min walking.  Jordaan is 8 min walking and when you want to go to the center you can take the tram, it will cost you 15 min.  AND you can also use our 2 bikes. The living room is very light has a robuust wooden (self-made) table. We love  plants and flowers so the living room is a green oase ;). There is a comfortable couch and a TV.  There is WIFI connection in the whole house.  There is an ensuite next to the living room. Here we store our books and there is a desk with a comfortable desk chair where you can work if necessary.  In the ensuite you can open the windows and we made a little seat so you can enjoy the afternoon sun here.   In the master bedroom there is a very comfortable luxury double boxspring bed. column10: We think Amsterdam West is one of the most diverse neighbourhoods in town. You find almost everything there! This multi-culti area – with a laid back attitude – is home to a cool mix of independent stores and many restaurant hotspots. You will find a diversity of hipster- proof coffee places, cool concept stores and vintage boutiques. Amsterdam West is also great for foodies! You find a nice eatery at almost every corner. Amsterdam West can be divided in different neighbourhoods. All with their own characteristics! Explore them all and discover Amsterdam its first indoor food market at the Kinkerstraat and Bellamy square. Or go shopping at one of the trendy streets like the Jan Pieter Heijestraat which is packed with cool stores. In the upcoming Baarsjes you will find the nicest restaurants and stores at almost every corner. Make sure to check out the Jan Evertsenstraat and the Admiraal the Ruijterweg. Do you like it more upcoming? Go Yolo in Bolo. We are talking about Bos and Lommer w

column5: Monumental house in Jordaan garden direct on canal
column6: A truely unique monument with a sunny garden directly on the canal. The sleeping and the living space have 4 meter high ceilings with big windows. This makes the rooms very light and you have a great view on the canal and garden.  It is small house not an appartment so you have no neighboors living above or next to you.  Situated in the cosiest part of the Center: "the Jordaan" you are in the mids of good restaurants, bars, walking distance of museums and the Vondelpark.
column7: Very light and relaxing atmosphere. With a view from the bedroom and livingroom on the garden and the canal. In summer you can sit outiside and enjoy the loungeset or the mammock.  In winter you enjoy the view from the livingroom and the fireplace. The sleeping and the living space have 4 meter high ceilings with big windows. This makes the rooms very light.

column10: The Jordaan is beautiful with flowers in the street, cosy bars and restaurants. The market is on saturday and monday. West is also in walking distance and is less touristic but offers great places to go. The market there is from monday till friday. Vondelpark is 13 minutes walk.
column11: The sleepingroom has a dressing area and a sleeping loft above. The stairs are quite steep as most Amsterdam houses have. People who are less stable on their feet should notice this, for most people this not a problem. Upstairs there is comfortable King size bed 180cm by 210cm
column12: You are in 5 minutes walking distance to the bus station. 9 out of 10 times you can go everywhere in the city directly without changing busses or trams Bus 197 from Schiphol Amsterdam goes directly From central station Amsterdam there are several busses and trams that goes directly also
column13: The whole house is for your private use.  If you feel like cooking or take out for a nice evening at home you will enjoy for sure the athmosphere with maybe a fire in the fireplace. The big garden directly on the canal is for your private use also. The garden in summer brings you scents of jasmine, roses and lavender. There is a vegetable garden were you can pick tomatos, arugula, mint and whatever is is growing. There are also some herbs which you can use. The garden is quite big and offers three places to relax. You can sit under the walnut three to have some shadow. You can sit on the lounge set or lay in the hammock.  And there is a little couch by the garden house were you are protected from most wind. column10: Amsterdam West is one of the most buzzing & diverse neighborhoods. You find almost everything there! It's an area with a laid back attitude an home to a cool mix of small stores and many restaurant hotspots. A great diversity of hipster- proof coffee places (to drink coffee, not the type that sells pot ;)), cool concept stores and bars with outside terraces. Amsterdam West is also great for foodies! You find a variety of kitchens and ambiences that will serve every needs. Furthermore within walking distance you reach the 17th century city centre, while you walk by the cool bars and restaurants before you know it you entered the Jordaan district. Here are the famous UNESCO listed canals like Herengracht, Prinsengracht and Keizersgracht. We are proud to say that our own area has recently been nominated for an UNESCO listing as well, since the archtecture is from a stream of the international Expressionist architecture. If you take a left turn when you leave the house right away you'll fi
column12: Less than a minute from the apartment is a tram stop, here 2 trams take you to Ann Frank house in just 5 minutes. There are connections that take you straight to all popular places is in Amsterdam. NO stop overs for anything... Like to go to the museum district a tram will take you there in 10 minutes, like to go to the Palace, again a direct connection. Everything you need to see is within easy reach! You have to pay for parking your car in front of the door.
column13: We love to rent out our lovely apartment to nice decent people, couples & families, anyone who treats it with respect.  This means we do not accept requests from people who come to Amsterdam solely to smoke and party. If you are looking to see the culture and enjoy the quality things Amsterdam has to offer, you are very welcome. If you are looking for a house where you can party, smoke in or want to crash with a group of (young) friends look further. That's not us.

column6: A new built family house (130 sqm), finished March 2016 with a beautiful view on the Amstel. You are in a quiet place very near to the Pijp and city centre. Metro- and train station are a 5 minute walk (10 minutes to central station). After you have visited the sites of Amsterdam, you can have a drink in the front garden or have a picnic at the water's edge and see the sun set over Amsterdam, while the kids play around on the lawns in front of our house. The house has a private garage.
column7: It is a new house, that we built together with our neigbours. We finished it in March 2016 and we are happy to share it with you. The Pijp is located directly south of Amsterdam's city centre and it is part of the borough 'Amsterdam-Zuid'. Most street names in the Pijp are named after Dutch painters, like Jan Steen, Frans Hals, Ruysdael and Vincent van Gogh. The most famous and busiest street market of the Netherlands, the Albert Cuyp Market, is in the Pijp. It is open six days per week and attracts a lot of tourists. The former Heineke
column10: The Pijp is located directly south of Amsterdam's city centre and it is part of the borough 'Amsterdam-Zuid'. Most street names in the Pijp are named after Dutch painters, like Jan Steen, Frans Hals, Ruysdael and Vincent van Gogh. The most famous and busiest street market of the Netherlands, the Albert Cuyp Market, is in the Pijp. It is open six days per week and attracts a lot of tourists. The former Heineken brewery is also a popular tourist attraction. Next to the former Heineken brewery is the Marie Heinekenplein, which has a lot of bars and cafes, as well as the near Gerard Douplein.

column5: Beautiful and sunny 80m2 apartment near Vondelpark
column6: A spacious, sunny, totally renovated and super comfortable 80 m2 apartment with a great view! Floor heated, with two balconies and a roofgarden its ideally located next to the Vondelpark with restaurants, shops, public transport and supermarkets close by. The city center less then 15 min away! The entire apartment is yours: A huge 40 m2 living and dining room, including a new, state of the art kitchen. A separate toilet and  bathroom with rain shower and two big bedrooms with King size beds.
column7: The entire, totally renovated and floor heated apartment is yours: A large combined living and dining room with a state of the art design kitchen with everything you need to prepare a Michelin meal, a big couch and TV, with great views and two identical balconies facing south - ideal for pre-dinner drinks in the sun.  The apartment  is split by our hallway which gives access to a separate toilet, two large (16 and 13 m2) bedrooms, each with king size beds, and a new bathroom with rain shower (all floor heated). The Master bedroom gives access to our 24 m2 big roof garden. Enjoy the views and the sunshine at the front of the apartment during the day, enjoy the evening on our roof terrace and wake up with the sound of the birds.

column10: Our apartment is located on the fringe of the neighbourhood "De Baarsjes" sticking out to the Vondelpark. The park can be seen from our windows and the buzzling Amsterdam West is our backyard. The city centre only 15 minutes away on the bike or with the tram.  Located on the edge of the Baarsjes this is an area in Amsterdam which has been spending a lot of time and energy in developing its cultural and creative community with all the fun stores and bars to match! ★ Near Vondel Park &Rembrandt Park two local hideaways ★ Near train and tram Station Amsterdam Lelylaan ★ Public Parking in front of the apartment ★ 15 minutes to the City Center! ★ Close to the Foodhallen  ★ Spacious RoofGarden  ★ Fully-Equipped Kitchen & Coffee ★ Modern Bathroom + Bathtub ★ Fast & Free Wi-Fi
column11: We have made a short introduction to our apartment, the location vis-a-vis the city center and hotspots, public transport and bike rentals. Most of what you would want to know is in there. If  you have any more questions we are glad to help you out. Our apartment is prfectly suited for either two or  four people. We have two bedrooms with two king size beds.
column12: The apartment is very easy to reach with public transport. From Schiphol airport it's only a 10 minute train ride to Amsterdam Lelylaan and then a two stop tram ride with either Tram 1 or 17 to Surinameplein, and a 150 meters by foot to our frontdoor. From Schiphol to our front door is half an hour max. Also with the car it's an easy ride and there is always enough parking space within 150 metres from our frontdoor, but usually in front of the door. Use Go og le ma ps to find directions. The parking is public and paid - about 3,50 an hour or 18 euro's for the day.
column13: You have access to all described above. The only thing that is restricted is the access to our roof garden after 22:00 at night. Because we don't want to disturb our neighbors we don't allow access after 22:00 at evening. If you would want to smoke we have two balconies at the front of the house that you can use.
column14: During your stay you can reach us at all times with any question!
column15: Thank you for staying with us in our home. But we want ask to you to remember that it is our home and we live here. We have put a lot of time and effort into making it beautiful, comfortable and cozy for us and our guests and we take great care of it and ask the same from our guests.  So we would like to tell you to feel at home in our apartment and ask you to treat our apartment like your own home :-) Thank you so much and have a great stay!

The place itself has elements of design and has a warm and authentic atmosphere. A 5 minute walk is....The Haarlemmerstreet with its numerous small shops and restaurants is a famous shopping street in Amsterdam.The Noordermarkt has a wonderfull market on saturdays and mondays. The Westerpark has something for everybody, markets, culture, movie theatre, restaurants etc. It is a wonderfull 10 minute walk to the Ann Frank Museum. The nearby tram (3 minutes) takes you to all the big museums (Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, the Stedelijk Museum and the Concertgebouw. The big grocery stores you can find on the Haarlemmerplein (3 minute walk).Central station is on walking distance but it is also possible to take bus 18. It is great to come home to a quiet and warm home after a day in the exciting wonderfull city of Amsterdam.You can rent a boot or a bike nearby.

column6: Perfectly located on a quiet side street in the heart of the vibrant and trendy 'de Pijp', with wonderful cafes and restaurants just moments away! A number of Amsterdam's must see sights are close by -  Heineken Museum (550m), Albert Cuypmarkt (200m), Museumplein (700m), Sarphaatipark (350m). With good tram links and bike rental nearby it's a great spot from which to explore Amsterdam!
column7: This spacious apartment (70m2) boasts a large living area and two separate double bedrooms giving plenty of room for 4. column6: Geweldige benedenwoning voor een koppel of gezin dicht bij alle highlights van Amsterdam.  Op loopafstand van het centrum, het beroemde Vondelpark, het Leidseplein, de Food Hallen, markt, bioscoop en diverse cafés en koffietentjes.
column7: Ons huisje is op de benedenverdieping en hierdoor erg makkelijk toegankelijk. We hebben een nieuwe keuken, badkamer met wasmachine, een riante woonkamer met mooie eethoek. In de slaapkamer vind je een heerlijk tweepersoonsbed en een persoons hoogslaper. Ons huis is heerlijk voor een koppel (met kind van 3-8 jaar oud). Voor uw kind is er genoeg speelgoed.
column8: Geweldige benedenwoning voor een koppel of gezin dicht bij alle highlights van Amsterdam.  Op loopafstand van het centrum, het beroemde Vondelpark, het Leidseplein, de Food Hallen, markt, bioscoop en diverse cafés en koffietentjes. Ons huisje is op de benedenverdieping en hierdoor erg makkelijk toegankelijk. We hebben een nieuwe keuken, badkamer met wasmachine, een riante woonkamer met mooie eethoek. In de slaapkamer vind je een heerlijk tweepersoonsbed en een persoons hoogslaper. Ons huis is heerlijk voor een koppel (met kind van 3-8 jaar oud). Voor uw kind is er genoeg speelgoed. Jullie mogen alles in ons mooie huisje gebruiken. Je kunt lekker koken in de nieuwe keuken, je kan de was doen en interactieve tv gebruiken (natuurlijk is er ook wifi). Je hebt ook toegang tot onze mooie gemeenschappelijk tuin waar picknickbanken staan en op dit moment de bloesem heerlijk ruikt. Tijdens je verblijf in ons huisje zijn wij zelf op vakantie, maar een vriend van ons zal voor je klaar staan! Iede
column10: Iedereen die je zal vragen naar de buurt Oud West zal laaiend enthousiast zijn. Werkelijk alles is in de buurt! Je kunt heerlijk mensen kijken en picknicken in het Vondelpark, je kunt vers fruit en groente halen op de Ten Katemarkt, je kunt naar de Local Goods Market die in het weekend in de Hallen zijn. Je kunt een drankje drinken bij alle cafeetjes in de buurt en bij slecht weer een filmpje pakken in de nieuwe knusse bioscoop. Daarnaast loop je zo naar de winkelstraten van Amsterdam en de musea in Amsterdam. En heb je geen puf meer om te lopen? Dan stap je op de hoek van de straat in de tram.
column11: Shoshi! Shoshi is een acht jaar oude poes die bij ons huisje hoort. Als wij weg zijn, blijft zij lekker op de bank slapen en rondscharrelen in de tuin. Daarom is het huren van ons huisje alleen mogelijk, als je onze lieve poes elke ochtend een bakje brokjes en wat schoon water wil geven. Ze slaapt niet op je bed want ook wij doen de slaapkamerdeur gewoon dicht 's avonds.
column12: De tramhalte is om de hoek en er gaat een tram direct naar het Centraal Station (nummer 17) en ook naar het winkelgebied, de grachten en de 'entertainment' area, het Leidseplein.  Ook vanaf Schiphol sta je binnen 20 minuten bij ons voor de deur.
column13: Jullie mogen alles in ons mooie huisje gebruiken. Je kunt lekker koken in de nieuwe keuken, je kan de was doen en interactieve tv gebruiken (natuurlijk is er ook wifi). column14: Tijdens je verblijf in ons huisje zijn wij zelf op vakantie, maar een vriend van ons zal voor je klaar staan!
column15: Dit is ons geliefde familiehuis waar we met ons zoontje wonen. Onze deur staat open en we hopen dat jullie een super tijd hebben in Amsterdam en dat dit huisje fijn thuis komen is. Natuurlijk hopen we wel dat het huis er bij vertrek net zo uitziet als bij aankomst en dat onze buren nog net zo blij met ons zijn.
column25: We are Elles and Or, 27 and 30 years old, living in the beautiful Amsterdam with our babyboy (born 06-09-2015). We love travelling and we used to go to a festival once in a while. Before the birth of our son we explored the world. Nowadays Elles  works as a trainer of new immigrants in the Netherlands, an very interesting job since you meet a lot of people with different cultural backgrounds and Or works at a tradingcompany. We love our house and wish another family a beautiful time in Amsterdam with our home as their base.

column6: A 75m2 apartment in a quiet street. The garden at the back can only be reached through the livingroom. The bedroom of the children can be changed into a bedroom for 2 grown ups (sofa bed).
column7: Ample living room including kitchen. With nice weather you can slide the glass doors open so the livingroom and garden become one.
column8: A 75m2 apartment in a quiet street. The garden at the back can only be reached through the livingroom. The bedroom of the children can be changed into a bedroom for 2 grown ups (sofa bed). Ample living room including kitchen. With nice weather you can slide the glass doors open so the livingroom and garden become one. You will have acces to two bedrooms, the livingroom (including kitchen), bathroom and garden. Basically the whole apartment, apart from a small cubboard where I will store some private stuff. For help/questions you will be able to reach me by mobile phone, as I will be on holiday whithin the Netherlands. The apartment is in a quiet street at walking distance of a supermarket and bakery. It is a 5 minute walk to Westerpark. A lovely park to go for a run, a picknick or drink. If you come with children the park offers a free pool (only for children), playgarden and childrens farm. Even closer to the apartment you also have a free pool for children and several nice playgarden
column10: The apartment is in a quiet street at walking distance of a supermarket and bakery. It is a 5 minute walk to Westerpark. A lovely park to go for a run, a picknick or drink. Even closer to the apartment you also have a free pool for children and several nice playgardens.
column12: You can use my bike or rent a bike at the bike shop at the end of the street. By bike it takes you 10 minutes to get to the centre. Otherwise it is a 5 minute walk to tram 12 or 14 and several busses. With tram 12 you are within 10 minutes at Sloterdijk station. With tram 14 it takes you 15 minutes to get to Dam square (city centre).
column13: You will have acces to two bedrooms, the livingroom (including kitchen), bathroom and garden. Basically the whole apartment, apart from a small cubboard where I will store some private stuff.

column6: The perfect base for exploring Amsterdam. There are plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants within walking distance. You can easily reach the centre by tram too and Muiderpoort station is a two minute walk away, with direct trains to Schiphol airport.
column7: Our apartment in one bedroom, but can be opened out into a studio. It's very light, and on the fifth floor - so it has a great view. There's a fireplace, a large terrace and a breakfast bar. We don't have an oven, but there is a hob.
column8: The perfect base for exploring Amsterdam. There are plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants within walking distance. Our apartment in one bedroom, but can be opened out into a studio. It's very light, and on the fifth floor - so it has a great view. There's a fireplace, a large terrace and a breakfast bar. We don't have an oven, but there is a hob. You will have access to the whole apartment - the living room, kitchen, bathroom, bedroom and terrace. The neighbourhood is known for its cultural diversity and it has a great vibe. column7: Building is 110 years old. The spacious room is two stairs up. Double glass for sound filtering in all the 4 windows. Unfortunately the stairs are only 1 meter wide and a bit small like in most classic houses in Amsterdam.

column14: In the weekends I am mostly on tour to do live music. My 11 years old son is mostly with me on Mondays till Wednesdays.

Divorced father with 12 years old son (that stays a few nights every week). Since 30 years I'm a profesionaly entertainer working in music and children's theatre. Therefore I travel a lot. Because I work late evenings I am not an early mornings person.

column5: Lovely house with garden near centre of Amsterdam
column6: Before you book, please check availability, introduce yourself and who is travelling with you (names, ages, profession), tell us what your plans are in Amsterdam. We have a cosy house, ideal for families, close to Sloterdijk Station (8 minute walk). From there you will be at central station in 6 minutes or visit any other place in the city you like. You could also easily go to the beautiful beaches from our location.
column7: The house is a bright and comfortable two storey house. Both the house and the garden behind the house are spacious and well taken care off. The living room, kitchen 0.5 bathroom and laundry room are on the ground floor. The  two bedrooms and the bathroom are on the first floor. The house is situated in a green, safe, quiet and upcoming neighborhood with a villagy vibe, 5 km from the center of Amsterdam. The location is between two stations for public transport: Sloterdijk station and station De Vlugtlaan, so the area is very well connected to everywhere in Amsterdam, but also to other parts of the Netherlands as you can take a train from Sloterdijk and reach even the most remote areas. Shops, restaurants and cafe's are close by. If you want any recommendations, let us know!

column10: The neighborhood was built in the early '50s under the architecture of a Dutch architect Van Eesteren. After WWll a lot of people needed houses, and this neighborhood was meant to solve the housing problem.  Nowadays, a lot of young families are buying the houses as it's very rare in Amsterdam to have an entire house with a garden in in the back and in front of the house. As almost everybody knows each other, there is a great sense of community and everybody will help one another out if there is a problem. It makes the neighborhood a safe, welcoming and happy place to stay for guests. In this part of Amsterdam you can visit the Van Eesteren museum and the street art museum. And don't forget to eat at the local restaurants, or have coffee in one of the local cafe's!
column11: The power sockets in the Netherlands may be different from the ones in your country. Please bring your own adapters as we don't have any for you.
column12: The house is situated between two stations for public transport: Sloterdijk station (trains, busses, metro and tram 12) and station De Vlugtlaan (busses, tram 7 and 14, metro), so the area is very well connected to everywhere in Amsterdam, but also to other parts of the Netherlands as you can take a train from Sloterdijk and reach even the most remote area.
column13: You can use the whole house and garden, except our office room on the first floor, and the shed in our garden.
column14: Our neighbor Nadia will welcome you and will be available for advise if you need anything.
column15: - no parties, smoking or drugs in the house - respect our neighbors: no loud music or other noises at night - there can be no other people in the house than the guests that are mentioned in the booking request. If there are more guests in the house, all fines from the community, which can mount to € 20.000, will be transferred to the person that made the booking - Should the owner or cohost find out there are unregistered guests in the house, additional fees of € 200 per extra guest will have to paid through Airbnb - leave the house nice and tidy. this will be mentioned in your review - if you break anything, let us know, so we can replace it for the next guests -
column25: We have been living in Amsterdam for about 7 years and moved into the current house 2 years ago. I am an anthropologist working in social services. My partner works for Amnesty International. We have a daughter of almost 6 years old. We like to cook, enjoy restaurants, music, ballet and travel (United States, Eastern Europe, Guatemala).

column6: Our house was built in the '20 as a shop. It's on the corner of a street with huge windows (a lot of light!). It is located in the family friendly area of Amsteldorp, a village-like neighbourhood within walking distance of Amstel train
column7: The front part of the house consists of a living room and open kitchen (with facilities such as microwave+oven and dishwasher) and the back part of the house has two big rooms for our children (of 1 and 4 years old). Our sons room is connected to a small, patio-like backyard. There is also a bathroom (with bathtub and separate shower) and a separate toilet. Downstairs there is a storage room with a washing machine and the master bedroom. This basement bedroom is connected in a mezzanine-like way with the living room, and therefore has access to natural light.

column10: Amsteldorp has the best of both worlds: on the one hand side it's a lovely, quiet, village-like neighbourhood with some of the best playing grounds of Amsterdam, green parks and within 15 minutes walking distance a shopping street (bookstore, clothing shops, a very popular ice-cream parlor, supermarkets, etc) - yet on the other hand you are within 7 minutes by subway in the bustling centre of Amsterdam and a short tram ride from the popular De Pijp neighbourhood and Museum quarter.
column11: Please note the sizes of our available beds: 1 baby cot, 1 single bed (sleeps our 4 y.o son but technically big enough for one adult) and 1 double bed. There's a spare mattress but it's not the most comfortable...
column12: It's a 7 minute walk from our house to Amstel station, where one can find trains (to all over the Netherlands - for example, it's only 20 minutes by train to Utrecht), as well as the subway, a bus station and taxis. There is also a bike-shop at the station where you can rent out bikes.  Our neighbourhood also has plenty parking spaces, yet it's paid (except for Sundays)
column13: Guests can access the whole house.

column15: No smoking inside the house, no pets and given the fact this is a quiet, residential area, no loud music/noise after 22:00. We think our house is best suited for families with (young) children.

column25:
Hi there!

My name is Saskia. Together with Wouter, I live  in this lovely appartement in Amsterdam. Both of us are teachers here, which means we share long summer holidays together. (Yeah!) We are bound for Africa this summer! A new continent for the both of us, so exciting times lay ahead... :)

A while ago, we had a really good experience with Airbnb in Rome. We had a warm welcome in a stylish appartment, just outside of the busy tourist centre, but close to all we wanted to see. We hope to give you exactly the same experience, with a warm welcome from the friendly hosts of Iamb&b, who will make sure you know everything you need to know about our place and our city!

This will also be the first summer that we will be renting out our house. We hope our guests will enjoy our fine place, our beautiful city and hopefully long, warm summer days...!

column5: Studio @ 30m from Vondelpark, 600m from Museum sq.
column6: Location, location and...location! The 3 most important criteria for your address in Amsterdam. The studio is cosy, quiet, located next to Vondelpark in a tranquil street, around the corner from cinema’s, restaurants and cafes. Leidse square and Museum square (Concertgebouw, 3 major museums) @ 600m. A tram stop @ 50 m serving 3 lines, for easy connections. The fully independent studio (25m2) has a private entrance, garden, espresso machine (whole beans incl), shower and toilet.
column7: Studio with fully automated espresso and cappuccino maker with complementary freshly ground coffee beans, tea, a double bed (very comfortable, hotel quality), cable TV, WiFi, small folding dinner table for two, closet with hangers, iron, iron board, bathroom with shower, complementary shampoo and soap, washbasin and toilet. The studio is not fit for children under the age of 12.

column10: The studio is very centrally located in a trendy neighborhood with lots of shops, cafe's, cinemas, live music venues, casino, theatres and restaurants. You will find the Vondelpark around the corner. The park is very popular for its outdoor café’s, monument status, picknick, jogging, tennis, and roller skate opportunities. The studio is within walking distance (5 minutes) from: 1) The Hallen with an art house cinema complex, restaurants and cafe's;  2) Leidse square with its nightlife, (outdoor) cafe's, cinema's, and its theatre's like Paradiso, Melkweg, de Balie, Stadsschouwburg, and Nieuwe de la Mar theatre; 3) Museum square with internationally famous museums like the van Gogh, Stedelijk museum, and Rijksmuseum, plus the Royal Concertgebouw; 4) PC Hooftstaat, van Baerlestraat and Cornelis Schuytstraat with an abundance of chique fashion boutiques and international brand stores. This is what Lonely Planet has to say about my neighbourhood: The action is revving up in this friendly, w
column11: If you stay 7 days or more, the apartment can be cleaned on Wednesdays during the day. The timing is in consultation with you.
column12: From the international airport Amsterdam (Schiphol) you are at the apartment in 10 minutes by taxi and in 25 minutes by public transport. There is a tram stop around the corner served by three lines. In 5 minutes you are in the center. If you come by car, Parkbee Overtoom is an underground parking garage at just 2 minutes walking distance from the apartment. The P+R Comeniusstraat (Station Lelylaan), is an affordable park and ride hub for visitors of Amsterdam. With tram line 1 there is a direct connection with the studio, 10 minutes from door to door.  Please check for details: ParkBee Overtoom or Q-park Comeniusstraat Amsterdam.

column5: Unique house with big sunny garden
column6: This house is located in a unique pittoresque little street with no tall buildings, in the upcoming De Baarsjes neighborhood, west of the center. There’s a big garden in the back with lots of sun until the evening. Perfect for couples or families.
column7: This house is located in a unique pittoresque little street without any tall buildings, in the upcoming De Baarsjes neighborhood, west of the center. There’s a big garden in the back with lots of sun until the evening. The house is in  the center of all the action, with both the Jordaan and the Vondelpark a 10- minute walk away.  Perfect for couples or families. Even though the area is getting more popular, one of the assets of this house is the quietness in the lush garden where you won’t notice you are actually in the middle of the city.  The street is quiet because it’s mostly used by cyclists. For guests with children: the house is in a kid-friendly area. column5: Cozy private room in Amsterdam - double bed
column6: Cozy private room with a comfy double bed in Old-West Amsterdam next to the trendy Food Hallen, 7 min biking to Leidseplein and 10 min by tram to Central Station. From Monday to Saturday we have the Ten Kate Street Market around the corner for a Dutch experience and the Kinkerstraat has everything you need any day, any time. You will also have access to kitchen, bathroom, balcony and a living room including TV. Two international girls will host you and give you the necessary tips to move around.
column8: Cozy private room with a comfy double bed in Old-West Amsterdam next to the trendy Food Hallen, 7 min biking to Leidseplein and 10 min by tram to Central Station. You will also have access to kitchen, bathroom, balcony and a living room including TV. Two international girls will host you and give you the necessary tips to move around. You will have access to the living room to chill in the couch or watch your series on Netflix, just so you feel like home. The kitchen with its utilities are also available so feel free to cook, we will always accept a bite of your cuisine ;) The Kitchen and the room have access to a balcony perfect for dinners & wine in the evening with the last rays of sun, enjoying a conversation and a Chardonnay. The apartment is located in Oude-West (Old West) of Amsterdam, exactly in the Kinkerbuurt. This
column10: The apartment is located in Oude-West (Old West) of Amsterdam, exactly in the Kinkerbuurt. This neighbourhood has become a boiler during the past two years, including every facility you need (plus) many of those nice and "gezellig" (cozy in Dutch) cafes that make Amsterdam. The street crossing our one, hosts everyday Monday to Saturday a street market where you can find everything: fresh baked bread, turkish dipping, fresh fruit and veggies, juices, and everything you can imagine. It is perfect for a fresh and healthy breakfast!! The Food Hallen is an open space with foods and drinks from all over the world where you can enjoy of some live music on the weekends and a great atmosphere. However, you MUST go to Waterkant: young and lively bar situated right next to the water. If you catch a sunny day in Amsterdam, make sure you run for a spot!
column12: The area has a great communication. you can walk to the city centre within 15 minutes, however, I still recommend to enjoy Amsterdam riding a bike. You can rent a bike for €10 a day right around the corner in Bellamystraat 10. If you are afraid of the two wheels, you can also take trams literally EVERYWHERE. From Kinkerstraat you can take tram 17 to the Dam square, (main square of Amsterdam) Westermarkt (Anne Frank House) and Central Station within 7-15 mins. Also you can take tram 7 and be in 4 minutes in the night most lively area of Amsterdam (Leidseplein) and all A'dam south and East.

The house is peacefull and quiet, the neighborhood is busy and lively!

Our house is peace full and quiet, the neighborhood is busy and lively!  Just PM me for further information

column10: Beautifull apartment located in a friendly and vibrant area; De Pijp. This is right in the heart of Amsterdam's "Quartier Latin" (de Pijp). Located close to the "Museumplein" (Van Gogh & Rijks Museums), "Heinekenplein" and Albert Cuyp market. Loads of very good restaurants, lunchrooms, boutiques and rooftop bars around the corner.  The best restaurants are on walking distance; Rijssel (make your reservations!), C, Reuring or Pekelharing. Supermarkets are around the corner and open till 21.00pm. get you breakfast there and enjoy the sun and peace on the terrace.   The 'Albert Cuyp' Market is at 5 minutes walking distance. Try here a herring with unions, a Dutch treat, or "poffertjes", a sweet Dutch treat.  Another 5 min. walk further is the Utrechtsestraat with its lovely shops like Labels, nice bars, good restaurants and other boutiques.  At a 10 minute walking distance, you can visit the Museum square, with its recently reopened 'Rijksmuseum', or Rembrandtsquare and Leidsesquare for d

column25:
We are a radiomaker/journalist and a filmmaker; we travel quite a lot, as you can see by various bits and pieces in our home. We love to take care of our garden, which we renovated a few years ago. We love cooking for our friends when we are here, and when the weather allows it, we serve it on our terrace. We have a cat, but we take him with us whenever we are not at home. 

Our main basis is in Rotterdam; the Amsterdam house is our second home (some people have a house in the south of France, we have one in the centre of Amsterdam:-) Whenever we are in Amsterdam, it feels a bit like a holliday. That is why we think it is good to share our place with others!

Without a pickup, the fastest way from Schiphol to the apartment is to take the train towards station Amsterdam Zuid (South) and transfer to tramline 4 and leave at stop Victorieplein. After that it's just a short 10 min walk to the apartment. From central station take tramline 4 and leave at stop Victorieplein. After that it's just a short 10 min walk to the apartment.
column13: You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others.
column14: Depending on your arrival we or one of our friends will provide access and show you around. Despite being on holiday, we will provide our mobile number so you can reach us in case you need us.
column15: Please don't trash the place, don't smoke inside or be loud at night. Other than that, enjoy as it is your own apartment.
column25:
Together with my girlfriend Eva I live in beautiful Amsterdam. I work in the IT industry as Business Development Manager, a job with the privilege to travel a lot. Besides my passion for travel, I like to work out (running and fitness). Also, during weekends I love going out in the city to my favourite restaurants and bars which I'll definitely share with you should you be my guest! 

We look forward to receiving you in our wonderful apartment and wish you a pleasant stay in Amsterdam.

B&E

column5: Tiny Inn - ecological bed, breakfast and bikes
column6: Welcome to my beautiful custom built, ecological and self-sufficient home the Tiny Inn.   Set in the stunning surroundings of rural Amsterdam the Tiny Inn is an absolute unique and hidden gem. It is the ultimate location for a romantic getaway, for nature lovers and adventurous city hoppers. DIY breakfast and two bikes are included! Also free parking is available. The house is set in the countryside which means there are rural inhabitants such as insects, flies, mosquitoes and spiders!
column7: The Tiny Inn has been built with love and care and with nature in mind. All the electrical equipment runs on self generated solar energy. There is a water free compost toilet and the water system has been designed so that you use 50% less water than usual without even noticing it. Furthermore the Tiny Inn has as much as possible been built with local and recycled wood.  The Tiny Inn is just 9 kms from Amsterdam Central Station. Combine the bustle of the city with a peaceful night sleep.  At the end of this page you will find an elaborate explanation on how to get there.  The fully equipped kitchen contains a mini fridge, two burner stove, sink and basic kitchen utensils. Everything for a delicious breakfast is in the house including organic tea and coffee.   The stylish bathroom is complete with shower and water free compost toilet. This toilet saves up to 13.000 liters of water per person per year. The ventilator of the toilet makes a low humming noise. The bathroom is stocked with th

column10: The Tiny Inn is situated in the front garden of a farm house overlooking the beautiful fields of Amsterdam. You find yourself in very peaceful rural surroundings where the noises of grazing sheep and an occasional tractor are your only noise diversions.  At this same spot there is a lovely resting point for hikers and bikers. U do not share any facilities with them.   This is the ultimate location for a romantic get away.  You will not find a better place to rest. There are various walking and cycling routes that take you through beautiful sceneries.  Canoes and electrical driven 'whisper boats' are for rent in the near vicinity and the bustling Amsterdam is at biking distance. Please note that the rural surroundings come with rural creatures like birds, cows,  insects and spiders.
column11: The house is set in a rural area which means there are rural inhabitants such as insects, flies mosquitoes and spiders fluttering around and also (sometimes)  in the house.  The bikes are suitable for people from 163 cm onwards.
column12: The Tiny Inn is just a stones throw away from Amsterdam central station. BIKE: It's about 30-40 minutes on bike to the city centre of Amsterdam on bike. Depending on whether you have Dutch biking legs.  BIKE AND TRAM In fifteen minutes you bike to tram 26 which takes you to central station in another fifteen minutes. PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Limited and time consuming!  You can take bus 392 from Central Station to Buiksloterplein. From there you will have to take a free public transport taxi. This taxi needs to be pre-ordered an hour in advance. For this you will need a day public transport ticket which you then need to register via phone and then you can book a public transport taxi. They have changed the system this year which makes it very difficult for you to get there. You have to download the app on (Website hidden by Airbnb) and buy a day ticket. As I said time consuming ! :(   Best thing is to take an uber cab from central station. (Costs are the same as two bus tickets). I will of co
column13: You have the house all to yourself including the direct front garden.
column14: I will be there to check you in and help you on your way. During your stay I can always be reached by phone as I do not live there.
column15: - Smoking is only permitted outside the house.  The location is situated in a peaceful area where people come to relax. Please take this into consideration. There are sheep in the garden please do not feed them.
column25:
Hiya, welcome to my profile! I am Annabelle from Amsterdam.

My life long passion has been the hospitality industry.  I am a chef and entrepreneur by profession. My latest adventure was building my tiny house.. an absolute wonderful project to do. 

I love good food, meeting new people, hiking, dancing, taking care of people.. I adore my friends and family. I believe that true kindness to oneself and others is the key to a happy world. 

Looking forward to meeting you soon!

column5: Idyllic, peaceful house + garden in trendy area!
column6: In a sunny, calm street in Amsterdam North we own a beautiful, cozy house with a green front & back garden. No city noises & exhaust fumes but singing birds & the smell of flowers. The city center is within 20 mins reach by bike & free ferry. Free parking! Ideal stay for a couple or young family. Our house and all appliances are for your use, including the garden. Closeby are the "Zaanse Schans", Volendam Twiske. Tell us a little bit about yourself and your travel goal prior to booking.
column7: The location of Tuindorp Oostzaan in Amsterdam North, 20 minute from the city centre, reachable by a lovely free ferry ride and even closer to the beautiful countryside, together with the ambiance in and around our house, make this spot quite unique.  (Please note last ferry to NDSM goed around midnight, after that you take another ferry +bike or uber) Here you get to unwind and relax after a busy day exploring the city buzz or nearby countryside. This will be your home away from home. We happily invite guests to enjoy all the good things in our house and garden. We expect you to respect our house, garden and cat like you would your own. There is a lovely garden table, chairs and, fire pot and BBQ to maximise the sunny hours in our garden. Or you might enjoy a relaxing soak in the lovely bathtub upstairs...We ask our guests to not leave any wet or hot items on our wooden kitchen countertops!!! This damages the wood and will require us to deduct from your deposit.
column8: In a sunny, calm street in Amsterdam North we own a beautiful, cozy house with a green front & back garden. No city noises & exhaust fumes but singing birds & the smell of flowers. This will be your home away from home. We happily invite
column10: Our neighbourhood (and especially our sunny street) have an exceptional village feel to them. This village connects the city centre to the North and adds to the typical North-Holland ambiance with nearby canals and the historical NDSM warf within walking distance. There you will also find the IJ Hallen, Europe's largest flee market.  Nature reserves Twiske and Ilperveld, as well as Waterland and world-famous Zaanse Schans, are just around the corner. On the other hand, you can reach the center of Amsterdam in under 20 minutes, either by bus or on your rental bicycle (riding the free ferry over the IJ just adds to the joy of living in North and we highly recommend this so that you will experience life as a true local! ) From the Central Station, you take the free ferry to NDSM. . If you have a bicycle, you follow the signs to Twiske. From Central Station you can also take bus 35 to Molenwijk. If you are travelling by car, you take exit S118 towards Tuindorp Oostzaan. Another option is t
column11: While we are away you will be kept company by our lovely red cat, Fela. He comes and goes as he pleases through the cat flap so he is completely independent and hardly any nuisance. Staying in our beautiful home will therefore need you to be a cat lover. You can keep him from going upstairs by simply closing living room door. We kindly ask you to feed Fela during your stay in our home which is reflected in the night rate. (Please note last ferry to NDSM goed around midnight, after that you take another ferry +bike or uber). If you book our house for the new years week, please note we do not allow any new years parties in the house not fireworks. Also we ask you to be aware that culturally the Dutch love their fireworks around new years, so please know that on New Years you will hear the fireworks most of the night!
column12: From the Central Station,  you take the underground metroline nr 52 to Noord and get off at Station Noord. This is the second stop.  At Station Noord you take the bus nr '36 Station Sloterdijk' and get off at Appelweg (12 stops in total). From there it's a 3 min walk to our house using your (Hidden by Airbnb) maps.  We recommend renting a bike during your stay to travel like a local comfortably from our house and around Amsterdam! (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Another option is to take the free ferry from Central Station direction NDSM (about 12 mins on the free ferry). From NDSM you can either rent a bike to get to our house or get an uber. Because most guests have luggage on arrival, they prefer the metro option or the uber option on day of arrival and then collect the rental bikes at NDSM next day.
column13: You enter via the front door in the hallway of the ground floor. This gives you access to the spacious and light living room of 35 m2 , open kitchen and back garden of 40m2. The stairs in the hallway gives access to the first floor with the very serene master bedroom right in front of you. The white kabinet in the master bedroom is for you to store your clothes. The room to the left is the babyroom and is not for the use of our guests. The master bedroom of 15 sqm has a high ceiling with beautiful exposed beams. The master bed is a kingsize 180 x 200 super comfy latex mattress on slats. Because the layout of the upstairs rooms is changing due to the small renovation we ar doing for the babyroom, we will update the new photos shortly. The bed and style of room is exactly the same though, so you can go ahead an book! When you come with 3 or 4 people, then the other guests sleep downstairs in the living room on the very comfortable Ikea Hemnes foldout couch (we bought this couch brand new
column14: As you will be renting the entire private house, we will not be around during your stay but we want to make sure that our guests are comfortable and enjoy their stay, not just in our house and garden, but in our city as well. We will be reachable during your stay and will leave you with some nice recommendations of things to see and do in the area.
column15: No smoking in the house Not suitable for pets No parties or events
column25: I am a Yoga teacher, Nature Coach and writer from Amsterdam. I love the outdoors, cooking organic meals, animals, travel and cozy places. In the city I like to explore coziness, art, music and people. I balance this with hiking preferably along the seaside or woods. My partner's name is Chun. He is a Math teacher.  We live together in a lovely house in Amsterdam which we also host on Airbnb when we are travelling together. We are a calm and neat couple and respect any place we stay as though it was our own!

Watch the stars at night or relax in the sun during the day, the possibilities are endless with this apartment.

column10: The apartment is located in 'West', the perfect place to spend your trip in Amsterdam. It's north of 'Vondelpark' which is a great place to have picnics, go for walks and perhaps have a cup of coffee or tea while enjoying the scenery. You'll also find that the 'Van Gogh Museum',' Rijks Museum' and the 'Stedelijk Museum' are very close by! If you want to have a great time out the 'Leidseplein' is nearby and is very popular with locals and tourists alike. If you want to go shopping while you're here for luxurious items, 'Pieter Cornelisz Hooftstraat' is a short distance away and is the epicenter of high-end luxury shopping here in Amsterdam
column11: Freshly made up beds with the finest quality linen & towels (1 per person) will be waiting for you upon arrival. We want to welcome you into a clean and cosy home!
column12: Walking distance from the apartment you fill find the stop for tram 17. This tram will take you directly to the CITY CENTER.
column13: You will have full access to the entire house. Make yourself at home!
column14: Feel free to contact us on Airbnb during your stay, if you have any questions about the apartment, or if you need any recommendations or tips on how to get around in the area and city. We're always happy to help. We are also able to meet up with you personally if desired. Just let us know and we will be there as soon as possible!
column15: We kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: - Please keep the noise down, especially when entering the complex. After all, you share the building with other people living there. All in all: we kindly ask you to respect your neighbours;  - Please do not accept any mail packages from the mail man, only the house owner is allowed to do so;  - We guarantee a clean house when checking in. When checking out, please leave the apartment closely to the same state as it was provided to you, in order to avoid double cleaning charges;  - No music after 22:00;  - Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited. The penalty is a fine up to €100,-  - No additional guests allowed without approval;  - Make sure to turn off the lights, heating and gas nozzle when it is not needed - respect the environment;  - No house parties;  - Please do not park your bikes directly in front of the apartment, but in a designated area only;  - Please be aware of the check i
column25:
We are Bart and Emilie. We live in our apartment with our two children (both boys) and a Jack Russel terrier.  We have been living here for nearly 9 years now, despite having planned for only 4 or 5 years. It’s because we really like the apartment itself with its light and practical interior and that it’s located in a quiet neighborhood yet very close to the city center. Dam square is only 10 minutes away by bike! Also, the area we are in is fast becoming a popular area of town with lots of nice cafés and restaurants that are not yet discovered by the masses. There are three parks within 5 minutes walking distance, but you could also stay home, open the folding doors off the living room and enjoy the sun on the roof terrace. Emilie tries to grow some herbs there, which you can use when cooking if you want. We have recently become hosts as we are planning to be away regularly on our sailing boat. While we are away enjoying the outdoors, we would like our home to be a comfortable base for you, from which to explore Amsterdam and its surroundings. 

We hope you feel as at home in our apartment as we do!

column5: Romantic Canalside Apt, Museum Distr. Top location
column6: Our romantic apartment is located in the best location in Amsterdam, the Museum Discrict. In this cultural heart of Amsterdam you’ll find everything Amsterdam has to offer within walking distance. The beautiful Van Gogh Museum, the world famous Rijksmuseum, the romantic canal district, the hip-and-happening “Pijp” district: it’s all one short walk away. The apartment is very stylish, offers a large balcony where you can enjoy your morning breakfast or a glass of wine in the evening.
column7: The apartment has recently been renovated and is equipped with lots of amenities to offer you a pleasant stay in Amsterdam. One master bedroom, a living room with dining area, a bathroom and a separate toilet. There’s also a sunny and fully equipped kitchen, free internet (WiFi) throughout the apartment, two TV’s, a toaster, kitchen appliances, Nespresso coffee, a traditional coffee maker, an oven and a dishwasher. Very conveniently, there’s also a full size washer and dryer for you to use. As true “Amsterdammers” we can honestly say that you’ll fall in love with the location and the neighborhood. We still enjoy it, every single day!

column10: The Museum District neighborhood combines the very best of Amsterdam. There’s no location in Amsterdam more pleasant and convenient to stay in.  You can explore the hip neighborhood “The Pijp” with its many cool bars, boutiques, concept stores and the well known Albert Cuyp market (1 minute walk) and the chic and posh Amsterdam Old South (actual location of the apartment) by foot. Furthermore, Amsterdam’s most famous museums and its Concert Hall are all within 5 minutes by foot from the apartment.  For shopaholics, the P.C. Hooftstraat is close by, a major shopping street offering high end fashion stores like Dior, Chanel, Louis Vuitton and Hermes. While visiting Amsterdam, you have to explore Amsterdams oldest park, the Vondelpark, which is within walking distance from the apartment. Also, the Leidseplein is minutes away, with its famous concert hall “Paradiso”, its movie theaters and clubs.
column11: The small print:  - Minimum stay 2 nights. - We don’t offer a baby kot.  - We can host maximum 2 guests. * 2020: There are road works in the street. There may be noise during the workdays, not in the weekend. To compensate, I offer you 2 free tickets for the Rijksmuseum where you can go unlimited within 5 minutes walking distance and a good price for your stay.  You still have the beautiful view over the canal and you will sleep quietly at the back of the house.
column12: All major tram lines stop near the apartment (2, 3, 5, 24) will bring you around Amsterdam very fast and easy.
column14: If you have any question, before, during or after your stay: just ask us and we’ll be happy to help you! We respond very quickly to any email or phone call.
column15: Strangers are not allowed into the apartments without our permission. - The trade or use of (soft)drugs and alcohol abuse are not permitted. - The apartment is a NON SMOKING area. Smoking inside in therefore prohibited. You may smoke outside on the balcony. - On the day of departure you have to check out before noon. - Any activity prohibited by the law is forbidden. - We accept no responsibility for any loss, accident, personal injury, medical expenses or property damage caused by personal negligence or by any other circumstances beyond our control. - Please be respectful after 10 PM,  especially in the corridor and on the balcony.

The apartment is located at the second floor. The bathroom is simple but functional, with a comfortable shower and a washing stand. Towels and linen will be provided for.

column10: The old maritime neighbourhood is a less touristy/more peaceful area of the city center. The area consist of lots of authentic canal houses and is very open, with lots of sunlight and canals. The maritime museum is just around the corner and there are many nice restaurants and cafes around. A beer brewery called 't IJ' located in an old windmill is at the end of the canal. The center is about 5 minutes by bike or a 15 minute walk form the apartment.
column12: There is a bus stop right in front of the apartment, bus 22 will bring you to the central station in 5 minutes. However, I would suggest to rent a bicycle or walk your way around the city, it is a beautiful walk from the apartment to the city center.

column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column14: Uiteraard ben ik beschikbaar om een en ander aan te bevelen of uit te leggen.  Volledige wens tot privacy wordt zeker ook gerespecteerd voor zover dat mogelijk is. Wees een beetje gezellig heb aandacht voor je omgeving  Ik zelf houd van mijn privacy en af en toe gezellig even wat bijkletsen, vind ik ook heel fijn.  We houden rekening met elkaar en respecteren de weinige regels die ik heb. Schoenen beneden. Deur voor de kat openlaten. Als je langer dan een week blijft mag je zelf je bed afhalen. Ik maak het op. Kom je s nachts thuis, stil graag en alle lichten weer uit doen. Etensresten en vuile  vaat eind van de dag naar beneden brengen.  Na het douchen, tot 23.30, de deur afnemen  met een wisser. Energiegebruik naar alle redelijkheid als het te veel wordt, ga ik er wel wat van zeggen. Meestal hoef ik niks te zeggen loopt alles vanzelf en hebben mensen net zoveel liefde voor mijn plek als ikzelf. Wij zijn heel vriendelijk  maar dat wil niet zeggen dat je steeds meer ruimte in kan nemen
column15: Gelieve geen extra gasten uit nodigen. Hond en kat aanwezig. Onze hond komt alleen op de benedenverdieping. Niet roken, no where! No drugs! Hond in overleg mogelijk toegestaan. Badkamerdeur na gebruik open voor de kat. Schoenen beneden uit. Douche deur afnemen met wisser na gebruik. Na 23.00 niet meer douchen tenzij in overleg goedbevonden en gelieve te fluisteren in ieder geval zachtjes te praten.  Denk aan de andere gasten en onze buren alsjeblieft.

column7: We're sure you will love this place! Our home is a 80 m2 spacious appartment with two balconies. If you stay here with children, we have plenty of toys, books and movies that your kids can enjoy and play with. Fully equipped kitchen with gas stove, oven, dishwasher, slow juicer, espresso coffee machine (Jura Classic 100), watercooker, fridge and freezer, all amenities. Both washing machine and dryer are at your service on the upper floor level. The bathroom has a walk-in shower, the toilet is separate. Central heating, dubble glas windows. The apartment is in a quiet one-way street and in the heart of a vibrant, yet very liveable neighbourhood with beautiful cafés, specialist food stores (culinary & ethnic), clubs and restaurants. The nearest bakery and supermarket are just 150 m away. Two beautiful parks and lots of playgrounds are within short walking distance.

column10: Amsterdam De Pijp Just a short tram ride south of Centraal Station takes you into one of the most cosmopolitan and vibrant districts of Amsterdam.  For the eternally inquisitive, many will try to second-guess what de Pijp stands for but the truth is, no one really knows. Perhaps it owes its name to the long narrow streets that resemble pipes or to the infamous gas company, the ‘Pipe’, which used to supply energy to the area. Whoever or whatever is responsible for the name should be proud of the association. Formerly a working class quarter built to ease the overpopulated Jordaan in the 19 th century and to house labourers, de Pijp as we Amsterdammers know it today is without doubt a melting pot of cultures and nationalities. Thanks to previous settlers such as Heijermans, De Haan, Bordewijk, Mondriaan and scores of students in search of a cheap room to rent, de Pijp continues to breathe life as the lively bohemian district known as the Quartier Latin (Latin Quarter). column10: This apartment is located near the City center! Short distance from all important attractions. It only takes 12 minutes to reach Dam Square and main shopping street of city 'Kalverstraat'. There you can find all the stores of the main shopping brands! The popular 'Anne Frank' House is only 15 minutes away in the Historical 'Jordaan' district. In this area you can also enjoy the cafe's and bars while enjoying the wonderful view of boats passing in the canals. Within 16 minutes you will be able to reach the '9 straatje' district. This area is known for its unique shopping boutiques and cozy Cafe's. Only 15 minutes from the apartment, you will be able to reach the Leidseplein. Here you will a find various restaurants and cafes to relax and enjoy the iconic canals of Amsterdam!. At the 'Leidseplein' you can enjoy a nice coffee at the cafe's or a cocktail at clubs surrounding the square. In other words, this apartment is perfect for your stay in Amsterdam!

Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein fea
column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column6: This newly renovated  heritage apartment is located on 'Prinseneiland'  - considered the most beautiful neighbourhood of central Amsterdam. 15 minute walk to Central Station, close to shops, the historic Jordaan and Westerpark. Can host up to 6 people (Families Highly Preferred). Built in 1628 the apartment features the original wooden beams & pillars alongside a brand new modern kitchen and comfortable rooms. Also enjoys access to a beautiful canal side garden.
column7: Here's our latest review from Anton who visited with 5 guests from Sweden. "Fantastic apartment in a fantastic area. So peaceful and relaxing atmosphere on the small island, but only a 5 minute walk to Amsterdam's city center nicest neighborhoods. The apartment was really nice and all the necessities were provided. We slept 5 adults and had no problems with the crowds and all could sleep well. Smooth and flexible check-in and easy-out. 5/5 I would recommend anyone who visits Amsterdam Robins accommodation. "

column7: The apartment is on the second floor in a four story, 100 year old building. It's located in a quiet street opposite the backside of an historic building (once a prison), which gives a nice open view and privacy.  Once inside you enter the living space with large couch and dinner table, television, art and books, a small kitchen equipped with everything you need, and a nice balcony on the sunny side.  The bedroom is in the back of the apartment, which looks over the neighboors gardens and is very quiet. There is a supercomfortable bed (1,60m by 2m) and large closet where you can store clothes etcetera, and a door to the second balcony.  Next to these two rooms there is a modern bathroom with shower and sink. In the aparment you will find: - Towels - Bedding - Shampoo and conditioner - Espresso machine with milksteamer - Kettle - Oven - Washing machine - Hair dryer - Tv with international channels - WIFI  - Insider tips for Amsterdam

It almost seems that a new hotspot pops up almost every day in this neighbourhood. It's nearby the ci
column10: Amsterdam East is one of the upcoming or so called hipster neighbourhoods in Amsterdam! It almost seems that a new hotspot pops up almost every day in this neighbourhood. It's nearby the city centre, but has such a different vibe. A drink at the rooftop of The Volkshotel is a must to enjoy the stunning views over Amsterdam! When it comes to restaurants there is something for everyone. From trendy coffee bars, industrial warehouses, cocktail bars to concept stores! The Czaar Peter Street and the Javastraat are some of the best shopping streets on the East side of town. All kinds of trendy shops can be found here. On a sunny day it's definitely a must to visit Roest for a drink on the waterfront. If you want the local feel and multi-culti then stroll over the Dappermarket or wander around the Oosterpark. The renewed Beukenplein is perfect for a drink afterwards!  For some inspiration what to do, have a look at:  www[dot]yourlittleblackbook[dot]me/cityguide/amsterdam/amsterdam-east/

Our back yard has a few hours of afternoon sun, and on warm summer evenings lends itself well for barbecuing.  The basement is mainly a play room for the children, but also has a bed.

The Jumbo super market offers all basics, the stores on the Zeilstraat pretty much all the rest. On the Amstelveenseweg you will find plenty of restaurants to choose from. In the other direction, the Cornelis Schuytstraat has a reputation for upmarket shopping.

column25:
I am a self employed consultant, husband and father of 4 children. 
Next to my family, my two big passions are wine and chess.  Give me a chess board and a good glass of wine, and life is perfect. Next to that, I love to travel, read, cycle, ski.
Having lived in various other places across the Netherlands, I landed in Amsterdam almost 30 years ago. It felt like coming home. I love this city, a true global village: small but cosmopolitan. It's got fantastic architecture, a rich cultural life, amazing places to eat and drink. And I love its tolerance: as long as you don't hurt and respect others, you can be who you want to be, and live how you want to live.

column5: Beautiful & comfortable apartment next to Amstel!
column6: Beautiful and comfortable apartment next to the Amstel river. The apartment can host comfortably 2 people in the bedroom's queen size bed and it's ensuite bathroom. One more guest can be comfortably sleep in the living room occupying the sofa-bed. The kitchen is fully equipped and it includes premium tableware. As long as Amsterdam's weather permits, the guest can make use of the apartment's small balcony but also it's private roof-terrace, on top of it.
column7: This is my house, where I live every day as a bachelor Amsterdam-er. In case you find it available in my AirBnB calendar and you book it, you will probably meet me when you check-in, as I will be heading for a weekend or a small vacation during your stay. You will have my personal space at your disposal, using my personal kitchen equipment, tableware, linen, bath towels etc. I like to treat my guests luxuriously as I treat myself. So let me introduce you to my house... The apartment is part of an early 20th century building (approx. 1910) of typical Amsterdam architecture. It is a small apartment of 40sq.m that it has been recently fully renovated a with high quality materials, including a wooden oak floor, double glassed windows, Italian tiles in the bathroom/wc, white lacquered cabinets and stone counter in the kitchen etc. It has been furnished with known designer's furniture from the premium manufacturers and minimally decorated. The kitchen is fully equipped with excellent quality

column5: VanGogh room-15 mins from centre in green suburb!
column6: My place is close to Amsterdam Sloterdijk train station, tram stops, many shops, local restaurants, and parks. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers,  and in particular is popular with people relocating to Amsterdam or coming for internships/courses.  Also - parking is free evenings and weekends - unique in Amsterdam. Note: the room and bathroom were renovated in January so everything is fresh and clean, with new furniture!
column7: A big semi-detached house in Amsterdam West is an oasis of rest located in a green area with everything you want to visit nearby!   It is a three floor house, with 2 Air BnB rooms and the shared bathroom (shared between the Air BnB guests and my housemate) located on the first floor.  I have my own bathroom.  The room is furnished with a single bed (can also convert to a double although this makes the room extra 'cosy' :-) ), wardrobe, lamp, laptop table and chair, and a rug. Bedding, towels, coffee maker and hairdryer are provided in the room. You may use the washing machine, iron and ironing board. You may also use the shared kitchen/dining area. The kitchen is shared with the other Air BnB room and my housemate. I have my own separate kitchen. I have 2 dogs and 1 cat who are not allowed in the guest rooms but you will hear some barking and possibly meowing during the day (at night they also sleep).

column10: The house is in a quiet and residential part of Amsterdam yet the heart of the city can be reached by bus, tram, train, bike or car in 15 mins. Near the house there are fast food (chinese, pizza, fried chicken, kebab) and turkish restaurants, shops (including supermarkets and, drugstores) and parks. You can walk to beautiful parks such as Westerpark and Sloterpas in 20 minutes as well as smaller local parks in less than 5 minutes.
column12: The house is located 15 min by public transport to the city centre. Walking distance 3 min to tram (no.7) and bus (no. 21) and  5 minutes walk to metro (no.50, 51), 10 min to train station Amsterdam Sloterdijk (e.g. travel time to centre only 6 min or to airport only 15min ) - hence perfectly connected. Driving time to Amsterdam ring, approx 2 minutes.
column13: Check in 6 - 10pm weekdays, 1-8pm on Saturday and Sunday .  Check out by 11am Sorry, it is not possible to leave luggage before and after the official check in and check out times respectively. WIFI is available for guests. Also to note - my Air BnB is a side venture and I work full time. As such I do not have a lot of time to interact with guests and cannot act as a travel guide. I provide maps and directions in the room of how to get to the nearest bus, tram, metro and train stations, and which numbers to take. I also provide the details of travel websites (in english!) so you can plan your routes. Of course I am always available in emergencies!
column14: My Air BnB is a side venture on top of my normal work. As such I do not have a lot of time to interact with guests and cannot act as a travel guide. column15: 1.No smoking anywhere in the house. 2. No drugs of any kind allowed in the house (both hard and soft drugs). This is mainly to avoid accidents with the dogs and cat, so please do respect this, thank you. 3. The house dogs are not allowed in the guest rooms - please keep your door shut and please do not leave your possessions, especially clothes, bags, shoes etc, in the passage ways or by the front door as one of my dogs likes to chew things!  4. No parties, no guests other than those confirmed in the reservation. If you wish to have a guest stay the night (maximum occupancy 2 people per bedroom) this may be possible if you ask me in advance, at the rate of EUR 20 per night. 5. Please be respectful of other guests - be quiet after 9pm. 6. Please keep communal bathroom and kitchen clean and tidy. 7. Please follow all guidance from the dutch government in relation to COVID-19, including social distancing measures.
column25: I'm an english expat who has been living in Amsterdam on and off since 2002. I love the city and enjoy hosting visitors. I work in finance as a freelancer so my work projects keep me pretty busy, though I try to enjoy some time off in-between too!  I'm a massive animal lover, in particular dogs, and I also enjoy nature, fitness, good wines, discovering new vegan restaurants, and live music.
