column7: If you want to have a real Amsterdam experience, enjoy this beautifully furnished apartment in the centrally located 'Pijp’-district. The Pijp district is a lively mixture of cultures, food, shops and sights. It is home to Sarphatipark and a host of cafes, restaurants, entertainment venues and hotels. The famous Rijksmuseum, Van Goghmuseum, Stedelijk Museum, Albert Cuyp Market and the Heineken Experience can be found around the corner. The area is just south of Amsterdam's main canal ring, and offers easy access to main city sights, which are only minutes away. The house is perfectly located, in front of a tram stop and surrounded by shops, restaurants and places to have a good cup of coffee! Situated on the Heineken square, this 50m2 apartment sits on the first floor of an apartment complex. column25: We are a family of five, Andrea, Mark and three children. Andrea is a professional painter. Mark is a writer/filmmaker who paints houses to earn some regular income. Our oldest daughter spent last year as a volunteer for Teach for India and will start university in Berlin in August. Our second daughter studies at UWC-SEA in Singapore. Our son attends secondary school in Amsterdam. Having two eager birds who left the nest at a very young age means that during the year and during most of the holidays we are just the three of us. It is for this reason that we welcome guests from time to time to use a part of our home (the first floor apartment of the building where we live). We ourselves live in the second floor apartment.

column5: Cosy apartment in 'De Pijp', close to the centre!
column6: This great apartment is located in 'De Pijp'. This is the perfect area to live like  a local in Amsterdam. You are outside the busy city centre but not to far away. It is, with the bike or public transport, just 5 to 10 minutes away from the heart of the centre. There is a beautiful park next to you where you can relax in the summer, Sarphatipark. One of the biggest outdoor markets of the country is also located in De Pijp, the Albert Cuypmarket and it is also close to the Heineken Experience.
column7: My apartment is your home away from home, a cosy and warm place where you can enjoy Amsterdam like a true local. The wooden table in the living room is perfect to read a morning newspaper, enjoy your dinner or even to get some work done. The bedroom is spacious and gives you access to the balcony (maybe to have your breakfast in the morning?).  Because I love to cook, my kitchen is fully equipped and perfect to prepare you meal, get a cup of coffee or tea.

column10: De Pijp is vibrant and very much on its way up. As can be expected of an area that is centred on the nation’s most famous outdoor market: Albert Cuypmarkt, near to the Heineken brewery. This Amsterdam neighbourhood is famously diverse with over 100 nationalities represented. While still the best neighbourhood to choose from a wide selection of ethnic food, more high-end bars and restaurants have come on the scene to service students and young professionals. Further east along De Pijp there is the Van Woustraat, with several of the city’s more highly regarded restaurants. But perhaps most representative of the area is Bazar, a former church on the Albert Cuypmarkt that has been reinvented as a funky North African café/restaurant.  A lot of breakfast, lunch and dining places are just around the corner.  From italian, french, indian and thai to 1-michelin star restaurants (located in the same street: Ceintuurbaan), healthy juice bars (The Juice Brothers) and pubs and bars! All on a 5 to 1
column11: Normal check-in and check-out times: Check-out  11:00 am. Check-in  before 20:00 pm (On the 24th of december the check-in will be before 17:00 pm) Check in after 20:00 is possible but it costs an additional of 20,- euro. After 0:00, I ask an additional 50 euro For other in- and check-out times please contact me or Stan. Other important notes: - Please don't use the washing machine and dryer (both located in the kitchen) at the same time.  - You can leave the trash bag from the bin only outside on mondays and thursdays after 19.00 pm.
column12: Central Station - 4km Dam - 3km Public transport nearby: 1 minute walking distance.
column13: You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others.
column14: Depending on the arrivaI time, myself or a Stan (host) will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and give you some must-see and restaurant tips in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance.
column15: Please don't trash the place, don't smoke inside or be loud at night. Other than that, enjoy it as your own apartment! Please be aware of the following: - Only put the trash outside on the appointed times and days (I will inform you on your arrival) - Always lock the door with the key (even if you are inside) & make sure the front door downstairs is closed. - Take into account the neighbors
column25:
Hi! I am Rosa, I love my city Amsterdam, because there is always something to do. I have a passion for sports and nutrition. Furthermore I love to go dancing, trying out new hotspots and drinking wine with friends. If you want to, I will share my favorite places and things to do in Amsterdam!

My apartment is just like me: welcoming & sharing inspiration. It is a mix & match of the places I have visited and the people i've met. I traveled a lot and I've been to South Africa, Colombia, Peru, Costa Rica, Thailand, Indonesia, North America and through Europe. But I still love coming home in this apartment and just relax!

column6: Beautiful spacious apartment in one of the most pleasant parts of Amsterdam, very close to the Oosterpark and park Frankendael. A variety of restaurants, cafes and shops are around the corner. The apartment does perfectly fit a family with two younger kids or a couple.
column7: The apartment is situated on the 2nd en 3th floor of an apartment building. The living area has a large sofa and a lounge chair. There is an open kitchen which is fully equipped and free for you to use. Next to the kitchen you will find a large dining table. On the 2nd floor you will also find a separate toilet. The bedrooms are situated on the 3th floor. The master bedroom had a double bed. There is one bedroom with a toddler bed and a bedroom with a baby bed. The bathroom is also situated on the 3th floor. The rooftop terrace is accessible through a staircase on the 3th floor.

column10: Lively neighbourhood, developing rapidly. Many new, fancy restaurants can be found in this area, incl small, fashionable stores. Close by are Brewery 't IJ, where you can drink craft beer and have a guided tour. Also the Tropenmuseum is just around the corner. The world famous Dappermarkt is the place where you can buy cheap vegetables and experience the true Amsterdam.
column11: Because of building regulations we can not accept groups of more then two adults. So only couples or a family with kids.
column12: Easy accessible by car and public transport: - Public transport: 10 minutes walking of train station Amsterdam Muiderpoort, which is only 30 minutes by direct train connection from Amsterdam Schiphol airport. - Car: P&R Zeeburg is close by, where you can park for only 1 EUR a day. Important to know is that cheap rate is only applicable if you take the tram to the centre.

If you need anything during your stay, they will available for questions so don't hesitate to ask at any time!

The large living room, three balconies and jacuzzi offer everything for a relaxing stay in A'dam. Suitable for 2 adults (plus 1 child). A city park and tourist attractions are closely located, and there's a good connection to all public transport (bus, metro, tram within 5 min. walking distance). Several restaurants, coffeebars, supermarkets in neighbourhood.

column6: We are so happy to have bought this 80 m2 ground floor apartment last Summer. Recently renovated,
column7: Our spacious (80m2), charming ground floor apartment epitomises the perfect recipe for a stay in Amsterdam: the intimacy of your own home combined with the luxury of Airbnb's finest. The apartment's unique location (5min walk from Jordaan & Leidseplein), canal view, garden, and cosy atmosphere will make you feel at home instantly.  Upon entering the apartment, you directly enter the charming, spacious living room with 2.83m high ceilings. Due to the high ceilings and the large windows, the apartment is particularly light and spacious. On the backside of the house, the fully equipped kitchen offers the opportunity to prepare breakfast, lunch and/or dinner at home while staying in Amsterdam. The dining area has French doors, leading into the balcony and our lovely city-center garden. The front side of the house gets good morning sun - we love to sit outside with a cup of coffee and breakfast on lazy weekend mornings. The garden is sunny in the afternoon, until 5:30 PM. We´ve spent endles
column8: We are so happy to have bought this 80 m2 ground floor apartment last Summer. Recently renovated,
column10: Our lovely apartment overlooks the "Da Costakade", a quaint Amsterdam canal full of life, providing the seclusion for those who want it yet busy enough for you to watch the world go by. The apartment is located in the heart of Amsterdam, at just a 5 minute walk from famous neighbourhood the Jordaan & Leidseplein, one of the city's major nightlife and dining areas. At just a 2 minute walk you will find "The Hallen", a tremendously popular indoor food market, comparable to Borough Market in London and Chelsea market in New York.  There's 2 supermarkets at just 1 min walking distance. Just across the canal there is a terrific breakfast/coffee/lunch bar, called DeFour. They also have great take-away meals. The De Clercqstraat, at a 1 minute walk, is full of fantastic cafés and restaurants. For shopping, we highly recommend the unique boutique stores in the "Nine Strees".  Of course, we're most willing to provide you with more tips and tricks to get the most out of your stay in Amsterdam!
column11: Check-out before 11 AM, check-in after 3PM.
column12: The location is very well connected to all four corners of the city. You can take a number of trams for your convenience (we are at a 1 minute walk to tram 17 , directly connected to Amsterdam Central Station) or you can be a real "Amsterdammer" and rent a bike around the corner! Should you wish to come by car: the parking rate in our neighbourhood is €3 per hour. On Sundays, parking is free.
column13: The entire apartment is all yours, except for the second bedroom, in which we tend to keep our mess, to make sure the rest of the apartment is perfectly neat :).
column14: Eline's brother or one of her close friends living nearby will be your host. We love to provide you with personal advice prior to your stay; should you need help with anything however, you can always contact your host!
column15: No smoking, no drugs, no loud music, no parties & no pets.
column25: Profound lover of music, nature, friends. Tech entrepreneur (founder Plugify), married to Willem, mother of Mélanie (2018)

column5: Apartment with spacious sunny balcony next to park
column6: Comfortabel, 54 m2, apartment with spacious, sunny balcony situated in Amsterdam West. The place is located just 10 mins (bus/bike) from the city centre. Located next to Westerpark where you can unwind or entertain yourself all day and all night long. The area has great restaurants and bars to offer. You can also find a bakery, movie theater and even a brewery. Festivals are being organised here all year long but don't worry these are not next door so you'll sleep like a baby.
column7: My cozy apartment is my sanctuary. As a creative individual I like my place to be breathe creativity too. I collect art and nice little thingies I find during trips I make. If you're into design and art I assume you'll like my little gallery and my humble collection of art and illustration books. Feel free to check them out!  There's plenty of daylight and you'll love the spacious balcony on the sunny side where you will spot a traditional old Dutch mill.   Cooking is one of my favourite activities and you'll feel at home at my kitchen that has, for apartment understandings, a big counter made out of concrete, how cool is that? Located 10-15 mins outside the actual hearth of Amsterdam makes this is the perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

column10: What makes the place unique is that the area is really calm and green. Westerpark is great for morning strolls. It's hard to find a place in Amsterdam where you can find calmness that's relatively close to the city centre.
column11: There's a supermarket and good breakfast / coffee places within a 5 min walk.  My neighbours are families and very quiet people. This is not be a party-apartment. But there's plenty of places to party in this area if that's what you're looking for.
column12: There's a bus stop in front of the door (30 sec walk) that will take you directly to the city centre.  Several tram stops are located 5 / 10 mins walk from the apartment.
column13: The living, kitchen, bathroom and balcony. You'll enter the hallway using the general apartment door and the place is on the 4th floor. There's no elevator.
column14: Needs specific tips or have any needs? Just ask. Amsterdam has so much to offer that it's hard to recommend things.
column15: - Respect my apartment and my neighbours. It's not a party apartment and the neighbours downstairs have a little boy. - You have to make or get your own breakfast but I've all the cooking, tea and coffee / espresso necessities you need. - No drugs and no smoking!
column25: Living the good live in Amsterdam. Love good food, good company, practising sports and visiting sport events. Running my one-man company in the creative industry

I will stay at my own private room so you will hardly notice I am there.  Nearby shops, restaurants, Albert Cuyp market, famous museums, Amstel river where the locals picknick and swim. Love living here. Enjoy the treasures of Amsterdam!
column7: Spacious house with sunny balcony. Perfect for a couple or a family visiting Amsterdam! There is a private room available and a great sofa for 2 persons or a comfy matras at the floor in a separate room if required (but let me know in advance so I can arrange it).  The place is  nearby shops, railwaystation, metro,  restaurants, Canvas, Albert Cuypmarket, Dappermarket, Museums (Rijksmuseum, Hermitage, House of Rembrandt, van Gogh), Amstel river where the locals picknick and swim. Parks and playground on a walking distance. Metro and a train station are at walking distance, but try to rent a bike, the best experience you will get: biking in Amsterdam ;-)! At a 15 minute walking distance  you can rent bikes.  Love living here in a quiet street but nearby the treasures of Amsterdam!

column10: Nearby the Amstel river (where you can picknick and swim like the locals do). Shops, café's, museums and restaurants are at walking distance. Located between two famous markets: Albert Cuyp and the Dappermarkt. Close to park and playground. Enjoy all of Amsterdam and espacially this part of the city.
column12: It's a 5 minutes ride to the Central Station by metro. It's a 3 minute walk to the house from the (metro) subway. You can rent bikes at 15 minutes walking distance.
column13: I will be staying in the apartment, but working day times. You will hardly notice  I am there. However when you have questions  or need something I am nearby to help. If you rather want to stay at a separate room, it can be arranged but it will be a comfy  matras at the floor. Just let me know if required.... looking forward meeting you :) .
column14: In case you need something or have questions I am just a text away. I can recommend some places where you can dance or enjoy live bands, enjoy nature or just let me know and I'll try to arrange it...
column15: Well this is Amsterdam but No drugs in the house please. Smoking is only allowed at the balcony.  You may play the piano, but do not play the piano between 9.00pm (21.00) and 10am.  Because my daughter is allergic, there are no animals allowed. Please be respectfull to the house and the neighbours!  Enjoy your stay!

column6: Restaurants, shops, the Vondelpark (5min walk) and the Citycentre very close. Museum area 10 min walk! A great space for your family holiday. We have everything your need for kids / stairgate!  A lovely place to experience Amsterdam as a 'local'!
column7: This house is really suitable for a family with children that want to explore Amsterdam. Also if you want to dine at home, and make your own meals this is the perfect place. You can have your morning coffee in the sun of your patio garden before you go and visit e.g. musea or shops! The musea and shopping areas are close and if you like walking, you can do a lot just by foot!

We have everything your need for kids / stairgate!  A lovely place to experience Amsterdam as a 'local'! This house is really suitable for a family with children that want to explore Amsterdam. Also if you want to dine at home, and make your own meals this is the perfect place. You can have your morning coffee in the sun of your patio garden before you go and visit e.g. musea or shops! column10: A village in the City, that's how I would discribe my neighbourhood. It offers everything you need, shops, cafe's, great restaurants, the park where we often start our day running. It's perfect to discover the city and all it has to offer and come back in this charming area to relax after a inspiring day. The Helmersbuurt is a great combination of family's with children, Yup'en, elderly people that live here for a long time.
column11: Be aware, this feels like a village, but it is a big city. Don't let your guard down to much, plse lock doors when you leave the house. Even if it is for a short period. In Amsterdam there are also very clever people how just walk into houses to get your ipad or iphone. So, be vigilant!
column12: If you like to walk, you can reach a lot from our house just by walking. But off course you can rent bikes and cars in the area, use trams,taxis, metros and the railway to areas outside Amsterdam. We will be happy to inform you about the possibilities, and we will leave instructions.
column13: You can use the complete house, we will not lock any rooms but will use the closets to stow personal stuff.
column14: Our priority is to give you a good feeling about the house and how to use it. For questions, we are always available.
column15: We live in this neighborhood with respect for our fellow Amsterdammers. We consider others when doing things that may cause some disturbance. And we ask that you do this when you stay here. Follow our guide for the house and you will find comfort in everything you do. Plse don't smoke in the house.
column25:
Hola, Hello, Bonjour!

My name is Kim and I live here with my husband and 2 kids in the popular Helmersbuurt near the museum area. We love running in the Vondelpark and often start our days in the weekend runnning!
We enjoy the restaurants, the playgrounds for kids and activities in the city, and hope you will to if you visit Amsterdam.
Plse feel free to contact us for any questions you may have about the house, the area or anything else.

column10: The apartment is located to the east of the city centre in a quiet, typical Amsterdam neighbourhood. Amsterdam's historic centre is less than 15 minutes away by bike, bus or tram. This area offers a number of café-restaurants and shares the premises with a number of interesting neighbours, which means that there's always plenty to do if you stay here! How about a drink at the city beach of Roest? A nice walk in either the Flevopark or Oosterpark? Or do you fancy a visit to the Tropenmuseum? Amsterdam Eastside has it all! You'll find an inspiring booklet with tips and tricks if you'll book my apartment. In this way you'll explore Amsterdam beyond the boundaries of regular tourism.
column12: Getting around is easy with a number of possibilities. From this apartment you have access to several tramlines, buses and a train station. Do you prefer a bike (recommended!)? Rent your bikes at the corner of the street! A city map is available.

column10: Oud-West is the city's snug living room. Quiet, beautiful residential areas alternate with bustling shopping streets. This is an area where Amsterdam residents from all walks of life live alongside one another in fraternal harmony. Here, you'll find street markets, cafes, restaurants, parks, museums, canals, as well as elegant mansions, cultural meeting points and great terraces. Relaxing The streets between the Vondelpark and the Overtoom are perfect areas for a stroll. Walk past ancient trees, grand 19th-century buildings and the Vondelkerk. The Zevenlandenhuizen (Seven Countries Houses) in the Roemer Visscherstraat from 1894 are a surprise; each house in the row represents an architectural style from another European country. In this part of Oud-West you will also find the Hollandsche Manege, the oldest riding school in the Netherlands. Horse riding lessons are given every day in this stylish building from 1882, but you can also go by to take a peek. Culinary enjoyment There is plen
column12: Public transport is super convenient, with the tram stop called 'Jan Pieter Heijestraat' located only 20 meters from the front door. Tram 1 departs every 5 minutes and will take you to the centre in 5 mins, and central station in 12. The cost is flat rate for public transport in Amsterdam is€2.80, valid for 1 hour. Unless you have an OV Chip card and then public transport is about half the price (depending on the distance of your trip). It could be worth buying one from any Train station or Schiphol Airport for €7.50. I would instead recommend renting a bicycle and exploring the city like a local. You can rent bikes for less than €10 a day from multiple bike rental shops within 5 mins walk from the apartment. Ask me, I might have a spare bike of you to borrow. You can also reach the airport in less than 30mins with public transport via the tram and then train.
column13: The entire apartment is yours to make yourself at home. The bedroom includes very comfortable king sized bed (180x200cm), the larger bedroom is 16m2 with french doors to a large balcony. Big bathroom with bathtub, washing machine, dryer, toilet, large comfortable living room, fully equipped kitchen, and fast wireless internet.

Enjoy your stay!

column12: Tram 17 The nearest tram stop is a one minute walk at the crossing Postjesweg/Hoofdweg (on the bridge). Here you can take tram 17 in the direction of Central Station. This line brings you to  Ten Katestraat: De Hallen, an indoor food hall with dozens of stalls  Elandsgracht, Marnixstraat and Westermarkt: the Jordaan neighborhood  Westermarkt: Anne Frank house  De Dam: Royal Palace, Nieuwe Kerk, National Monument, Madame Tussaud’s museum, Kalverstraat (most famous shopping street) and at walking distance the red light district “De Wallen” From the same tram stop as above you can take tram 17 in the other direction (direction Osdorp Dijkgraafplein) and this will take you to Amsterdam Lelylaan train station were six trains per hour will bring you to Schiphol Airport within five minutes.
column13: Appartment contains: - dish washer - micro wave / oven - fridge - freezer - washing machine / dryer - large TV - highspeed wifi (40 Mbit/s) - hifi

column10: Neighborhood 'De Baarsjes' is a very a lively part of the Old West in Amsterdam. It has everything to offer with nice cosy restaurants and bars (we have our top list for you available at your arrival in our guest map), the Foodhallen, shopping streets (incl. Overtoom and Jan Evertsenstraat) and direct access to public transport.  Within 5 minutes by bike you are in the well-known Vondelpark, and within 10 minutes you will be in the heart of the city centre (Dam Square). The RAI Congress Centre is only 15-20 minutes away by bike of bus/tram. Exploring the city is ideal with our apartment as starting point!

column10: Today, De Baarsjes is simply an inviting, community-oriented Amsterdam neighbourhood. De Baarsjes is remarkably close to the city centre. It’s not only minutes away from Vondelpark, but it also has its own green and rambling Rembrandtpark. Off the commercial shopping boulevard Jan Evertsenstraat there’s an open air market on Vespuccistraat. These days the area is home to trendy dining haunts such as Bar Spek, Radijs, an espresso bar Buon Giorno, an organic snack bar Natuurlijk Smullen and even its own club: Club 8.

column6: This newly decorated, modern yet cosy apartment on the second floor of a beautiful 110-year old building, which has been built in the classic ‘Herenhuis’-style which is so characteristic for Amsterdam. The apartment sports a brand new, fully equipped kitchen, a separate bedroom, separate toilet and a balcony which is big enough for two persons to enjoy.  Ideally located in the hip ‘Staatsliedenbuurt’,  very close to the city centre, the Jordaan, Trendy and Cultural Westerpark & Haarlemmerdijk.
column7: This newly decorated, modern yet cosy apartment of around 40 square meters is located on the second floor of a beautiful 110-year old building, which has been built in the classic ‘Herenhuis’-style which is so characteristic for Amsterdam. The apartment sports a brand new kitchen, a separate bedroom, separate toilet and a balcony which is big enough for two persons to enjoy. The apartment is ideally located in the ‘Staatsliedenbuurt’, a neighbourhood on the edge of the city centre and only a stone’s throw away from one of the biggest parks in Amsterdam, the Westerpark (which some say is even nicer than the popular Vondelpark). By bike, the popular ‘Jordaan’ takes only a few minutes to reach and within 10 minutes you are standing on Dam Square in the city centre of Amsterdam. From there, it takes you only another 5-10 minutes to get to most of the tourist highlights. At night, you will appreciate the serene and quiet neighbourhood. column11: After entering the building on the ground floor, use the switch mounted on the wall on your right hand side to turn on the lights on the staircase (there is a similar switch on every floor). Go straight up the stairs in front of you to the second floor, where the door to the apartment is located. Please note that the staircase is particularly noisy and any sound you make can be heard by my neighbours, so please take this into consideration and act respectful while entering and leaving the apartment (especially late at night after 22.00 or early in the morning). If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Please note, to bring this amount in cash since it goes straight to the Host for the late hour. Hopefully you can make it before the late fee deadline, but this way, we can accommodate you even if you don't. Thanks for understanding! There is an extra curtain in the
column12: Parking your car in Amsterdam is very expensive. In my neighbourhood you will pay 3 euros per hour between 07.00 and 24.00 (there is a daily cap, but it’s still very expensive), and it’s even more expensive nearer to the city centre. Therefore, it’s preferable that you arrive by public transportation. However, if you do arrive by car, the cheapest way to park is to use the P+R system. In short, using this system you park your car at the edge of the city and continue your journey by public transportation. In return, you receive extremely reduced parking rates. Learn more about this system here: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  If you arrive by plane, the fastest and most relaxed way to get from Schiphol to my apartment is by taxi (or preferably Uber, the new taxi-alternative which is a lot cheaper and works very well in Amsterdam, check (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info), but it’s also the most expensive at around 35-50 euros for a one-way trip. column6: Our apartment is right in the middle of one of the most vibrant districts in Amsterdam, De Pijp. De Pijp is brimming with fantastic cafés, restaurants, coffee shops and bars. De Albert Cuijp market, Rijksmuseum, Heineken brewery and Sarphati park all right around the corner on walking distance. Relax on our rooftop from where you have a spectacular view of the city. We have a master bedroom of approx 20m2 and a smaller one of approx 12m2. The apartment has two full and two half bathrooms.

column10: The neighborhood is very cosy, with many good restaurants and cafes closeby.  For example: De Dikke Graaf, Wilhelminastraat 153, cosy, good food, also for drinks on a sunny afternoon. De Figurantenbar, Rhijnvis Feithstraat 93, typical old Amsterdam cafe.  Forno, Rhijnvis Feithstraat 43, very good Italian food, also a sunny terrace. De Ebeling, Overtoom 52, awesome bar for drinks, haven't tried the food yet. This is great for a stopover on your way to the city center.  This is just to give you an idea of what kind of hotspots you find in our neighborhood. Of course, the city has much more to offer.
column11: Normal check-in and check-out times: Check-out: 11.00 AM Check-in: before 21.00 PM Check in after 21:00 is possible but it costs an additional of 20,- euro. After 0:00, we ask an additional 50 euro. For other in- and check-out times please contact me.
column12: The most common way to get around in Amsterdam is of course by bike. You can rent bikes in many shops all over town.  If you're not so comfortable with riding a bike, you can of course use taxi's/Uber, but the public transport network is also quite good in Amsterdam. Usually trams, buses and metros run till about 00.30.  To/from Schiphol Airport From the airport, take the train to station Amsterdam Lelylaan. From there, take tram 1 in the direction of Central Station. Get off the tram at the stop: Rhijnvis Feithstraat. From here it is a few minutes walking to our apartment.  To/from the city center To get to the city center and back, you can take tram 1 at the stop: Rhijnvis Feithstraat, which is a few minutes walking from our apartment. Take the tram in the direction of Central Station, which will take you to for example the Leidsesquare, Dam Square, etc.

“Iamb&b is taking care of my apartment while I am gone!” 

My name is Emma, I'm 23 years old. I've been enjoying the beautiful city of Amsterdam since 6 years, currently living together with my boyfriend Toby in the West of the city center. I'm currently finishing my masters program here at the VU University, so I will start applying for jobs this summer. Although I really love this city, I also enjoy travelling a lot, our next big trip will be to South Africa.

column6: Situated in Amsterdam East only 20 minutes from the centre you'll find our spacious and dutch family house with a great and sunny garden. Perfect for families (or max 4 adults). No need to rent bicycles; there are 4 normal city-bikes you can use! Very close you will not only find nice parks like the Oosterpark (with the Tropenmuseum) and Frankendael, but also a great choice of shops, the daily "Dappermarkt", restaurants and bars. For a nice stroll/ride into town just follow the river Amstel!
column7: OUR HOUSE The living has wide opening doors with access to the garden. Our garden has more than enough space for a nice diner or BBQ. Or just relax in the hammock! We love to cook so you'll find a well equipped design kitchen with fridge, dishwasher,  oven and microwave. Good equipment and lots of tableware are all there to have some lovely diners at home! Next to the open kitchen you will find a dining table serving 6 people, we just love to sit here, warm and cozy! The other end of the living room is for relaxing at the fire place, reading or watching TV. There are 3  bedrooms: 2 double bedrooms and 1 large attic with a single bed.  The house is equipped with wireless internet. A washing machine and dryer are there for you to use. Bedlinen and towels are provided. AMSTERDAM OOST/WATERGRAAFSMEER We love Amsterdam East! column10: Try the posh restaurant " De Kas" at park Frankendael or have a high tea at Merkelbach. In Amsterdam-East you'll find restaurants from all around the world and for every budget. One of the best Indonesion-take-aways in Amsterdam though is Kediri at the Linnaeuskade. For blockbuster-and arthouse I would recommend the cinema at Studio K or Kriterion. Nice pubs are situated at the Beukenplein or at the Linnaeusstraat near the  Oosterpark. If you want a real local treat, take (a lot of) beers at café Ruk en Pluk....

column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.
column11: Check-in and check-out time is flexible and can always be discussed.
column12: Tram 14 (1minute walk) goes directly to Waterlooplein, Rembrandtplein, the Dam, Anne Frank huis. Tram 10 (3 minute walk) goes directly to Leidseplein. Amsterdam Muiderpoort (train station) is a 10 minute walk. Here you find a direct train to Schiphol airport.

column6: Private bedroom with ensuite bathroom. You will have complete privacy and all amenities needed for comfortable stay.  Small bedroom yet has a bathroom with nice shower, great double bed, heating, wardrobe, tea/coffee, fridge,Cable TV, etc.  Bedroom has a patio outside and hence quiet and you can step out for fresh air.  Great location: close to most musuems and sights - Hermitage, Foam, Rembrandtplein  Weesperplein metro station is 3 min walk: easy access to Amsterdam Centraal and Trams.
column7: Small but cosy and has all that you would need to have a comfortable stay in Amsterdam.  Bedroom has a private ensuite bathroom with comfortable hot/cold shower, WC and sink.  There is TV, coffee/tea, some drinks in the fridge, if you wish to laze in your room.  You also have access to patio for fresh air.  The bed is comfortable for two with fresh clean linens.

column10: Weesperplein metro station is less than a minute walk. Its 3 stops on metro to Amsterdam central station. Its easy to get to Schiphol Airport.  Most of the sights are within walking distance. You can also take a tram to all parts of the city from Weesperplein.  Musuems like Hermitage and Foam are within few minutes walk.  The neighborhood is in the centre yet very quite street and apartment overlooks the canal.
column11: The steps to room are bit steep and hence might be a struggle if with very heavy bags or have mobility issues. You may want to consider this while booking. However, there are less than 10 steps to access the room.
column12: The apartment location is well connected through various modes of public transport. Metro, tram and bus. We have two spare bicycles that can be used by guests during the stay.
column13: Guest have access to the bedroom, patio and the ensuite bathroom. No kitchen but there is a fridge in the room.  The room is on ground floor of the two level apartment. Steps (a bit steep) lead downstairs to bedroom.  The access to the bedroom is close to entrance of the apartment and hence you can have complete privacy if needed.
column14: Henry and I are very friendly and happy to show you around Amsterdam, or make you part of our weekend plans - if you would like. We provide our guest complete privacy.  We are happy to give you tips for sights and visits in Amsterdam.
column25:

I really like to meet nice people, having good conversations, creating funny stories and adventures, discovering countries and cities, sharing ideas, joy, food and life.

column5: Family house with garden near the Vondelpark
column6: Very nice family house with garden in one of the most beloved neighborhoods of Amsterdam, The Helmers buurt in Oud West. Trendy restaurants, hipster bars, vintage shops, a daily market, playgrounds for the kids and the the city centre with the famous canals and museums (Van Gogh , Rijksmuseum etc.) at walking distance (10-15 minutes). Our house is situated at the ground and first floor and has a very nice garden at the back . You will have 3 bedrooms and big bathroom at the first floor.
column7: Our house is dating from 1900, it consists in total of 5 levels, you will have the ground floor and first floor at your disposal. We complety renovated it and made it a comfortable , modern family house . The entrance is at the ground floor , the kitchen is at the front and has all built inn appliances necessary ; fridge, separate freezer, dishwasher, gas hob, hood and a combi microwave/oven. There is a toilet near the entrance. The garden is at the back you can enjoy the afternoon and evening sun here! there is a BBQ at your disposal. The bedrooms are at the first floor, the master bedroom with kingsize boxspring bed (180 x 200) is at the back. The bedrooms for the kids are at the front. One has a bunk bed ( 90 x 200) and the other one a high sleeper (90 x 200) . The bathroom is in the middle and has a shower, double sink, bath and toilet. At the second floor you find the second bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. You can use our washing machine and dryer during your stay.

column10: Our house is located in the Helmers area, in Amsterdam Oud West, close to the Vondelpark and musea at walking distance , 10-15 minutes (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) . There are lot of nice restaurants at walking distance. In the Jan Pieter Heijestraat for example or you can go to the Hallen a indoor food market in the former tram depot. Here you also find a cinema, shops , indoor weekend local goods market and restaurants.
column11: Our cat Snoet will be in the house during our holiday, so if you are allergic for cats our place will probably not be suitable for you. We would like you to look after the cat.

column10: Today, De Baarsjes is simply an inviting, community-oriented Amsterdam neighbourhood. De Baarsjes is remarkably close to the city centre. It’s not only minutes away from Vondelpark, but it also has its own green and rambling Rembrandtpark. Off the commercial shopping boulevard Jan Evertsenstraat there’s an open air market on Vespuccistraat. These days the area is home to trendy dining haunts such as Bar Spek, Radijs, an espresso bar Buon Giorno, an organic snack bar Natuurlijk Smullen and even its own club: Club 8.

Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area wi
column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

column6: Located right at the Vondelpark with a roof top terrace looking out over the park! A stay in my apartment will give you a local and true Amsterdam experience! It has a large open living and a separate kitchen, a master bedroom and an extra room. The neighborhood offers local shops, bars, restaurants and of course the Vondelpark.
column7: The apartment is located in a quiet dead-end street where you can simply walk straight into  the Vondelpark. The apartment has a large open living with all ‘necessary’ electronic applications (TV, WIFI, SONOS) and a balcony to have breakfast outside. There is a kitchen with all the cooking stuff you can wish for. Upstairs is the master bedroom, bathroom with a bath and a separate shower, an extra room plus the roof top terrace! Beautiful view over the park, sunny all day and a lovely place to enjoy the quietness in the middle of Amsterdam.

column10: The Vondelpark area (Old west) is very trendy with many cute bars, cafe's and restaurants. It’s a great place to visit, to have a drink or just for a walk around the park.  All shops to get some groceries are nearby and also evening shops are located in the street. Its famous throughout Amsterdam, has a fantastic selection and is not overpriced at all! It's open every day till midnight and I love it! Nice bars are Ter Brugge (beer and food), Oslo (wine and foot), Gollem (lots of different nice beer), Zouk (great on Friday evening). Enjoy a fantastic stay in Amsterdam by booking my apartment in this great location. You'll be very comfortable and feel like you're actually living like a local in this amazing city. I'm sure you'll have a wonderful time here!
column12: From schiphol it only takes 20 minutes to reach the apartment. Take the train to Amsterdam Central Station and transfer at Amsterdam Lelylaan. Take tram 1 to Amsterdam Central Station and step out at Rhijnvis Feithstraat. From there it is a one minute walk.  A taxi from schiphol is around EUR 40,- The apartment is easy to reach from Central Station by taxi which will cost you around €15,-.  You can also take tram 1 in front of Central Station or Amsterdam Lelylaan and it stops 1 minute walk from the apartment. This will cost you € 3,- This tram also takes you pretty much around Amsterdam. It stops at popular sights like: - Leidseplein (shopping and nightlife)  - Museumsquare (with the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum & the Modern Art Museum)  - The Amsterdam canals  Of course you can transfer to other public transportation to get you anywhere you want in town.  The best way to get around Amsterdam and to feel the city is by renting a bike though.

column6: - Two floor apartment:  large living room + kitchen on the 3th floor and a nice sunny balcony's. On the 4th (top floor) there is a large bedroom and bathroom with bathtub - 4 persons max -  You'll share the apartment with two cute cats - In the heart of the upcoming en hip east side of Amsterdam! - Bar, restaurants, supermarkets and concept stores are around the corner. - Very easy access to public transport. Just in 10min to Central Station, city center like Dam square
column7: -  You'll share the apartment with two cute cats - It is a very light and spacious two floor apartment.  - The apartment lays on the 3th and 4th floor, these are the top floors of the building.  - With some nice furniture, plants and art, we created a trendy and comfy decorated house.  - Because of the big windows on both sides of the living room and kitchen area, you'll get a lot of natural light inside.  - With a 'french' balcony at front and a big balcony on the south side, you can  get some fresh air and relax in the sun.  - In the summertime we love to eat breakfast on the big balcony in the morning sun or drink a cold beer in the afternoon sun. - The master bedroom is very large with a nice and comfy two person bed and a lot of closet space and two large mirrors.

column10: - Amsterdam East, and especially 'de Javastraat' can be described as an upcoming neighborhood. - In a two minute walk you find everything you need. Like supermarkets and a pharmacy. - There are a lot of new and different bars, cafe's, restaurants and concept stores. - Very easy access to city center and other neighborhoods.  see also about Amsterdam East: (Website hidden by Airbnb)
column11: -  You'll share the apartment with our two cute cats -To enter our apartment you have to climb some stairs. If you have a reduced mobility we don't recommend our apartment. -Be aware there's one bedroom with a double bed and one sleeping couch for two persons.
column12: - Very easy access to public transport; - Just in 10 minutes to Central Station or city center like Dam square by tram, bus or train; - We recommend to explore explore Amsterdam by bike, it is very easy; - In the close neighborhood you find several bike rentals; - Parking your car is possible, but long term parking can be expensive.

column25:
Hi,

I'm Nejifi from Amsterdam. I have lived my whole life in the Netherlands but my parents are from South America. I like to think that's why I love to travel around the world. I speak three languages fluent; Dutch, English en Spanish. So don't hesitate to contact me.

Ciao!

column10: The Kinker area and the Overtoom district are a part of Oud West (Old West) Amsterdam. Oud West is in the middle of Amsterdam and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. The Kinkerstraat is the commercial street of this district, with a lot of clothing shops, restaurants and more. The Ten Katestraat is also a commercial street with a daily market, like the other markets in Amsterdam.

The Rivierenbuurt (River neighburhood) is derived from the fact that many of
column10: The Rivierenbuurt (River neighburhood) is derived from the fact that many of the streets in this borough are named after Dutch rivers, like Maas, Waal, Schelde and Rijn. The Rijnstraat is a busy shopping street with many small businesses owning bakeries, butcheries and fruit and vegetable stores. The Rivierenbuurt is a busy shopping and residential area not too far from popular neighborhoods like the Pijp as well as the city centre. Here you can beat city centre prices while being only a tram ride away from all the major tourist attractions. The Martin Luther Kingpark is a small urban park at the Amstel and there is a other park names the Beatrixpark.

column25:
Love travelling and am very passionate about learning other languages. After highschool I lived in Rome for half a year and took Italian courses. When I finished at the University my boyfriend and I travelled through South-America where I learned some spanish. One of the highlights of the journey was a visit to the Galapagos Islands where we snorkelled with huge seaturtles! 

At home I sing in a female vocal group and live in Amsterdam with my husband Joris. I like to draw and paint when I'm home from work and meet up with friends to cook dinner together, go dancing or just talk the night away.

column6: Our 100m2 city centre apartment is the perfect place for a short or long stay in Amsterdam. Located just two tram stops (4 minutes) or a fifteen minute stroll from Central Station and Dam Square and conveniently situated for those travelling by car.
column7: Our house is ideal for singles or couples who want to discover Amsterdam on foot, by bike or public transport, but who aren't big fans of touristy and crowded inner-city streets. The neighbourhood is supergreen and leafy, lots of water around (safe to swim in). The apartment is situated quite close to the road, so some traffic is audible during daily peak hours. You will be staying just a stownthrow away from the cute Artis Zoo, the  beautiful Maritime Museum Grounds and the famous NEMO Science Museum (all within 5 minute walking distance).  In preparation of your trip, find out what our neighbourhood has to offer using (Hidden by Airbnb) street view! Also check out our personal travel guide for our local recommendations. The supermarket is around the corner and hip little restaurants coincide with historic buildings and safe residential living; a rarity in Amsterdam, but our gem of an apartment is located right in the middle of this synergy. column10: Oud Zuid is central: on one end you have Amsterdam’s nightlife and culture square Leidseplein and on the other Amstelveenseweg that is developing into a true culinary boulevard. And throughout the neighbourhood, a new bar seems to pop up every week. But for residents, firm favourites remain Vondelpark’s Vondelpark3 and Blauwe Theehuis. The Vondelpark remains Amsterdam’s most densely populated place-to-be whenever the sun shines. Besides this it’s nice to live near one of the greatest overviews of Western Art in the world. Two of the main museums, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. For big shopping streets you can go to the PC Hooftstraat, Jacob Obrechtstraat, Cornelis Schuytstraat and Beethovenstraat.

column10: Oud-West, this leafy yet lively and eminently liveable part of town, is the part of West that’s closest to the city centre. Occupying an area bordered by the stately Vondelpark and the Singelgracht canal, Oud-West and neighbouring De Baarsjes are the result of rapid urban expansion in the last quarter of the 19th century. Prior to that, the semi-circular Singelgracht had demarcated Amsterdam’s outer limits, and earlier still, the Overtoom – nowadays a busy arterial road running parallel to the Vondelpark, and the best place in town for furniture shopping – was a footpath connecting Amsterdam with the town of Sloten. As such, it was part of the route that had brought thousands of European pilgrims to Amsterdam following the 1345 ‘Miracle of Amsterdam’, providing the city with its very first tourists. (Source: (Website hidden by Airbnb)

column10: Like anywhere in Amsterdam, you're never too far from anything, but this apartment is particularly well positioned.  The Jordaan is one of the oldest areas of Amsterdam. It has (or is super close to) everything that you want to get experience everything Amsterdam - cool bars, old bars, swanky restaurants, late night food spots, clubs, shopping, culture and some of the most beautiful canals in the world.  On Saturdays there are two markets no more than a few metres away; Lindengracht market and the famous Noordermarkt Farmers market. At the end of the street is Winkel - home of world famous apple pie.  Turn right out of the apartment, ride for 3 minutes and you get to Anne Frank's House. Want to turn left instead? After a 7-minute ride you'll get to lush Westerpark via Haarlemmerdijk.  The Red Light district is also about 8 minutes ride away with all its delights (if you're into that sort of thing). And the incomparable 9 Streets are only 5 minutes away.

There are also tram stops relatively close by but hopefully you'll be cycling - it's the best way to experience the city.

column7: You're going to share our cosy flat with me, my boyfriend and our cat, so, if you are allergic to cat's hair, it might be not the right place for you. Since Pedro is a kitten, you will need to follow a few simple rules, such as : never leave the windows open; if you don't want him to jump on your bed, don't leave the door of your room open; when leaving the house, first open one door, then close it, and after leave by the main door, otherwise Pedro will try to escape; don't feed the cat with your food. I'm sure all the cats lovers will understand how important is to follows these rules :)  Please, remember that you are renting only one private room, and not the all apartment. Here in general also a simple rules to follow : - If you're a smoker, you can always smoke on the balcony - When you leave the place, please lock the main door twice with your key - If you wish to cook, then clean after yourself - No party/inviting people at home

column10: Our apartment is situated at the Admiralengracht. This canal lays in the middle of an area called De Baarsjes, a booming part of Amsterdam West. Since 10 years this is an upcoming neighboorhood, where artists, students, young families and people of all origin feel very much at home. In the buzy shopping street just around the corner you will find all kind of places: art studio's, two large supermarkets and shops of any kind. A new restaurant is opening doors almost every month. Don't forget to visit the Ten Kate-markt and the adjacent Foodhallen. There are three parks in walking distance, under which the famous Vondelpark. The Erasmuspark and Rembrandtpark are also very nice.
column11: When you'll come with a third or fourth adult, we will open our studio for you. Although there are more (childrens) beds in the house, it is in Amsterdam strictly forbidden by law to sleep with more then four persons in this apartment! There are no pets in the house.
column12: Schiphol airport is just 15 minutes away by car, a taxi costs around € 35,- Just around the corner, about 100 m away, is tram and busstop Marco Polostraat. From here you have a direct connection to many parts of the centre. You will be at the Anne Frank House and the Dam square in about 10 minutes. The Central Station is about 15 minutes away (tram 13 of bus 18). The belt highway away around Amsterdam is just 5 minutes away. You can park your car in front of the house, for € 2,40 per hour. For 24 hours you pay € 21,60, Sunday is free of charge. Under the Mercatorplein, at 5 minutes walking, you will pay € 15,- per 24 hours. The good connections by car and public transport make this apartment also a good base for trips outside Amsterdam. With a Holland Travel Ticket (€ 39,-) you can use all public transport in all the Netherlands (after 9 am). Ofcourse I will be glad to advise you - even being at a distance - to advice you on the best options for using the car, trams and trains.
column13: You are allowed to use the whole house. The separate B&B will be opened when you come with groups of three or four adults. In both parts of the house you will have total privacy. For more information about the B&B look for "Cosy B&B near city center".
column14: Our neighbor will hand you the key and show you the house. But over the phone and app I will be available around the clock to answer all your questions.
column15: We only accept families with children and couples. Our house is best suited for families with (young) kids. Only at the balcony it is allowed to smoke.  Pets are not allowed.

Airbnb is also a fantastic way to meet people from different backgrounds.

column10: West  Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.

column12: There is lots of parking space in front of the appartment and it's paid parking from Monday - Friday: 9.00 am-7.00 pm at €1,40/hour. You can also park your car for free in the adjacent town of Amstelveen at a 5 minutes walking distance. There is an easy connection with every area of Amsterdam with tramline 5 and metroline 51. Tram 5 can take you to Museum Square, The Royal Concert hall, Leidseplein, Dam Square, Central Station, etc. And you can transfer to almost all the other tram lines along the way. Metro 51 brings you to RAI, Amstel, Rembrandtplein, Red Light District, China Town, Central Station. A big shopping mall is located nearby with a great variety of shops and restaurants. Three stops with tram 5 or metro 51 will take you to Station Zuid where you can catch the train to get you at Schiphol Airport within 7 minutes.

column15: Please not that this room can only be booked for ONE person. No overnight guests/strangers or visitors (unless previously agreed upon and arranged well in advance). This is a major rule. The best way to go to the centre of Amsterdam is by Metro (Noord Zuidlijn). It takes a 10 minute walk from the house to the Metro-station, and within a few minutes you arrive at the Central Station. Another more romantic way is by bike (20 min. and 5 min. on free ferry). The route is quiet, green and along the canal.  By car, it takes 10 minutes to go to the centre. column10: NEIGHBOURHOOD:  The room is located in a peacefull residential neighbourhood but not in the centre of amsterdam. Supermarkets, cafe's and restaurants are just 2 minutes walking away. Within 7 minutes walking distance you'll have access to trams lines 4 and 12 ( Stop Victorieplein ) .The City Centre is about 15 - 30 minutes by tram or bike. - Supermarkets bakeries and Deli shops are just 2 minutes walking away and open daily from 9.00 h untill 22.00 h
column11: DISTANCES: Shiphol airport takes around 35 minutes travel time  ( 10 minutes by train to Amsterdam RAI station and then 20 minutes walking. Or train to AMSTERDAM RAI station and then tram 4 to VICTORIEPLEIN an then an 8 minute walk )  CENTRAAL STATION / DAM square: circa 30 minutes.  Tram 4 from CENTRAAL STATION or DAM. Get of the tram at stop VICTORIEPLEIN. Then it's 8 minutes walking.  The CENTRE: Tram : Walk 8 minutes to VICTORIEPLEIN and take tram 4 or 12.. Subway / Metro: walk 15 minutes to stop EUROPAPLEIN and take metro 52 into direction NOORD ( the only metro at that stop ) . By foot: if you like to hike. Any spot in the centre can be reached by foot in circa 30 to 60 minutes.  PRICING Pleas be sure to select the right amount of persons in the booking process for 1 person the price is lower than for 2.   CHECK in / CHECK out  check in : On request. Flexible but guaranteed from 18.00 hrs.  check out: On request. Before 11.00 am or later on request.  Whenever possible we're flexi
column12: DIRECTIONS / TRANSPORT PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Tram line 4 is only 7 minutes and Amsterdam RAI station is 20 minutes walking distance. Once you have booked you'll receive detailed directions to travel to the room. BY CAR: It is possible to Park you car in the street. The tariff is around EURO 20 per day. Exept Sundays. Parking is paid in all surrounding neighbourhoods. If you want to park cheaper you can go to a P+R site and take public transport into Amsterdam.  BY TAXI: a taxi from the airport to the room is circa EURO 45.
column13: The facilities include the private room and private bathroom which is located right next to the room on the common hallway. There is one neighbor sharing the common hallway. There is no tv or radio in the room. If you wish we can supply a small iron and ironing board in the room. Please notify us before arrival.

column10: The house is situated in a quiet street in the Schinkel Area in Amsterdam Oud Zuid (Old South). The city center is a 10 minutes tram / bike ride away, and so are the museum quarter, concert hall, Leidse plein, Amsterdamse Bos to name a few landmarks. The famous Vondelpark is no more than a 5 minute walk. The Schinkel area has a lot of nice cafés and restaurants. Also all shops you'll need (supermarket, baker shop, convenience store, drugstore etc.) are just around the corner.
column11: Please note the sleeping quarters are in the downstairs floor of our house.  One of the rooms has a window. The entire floor is fitted with an air circulation system.

column13: You will have the entire house, accept one small downstairs bedroom and the downstairs toilet, all to yourself. column10: The apartment is located in trendy 'Spaarndammerbuurt', next to the Westerpark, the Haarlemmerstraat and the Jordaan (10 min walks). In the weekends we love to go out to the Westerpark: at the Westergasfabriek there are cultural and culinary activities almost every weekend. There's also a cinema and lots of restaurants and bars. Check (Website hidden by Airbnb) to see what's on. You can go for a swim outside at the Brediusbad: (Website hidden by Airbnb) or rent a free pedalboat at the Van Noordtgracht (Old sailer with a white beard: Ad van Deventer). Our local pubs De Walvis and Bar Mick at the Spaarndammerstraat are very good for a drink or a daily plate.
column11: We have very friendly neighbours, but please please respect their peace and quit. After 22PM it should be quit outside. No music or loud talking. Don't use the wasmachine and the tumbledryer at the same time, it will overuse the electricity.  If the weather is hot, and its no trouble, perhaps you can water the plants? The rocking-chair is a rare collectors-item ánd a heirloom, so please be very gentle with it. Also no jumping on the sofa. General house rules apply to the apartment: - No loud music, noise or other nuisance in the apartment - No smoking in the apartment or in the common entrance - No drugs - No house parties, no persons permitted in the house except for the people who have booked (after midnight) - For the loss of keys, we charge 20% of the security deposit - CLEANING:  We will take care of cleaning so no need to vacuum or mop

column10: Jordaan is one of the most unique and charming areas of the city.  Picturesque canals, street side cafes, small independent designer shops, art galleries and local market make it also my favorite part of Amsterdam.  It’s interesting to know the story behind it as it was previously a working-class and poor immigrants quarter of Amsterdam, where houses used to serve as warehouses for goods from overseas.
column12: The apartment is located only 8 min walk from Central Station. Once there, the best way to explore Amsterdam is by bike, that's the way locals do it. 2 blocks away on Spuistraat you will be able to rent bikes.  Within 5 minutes walk you can reach; the city center (Dam square), the Anne Frank house and best shopping area The 9 Little Streets.  Since UBER Pop/X has been banned in Amsterdam (you can still use Uber Black), try new app ABEL if you are looking for low price taxi service.

column25:
Amsterdam based, World Traveller

“Please be a traveler, not a tourist. Try new things, meet new people and look beyond what’s right in front of you. Those are the keys to understanding this amazing world we live in.”

Travelling has always been big part of my life. I love to discover new place, meet new people and learn new cultures. 
Next to travelling I also have a passion for sports, photography, creative dressing up, and everything related to spirituality and self development.

While travelling I like to share my home with other travellers and I do my best to make sure they have the best experience possible. I also make sure you experience it like a local; from personal feeling at my place created with books, art and little details, to my favourite places in Amsterdam, that I recommend to my guests. Enjoy!

It's located right next to the city centre so it is very easy to get around the city from the apartment. The surrounding area has a variety of restaurants and shops, so you will never get bored. The apartment itself is also great. The apartment is very bright and has a lot of natural light. There is a big living room, modern kitchen, two great bedrooms and a modern bathroom. The living room is spacious and very comfortable with a great atmosphere. You can just sit down on the couch and relax. The kitchen is modern, fully equipped and a great place to cook and enjoy delicious meals. The two bedrooms are both big and accommodated with a comfortable and big beds where you really get to rest after a long day of sightseeing through Amsterdam. column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column10: Today, De Baarsjes is simply an inviting, community-oriented Amsterdam neighbourhood. De Baarsjes is remarkably close to the city centre. It’s not only minutes away from Vondelpark, but it also has its own green and rambling Rembrandtpark. Off the commercial shopping boulevard Jan Evertsenstraat there’s an open air market on Vespuccistraat. These days the area is home to trendy dining haunts such as Bar Spek, Radijs, an espresso bar Buon Giorno, an organic snack bar Natuurlijk Smullen and even its own club: Club 8.

column25:
Hi there!

My name is Saskia. Together with Wouter, I live in this lovely appartement in Amsterdam. Both of us are teachers here, which means we share long summer holidays together. (Yeah!) We are bound for Africa this summer! A new continent for the both of us, so exciting times lay ahead... :)

A while ago, we had a really good experience with Airbnb in Rome. We had a warm welcome in a stylish appartment, just outside of the busy tourist centre, but close to all we wanted to see. We hope to give you exactly the same experience, with a warm welcome from the friendly hosts of Iamb&b, who will make sure you know everything you need to know about our place and our city!

This will also be the first summer that we will be renting out our house. We hope our guests will enjoy our fine place, our beautiful city and hopefully long, warm summer days...!

Iamb&b is taking care of my apartment when I am gone!

column6: “Katja's City Apartment" is a completely renovated luxurious apartment in a heritage building right in the heart of the 17th century Canal area (Grachtengordel) of Amsterdam. The apartment is part of  a weaver’s house built  around 1670, the height of the Dutch golden age.  This modernly furnished apartment has a living-room, a bedroom and a bathroom, and is located in the basement of this recently renovated monumental building..

column7: Our appartment has two floors (2 and 3), and and an attic, accessible via one pricate entrance at the first floor. 3rd floor offers 3 bedrooms (this floor is our childrens floor, with a separate bathroom). One of these rooms has a double bed. Fourth bedroom, on 2nd floor, is a small doublebedded one, in which summernights gives us a lovely feeling of sleeping outside. Floor3 has two doors to our very big roof terrace, with wide green view over the inner courtyard garden. Floor 2: fully equiped kitchen, separate bathroom, studyroom, living room and dining room (adjacent to open kitchen). Washing machine, storing room at floor 4 (attic).

column10: You will wake up with only the sound of birds singing. Within 2 minutes walking you will find a lovely 'dining-street' with over 10 international kitchens.  15 minutes walk from the famous Albert Cuyp market. 10 minutes walking distance to three big parks.
column11: Our house has been built in 1930 and most authentical details are still there.

column15: To make our guests feel at home, we leave our house with personal stuff like art, books, music and kid stuff all in reach. We expect our guests to treat our stuff with respect.. We furthermore expect our guests to respect our neighbours nightrest and not make disturbing noise outside after 23.00.  Please bear in mind that noises outside are amplified by the natural shape of the inner courtyard. For this reason we prefer couples, with or without children. Due to the rules in Amsterdam the number of guests is strictly limited to 4 adults and 2 kids.

column6: This 'Vintage Attic Studio' with a great view is situated on the top-floor of a typical Amsterdam monument in the city center along a quiet canal near to the Amstel river. Easy access to public transport (Metro Weesperplein and three Tram Lines) and easy to reach by car from outside the city. On walking distance from the Hermitage Museum, the Skinny Bridge and the Amstel Hotel as well as a great variety of shops, cafes, restaurants and theaters (the Carré-Theater and the Opera-house).
column7: The studio offers a great view over the city! But do mind that you will have to climb the stairs to earn the view from the fourth floor!  The Studio has its own entrance and a private shower and toilet.

column10: This short-stay studio full of atmosphere is located in a save neighborhood very near to the Amstel river, in the canal-district city center of Amsterdam. Situated on the top floor of a lovely turn-of the-20th century building on the corner of two canals. This home is a sunny location and is naturally light, even on the darkest of Amsterdam days and is on (short) walking distance from the Utrechtsestraat with its many cosy shops, cafes and restaurants. Around the corner there is a small supermarket and a launderette is nearby. This is the ideal base from which to work and to enjoy the best of Amsterdam.
column12: Easy access (five minutes walk) to public transport (Metro Weesperplein and three Tram Lines 1, 7 and 19). Arriving by train from Schiphol Airport at Amsterdam Centraal Station you can take Metrolines 51, 53 and 54 untill the third stop 'Weesperplein'. The location is easy to reach by car from outside the city. Bike rentals also are very near. Parking your car near the house is certainly possible, but rather costly (over 7 euros per hour).

column10: Oost is so nice to live in, and great for you to explore. There are the many upcoming initiatives of all sorts: shops, bars, restaurants, companies, often which a local touch to it. For example: the coffee roasting company Stooker Roasting Co. downstairs in our building, you can drink and buy their coffee around the corner at All the luck in the World. Or Erik from Erik’s Delicatessen, who delivers his local produced cheese to restaurant De Kas, located just one park away. They grow their own herbs and vegetables in the greenhouses and gardens at the restaurant side. Or &Klevering, owned by a local, where you can buy the scent of Amsterdam in a bottle; Eau d’Amsterdam; also an initiative of a local. All these things make you feel at home in this wonderful, beautiful, bubbling and busy world town like Amsterdam.
column11: The apartment is located on the 2nd and 3rd floor If you need to check in to the apartment between 21:00 (9PM) and midnight, this is possible, but there is an additional fee of €25, after midnight that will be €50. Please note, to bring this amount in cash since it goes straight to the Host for the late hour. Hopefully you can make it before the late fee deadline, but this way, we can accommodate you even if you don't. Thanks for understanding!
column12: Arriving from Schiphol Airport, take the train to Amsterdam Central Train Station. From Amsterdam Central Train Station to our house take: Tram 9 in the direction of Diemen Sniep, get off at tram stop: Wijttenbachstraat (which is on the Linnaeusstraat at the corner of the Oosterpark). From here it is only 3 minutes’ walk to our house. Tram 7, get on at: Linnaeusstraat stop (which is on the Wijttenbachstraat) in the direction of Slotermeer. This tram will take you downtown, to the Rijksmuseum and Leidseplein for example. Tram 3, get on at: Linnaeusstraat stop (same as tram 7) in the direction of Zoutkeetsgracht. This tram will take you downtown as well, to the Museumplein (with the Stedelijk Museum, Van Gogh Museum and The Concertgebouw) for example. Opposite directions: Tram 9: Centraal Station, get on at Wijttenbachstraat stop (which is on the Linnaeusstraat). On the way to Amsterdam Central Train Station it will pass Rembrandt Square and Rokin for example.   Tram 7: get off at Wijtte

column10: Just around the corner is the J. P. Heijestraat and the Kinkerstraat, with all its markets, restaurants (Italian, Turkish, Indonesian, African, French, etc. etc.) and shops (design furniture, vintage clothes, urban gardens, food).  The Vondelpark is around the other corner, just 1 minute walk.  Vondelpark is the largest city park in Amsterdam, and certainly the most famous park in the Netherlands, which welcomes about 10 million visitors every year. The Vondelpark is centrally placed south of Leidseplein and near Rijksmuseum, Stedelijk Museum and Van Gogh Museum. The Vondelpark is loved by Amsterdammers as well as by tourists, and is full of people - enjoying a sunny day, dog-walking, jogging, roller-skating, listening to music, people-watching, or just lazing about in grass. Free concerts are given at the open-air theatre or in the summer at the park's bandstand. Other attractions are the statue of the poet Vondel, the cast iron music dome, the Groot Melkhuis with playground for child

column10: Today, De Baarsjes is simply an inviting, community-oriented Amsterdam neighbourhood. De Baarsjes is remarkably close to the city centre. It’s not only minutes away from Vondelpark, but it also has its own green and rambling Rembrandtpark. Off the commercial shopping boulevard Jan Evertsenstraat there’s an open air market on Vespuccistraat. These days the area is home to trendy dining haunts such as Bar Spek, Radijs, an espresso bar Buon Giorno, an organic snack bar Natuurlijk Smullen and even its own club: Club 8.

column10: Built during the city’s Golden Age, the three parallel canals are interconnected with streets filled with shopping, eating and drinking opportunities. The Canal Ring is made up of Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. In a way, the Canal Ring forms a crossover from the more bustling Centre to the gentler outer neighbourhoods of Jordaan, Museum District and De Pijp. The Canal Ring includes the city’s two main nightlife and culture squares. Leidseplein features such legendary concert halls as Paradiso and Melkweg. Rembrandtplein has several bars, two large nightclubs (Escape and Air), and ‘old world’ evocative treasures such as De Kroon and Café Schiller. The whole area is dotted with Amsterdam's beloved neighbourhood ‘brown cafes'.

column5: modern & spacious private appartment in amsterdam
column6: Welcome to my private, luxurious and peaceful apartment in Amsterdam. It's fully equipped: big fridge, washing machine, dryer, big flatscreen with free movie channel, Wi-Fi and everything else that you might need for a pleasant stay.  It has a large living room, one bedroom with a big bed, a professional kitchen, a very spacious bathroom with shower and a sunny balcony. Its really the perfect place to come home to, after a day of wandering around the city and relax.
column7: Welcome to my private, luxurious and peaceful apartment in Amsterdam. It's fully equipped: big fridge, washing machine, dryer, big flatscreen with free movie channel, Wi-Fi and everything else that you might need for a pleasant stay.  It has A large living room, one bedroom with a big bed, a professional kitchen, a very spacious bathroom with shower and a sunny balcony. Its really the perfect place to come home to, after a day of wandering around the city and relax.  The building is located in a quiet and neighbour-friendly area: On the edge of the hip and colourful 'Indische Buurt-area' and surrounded by lots of green, trees and water. From the windows you're looking right into the Flevopark. column6: Welcome to Amsterdam! We are looking forward to rent out our apartment to you. Located in the popular area Rivierenbuurt, a quiet neighborhood next to the Amstel and near lots of nice spots.  Although strategically situated between the city center / Schiphol airport and RAI convention center, the apartment lies in a quiet and safe street.  Around the corner: *Tree supermarkets (less than 300m by foot) *Restaurants and shops with all the basics you need  (open 7 days a week).   Nearby: *Close to the Amstel Station from where you can go to the airport and downtown. *Tram 4 stops at Victorieplein which is a 10min walk to our home. * Opposite our house you have the Martin Lutherkingpark where you can pick nick or just chill in the grass. (From 12th of August until 28th of August you will find here the Parade street festival which is great fun) Getting there: *By train. column25:
Dear Guest,

First of all I'd like to thank you for visiting my AirBNB-page. 

My name is Jill and since July 2015 I've had the great opportunity for making this apartment 'my apartment'. Ever since I spent a lot of time and energy in turning the apartment in a 'lovable, warm and cosy' home.. Not just for me only, but also for you.

Especially the view on one of Amsterdam's beautiful canals is truly wonderful and for me it really is a luxury to may live here. 

It's a lovely, quite and safe neighborhood but if you'd like to go to a more crowded place; you can find all kinds of bars and restaurants just around the corner.

For me, my home is a place where I can find my happiness and I really hope to may welcome you someday so maybe we could share the same experience :-))

Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor mar
column10: Dappermarkt is one of the country’s oldest - and best - outdoor markets. It forms the multicultural heart of the neighbourhood along with such major arteries as Javastraat, which once only provided every manner of global grocery but is now beginning to feature more upscale cafes and terraces. One of the city’s largest general hospitals, OLVG, is also located here. Two stellar city parks, Oosterpark and Flevopark, provide quick escape from the relatively busy streets. Besides many cheap ethnic eateries and supermarkets, the area is attracting much more higher-end cafes and restaurants who are often re-inventing many of the area’s industrial monuments. On sunny days, the parks and terraces are filled with nice people.
