column5: Sunny 2 bed apt in convenient, hip neighboorhood
column6: Our sunny relaxing apartment is a short walk to the historical centre of Amsterdam in a hip, up-and-coming neighbourhood with many restaurants, cafes and bars. A short walk to many attractions- Hermitage Museum (1.2km), Tropen Museum (0.9km), beautiffuly landscaped Oosterpark (0.3km), Hortus Botanicus, Artis (Zoo), the Dappermarkt (local daily open-air market) etc.  One block from Wibautstraat metro station, bus and tram stop. Perfect for couples, business travellers, and families (with kids).
column7: The main bedroom has a king bed with wardrobes and TV. The second bedroom can be used as either a bedroom or study. We will set up either a double bed or a desk depending on the purpose of your stay. The two bedrooms are at opposite ends of the apartment so that is good for privacy. The bed in the second bedroom is an inflatable bed but it is a top of the range, high quality bed so it is very firm and comfortable. There is a living room / dining room with couch, dining table for 6 ppl and TV.  The bathroom and toilet are separate and both off the hallway. Our lovely eat-in kitchen has large windows and gets a lot of sun. The kitchen and the living room both open up to our balcony which overlooks a square.

column12: You'll be at Rembrandtsquare and Waterloosquare within 10 minutes by public transport, and it's only a 10min walk to the recently renovated Maritime Museum ('Scheepsvaartmuseum'), which exhibits the rich history of the Dutch 'Golden Age' and the ships used during that era. The city's famous zoo Artis is only a 5 minute walk away from the apartment. This is the oldest zoo in the Netherlands and definitely worth a visit. Just 5 minutes by tram 26 or 10 minutes by bus or bike away from Central Station. The apartment is located on the former eastern docks of Amsterdam, which is still the city center. It's extremely easy to get around the city from here. Small art and design companies around on every corner mixed with amazing food from around the world. What about visiting Artis, eating at Jamie Oliver's Fifteen and end your evening in Club Panama or inner beach club Roest after some french tapas and entrecotes at Rosa&Rita which are only a 3 min. walk from the apartment. column5: Charming Vondelpark retreat in Old-West area
column6: Do you want to experience what it's really like to live in Amsterdam? Stay in our cosy city apartment just 2 minutes walk from the famous Vondelpark and 15 minutes walk from the city centre (Leidseplein, Museumplein). Start with a morning walk in the Vondelpark, a cup of coffee in one of the charming cafés in the trendy Oud-West area or a homey breakfast in the sun on our cute french balcony.
column7: Our apartment is an original 'old Amsterdam' building, located on the 3rd floor, therefore expect narrow and steep stairs (keep that in mind when packing) and enjoy the authentic Amsterdam experience. :) The space is about 90 sqm. We have 1 bedroom with a large 1,80m bed (for 2 people) as well as an extra sleeping sofa (1,40m) which fits two people comfortably. You are welcome to stay with 4 people.
column8: Do you want to experience what it's really like to live in Amsterdam? Stay in our cosy city apartment just 2 minutes walk from the famous Vondelpark and 15 minutes walk from the city centre (Leidseplein, Museumplein). Start with a morning walk in the Vondelpark, a cup of coffee in one of the charming cafés in the trendy Oud-West area or a homey breakfast in the sun on our cute french balcony. Our apartment is an original 'old Amsterdam' building, located on the 3rd floor, therefore expect narrow and steep stairs (keep that in mind when packing) and enjoy the authentic Amsterdam experience. :) The space is about 90 sqm. We have 1 bedroom with a large 1,80m bed (for 2 people) as well as an extra sleeping sofa (1,40m) which fits two people comfortably. You are welcome to stay with 4 people. We rent out our apartment when going away for the weekend. We will make sure to let you in and provide you with everything you might need during your stay before that. We are always reachable by phone
column10: Within 15 minutes walking you will reach the lively Leidseplein - with Amsterdam's main bars, clubs, cafés as well as the start of the large shopping area, as well as the Museum district with the Museumplein, the famous Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh museum and many more within walking distance. There are plenty of bike rental shops within 1 minute of the apartment as well as a supermarket within 10 metres of walking.
column12: The Tram to the city centre or central station (direct connection) is just 1 min walking on the main street called Overtoom. The airport is 15 minutes by Taxi and can also easily be reached by tram/train within 30 minutes.
column13: We rent out our apartment when going away for the weekend. We will make sure to let you in and provide you with everything you might need during your stay before that. We are always reachable by phone during your stay and will leave some recommendations about the area and Amsterdam in general so that you can make the most out of your stay! Please treat our lovely home as you would want yours to be treated. :)
column15: No smoking (you can smoke on one of the two balconies). No extra guests allowed. No parties, events or loud music.  For security reasons, no use of the fireplace or visiting the roof! Leave the appartment clean before you check-out.
column25: We are a young couple working and living in Amsterdam. Jessica is originally from Germany and moved to Amsterdam a couple of years ago. Pie was born and raised in the Netherlands.

Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village
column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

Also, some great restaurants are located within 5 minutes from the apartment. I will have a list of convenient spots available at the apartment!

column13: Within 2 minutes you reach a tram stop with the following public transport: - Tram 12 (directly from and to Museumplein, Rijksmuseum, Concertgebouw, de Pijp area) - Tram 13 (directly from and to Central Station, Dam Square, 9 Straatjes shopping area, Westermarkt and Anne Frank house) - Tram 14 (directly from and to Rembrandplein, Dam Square, 9 Straatjes shopping area, Westermarkt and Anne Frank house) The apartment is easily reached from Schiphol Airport or Amsterdam Central Station by public transport. Please contact me for further details.

column25: Amsterdam, North Holland, The Netherlands
column26:
Hoi, ik ben Claire en leuk dat je op mijn profiel kijkt! Ik heb sinds kort mijn eigen huisje op een van de leukste plekjes van Amsterdam en dit wil ik jullie natuurlijk niet onthouden :)

Amsterdam, daar moet je zijn geweest! De leukste winkels, rondwandelingen, de lekkerste restaurantjes, de mooiste hofjes, de geschiedenis van de stad, de monumenten, musea in de buurt, uitgaansgelegenheden... noem maar op.

Ik zal proberen jouw verblijf zo aangenaam mogelijk te maken, onder andere door je te voorzien van alle toeristische info die je nodig hebt. Daarnaast ben ik of een contactpersoon altijd in de buurt, dus mocht er iets zijn kan je mij meteen bellen.

Ik ben zelf zeer reislustig, heb alle continenten zo'n beetje wel gezien, maar nog lang niet klaar natuurlijk. 
In m'n vrije tijd vind ik het heerlijk om te koken, eten en dingen te ondernemen met vrienden. 

Tot snel in Amsterdam!

ENGLISH

Hi, my name is Claire and welcome on my profile! I have recently moved in to a beautiful apartment in Amsterdam and I would like to share this with you all :)

Amsterdam is a beautiful city to discover! This is the town where you can marvel in beautiful picturesque little streets, where you can photograph old buildings, where you find original shops, where you can have a drink with the locals or go out to the best restaurants in the city. What Amsterdam has to offer? The nicest shops, walking tours, restaurants, the most beautiful alms-houses, history of the neighborhood, monuments, museums and many other entertainment areas. And this all within 10 minutes of the apartment!

I'll try to make your stay as pleasant as possible by giving you all the touristic information you need. Also, me or one of my friend will be in the neighbourhood, so if there's anything you need don't hesitate to call.

I like to travel a lot. I've seen all the continents but off course I'm far from being finished! Furthermore, I love to cook and eat (which my kitchen might show...) and hanging out with friends.

See you soon in Amsterdam!

column10: The apartment is literally located in the heart of the city, on the border of the Jordaan district and the Negen Straatjes (Nine Streets). Two of the most popular trendy areas of the city. Full of great bars, restaurants, shops and galleries. Several grocery stores very close. Dam Square, Leidseplein (Stadsschouwburg, De La Mar Theatre, Melkweg, Paradiso, The Bulldog), Flower Market, Spiegelstraat (antiques), the Vondelpark, Museum Square (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk Museum, Concertgebouw) and PC Hooftstraat (exclusive shopping) are all within reach of a 10 to 15 minute walk! One of the best night supermarket is around the corner ... and also the best ice cream!
column12: The area is surrounded by trams and buses that bring in virtually all areas of the city. See trams 13, 14, 17, 12, 3. The means of transport for excellence in Amsterdam, however, is the bicycle. Highly recommended hiring bikes to experience the city at its proper pace.

column15: We hope you'll feel at home away from home in our house. Still we would like you to respect a few house rules: Who can rent our house: We only rent out the house to one couple or a family. This has to do with the beds: the bed bunk in the children's room is fine for kids, but not for adults.  The house is not available for parties or events. We are not located in a party-area. Identification: Please show your ID on arrival. We will register your ID number, name and dates of check in-check out. Tranquility: Even though you are within cycling distance from the city centre, the house is situated in a quiet neighborhood. Please respect our neighbors tranquility! This means: no music in the garden, and no parties inside or outside the house. And please no loud conversations in the garden early in the morning and after 9 pm.  No smoking inside Our house is a non-smoking house. Please don't smoke in the house.  You can smoke in the garden, as long as you clean up the cigarette ends. BBQ and g

You can also make use of the washing machine and dryer. Entire apartment We will check you in personally or via a key deposit. There’s a manual for the house and a guide with some insider things to do in the area. You can always contact us, there to help! Amsterdam East is one of the upcoming or so called hipster neighbourhoods in Amsterdam! It almost seems that a new hotspot pops up almos
column10: Amsterdam East is one of the upcoming or so called hipster neighbourhoods in Amsterdam! It almost seems that a new hotspot pops up almost every day in this neighbourhood. It's nearby the city centre, but has such a different vibe. A drink at the rooftop of The Volkshotel is a must to enjoy the stunning views over Amsterdam! When it comes to restaurants there is something for everyone. From trendy coffee bars, industrial warehouses, cocktail bars to concept stores! The Czaar Peter Street and the Javastraat are some of the best shopping streets on the East side of town. All kinds of trendy shops can be found here. On a sunny day it's definitely a must to visit Roest for a drink on the waterfront. If you want the local feel and multi-culti then stroll over the Dappermarket or wander around the Oosterpark. The renewed Beukenplein is perfect for a drink afterwards!  For some inspiration what to do, have a look at:  www[dot]yourlittleblackbook[dot]me/cityguide/amsterdam/amsterdam-east/

column12: Train station (Amstel) within 10 minutes walk, Metro, bus and tram just around the corner. Supermarket across the street (within 40 meters).

column15: My neighbours privacy and peace is important to me, so please keep your voices down on the balcony when enjoying the sun (like my neighbour does as well :) No extra guests, smoking or loud music.
column25: I've been living in Amsterdam for four years now of which the last two in my beautiful house in the most booming neighbourhood: East! I work as a supply chain manager at a Dutch multinational. In my spare time I like to go kitesurfing, travelling and going out with friends. I also like to cook and enjoy a nice breakfast on my balcony in the morning. Looking forward to meet you!

column6: A lovely bright cozy design home located in the middle of "Oud-West" near the city center.  My place is at walking distance to the Vondelpark, Leidseplein and cool food markets the Ten Kate Market and De Hallen. An open bright living room with a comfy sofa, big dining table and adjoining open kitchen area. A cosy bedroom with a french balcony, a clean simple bathroom and another sunny balcony. A fully equipped kitchen and a washer/dryer. Of course there is speedy wifi too!
column7: My place is located on the first floor of a traditional Amsterdam building. The apartment is light, open and comfortable. The living room with a large dining table and super comfy sofa has an adjoining kitchen that opens up to the sunny balcony on the south. The kitchen is fully equipped with a 5-pit stove, dishwasher & washer/dryer. The bedroom has a nice large bed and a french balcony. The bathroom has a shower and toilet. Wireless is speedy and a smart tv is also available. The apartment is non-smoking.

column10: Oud-West really is my favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam. When you step out you will find many shops, restaurants and café’s nearby. My place lies centrally located in a quiet street in Oud-West, Amsterdam. Major attractions like De Hallen, Ten Cate markt, Vondelpark, Jordaan and Museumplein are closeby - walking distance or easily reachable by tram. is centrally located in a quiet street in Old-West, Amsterdam close to major attractions like the De Hallen/Ten Cate market (5 min. walk), Vondelpark (5 min. walk), Jordaan (5 min. by bike or public transport) and the museum square (10 min. by bike or public transport).
column11: Check-in/check-out Check-out is at 11 am at the latest.  Check-in time is flexible. Preferably after 3 pm. Please note that we charge €25 after 8pm and €40 after 10pm.
column12: Public transportation is easy in Amsterdam! A tram stop into the city center is just a stone throw away from my place.
column13: Whole apartment

column25: My name is Janna. I am both a yoga teacher and a banker. I really love my place and am proud to share it with people who want to experience Amsterdam as a local. I love spending time with my friends and family. I am passionate about yoga, travelling and learning how to cook one dish at a time. And I look forward to meeting you!

column5: Live like a local in Oud-West near Vondelpark
column6: Spacious, 55m2, cosy,  light and comfortable apartment in OldWest, Oud West. Close to all of the things you want to see and do. The apartment will be a quiet haven to revive from your time exploring the city.  The neighborhood has lots to offer itself as well! Here is where the local people of Amsterdam live their day to day life. Various and numerous choices to go shopping, dining, drinking, exploring and thus entertain yourself!   Only 7 min walk to Vondelpark and 10 min by tram to Centre.
column7: The apartment is light, modern and has a cosy interior design that will make you feel right at home. This home is well-decorated with a mix of modern design and vintage furniture that gives it personality. Relax on the comfortable couch together with a good book and a drink.  The bedroom is spacious and has a king size bed where you can have a good night of rest.  The balcony is the ideal spot to spend some quality time while enjoying the warm sun. MAIN FEATURES  ★ Great location! Close to Vondelpark  and City Centre!  ★ Balcony ★  55m2 ★ Light because of the many windows ★ Quiet apartment (no busy street, few adjacent neighbours)  ★ Free WiFi ★ Fully equipped kitchen ★ Bedroom with Kingsize bed ★ Washing machine ★ Booklet with local travel information (specifically aimed at neighbourhood)

column15: I kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: - Please keep the noise down, especially when entering the complex. After all, you share the building with other people living there. All in all: I kindly ask you to respect your neighbours; - The wooden floor is my pride of the apartment. Because it is a very vulnerable floor please handle with care (for example with regards to fluids, grease, heavy and/ or sharp objects etc).;  -I guarantee a clean house when checking in. When checking out, please leave the apartment closely to the same state as it was provided to you. - Smoking  in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited. Smoking is allowed outside on the balcony. Kindly requested to leave the doors and windows closed while smoking there.
column25: Hi! I am a Dutch woman living and enjoying Amsterdam. I love to travel and explore the world. I hope you enjoy your stay!

column6: Lovely Duplex Apartment in the middle of De Pijp right next to the Albert Cuyp market and the Sarphatipark.  Besides the superior location, you will enjoy the space and the light of the apartment. In and around the apartment you will find everything you need to enjoy your stay in Amsterdam.
column7: The apartment is located on the second and third floor which makes it a very light space.  There are two big bedrooms with both two persons beds. When you enter the apartment there is a hallway that gives access to the kitchen, the living room and a seperate toilet. The kitchen is well equipped and offers you all the tools you need.  Next to the living room you will find a big bed room with a two persons bed. The living room is connetcted to the third floor through a internal spiral staircase. On the third floor you will find the master bedroom with a two persons bed and the bathroom with which contains a big bathtub, a seperate douche cabine and a toilet.

column10: The location is very central and ideal to start your discovery of Amsterdam. There are loads of bars, restaurants, breakfast places and small boutique stores around. Start your day with a two minute walk to the Albert Cuyp market and find out if you dare to treat yourself with a haring (a typically Dutch raw fish) or go for a stroll in the parc.  The canals and the city centre are also within walking distance.
column11: The apartment is located in a quiet street. However, the apartment was built in 1893 and is therefore not 100% soundproof for the neighbours. Please respect the neighbours and try to stay quiet (i.e. no loud music or whatsoever), especially after 22.00 pm.  The apartment is perfect for families and couples, but groups that just come for Amsterdam's nightlife might consider other accomodation.
column12: From Schiphol, take the train to Amsterdam RAI. Then take tram 4 to Centraal Station and hop off at Van Woustraat. It is a 5 minute walk to the house from there.

column5: Great apartment next to Vondelpark & Museumsquare
column6: This lovely apartment is located next to the famous Vondelpark, and in the middle of the city’s cultural hotspot (Van Gogh Museum!). Comfortable apartment with spacious livingroom and an ideal location: all of Amsterdam’s major highlights are only a stone’s throw away! Attention: Your check-in time on saturday must be between 08:00 and 14:00 hours. :)
column7: This apartment is light, has a spacious living- and diningroom with romantic French doors that give access to a lovely garden. Start your day by getting a freshly-brewed to-go coffee at the coffeeplace just down the street, and enjoy the sunlight and a nice breakfast in the garden.  We have a small but cosy bathroom where you can take a warm shower and get yourself ready for the day. You can prepare a meal in the fully-equipped open kitchen which is linked to the livingroom via a counter. After dinner, you can take a stroll through the gorgeous Vondelpark. It’s at its most beautiful with the sun just setting. After your night in a trendy bar nearby, a fresh bed is waiting for you.  APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS -Located in the cultural hotspot of Amsterdam and next to the famous Vondelpark -Spacious living- and diningroom with French doors -Big garden accessible through French doors -Two bedrooms suitable for four people

column10: This apartment is situated in a truly ideal location. In beautiful Old-South you’re within walking distance of Museumsquare. Within a 5 minute walk you can visit the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Stedelijk Museum and Concertgebouw (concerthall) for the best classical music of the Netherlands.  Have a lovely stroll or picknick at the famous Vondelpark, which is literally next door. This park is beautiful and in the summers always buzzing with people.  There are plenty of lunchrooms, coffeecorners, trendy pubs and charming restaurants in this neighborhood.  When it's time for dinner you can also go to the supermarket at the Museumsquare of visit the well-known Albert Cuyp Market (10 minutes by bike) for some fresh fruits and veggies to make your own meal or picknick.  We have a lot more tips for the best cultural activities, music venues, restaurants, bars, clubs or theatres. Feel free to ask! And the best part is: it’s all just a stone’s throw away.  NEIGHBORHOOD HIGHLIGHTS: -Vondelpark
column12: Perfect public transport possibilities. You can reach any destination in no time by tram or bus. We recommend though to rent a bike. There's a good bike-rental just down the street.

I'm currently a student of Philosophy in Amsterdam, so almost needless to say I enjoy a good conversation. I've recently started my own business and working hard to expand it.

I live together with my girlfriend, who also studies Philosophy. We are a young couple and love living in Amsterdam!

When traveling we mostly enjoy city-trips; having some nice food with a great view.

column5: Cosy Studio in lively and beautiful Pijp Area
column6: Nice and cosy studio, with kitchen with an oven and own toilet and shower (no bathroom). Situated on the 1st floor on the corner, so nice views from the studio into the lively Streets of the Pijp. We are on the corner of the Gerard Doustraat, which has a nice square with bars and restaurants. But this is 5 minutes from our house. This Street crosses our street, the Frans Halsstraat, which is being called as one of the nicest Streets in this area, with many great restaurants.
column7: It is a typical old Amsterdam house situated on the corner of 2 beautiful streets with great restaurants. We are renting out one floor of our house and wanted to accommodate our guests with a private toilet and shower and placed these extra on this floor. This used to be our diningroom.  Our house consists of 3 floors and an attic and every floor used to be housing a couple or family. This space is located on the first floor. Because it is located on a corner and has large windows it is beautiful to watch the typically Dutch scenery from this studio.

column5: Stylish Vondelpark apartment with roof terrace!
column6: My apartment is nicely furnished and has a lot to offer; the serenity of the park while being close to everything you might want to do in Amsterdam.  Trams stop in front of the door and there is a supermarket across the street. Want to chill out? Enjoy the view from the terrace, take a stroll or bike in the Vondelpark to Leidseplein or Oud-Zuid. Shopping? The JP Heijestraat is next door and is one of Amsterdam's most up and coming areas. A lot of good restaurants and cosy bars are nearby.
column7: The apartment is recently renovated, bright and repainted. It has fast wifi. For people who love to cook it offers all the essentials in the kitchen, an oven, microwave and dish-washer. For relaxing we refer you to our roof-terrace, a soak in our bath tub or a walk in the park which is literally a 30 second stroll around the corner.

The neighbourhood is in this way very diverse and there will be something for you to see whether you want to explore culture or fashion.

column5: Historic, Modern, Comfy, Canal View apartment!
column6: Our spacious 2-bedroom apartment, spread over 2 floors in a monumental home, has a beautiful views of two of our world famous historic canals. Centrally located: the Jordaan area, Anne Frank House, markets, cafés, restaurants & shops are around the corner and it's only a pleasant 10 min. walk to Central Station or Dam Square.  Our home comfortably sleeps 2 to 4 people max. and is best suited for couples, or families with older children.
column7: Monumental class meets modern comfort best sums up our apartment. On the outside it is a typical canal home on the inside you will find classic elements of this like exposed beams but the interior is modern and fully up to date. The entrance on the first floor draws you into the dining area from which you can best enjoy the views of the canals and bridges. The dining area naturally flows into the kitchen with a granite cooking island and further into the living area with comfy lounge sofa and a skylight. There is also a WC/powder room located on this floor. A flight of stairs takes you down to the second level. The master bedroom (w/ king bed, tv, approx. 25 m2), guest room (w/ 1 double or 2 single beds, approx. 20 m2) and the bathroom with rain shower, toilet, bidet and two sinks are all here. As this floor is partially below ground level it stays quite cool in summer and the floor heating keeps it warm in winter. The apartment is >100m2 in total.
column8: Our spacious 2-bedroom apartment, spread over 2 floors in a monumental home, has a beautiful views of two of our world famous historic canals. Centrally located: the Jordaan area, Anne Frank House, markets, cafés, restaurants & shops are around the corner and it's only a pleasant 10 min. walk to Central Station or Dam Square.  Our home comfortably sleeps 2 to 4 people max. and is best suited for couples, or families with older children. Monumental class meets modern comfort best sums up our apartment. There is also a WC/powder room located on this fl
column10: Special and something for everybody! Our street, the famous canal Keizersgracht, is on the world heritage list and our 17th century building is a national monument. Situated just around the corner of another canal the Brouwersgracht, you are steps away from a variety breathtaking canal views that are ever changing with the time of day and with each season. Or you can just stay in and enjoy the view right from our doorstep or dining room table. History and leisure are literally just around every corner from our home. The Anne Frank House, the churches Westerkerk & Noorderkerk, the Sunday & Monday open air markets, the exciting Jordaan & Canal areas with its cafés, restaurants, bars, boutiques & commercial shopping. Culture. Diversity. Food. Fun. It's all right here! We feel lucky to live in such a special area and we truly believe that our guests will have a comfortable, fun and memorable Amsterdam experience staying at our home, which we call K2. We hope you visit!
column11: - We share our home with Marty our dog ( (Hidden by Airbnb) : @realamsterdog) - Our house is clean, however it may not be suitable for people allergic to dogs - Our apartment has stairs. column12: - Trains, trams and busses are available at Central Station, a 10 minute walk from our door.  - Bike rentals are possible within one to two blocks from our home. - Private canal tour by boat with captain is possible (starting right around the corner). column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.

column5: Modern private apartment with huge roofterrace
column6: This tastefully furnished apartment has everything you will need for a lovely stay in Amsterdam. It offers privacy and is very spacious. Enjoy the fully equipt kitchen and the large roofterrace (including the big green egg BBQ!!). The apartment is located in the best neighbourhood of Amsterdam: De Pijp. A young neighbourhood with a lot of culture, restaurant and bars.
column7: This stylish, light apartment has a modern interior that offers everything you need for a comfortable stay! It is perfect for a couple or two friends.  The apartment has a bedroom with kingsize double bed and a comfortable bathroom with a walk-in shower that can be turned into a large bathtub. The bedroom is located at the back of the apartment and therefore is very quiet and peaceful at night. Roof Terrace The private roof terrace of 40 m² is an absolute gem with stunning views of Amsterdam. Feel free to use the Large Big Green Egg barbecue during your stay. Enjoy the view from the lounge couch and big outdoor dining table. * Wi-fi is available in both the apartment and on the roof terrace. * The apartment is situated in an historical building in de Pijp that has retained its historic details from the outside while being completely renovated in 2014. The interior of the apartment is completely new and offers all modern comforts. * All rooms are private, there are no shared facilities.

column10: De Pijp is vibrant and very much on its way up. As can be expected of an area that is centred on the nation’s most famous outdoor market: Albert Cuypmarkt, near to the Heineken brewery. This Amsterdam neighbourhood is famously diverse with over 100 nationalities represented. While still the best neighbourhood to choose from a wide selection of ethnic food, more high-end bars and restaurants have come on the scene to service students and young professionals. Further east along De Pijp there is the Van Woustraat, a former fast food strip, there are now several of the city’s more highly regarded restaurants. But perhaps most representative of the area is Bazar, a former church on the Albert Cuypmarkt that has been reinvented as a funky North African café/restaurant.

The kitchen includes a microwave, oven, dishwasher, kitchen machine, fridge and several other appliances such as a washing machine and dryer. The bedroom has a double bed. From the bedroom you can access the balcony with a beautiful view on the quiet rom
column7: The apartment has high ceilings so it's very bright and sunny. 1 comfortable  sleeper sofa for 2 persons A pretty balcony on the the east side for morning sun and another balcony on the west side makes it a perfect place for afternoon drinks in the sun and chilling after a day in the bustling city. The large windows in the front provide a great wide view over the waterside that is aligned with trees. The apartment is situated in the city centre and is a perfect base to explore all of Amsterdam's highlights. Jordaan with the famous 9 streets, Anne Frank's house and many restaurants only a 7 minute walk. Old West is a booming area with many new restaurant concepts opening every week. The apartment is right in the middle of it! Last but not least... the best deli-nightshop in town is only 15 meters away! This means your breakfast, late night drink or snack is always within reach.... :-) Dam Square and Central Station 15 min walk, 10 min by tram. Leidse Square 5 min walk. Public transport
column8: Located on the 2nd floor, the apartment is appr. 95 square metres and consists of a spacious Art Nouveau living room with an open fireplace, kitchen and dining area, separate bedroom, separate toilet and a bathroom with overhead shower. From the bedroom you can access the balcony with a beautiful view on the quiet rom
column10: Old West is the mini Berlin of Amsterdam. Many hip and happening places are opening every week. Galeries, restaurants and pop-up stores. Markthallen has recently opened with many little food stalls, inspired by the Barcelona foodhalls. The big musea are nearby but also nature and quietness is closeby with the Vondelpark and Westerpark. Jordaan is famous for it's shops, the Nine Streets and its cozy restaurants
column12: Trams and buses leave at a few meters from the apartment, to all areas of the city. Central Station is approximately 10 minutes by tram. Bikes can be rented just around the corner.
column13: Shared hallway with 2 neighbors. Two fairly steep stairs to get to the door.
column25: Amsterdam.

column5: Cosy family house in a quiet neigbourhood.
column6: Our nice and cosy family house is situated at a small town square with a play ground in front of the house in a very calm and quiet neigbourhood of Amsterdam. With tram (or bike) you can reach the centre/Dam square in 20 minutes, and in 5 minutes the train station or highway (A10). Enjoy our 1930-house or relax in the sun in our private garden. You will feel directly at home, with a modern kitchen, rooms and space for everyone. Our house is available for families and couples from 28 and older.
column7: In our house is a piano. In The Netherlands it is normal to look after your neighboors between 10 PM and 7 AM. But all the other hours you can play the piano. Dont use the chimnee in our house.
column8: Our nice and cosy family house is situated at a small town square with a play ground in front of the house in a very calm and quiet neigbourhood of Amsterdam. column10: We have a map of the environment. Next to the play ground and two streets ahead there are several shops and some bars. Around the corner is a small restaurant. At the bicycle shop around the corner you can hike a bike.  There is nearly any traffic (so you can sleep with the windows open if you  want).
column11: It is possible to park your car outside, but you have to pay high parking fee!! Het is mogelijk om de auto aan het plein voor de deur te parkeren. Maar let op de parkeertarieven zijn erg hoog.
column12: By tram 9, you are in approx. 30 minutes at the Central Station of Amsterdam. By bus 65, you are in 10 minutes at the Amstel Station. By car, take the A10 - S113 and you are in 5 minutes at ours.

column5: Sunny & spacious apartment in fancy Oud-West area
column6: Comfortable, authentic, 2-floor apartment in one of the most beautiful streets of Amsterdam! Located in the Neighborhood Oud-West. Full of local hotspots and hidden gems! 50m2 sunny living room with beautiful kitchen and balcony on the third floor of a typical Amsterdam building built in 1910. On the fourth floor a bed room with walk in closet and a large bathroom with hot tub.  Some famous highlights nearby: Rijksmuseum, Pieter Cornelisz Hooftstraat, Vondelpark, Foodhallen, De Jordaan.
column7: Apartment is located on the two top floors (third and fourth floor) of a typical Amsterdam building build in 1910 (so no noise from neighbors walking above you). On the third floor is the 50m2 sunny living room with beautiful well equipped kitchen, a comfy couch, large TV and a balcony with lot's of sun in the afternoon. On the fourth floor a bed room with a large bathroom with a rain shower and a hot tob. The bed is very comfy (M-line mattress) 180 * 220. There is a toilet on both floors.

column10: Bordering the centre of the city, Oud-West is a special corner of Amsterdam; a popular, dynamic neighbourhood dotted by trendy design stores, cool cafe bars and some of the best restaurants in the city. With a lot to offer and a great deal to experience, you’ll want to come back to this vibrant Amsterdam neighbourhood time and time again.
column11: The check-in standard is set to flexible. Please note that if we have guests checking out on the day of your arrival, your guaranteed check-in time is 15:00/3PM. If you book last minute (on the same day, before 6PM), please note that the check-in time depends on the cleaning. We will do our best to make sure the apartment is ready as soon as possible! If you wish to check-in to the apartment between 21:00/9PM and 08:00/8AM, this is possible. Due to the late hour we do charge an extra fee of 40 euro’s between 21:00/9PM & 00:00 or 80 euro’s between 00:00 & 08:00/8AM. Thank you for your understanding!
column12: It is really easy to reach the apartment with public transport. From the airport it is like +/-25 min to the appartement.  The nearest train station is: Station Amsterdam Lelylaan  The nearest tram stop is: Rhijnvis Feithstraat (tram 1)
column13: You enter the building on the ground floor, the stairs are shared with the neighbors of the first and second floor. The apartment is of course all private for you, it can be entered through the door on the third floor of the building.

column16: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we will charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. --------------------------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check-in: -

column5: Beautiful House & Garden Amsterdam in de Pijp
column6: Very cosy apartment with veranda and peacefull garden. Spacious living room, sunny kitchen and romantic sleeping room.  Perfect for business travellers or lovers.  The house is located in 'De Pijp', next to Museum Quarter, famous Albert Cuypmarkt, Het Concertgebouw, Heineken Experience. 'De Pijp' is a very popular neighbourhood for young families. Due the amount of local stores and bar it is never boring, but just not as busy as the hectic city center.
column7: If you want to enjoy a rest and feel at home you can stay in the house and enjoy on the lovely veranda in the backyard. The quieteness and view is so piecefull! Open the French windows to enjoy the green valley from the comfortable bed. Sometimes you don't need to get out of bed to enjoy nature.

column5: big apt, 5 rooms, very central, rooftop terrace!
column6: Although we live very central, we live on a beautiful green, quiet place. Our beautiful apartment is just 5-10 min. walking to the popular, historic 'Jordaan'! And 8 min. by bus to the Central Station! And a 2 min. walk to the big Westerpark. Or cycle to the musea in 10-15min!  Trendy restaurants, cafes, shops in the direct neighbourhood.  We have 3 sleeping rooms, a study, living and kitchen, bathroom with seperate bath and shower. And a sunny rooftop terrace on south with chairs and table.
column7: Our apartement is 120m2.  It has 4 levels, so we have a lot of stairs.  So its feels vey spacious!

We do not stay in the apartement when you are there, so you have it in private.  Unfortenaly we will not meet because we will be on holiday oureselves when you arrive. My mother or friend will welcome you and is available for questions.  In case of emergency you can ofcourse phone us! See my travel guide! And: our small neighborhood is one of the fi
column10: See my travel guide! And: our small neighborhood is one of the first ecological neighborhoods in a city. Architectes end city planners from all over the world come and visit it! We have many gardens for fruit and vegetables, so it is very green.  On some rooftops grows grass for isolation. Or the rooftops do have sun collectors.  We have special toilets which use less water. And some houses collect the rain to re-use the water.  We only use special paints and so on!
column11: We just rent to quiet people (families or two couples)  because we have a connected house and we do not want anyone disturbs our kind neighbours We only accept people with an uploaded ID. We have two nice cats. They have  a (invisible) litterbox in the hall. It will be cleaned every 4 days (or you can do it).
column12: You can take bus 21 from the Central Station. In 8 minutes you will arrive at station VAN BEUNINGENPLEIN. Our house is a 1-2 minute walk. Walk in the direction of the bus route. Take the first (car)street left. We live in the third block at your right hand.  From the airport you can take a direct train and than the direct bus 21.  Or take a taxi. The taxi ride will be 20-25 minutes and cost you about 40- 45 EUR.
column13: You can use the whole house and the rooftop terrace.

column15: Please consider our nice neighbours:  *Do not wear high heels or hard  shoe  soles inside. *No loud music.  *After 22.00 hr. and before 9.00 : be quiet in the house and absolute quiet on the terrace. *Be quiet on the stairs when you come in late or leave early,  especially when you come in or leave with your luggage * No drugs in the house or on the terrace.
column25:
I live with my two children and husband. And our 2 cats. 
I work as a researcher. In my free time i like to read, see movies, eat good food and drink fine wines, or do sports (yoga, walking).
I like traveling. Last years we were in   Jordania and Sri Lanka with the family. We loved it!
We like to share our home with nice people who want to experience our lovely city and will treat our house with respect.

column5: Light & Modern apartment near center Amsterdam
column6: Beautiful restyled apartment in the lively and friendly neighbourhood Amsterdam West. There are many cozy & hip restaurants and bars nearby. And do not forget the Erasmuspark around the corner where  you can enjoy drinks and sandwhiches while you can wath the locals doing their excercises. The city center is just 10 minutes away by public transport or bicycle (you can use 2 bicycles for free to explore Amsterdam as if you would be a local).
column7: Apartment The apartment is on the first floor and approx. 60 m2. It's well equiped incl. TV and wifi. There is a balcony on the south where you can work on your tan in the afternoon and evening.  The apartment is light and has enough space. It has a comfy sofa and chair, you can put your drinks on the side-tables while your relaxing and watching tv. You can eat in a separate dinner room. Of course the apartment has a separate bedroom with a nice 2 person bed.

Other must see areas like Musuemplein, De Pijp, Nieuwmarkt and the city centre are quite easy to reach via the two free bikes we can provide you with.

column5: Spacious apartment on walking distance to centre!
column6: We offer a sunny two-floor apartment (120m2) with rooftop terrace in popular Oud-West, with a sweet cat to keep you company!  The neighborhood offers everything you want on a city trip: nice shops, cafés, restaurants, a market and the Vondelpark. Perfect for families!
column8: We offer a sunny two-floor apartment (120m2) with rooftop terrace in popular Oud-West, with a sweet cat to keep you company!  The neighborhood offers everything you want on a city trip: nice shops, cafés, restaurants, a market and the Vondelpark. Perfect for families!
column10: Oud-West has that great mix of cultures and economic levels which makes it a vibrant neighborhood. It’s fun to explore the posh streets near Vondelpark and the ethnic grocers on De Clercqstraat and Kinkerstraat. You’ll find lots of students and young creative people in this area, as well as families with small children. Oud-West is full of excellent restaurants, cafes and bars. If you’re craving pizza, coffee, burritos or beer you can find it all in the neighborhood. Our quiet street ends at the JP Heijestraat which has many fun shops and restaurants. We’re at a 7 minutes walk from the Vondelpark and 10 minutes walking from the Hallen.
column11: We’re on the third floor without an elevator (like most of the authentic houses here) so make sure you’re in shape to climb some stairs!
column15: We have a sweet cat named Moskow who is good company and needs some food every day!  Please treat the apartment as if it were your own and keep in mind that you have neighbours. The apartment is a regular home not an after hours club, so no parties, no drugs, no loud music/TV, etc.  Smoking is only allowed at the balcony and on the roof. Smoking inside the house may also result in a triggering of the fire alarm.  Thank you!
column25: Hi we are a family of four from amsterdam enjoying living in a great house and neighbourhood  that we like to share with you.  We are both self employed professionals and have two kids Joris (2003) and Renee (2005).

column5: Lovely, cosy apartment in the heart of Amsterdam
column6: This lovely, charming, very cosy, and clean apartment is situated in the eastern part of the centre in Amsterdam. This neighbourhood is absolutely wonderful! The apartment measures 65 square meters. It has one bedroom, a nice kitchen and a nice balcony. A great place from which to discover Amsterdam.
column8: This lovely, charming, very cosy, and clean apartment is situated in the eastern part of the centre in Amsterdam. This neighbourhood is absolutely wonderful! The apartment measures 65 square meters. It has one bedroom, a nice kitchen and a nice balcony. A great place from which to discover Amsterdam. The apartment is located on the third floor, accessible with a staircase. I will most likely be in Amsterdam during your stay so you can always contact me with any questions! The apartment is located on a quiet street in the center of Amsterdam. This  truly unique neighbourhood was originally a shipyard area but became a residential area in the beginning of the 20th century. Within walking distance you will find the Maritime Museum (Scheepvaartmuseum), the Tropical Museum (Tropenmuseum), Artis (the zoo), the botanical gardens “Hortus Botanicus, Dapper Market, Waterlooplein (the oldest flea market of Amsterdam) In the summertime you can sometimes hear the Howler Monkeys from across the wate

Within walking distance you will find the Maritime Museum (Scheepvaartmuseum), the Tropical Museum (Tropenmuseum), Artis (the zoo), the botanical gardens “Hortus Botanicus, Dapper Market, Waterlooplein (the oldest flea market of Amsterdam) In the summertime you can sometimes hear the Howler Monkeys from across the water. The newly opened "Plantage" is a restaurant and bar connected to the Zoo which is one of Amsterdams new prides.

column5: Charming house with garden- great for families
column6: Playful split level home in the up and coming east side with garden- perfect for families. Sleeps 3 adults and 2 kids. Plenty of things to do in the area (shops, restaurants, park) and with the city centre at 10 minutes by bike or tram. A cat will be there to welcome you.
column7: The lay out of the place is very playful, with a split level living area and kitchen adjacent to the garden which feels like an outside living room in summer. In addition to the spacious master bedroom, there are 2 rooms for kids of up to seven years old, and a single room for a teenager or an adult.

column15: We kindly ask you to respect the following house rules: - Please keep the noise down,  since we share the building with our beloved neighbours! When checking out, please leave the apartment  to the same state as it was provided to you.  - Smoking and/or using drugs in the apartment and/or complex is strictly prohibited.  - No loud noise in the garden and please respect the neighbours on warm summer evenings. - This is a family house, so please respect our belongings.

column7: I welcome you to a nice, warm place to come home to after a long day of work or playing outside in the city.  You will love the atmosphere. The appartement is located in a quiet neighbourhood on the boarder of the city centre. It's the perfect location. All the must sees are in a 10/15 minute reach. And when it's time to go home, you will get your sleep and be superfit for the next day. It's a 60m2 meter appartement situated on the ground floor (US) or first floor (US) It has a spacious living room and a separate kitchen. Both rooms have the opportunity to open the doors and take a step outside to a balcony. You'll have access to a bathroom and separate toilet.  And then there is a spacious bedroom. column10: The apartment is located in a quiet neighbourhood on the boarder of the city centre. It's the perfect location. All the must sees are in a 10/15 minute reach. And when it's time to go home, you will get your sleep and be superfit for the next day.  To enjoy the city as a local, you can rent a bike. Ride your bike to the Van Gogh or Anne Frank museum in 15 minutes. Park it in the red light district, walk around the canals, have a nice meal en let the city take your breath away. If you feel more like talking a walk. Walk to the Javastraat (Eastside) in 5 minutes and visit one of the newest restaurants or cafe's. Have a surf and turf near the Oosterpark, or grab a IJbeer in the big windmill just around the corner. Also just around the corner, you'll find the best shopping street of 2015 "Czaar Peterstraat". They have cute little boutiques, nice coffee spots, and a great winery. If you don't feel like walking or taking the bike, there's public transportation all around the apartment
column11: The check-in standard is set to flexible. Please note that if we have guests checking out on the day of your arrival, your guaranteed check-in time is 15:00/3PM. If you book last minute (on the same day, before 6PM), please note that the check-in time depends on the cleaning. We will do our best to make sure the apartment is ready as soon as possible! If you wish to check-in to the apartment between 21:00/9PM and 08:00/8AM, this is possible. Due to the late hour we do charge an extra fee of 40 euro’s between 21:00/9PM & 00:00 or 80 euro’s between 00:00 & 08:00/8AM. Thank you for your understanding!
column12: From Schiphol Airport you take the train to Amsterdam Central Station. Bus 22 takes you from and to Central Station. Stop Oostenburgergracht is in front of the apartment. Tram 10 takes you to Leidseplein or even the west of the city if you want to explore.
column13: You will have access to the whole apartment!
column14: Unfortunately I won't be able to welcome you myself as I'm travelling. But I have the best of faith in my host who will take your booking and welcome you. I'm positive you will love your stay here.
column15: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we will charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. --------------------------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check-in: -
column25:
Hi! I'm Jacqueline, 35, live and work in Amsterdam as a nurse. 
Love to travel, see and explore another world, cultures and habits. 
I try to make a long trip every year, or at least a few short trips. The most memorable trip was the one to Cameroon. But i am also a huge fan of Asia. Next on the list is South America.
Next to traveling i like to cook, wander around, take photo's, catching a good film, host or attend dinnerparty's. 

What i love about airbnb is the experience of seeing and feeling the city/village as a local. Therefore i'd like to give fellowtravelers something back. 
Because my travels are often for a longer period of time and therefore i am not allways at home to welcome guests personally (unfortunately), i asked 'the friendly host' to take over when i am away. I have good experiences with them and i trust them to make the stay just as personal as i would do so myself.

column7: Unique bright 90m2 space in typical Amsterdam building in the popular district " De Pijp " with everything you need for a comfortable and unforgettable stay in Amsterdam.  The district is almost a little village within the city. Within walking distance you find popular sites as Heinken Museum, Leidseplein, Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum, Paradiso, the Royal concert hall and many more. The Apartment itself is located on the most famous market of Amsterdam the Albert Cuyp market.  Facilities; airco- bath - douche - spacious kitchen with 6 burner stove - fridge+freezer - quooker - rooftop terras with lounge - WiFi - walk in closet - washing machine - drying machine - separate toilet - fohn - kitchen equipment - nespresso - microwave - 2 big flatscreen televisions ( living room and bedroom ) - working desk with laptop stand and printer- free WiFi  We will make sure you can feel at home during your stay ! column5: Family house at dyke + great garden + free parking
column6: This amazing house is perfect for family's and couples. The house offers a spacious living room and a living kitchen with dining table and view over the lake.  Enjoy the spacious garden with trampoline and great view over the water. The house is situated at a beautiful dyke in a calm area close to Amsterdam: Durgerdam.  You are in 30 minutes in the city centre!
column7: This amazing family dyke house offers at dyke level a spacious living room and modern kitchen with a stunning view to the lake at front side of the house and the endless meadows at the back side. At first floor you find two bedrooms: one romantic bedroom with double size bed and one bedroom with two single beds. Lovely extra livingroom at garden level with direct access to the large garden with trampoline: perfect to relax or play. Last but not least the large balcony at backside of the house bordering the kitchen area. I'm sure you will enjoy your stay at my place.
column8: This amazing house is perfect for family's and couples. The house offers a spacious living room and a living kitchen with dining table and view over the lake.  Enjoy the spacious garden with trampoline and great view over the water. The house is situated at a beautiful dyke in a calm area close to Amsterdam: Durgerdam.  You are in 30 minutes in the city centre! This amazing family dyke house offers at dyke level a spacious living room and modern kitchen with a stunning view to the lake at front side of the house and the endless meadows at the back side. column10: The house is situated in a calm little village called Durgerdam next to Amsterdam: The Durgerdammerdijk is a lovely, authentic, very popular dyke with at the front side of the house a view over the small harbour and a small beach at the IJmeer, really nice to have a dip after a day in the city.
column11: In the garden there are chickens, the neighbours take care of them. Also there are two lovely cats in the house you need to take care of.
column12: You can get to the house from Central Station by bus, it takes around 30 minutes. In the city centre you can rent bikes at several places or you can use the public transportation like trams and metro's to travel with.  By car: It is free parking at the parking place at the end of the village, 250 meters from the house. If you want to use the car to get into the city you can drive to closeby P+R park your car and take tram to Central Station (10 minutes), or Bus to East side of Amsterdam.
column13: You have full and private access to the house during your stay.
column14: For the rental of my house I asked Awaykey to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you. We look forward to hosting you.
column15: - Our home is only suited for families, couples and business trips. - Please respect the house and the neighbourhood: quiet time after 9 pm. - We charge €30 for late check ins after 8.00 PM. - Let us know your estimated time of arrival ánd departure as soon as possible. - No smoking inside  - No loud music - No parties - No drugs - No guests In case of breaking one of the rules you will be charged with a penalty of €200 per broken rule.
column25: Hello I am Zander. Together with my family I live at a nice dyke in Durgerdam, a picturesque village at the lake close to Amsterdam. I am excited about renting our house to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam and love to stay in calm area.

column5: Jordaan apartment on a canal with fire place
column6: The apartment is in the most beautiful area of Amsterdam - Jordaan. The modern top floor apartment is in a Unesco Heritage listed building and overlooks a beautiful canal. The king size bed and free standing bath and fireplace are perfect for relaxing after a busy day exploring the galleries, bars, restaurants and boutiques of the area. It's the perfect place for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
column7: The modern apartment is in a traditional building originally built in 1650 set on a canal - just like the postcards. Entry is up four flights of stairs in the typical Amsterdam style - steep! You're rewarded with a top floor view over one of the most beautiful canals in Amsterdam. The apartment is over two levels. The living and kitchen areas are on the first floor. The open plan bedroom, bathroom and wardrobe are on the second floor.

column6: Come visit Amsterdam and stay in this 2-bedroom 95m2 apartment right next to the lively Westerpark and Jordaan area. It has 2 separate bedrooms with double beds, a spacious living room with a modern kitchen, dining table, balcony and great sofa!
column7: If your looking for a nice apartment to spend your time in Amsterdam, look no further! This 2nd floor fresh 95m2 is suited with everything to fill you needs. The central heated apartment has a modern but also authentic look and feel. The living area has a (big) open kitchen (incl. stove with oven, fridge, dishwasher, hot water cooker, toaster and necessary kitchen gear), big dining table, sofa, piano, tv and a very fast WIFI connection. The dining and kitchen are connected to a balcony (5m2). A separate bedroom sleeps 2 (double bed). A second bedroom also has a matras for 2 (double bed). There is also a possibility to sleep 1 on the sofa / couch on the living room. There is a small, but nice bathroom with shower, sink and washing machine. And a separate toilet. Clean sheets and towels will be waiting for you.  Please note we have a minimum stay of 2 nights. The apartment is ideal for couples, friends and business travelers.

The house is also close to the historic city centre of Amsterdam: Dam Square, Leidseplein, Museumplein, etc. are just a 15 min. tram ride away!

column5: Quiet and bright 3rd floor flat in the trendy East
column6: My quiet and light 3rd floor apartment is based just off the beaten track of Indischebuurt. Within 5 minutes you can either be in the serene nature of Flevopark, or amongst the hustle and bustle of Javastraat and it's famous Dappermarkt. Take your pick :) The flat is suitable for couples, solo adventurers and business travellers.
column7: The 50m2 apartment is light and airy due to the large windows in bedroom and living room. The sun rises on the bedroom side, so you can wake up to lots of light before taking your breakfast out to the balcony - though if you're not such a morning person, you can use the electric blinds plus curtains to keep the light out. The living room and kitchen get most of the afternoon and evening light. It's a great space to cook / eat on a sunny evening with the windows and doors wide open. The TV has extended TV packages, DVD player, and also a chromecast so if you download the chromecast app and then netflix or spotify etc. you can transfer movies to the TV via the wifi. Amenities: Towels, bedding, shower gel, toilet paper, Wifi, TV, Digi box, DVD Player, chromecast, hairdryer, washing machine, dishwasher, cooking essentials (oil, herbs, butter etc.) and electric bedroom blinds

column10: The flat is excellently located on a quiet suburban street. The neighbourhood is great, very quiet and calm, but within 5 minutes walk you can be in the heart of Javastraat which leads onto the Dappermarkt (market). It's a bustling and vibrant area with lots of cool bars, shops and restaurants. There's also a lovely park (Flevopark) within 5 minute walk, where you can go for a walk / run / sit and enjoy a small glass of Dutch jenever overlooking the lake. Favourite bars include Bar Botanique, Bar Basquiat and Brouwerij t'iJ (the local brewery serving many a tasty beer!)
column11: No parties / events No noise after 23:00 Enter and leave the building quietly (as the stairways are noisy) No smoking inside
column12: Schipol airport is around 45mins away via Centraal Station. Once you arrive, I would highly recommend you hire a bike to get around.  But if that's not your bag, transport links are easily accessible from the flat to take you to Centraal Station (15 mins), the Pijp, Museumplein, Leidseplein, Rembrandtplein, the Jordaan and further. More info shared in the confirmation documents :)
column14: I'll be available on phone throughout your stay, and if i am not in the country, will have allocated a friend who can help out in my absence to get you settled into the flat.
column25:
Hello :)

I'm Lucie, I'm a digital designer based in Amsterdam - though originally from Scotland. I love to go to new places, and meet new people. I'm really interested in art and photography, and love to go to galleries and museums and soak up different local cultures. I am very friendly and personable, and like to meet new people - especially when it involves nice food and good wine. 

I'm so excited about airbnb because it has opened up a new door to go and experience new places in a much different way from if I were staying in a hostel or standard hotel. I can't wait to visit some new cities while staying in some lovely authentic homes. Let the adventure begin :)

column6: Spacious and comfortable familyhouse, nearby the citybeach, with our own parkingplace in our sunny and green garden. Lots of children toys to play with.
column7: We have a lovely fireplace and a sunny garden.  The house is provided with underfloor heating which can be set for every room apart.  A modern open kitchen provided with a regular oven and a steamoven. The counter has two  heights, which makes it comfortable for both tall and smaller chefs to work on.  Our bathroom comes with a rain shower head and a large bath.

column10: The citybeach 'Blijburg', it's fantastic restaurant and the surfschool is reacheable within a ten minute walk.  Also within a ten minute walk:  - a small harbour surrounded by restaurants and a cosy market on Saturday.  - Theo van Goghpark, a sunny and green park with a ravishing playground. - outstanding restaurants recommanded by Tripadvisor or as an Iens Topper.  The World of Food, Amsterdams' biggest indoor streetfoodmarket is reachable within 20 minutes by bus towards Bijlmer Arena.
column11: SUPERMARKET The closest supermarket is within a 10 min walk. It's called 'Multi Tokorien'. Originally a turkish supermarket, with turkish groceries. Nowadays they sell dutch and asian groceries. Adress: pampuslaan 11-19. Run by a turkish family, very friendly and helpfull people.  The second one is a bit further. It's called the 'Albert Heijn'. A very well known grocery store in Holland. Adres: IJburglaan 719.  By tram it will take you only two or three minutes, but you have to walk to the tram first. Approximately 15 min in a slow pace. Tramstop: Eindhalte - Vennepluimstraat (this is the stop for you to step out of the tram for the supermarket). Every five minutes another tram. Another way to reach this supermarket is by bus. The busstop is within a 7 min walk ( slow pace) and it's called 'Peter Martensstraat'. Endstop: Vennepluimstraat. The bus will take 5-6 minutes. Every 15 minutes another bus.
column12: INFORMATION (PUBLIC) TRANSPORT  1. A place to park your car is on our property. The carport is in our garden. Guests are able to use this carport. 2. The best way to reach the centre of Amsterdam is by tram. Line 26 -Amsterdam centraal (= central station). It's the same tram towards the supermarket 'Albert Heijn'. For the supermarket you have to stop at tramstation 'Vennepluimstraat'. For the centre of Amsterdam, you'll have to stop at 'Centraal station'. It's the end of line 26 as well. Tramtickets can be bought directly at the tramdriver.

column11: The easiest way to get around in Amsterdam is on a bike. We recommend the Black-Bikes Amsterdam, as they have 13 locations around the city where you can pick bikes up and drop them off, including close to our home.
column12: From the airport: the train + subway is cheap and fast (~30 mins). There is a frequent train until late from the airport (at least until midnight). It typically leaves from platform 3 at the airport. Take the train that stops at Amsterdam Central. From Amsterdam Central take either subway #51, #53 or #54 (they all go in one direction). In all cases, get out at the stop called 'Weesperplein, which is the 3rd stop'. From Weesperplein it is about 8 min walking (700 m). You can buy a train ticket at the blue/yellow ticket machine in the main hall before you enter the platform. The subway ticket you can buy downstairs when exiting Amsterdam Central Station. You can also buy a multi-day tourist card for the tram/subway at a good value at any station. There is also the 'i amsterdam city card' (great value if you plan to visit many of the museums etc. and want to go on a canal cruise, which is for free then).

column25:
H401 is the name of a 17th century canal house in the very centre of Amsterdam at one of the most beautiful canal conjunctions. The house has a stunning history as a hiding place during WWII, but other than the Anne Frank house the building is still used for living and working . In their gallery and studio space H401 features a unique high end cultural programme based on the history of the house that has always been a magnet for artists, writers and people on the move. Castrum Peregrini was the code name during the war and literally translates as 'castle of the pilgrim'. The original hiding place is still preserved and the various floors and spaces represent the houses vibrant history since the 1940s.

We are three friends, Michael, Frans and Lars that run H401 today and we also live in the building, which is big enough to be a universe in itself. We offer three luxurious independent guest appartments, both recently restored in a minimalist manner, with a stunning view to the canal in the front  facing a row of historic 17th century gables and the monumental Krijtberg Church in the back. The rooms offer the unique experience of a historic place with contemprary comfort (state of the art beds, linen, towels etc) The appartments offer equiped kitchens and coffee, tea, and some simple breakfast incredients. Though the accomodations are situated at a quite part of the famous 'gouden bocht' of the Herengracht, the lively and fashionable nine streets are just a stone's throw away; they offer stylish cafes, bars, shops, lunch and diner possibilities. All famous sites and musea are walking distance. Amsterdam at its very best!

column5: Entire monumental house in the heart of Amsterdam!
column6: Welcome to our home in the heart of Amsterdam! From our house you are within walking distance of Museum Square, Leidseplein, Vondelpark, the Canals and many other great sights. We are renting out our entire house, so you have a lot of space and privacy. The photos are of the two bedrooms for our guests, one with a king-size bed and another with twin beds, and the spacious living & dining room.  We are a family with 3 young kids, so also we have facilities for younger guests if needed!
column7: Welcome to our spacious and comfortable house in the heart of Amsterdam! The living room, dining room and kitchen are on the ground floor, which has a very comfortable and spacious feel thanks to its 4.5m high ceilings and floor-to-ceiling windows. The floor is ~80sqm / 850 sqft. The two bedrooms are on the same floor, both with an en suite bathroom. One of the bedrooms has a king-size bed, the other twin beds. The other floors of the house are open to the guests, except for the master bedroom which we will keep locked.  We have three kids of 6, 4 and 8 months old, so have all the facilities a family with young kids might need!

You can go for a walk (or run!) through the Vondelpark, which is around the corner.   Its a 10 min walk to the Hallen, a food market that is very popular in Amsterdam.

column6: Welcome to our spacious home (100m2) in the hip East area of town. It's a very nice neighborhood, ideal for families who want to enjoy Amsterdam in a relaxed way. It is only about 10 minutes by tram and you’re in the middle of city centre. Special features of this house are the: green view onto the park, authentic 1930’s elements, the modern, open kitchen, the double shower and the spacious and sunny roof deck. Welcome!
column7: When you enter the front door, there is a stairway to the first floor. On the first floor, there is a spacious living room at the front with two couches and a big screen TV and DVD player. At the back of the first floor, there is a modern, open kitchen with dining room. The living room and dining room are connected via an authentic 1930’s en suite. There is also a toilet on the first floor. On the second floor, there are two bedrooms, a study, a bathroom, and a toilet. The master bedroom is situated at the front of the house. Another large bedroom and the study are at the back of the second floor. The bathroom is situated in the middle of the second floor. It contains a shower cabin with two showers, a bath and a sink. On the third floor there a 25 square meter roof deck. On the roof deck there is a sandbox and a play house. Lovely for warm spring and summer days!

column10: Watergraafsmeer is a nice and quiet neighborhood with a lot of green and playing facilities for kids. A big playground and a petting zoo (“kinderboerderij”) are within 5 minutes walking distance. And the square in front of the house is an excellent spot to (learn to) ride a bike. It has a shopping street close by for groceries, enjoying a coffee, etc. The city centre is only 10 minutes by tram, or 15 minutes by bicycle.
column11: Please be kind and respectful to our neighbors and take of your shoes in the house. Much appreciated!
column12: Tram stop ‘Hugo de Vrieslaan’ is only a 5 minute walk away. Tram 9 takes you to the city centre in about 10 minutes from there. There is enough parking space on the street. It is paid parking, hourly rate of 2,40 euros from Monday to Saturday from 9:00 to 21:00. Amsterdam Science Park train station is also about a 5 minute walk away. From there you can get to Amsterdam Central station and Schiphol Airport by train.
column13: You will have access to almost the entire apartment, including the two balconies and the roof deck. We keep a part of the attic to store our personal items. Because our washing machine is unreliable (it frequently leaks and/or breaks down), you will not have access to it.

column15: GENERAL HOUSE RULES Thanks for booking our place. We hope that you will have a great time here. Below you’ll find some general house rules and instructions. Please read them carefully and enjoy your stay. Not allowed: - Extra guests - Smoking anywhere inside the building - House parties, drugs and/or loud music Garbage: - Please take the garbage out only on trash pickup days or dump it in a container outside. More information about when to take out the garbage can by found in the information book in the house. Keys: - Please be careful with the keys. If you lose a set, we may have to charge you the costs for replacing the locks. - Never leave the key inside the lock on the inside of the door when you leave the house. If that happens, the door can’t be opened from the outside and we have to call a locksmith. - If you lock yourself out, any potential costs for the locksmith will be charged to you. --------------------------------------------------------------- ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE Check

Very cheap (from 7,50 euro), and very nice for students and families. I leave close to a shoppingcentre (clothes, parfume, food, health etc) and there are very often markets with fresh food and bakery, just 5 minutes walk. I live also close to the theatre and sportcentre with new swimmingpool and parks. Free parking: unique in Amsterdam. Close to public transport (bus, metro). Train -Bijlmer Arena- to the airport (by bus just 5 minutes).If you’d like to pick up some African fufu, authentic Japanese sushi or a plate of grills from Turkey – and would rather not spend a fortune on airfare – then you’re in the right neighbourhood. column5: Green paradise studio next to the Vondelpark
column6: In my beautiful town garden you'll find your private renovated studio.  You are in the middle of a unique green paradise, a place of peace and quiet. And just around the corner the lovely Vondelpark and the bustling city with plenty cafes and restaurants. And the tram which takes you to the inner city in just 10 minutes. The direct bus to Schiphol is a few minutes walking. You can lend my two bikes for free (my size, 1,78m), to explore Amsterdam cycling.
column7: The studio of 21m2 is in a real green paradise in my garden. It is a unique place to stay. You have a lot of privacy. No adjacent neighbours. The studio comes with a kitchen with microwave, refrigerator, a Nespresso coffee machine, Nespresso milk frother, a water cooker, an assortment of coffee cups and an assortment of tea bags. You can have your meals at the table, where you can also put your laptop. In the comfortable double bed (160 x 200 cm) you'll sleep like a rose.  You'll also find a wardrobe, next to the bed. And you have your own private bathroom, with shower and sink and toilet. To go into the studio, you have to walk through my house: one straight line from the front door. I don't mind you walking through the house, and in fact it is very handy in case you have questions. Of course I provide the bed linens and the towels. You'll also have a hair dryer at your disposal. For small children (0-2) there is a cot available, including bed linens, and a high chair.
column8: In my beautiful town garden you'll find your private renovated studio.  You are in the middle of a unique green paradise, a place of peace and quiet. column10: The studio is behind my apartment in a quiet street, but just around the corner you can find lots of cafes, restaurants, shops and of course the Vondelpark. The Museum Quarter is 8 minutes away.
column11: If I have other guests the same day, and you arrive before check-in time, you can leave your luggage, to pick it up later. The same goes if you leave late. You can lend two of my bicycles, if you'd like to explore the city by bike. Replacing the bikes when stolen will cost € 600.
column12: Public Transport is very close. In just two minutes walking you'll find the tram which will take you to the heart of Amsterdam. That takes 15 minutes. Six minutes walking from my place will bring you to bus 197, that goes directly to Schiphol Airport. The bus will take you there in 20 minutes.
column14: I am available to inform you on everything Amsterdam has to offer and to help you in any way I can.
column15: Do as if you're home and please treat the studio as such. With the set of two keys (replacing the keys will cost € 30) the doors must be locked every time you leave or enter the house.  As I am living in the building myself and other people on the floors above, please be quiet, especially during the night. Absolutely no smoking inside the studio. No smoking in the garden, as you share it with me. Smoking inside will be fined with € 300. You can lend you two of my bikes. They are fit for somewhat taller people (over 1.70 m). I will show you the bikes and how to lock them. Replacing the bikes, when stolen, will cost you € 600 (including locks), € 300 per bicycle.
column25:
I live in Amsterdam near the Vondelpark. I work as an interim manager, for companies and institutions that like to be ready for the future. I help them with that. 
I currently work with the public transport company of Amsterdam, GVB.
I love to receive guests from all over the world and tell them about the beautiful and wonderful city I live in.
