column5: Nice and cosy room across the Westerpark
column6: The apartment is across the Westerpark with several possibilities to hang out (Pacific Parc, Westergasfabriek, North Sea Jazz Club or just your own picknick). Close to Amsterdam Central Station and the centre. The room is 15 square meters, has two single beds and is suitable for couples and solo-adventurers. Sheets and towels are included.
column7: The room is just redecorated and very light. You will have a view on our garden and the communal garden behind ours, so actually a very green view. It could be that you will awake by the sounds of the birds. It's quiet, no noise from cars.
column8: The apartment is across the Westerpark with several possibilities to hang out (Pacific Parc, Westergasfabriek, North Sea Jazz Club or just your own picknick). Close to Amsterdam Central Station and the centre. The room is 15 square meters, has two single beds and is suitable for couples and solo-adventurers. Sheets and towels are included. The room is just redecorated and very light. You will have a view on our garden and the communal garden behind ours, so actually a very green view. It could be that you will awake by the sounds of the birds. It's quiet, no noise from cars. Guests have access to their private room, bathroom and toilet. No access to the rest of the apartment. If needed we can advise or help you find spots you need to see. In the room we have a map from Amsterdam.  In case you need help while on your way, don't hestitate to give us a call or text a message. The neighbourhood is nice, everything you need is just around the corner. A postoffice, groceriestore, drugstore.
column10: The neighbourhood is nice, everything you need is just around the corner. A postoffice, groceriestore, drugstore. For breakfast you can cross the Haarlemmerweg to go to the Bakkerswinkel. They have very nice Dutch breakfasts or a coffee to go if you'd like to go for a walk in the park. Several restaurants (Fish, Italian, Dutch) nearby for a nice dinner. Walking distance to the Jordaan (famous 9 streets to shop) or to go shopping at the Haarlemmerdijk/Haarlemmerstraat.
column11: Make sure you leave the door of your room closed at night, unless you like to have one of our furry home-mates into your room ;-) If you come home late at night, please be aware of our sleeping neighbours. The hallway can be noisy if you speak up loud.
column12: The tram stops at around the corner, a few minutes walking, and will take you to the city center in 15 minutes.  Bus stop is about 800 meters, with a direct connection to Amsterdam central station (less than 10 minutes)
column13: Guests have access to their private room, bathroom and toilet. No access to the rest of the apartment.
column14: If needed we can advise or help you find spots you need to see. In the room we have a map from Amsterdam.  In case you need help while on your way, don't hestitate to give us a call or text a message.
column15: - Private room with shared bathroom - No direct access to the rest of the apartment - There are cats staying with us - No excess noise please.

column5: Trendy 70m2 apartment, water view & great location
column6: Our apartment is located in the trendy and upcoming part, called 'Spaarndammerbuurt'.  Public transportation, famous neighborhood 'Jordaan' and vibrant 'Westerpark' are within walking distance. You’ll love our place because of the 70m2 of private space, newly renovated with warm interior, and the morning sun in front of a balcony with water view! Our apartment especially likes to welcome couples, small families and business people that go in and around Amsterdam for a great time.
column7: You’ll have full private access to our 70m2 apartment. It has a big kitchen, warm interior, separate bathroom & toilet, a bath tub and is generally free of loud people.  The bedroom has a large bed (180cm x 210cm) with comfy mattresses. As the curtains block out light very well your good night's rest is well assured. Don't forget to catch the morning sun in front of the balcony with the beautiful water view!

column10: Our apartment is close to a bus stop (150m) which brings you to Central Station in 7 minutes, every 20 minutes. You can also walk or take the bike to Central Station as it's only 2km. It's also close to the beautiful Westerpark (600m) with all of its green and trendy places to drink and eat. Also walk through the Spaarndammer street and the Haarlemmer street. They're full of hip shops and places to eat and are just a few minutes away. The Royal Palace is at 2,5km distance.
column11: Please watch out with water on the wooden floor, when you use the bathroom or kitchen. If you dry it right away, then there is no problem. Please don't hesitate to use an extra towel for it.
column12: Renting a bike is of course the most authentic way to travel around Amsterdam. It can be quite busy on the bike lanes so be careful. Ask for a bike rental place to someone at the Central Station, you can find them everywhere. If you want to travel with public transport I recommend the Amsterdam Travel Ticket which you can purchase at the Schiphol Airport or the Central Station. It's only €25 for three days, gets you a return trip from/to the airport into Amsterdam and it allows you to travel with all blue (GVB) bus, metro, tram and ferry lines.
column14: I'll be available via AirBnB, phone and email. Don't hesitate to contact with any questions.
column15: After 10 PM no noise please. Watch out with water on the floor, please use a towel right away.

column5: Spacious and light apartment in Amsterdam
column6: Our 90 sqm. apartment offers light and modern comfort. The baby bed, the toys and books of our 3-yo son are ideal for families. We hope you will also love the quiet energy and the clean lines. Our neighbourhood is surrounded by a natural reserve, a park and a beach. If you do not feel like cycling, the tram will bring you to Amsterdam City Centre / Central station within 20mn.
column8: Our 90 sqm. apartment offers light and modern comfort. The baby bed, the toys and books of our 3-yo son are ideal for families. We hope you will also love the quiet energy and the clean lines. Our neighbourhood is surrounded by a natural reserve, a park and a beach. If you do not feel like cycling, the tram will bring you to Amsterdam City Centre / Central station within 20mn. Tram 26 connects IJburg to Amsterdam Centraal within 20mn.  There are plenty of parking spots around our building, 2,4 euros per hour, 14,4 euros a day between 9am and 7pm and free on Sunday.   Another parking option is to leave your car at Park&Ride Zeeburg (URL HIDDEN)  The conditions to use Park&Ride is to travel to Amsterdam City centre by public transport (with the super convenient Tram 26).  Cycling to Amsterdam from IJburg is also possible and the path thru Diemerpark is lovely. Plan 30mn between our flat and the Artis Zoo in East Amsterdam for example.

column5: Cool & renovated apartment in a much cooler city
column6: The apartment is located in the upcoming district Van Lennepbuurt in the neighborhood Amsterdam West. This district is named after the Dutch writer & politician Jacob van Lennep. The place itself is newly renovated last year. Everything from the kitchen to the living room and the bathroom is new. Furthermore, it has a great sunny terrace that you definitely will love! We hope that you'll enjoy the apartment as much as we do.
column7: The place itself is newly renovated last year. Everything from the kitchen to the living room and the bathroom is new. Also there's a 10m2 balcony with proper lounging furniture. Furthermore are two TV's, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Both of them are connected to our NETFLIX account. You're freely able to use our account during your stay. Additionally, it is good to know that the apartment is located at the 4th floor. So you will have your cardio even when you are on holiday!

You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and l
column10: Oud West is close to the city-centre and close to both Vondelpark and Rembrandtpark. Ten Katestraat market is an excellent outdoor market with its charming cross-street ‘Bellamystraat’ giving the area an old-fashion village vibe – complete with dance studio and blacksmith. Kinkerstraat is a multicultural area with a large shopping street filled with bars, restaurants, clothes etc. It’s criss-crossed with commercial streets, including Overtoom which has become a major interiors boulevard. Two of the city’s more interesting alternative cultural complexes, OT301 and Lab111, which both mix music, film and art, are located here. But for a real taste for the relaxed diversity of this neighbourhood, visit the sprawling terrace of Du Cap to truly witness all walks of life. And again: the whole city is pretty much nearby.
column11: Normal check-in and check-out times: Check-out  11:00 am. Check-in  before 21:00 pm. Check in after 21:00 is possible but it costs an additional of 20,- euro. After 0:00, we ask an additional 50 euro. For other in- and check-out times please contact me. Are you interested in a late check out? Please check the availability 2 days before your check out date. If the apartment is available we offer a late check-out at 14:00 for an additional charge of 20 euro.
column12: The fastest way to get to the apartment via Schiphol is to take the train towards Amsterdam Lelylaan and transfer to tram line 17. After the transfer leave at stop Jan Pieter Heijestraat, then it's just a short walk to the apartment. From Central Station take tram line 17 and leave at stop Jan Pieter Heijestraat, then it's just a short walk to the apartment.
column13: You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others.
column14: Iamb&b will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and if you like in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance.
column15: Please don't trash the place, don't smoke inside or be loud at night. Other than that, enjoy as it is your own apartment.
column25:
Hi!

We are Jorinde and Wouter and we currently living and working in Amsterdam. Jorinde is working as a physiotherapist near Amsterdam and I am working in the financial sector in Amsterdam. We recently moved in Amsterdam, in the lovely Oud West district. Where we completely renovated our apartment. We would like to give the opportunity to other travelers who want to explore the beautiful city Amsterdam, while we are abroad exploring other great parts of the world.

I live in Amsterdam and work as a trainer / consultant in fashion. I like to work out, ride my motorbike, enjoy the beach and good food.

When I am abroad I prefer to eat local cuisine, go where the locals go and avoid the touristic crowds as much as possible. Always eager to learn a bit of the language that is spoken. Looking forward to meeting new people and learning new things.

column5: Comfortable Room in De Pijp in a lively area.
column6: A super cozy renovated apartment in the trendy neighbourhood of Amsterdam in walking distance of cafes,pubs,super market,public transportation etc. Only 15 min by taxi and 30 min by public transport from the airport. Perfect for a city break for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers.
column7: You have your own private room and private bathroom. We will provide you with bed linen, towels, shampoo etc, all you need to do is be here yourself. Cafés, restaurants and nice specialty shops are within walking distance. The apartment was refurbished in 2014.
column8: A super cozy renovated apartment in the trendy neighbourhood of Amsterdam in walking distance of cafes,pubs,super market,public transportation etc. Only 15 min by taxi and 30 min by public transport from the airport. Perfect for a city break for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers. You have your own private room and private bathroom. We will provide you with bed linen, towels, shampoo etc, all you need to do is be here yourself. Cafés, restaurants and nice specialty shops are within walking distance. The apartment was refurbished in 2014. You will be able move around the apartment freely, make use of the modern kitchen with all the necessary equipment, the cozy living room and so on. We share the apartment with 2 people, but are hardly here at the same time. One of us works and the other is doing her second master degree in the university.  Both of us have been living in Amsterdam for quite some time already and know our way around. We are more than happy to give you tips
column10: The neighbourhood is very vibrant, with nice bars and restaurants nearby and of course the famous Albert Cuyp market for your daily fresh produce! De Pijp, which used to be the old labour part of town is now one of the most cosmopolitan and vibrant districts of Amsterdam. Within 5 min walk or short tram ride at most nice Amsterdam hotspots! Albert Heijn supermarket is a 3 minute walk!
column12: There is a tram stop 3 minute walk away, which takes you directly to: Central station Citycentre  Utrechtse straat  Dam square Museumsquare  PC Hooftstraat

column15: Even though we would love you to feel just like at home we have a few house rules. You are given access to the front door, so you are welcome to come and go as you please. column5: House at dyke with garden + free parking
column6: This house is situated at a great monumental dyke. With great living kitchen and separate livingroom both with lovely view over the dyke.  The two bedrooms makes the house perfect for a couples with an additional person. The house offers a beautiful garden which is perfect to relax after a busy day in the city. There's free parking in this area. The dyke is calm and within 20 minutes you are in the middle of the city centre by bus or bike!
column7: At ground floor you find the modern living kitchen plus dinner table next to the separate livingroom both with great view to the dyke. The house has at front ánd back side nice large gardens. There are chickens at the end of the back garden, taken care of by the neighbour. The garden gives you sun through the whole day.  There are 2 bedrooms: one cozy bedroom with single size bed for two at the first floor and one convertible sofa for two in the quiet living room with gardenview. The clean bathroom with shower is situated at first floor.  An extra is the free parking in this area! This house is perfect for small family's or couples.

column10: Situated north of the IJ River, the apartment encourages you to explore authentic Dutch life unspoilt by the tourist crowds. Safe and peaceful, the surrounding area is home to two beautiful natural highlights adored by the local community, the Florapark and the Vliegenbos. The latter has existed for over 100 years as a charming city forest, highly recommended for a leisurely stroll or picnic. Several cafes, restaurants and stores can be found within easy reach and the impressive EYE Film Theatre and Museum ánd Adam Tower is accessible by bike in less than ten minutes. Discovering Amsterdam’s historic core, home to such famous highlights as Dam Square, the Red Light District and the Canal Belt, is simple. The nearby bus link allows access to Central Station in just twelve minutes, although a brief bike ride to the water’s edge provides an alternative method, with a series of ferries departing across the IJ free of charge on a regular basis.
column11: There are two sweet cats in the house. Hilda, the neighbour is taking care for them if necessary. The other neighbour, Marieke, is taking care of the chickens.
column12: You can easily get to the house by bus from Central Station, or by bike with the 24/7 free ferries. Both around fifteen minutes. Bike rental just around the corner.
column13: You have full and private access to the house during your stay.
column14: For the rental of my house I asked Jolanda and Rob from Home2host to take care of everything, from the booking, the welcome at the house, the cleaning of my house after your stay. They will also handle all communication with you.
column15: Please respect the house and the neighbourhood. No smoking inside, no loud music, parties or drugs. Let us know your estimated time of arrival ánd departure as soon as possible.  We charge €20 for late check ins after 9.00 PM.
column25: Hello I am Chris. I live in the north part of Amsterdam. I am excited about renting my dear house to people who want to explore the great city of Amsterdam and enjoy living at a calm authentic dyke.

column25:
Hi all,

My name is Jasmijn (30 years). Born on Marken and raised since the age of 8 in Amsterdam. I'm working as an accountmanager for a Boat company in luxery private boat cruises her on our famous canals. 
Sharing my 3 bedroom appartment with my adorable and friendly cats (Phoebe and Hazel). 
Love to travel, cook, explore good restaurants, dance (salsa), watch movies from the couch and in the cinema, practice yoga and nature.

column5: Private room next to Vondelpark & Museumsquare
column6: This lovely apartment is located next to the famous Vondelpark, and in the middle of the city’s cultural hotspot (Van Gogh Museum!). Comfortable apartment with spacious livingroom and an ideal location: all of Amsterdam’s major highlights are only a stone’s throw away!
column7: This apartment is light, has a spacious living- and diningroom with romantic French doors that give access to a lovely garden.  Start your day by getting a freshly-brewed to-go coffee at the coffeeplace just down the street, and enjoy the sunlight and a nice breakfast in the garden.  We have a small but cosy bathroom where you can take a warm shower and get yourself ready for the day. You can prepare a meal in the fully-equipped open kitchen which is linked to the livingroom via a counter. After dinner, you can take a stroll through the gorgeous Vondelpark. It’s at its most beautiful with the sun just setting. After your night in a trendy bar nearby, a fresh bed is waiting for you.  APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS -Located in the cultural hotspot of Amsterdam and next to the famous Vondelpark -Spacious living- and diningroom with French doors -Big garden accessible through French doors -One bedroom suitable for two people

column10: This apartment is situated in a truly ideal location. In beautiful Old-South you’re within walking distance of Museumsquare. Within a 5 minute walk you can visit the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Stedelijk Museum and Concertgebouw (concertbuilding) for the best classical music of the Netherlands.  Have a lovely stroll or picknick at the famous Vondelpark, which is literally next door. This park is beautiful and in the summers always buzzing with people.  There are plenty of lunchrooms, coffeecorners, trendy pubs and charming restaurants in this neighbourhood.  When it's time for dinner you can also go to the supermarket at the Museumsquare of visit the well-known Albert Cuyp Market (10 minutes by bike) for some fresh fruits and veggies to make your own meal or picknick.  We have a lot more tips for the best cultural activities, music venues, restaurants, bars, clubs or theatres. Feel free to ask! And the best part is: it’s all just a stone’s throw away. column12: Perfect public transport possibilities. You can reach any destination in no time by tram or bus. We recommend though to rent a bike. There's a good bike-rental just down the street.

When traveling we mostly enjoy city-trips; having some nice food with a great view.

column6: This modern but cosy family-home on the waterside is located in the Eastern Docklands (Amsterdam East). The house has 3 levels, with daylight in each room and a small terrace facing the water. Great facilities on walking distance: traiteur, restaurants, public transportation, supermarkets). On just 10 bike-minutes from Central Station, Dam Square, Oosterpark or Flevopark(bad). Ideal home for family with kids (play- and swim area). Free parking (1 car) in carport, and space for 7 bikes.
column7: The house has day-light from many angles making it a pleasant and comfortable environment. Its location is in Amsterdam East close to the city center and all the other facilities this beautiful city has to offer. Lively street live in summer with swimming in front of the house.

column25:
The last couple of years revolved around finishing my neuroscience study, which is sadly coming to an end.
Next to my study I like to read, listen to music (altough i'd rather go to concerts), surf whenever possible in Holland and recently I started boxing but as I found out, getting punched in the face in not really my thing.

My Asian roots definitely found its way to the kitchen where I feel most comfortable :) I like traveling for longer periods of time outside of Europe as opposed to short holidays in Europe. Me and my girlfriend just came back from a half year trip around asia, which was great.

I would love to have you over so you can enjoy Amsterdam as much as I do.

Yoshi

Sarphatipark, the daily Albert Cuyp market and lots of cafés, restaurants and shops are just a few steps away. Ideal for visitors wanting to explore the city, but also a good place for business travelers since the apartment is near RAI congress centre and business district 'Zuidas' with good public transport connections.
column7: A nice private bedroom in a clean, bright and recently renovated apartment. Tea & coffee available in your room.

column25:
My name is Joris and I've been living in Amsterdam for about 20 years. Originally I come from the provence of Brabant (South of the Netherlands) and I came to Amsterdam to study. I stayed here because I love the people, energy, diversity and the many cafe's, restaurants, clubs, museums and other cool places. 

I'm a business developer and I work for different cultural companies, such as a company that offers theatre training. In my spare time I like to practice yoga and acting, swimming, cooking and reading. I have worked in the restaurant business for a long period during my studies and love to take care of, entertain and meet new people!

column5: Spacious and cosy apartment near Central Station
column6: This newly renovated apartment (85m2) is centrally located close to Jordaan, the canals, central station and Westerpark (all within walking distance) in the upcoming ‘Zeeheldenbuurt’. It has 2 bedrooms: 1 with a queen size bed (160x200) and 1 with a queen size sofa bed (160x200). There’s a large living room with open kitchen and bar. This is the perfect place to stay during your city trip in Amsterdam.!
column7: The space itself is newly renovated, newly furnished and all of the appliances are new. Furthermore the apartment is in walking distance of the Jordaan district and the city centre.
column8: This newly renovated apartment (85m2) is centrally located close to Jordaan, the canals, central station and Westerpark (all within walking distance) in the upcoming ‘Zeeheldenbuurt’. It has 2 bedrooms: 1 with a queen size bed (160x200) and 1 with a queen size sofa bed (160x200). There’s a large living room with open kitchen and bar. This is the perfect place to stay during your city trip in Amsterdam.! The space itself is newly renovated, newly furnished and all of the appliances are new. Furthermore the apartment is in walking distance of the Jordaan district and the city centre. You have access to the whole house with kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living room. You do not have to share this apartment with others. Iamb&b will let you in, hand you the keys and show you around in the house and if you like in Amsterdam. After that you can always call if you need any assistance. The ‘Zeeheldenbuurt’ is a quite and upcoming neighbourhood right next to the historical centre of Amsterdam. C
column10: The ‘Zeeheldenbuurt’ is a quite and upcoming neighbourhood right next to the historical centre of Amsterdam. Central Station, the Jordaan neighbourhood, the canals, the ‘Prinseneiland’, popular shopping street ‘Haarlemmerstraat’, the Westerstraat, the Noordermarket, the Westerpark and the raw and hip NDSM warf are just around the corner (all within 1,5 km). There are lots of nice bars and restaurants within walking distance. The centre and the museum area are easy to reach by public transport. Tram 3 will take you directly to Amsterdams most famous museums; Rijksmuseum, Van Goghmuseum and Stedelijk Museum.
column11: Normal check-in and check-out times: Check-out  11:00 am. Check-in  before 21:00 pm. Check in after 21:00 is possible but it costs an additional of 20,- euro. After 0:00, we ask an additional 50 euro. For other in- and check-out times please contact me.
column12: The fastest way to get to the apartment via public transport from Schiphol is to take the train towards Amsterdam Sloterdijk and transfer to bus line 22. And leave at stop Nova Zemblastraat, after that it's a short 10 min walk to the apartment. From Central Station take bus line 48 towards stop Barentszplein. After that it's a short 10 min walk to the apartment.

column25:
We’re a young couple who just bought and renovated our first house. I’m working as a manager in a child day care in Amsterdam, and my boyfriend is a journalist/documentary filmmaker. We both love our jobs and we really enjoy living in Amsterdam. To earn some extra money, we’re renting out our apartment. 
Some people may think that everybody in Amsterdam smokes and uses drugs. On the contrary, we don’t. We prefer hosting people who embrace the same way of life. Amsterdam is much more then a drugged city, and we’ll be happy to show you.

column6: Mijn ruimte is vlakbij  Beautiful spacious 4 bedroom apartment with a large living room on the second and fourth floor of the Biesboschstraat 39-2.  The property is located on the wide Biesboschstraat. One of the nicest locations in Rivieren area within walking distance of Maasstraat and Waalsstraat.  Especially the Maasstraat is known for its extensive range of delicatessen shops and cosy restaurants. The apartment is centrally located near the vibrant area De Pijp and Oud-Zuid and the Amsterdam RAI congress center is within a 5 minute walk. he city center is only a 10 minute bicycle ride away . Je zult genieten van mijn plek vanwege de gezelligheid, de ruimte, de ligging, het balkon. Mijn ruimte is geschikt voor stellen, zakenreizigers, gezinnen (met kinderen) en grote groepen.

column6: Due to the current COVID-19 situation we have a few apartments available directly for a 2 to 3 month stay with reduced rates. Please contact us for more info. Livia's Hideaway team is pleased to invite you to her charming two bedroom apartment hideaway nr 1 overlooking the beautiful and cosy Amstelveld square. Footsteps away from the Prinsengracht, this recently renovated apartment offers all the comfort and luxury you may expect in a contemporary home.
column7: The B&B is elegantly styled throughout and features a high ceiling and large windows, allowing an abundance of natural light into the living space. The spacious living area, which is decorated with an 18th century mirror and some fine pieces of antique Indian art, features a comfortable sofa, pouf, flat screen and writing desk, making it a great space to sit and relax after a long day of work or exploring the city. The two equally sized and beautifully decorated bedrooms are located on the backside of the space. Both rooms offer a double bed and more than enough storage room. The large French doors in both bedrooms allow access to the balcony. The family bathroom features a bath, shower, sink and toilet. This beautifully and cosy B&B is a perfect hideaway for families with children, couples and business guests seeking for a comfortable stay in Amsterdam.
column8: Due to the current COVID-19 situation we have a few apartments available directly for a 2 to 3 month stay with reduced rates. Please contact us for more info. Footsteps away from the Prinsengracht, this recently renovated apartment offers all the comfort and luxury you may expect in a contemporary home. The B&B is elegantly styled throughout and features a high ceiling and large windows, allowing an abundance of natural light into the living space. The spacious living area, which is decorated with an 18th century mirror and some fine pieces of antique Indian art, features a comfortable sofa, pouf, flat screen and writing desk, making it a great space to sit and relax after a long day of work or exploring the city. The two equally sized and beautifully decorated bedrooms are located on the backside of the space. Both rooms offer a doubl
column10: Livia’s Hideaway 1 is wonderfully situated on the edge of the famous canal belt, overlooking the Amsterveld square and Prinsengracht. This peaceful yet lively area has a lot to offer and creates the perfect opportunity for you to experience Amsterdam as a local. The Utrechtstreet and Rembrands square are just around the corner offering you a very nice selection of cool bars, local restaurants and trendy shops. Within 5 minutes walking distance you can find popular places such as the Amstel river, Hermitage Museum and Carré Royal Theatre. The Anne Frank House and museum square, home to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and museum of modern art, are just a 15-minute stroll away. Several picnic tables are situated just outside of the apartment which are at your disposal. It is a beautiful setting to enjoy each others company after a warm summer day, while your children are enjoying the playground on the Amstelveld square. The city is easily accessible by tram however, bike and boat rental
column11: Please note that this B&B is located in a residential area and therefore is not suitable for guests with the intention to party. Also please note that due to the Dutch architecture style of the building the B&B is only accessible true a steep stairway. Therefore, this B&B might not be suitable for guests with reduced mobility. The check-in for Livia’s Hideaway 1 Canalbelt is done at the B&B itself which is located on the Amstelveld 9, Amsterdam. The owner will be there to welcome you! Our check-in time is between 2PM and 8PM. A late check-in after 8PM comes with an additional charge of 50EUR. Please let us know what your time of arrival is!
column25: Hi there! We’re CAP Homes in Amsterdam. Together with our local hosts and over 50 holiday homes distributed across prime locations in the heart of Amsterdam, we are here to make your stay unforgettable. Since 2015, we have been focused on offering holiday accommodations by selecting only the best and coziest apartments in the city for you. We're created several projects as Harbour Suites, Livia's Hideaway and De Vergulden Eenhoorn. We love to focus on personal experience but as well easy/modern way of traveling. Please gloss over our listings carefully to be sure we are good fit for your trip! We appreciate some few words about yourself with your booking, so we get to know each other a bit more before your trip! Thanks!

column6: Our friendly townhouse is beautifully situated near Vondelpark, museum district and entertainment area. It is an excellent starting point for your exploration of Amsterdam because public transport is very close. You will feel at ease in the cosy basement with its comfortable bathroom. Weather depending, you might enjoy our garden, too.
column7: Our guests have the basement and the bathroom to themselves. Although there is no kitchen, coffee and tea can be made and a bar cooler is present.  Our guests have access to the garden. Weather depending they could sit outside. Due to it being a courtyard our neighbours need to be respected at all times. (i.e. we ask our guests to refrain from having telephone conversations in the garden, refrain from smoking our talking loudly etcetera) We live in the same house as our guests. Although our guests have the basement practically to themselves, they need to be aware of the fact that creaking floors, slamming doors and people walking up and down the stairs will be noticeable. Sometimes the washing machine and/or the dryer might be in use. During showers or after flushing the toilet the pump disposes of waste water. So, taking baths or showers after midnight might wake up your family/friends. As long as all of us "speak our truth quietly and clearly; and listen to others", to quote Max Ehrm
column8: Our friendly townhouse is beautifully situated near Vondelpark, museum district and entertainment area. It is an excellent starting point for your exploration of Amsterdam because public transport is very close. You will feel at ease in the cosy basement with its comfortable bathroom. Weather depending, you might enjoy our garden, too. Our guests have the basement and the bathroom to themselves. Although there is no kitchen, coffee and tea can be made and a bar cooler is present.  Our guests have access to the garden. Weather depending they could sit outside. Due to it being a courtyard our neighbours need to be respected at all times. (i.e. we ask our guests to refrain from having telephone conversations in the garden, refrain from smoking our talking loudly etcetera) We live in the same house as our guests. column10: Our house is situated in a street that gives access to the Vondelpark, which is a treat in itself. This also opens up the possibility to walk to the museum district (The Modern Art Museum, Van Gogh Museum and the National Museum), a 15-minutes' walk from our house. Leidseplein, with its bars, cinemas and theatres is also a 15-minutes' walk from our house, although if it pubs, you are after you can just take the first corner and grab a beer at Draft and Craft or Café Parallel. Raleigh and Ramsey is a wine bar with a set menu of 29,50, which we like to recommend. Our street gives access to the renowned and stately Vondelpark where you can have a drink and a chat either at the "Blauwe Theehuis" (Blue Tea House), the "Groot Melkhuis" (The Milkhouse) or the "Vondeltuin". At the Vondeltuin you can also rent inline skates. Apart from that, you could also have a picnic at the park or just chill out. At Overtoom you can have your breakfast or lunch at Toasty (Overtoom 437) which can be found ar
column11: Parents with a child over twelve years old are welcome to the house. However, our basement is neither equipped for young children nor is it accessible for disabled people.
column12: Tram number one stops in front of our street. From Schiphol Airport using train and tram, you will arrive at the house within 25 minutes. Furthermore, tram number one takes you to Leidseplein, canal district, Central Station and Station Lelylaan.
column13: The master bedroom has enough closet space, a desk, and two chairs. The windows face street level and can be opened to air the room. Next to this bedroom the bathroom including a shower, tub and toilet can be found. The second bedroom, a rather narrow room with a bunk bed, a table and some closet space gives access to the courtyard garden where our guests can relax.
column14: We always try to be of service to our guests. If anything or any help is needed we are either present or available via our mobile phone. We urge our guests not to be reluctant to call us, if they require our help.

Livia's Hideaway invite you to her charming and authentic hideaway right in the middle of the trendy and historic Jordaan neighbourhood. Situated on the famous Elandsgracht, this recently renovated apartment offers all the comfort and luxury you may expect in a contemporary home.
column7: The apartment features a bright and spacious living area with a comfortable sofa and flat screen making it a great space to sit and relax after a long day. The adjoining dining area and open kitchen create a lively and cosy atmosphere where you and your family/friends can come together and socialize. The open kitchen is fully equipped, including a full-sized refrigerator, dishwasher, oven and microwave. Large French doors lead to the balcony on the backside of the apartment. These doors allow an abundance of natural light and fresh air into the apartment. Next to the kitchen the first bedroom is located offering a small double bed. A toilet is located in the hallway. On the second floor two lovely decorated and spacious rooms are situated with both offering a double bed and more than enough storage room. The family bathroom features a bath/shower combination, sink and toilet. This charming apartment oozes serenity and is beautifully decorated with colourful tones, making this apartment

column10: Livia’s Hideaway 2 is set right in the middle of the trendy and dynamic Jordaan neighbourhood which is located within the famous Amsterdam canal belt. This lively and historic area has a lot to offer and creates the perfect opportunity for you to experience Amsterdam as a local. Trendy design stores, eclectic collection of boutiques, local street markets, cool bars and some of the best restaurants in the city are located here, making this beautiful hideaway a perfect base from which you can explore the city and its nightlife. Within 5 minutes walking distance you can find popular places such as the Anne Frank House, Nine Streets and the Royal Palace at Dam Square. The museum square, home to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and museum of modern art, is just a 15-minute stroll away. Don’t forget to visit the Vondelpark on your way back for that moment of peace and serenity. The city is easily accessible by tram however, bike and boat rental are just around the corner.
column11: Please note that this apartment is located in a residential area and therefore is not suitable for guests with the intention to party. Also please note that due to the Dutch architecture style of the building the apartment is only accessible by a steep stairway. Therefore, this apartment might not be suitable for guests with reduced mobility. The check-in for Livia’s Hideaway 2 Jordaan is done at the apartment itself which is located on the Elandsgracht 110-2, Amsterdam. Our check-in time is between 2PM and 8PM. A late check-in after 8PM comes with an additional charge of 50EUR. Please let us know what your time of arrival is!
column13: The guests have the apartment to themselves.
column25: Hi there! We’re CAP Homes in Amsterdam. Together with our local hosts and over 50 holiday homes distributed across prime locations in the heart of Amsterdam, we are here to make your stay unforgettable. Since 2015, we have been focused on offering holiday accommodations by selecting only the best and coziest apartments in the city for you. We're created several projects as Harbour Suites, Livia's Hideaway and De Vergulden Eenhoorn. We love to focus on personal experience but as well easy/modern way of traveling. Please gloss over our listings carefully to be sure we are good fit for your trip! We appreciate some few words about yourself with your booking, so we get to know each other a bit more before your trip! Thanks!

column6: Large Family house in Amsterdam with garden near waterside A light and comfortable familyhouse, located in the popular living area 'IJburg'. Our house has three floors (145 square meter).

column7: Three bedroom Appartement at the most central place in Amsterdam. Two Double Beds and Two Separate Beds, Kitchen, Living Room and Bathroom. Clean and bright, with everything you wish for at walking distance. Our House Has 3 bedrooms, a kitchen and livingroom. Two bedrooms with double beds and 1 with two separate beds. A separate toilet and a bathroom with shower and toilet. There's a washing machine and kitchen utilities.  About us  We are three female students/starters living at the most central place in Amsterdam. We only use airbnb for a short period. Our interior is not from any designer or matching sometimes but it is the perfect stay in Amsterdam.

column10: The location The best you can get. The house is in a street with loads of restaurants and cafes, so sometimes it is noisy. The appartement is located on the 2th and 3th floor of the building, the rooms on the 3th floor or in the back of the building. There is not much noise in the bedrooms, but please be aware that the noise might be a little higher than you are normally used to.  Close to: - Rijksmuseum - Anne Frankhouse  - Heineken Experience  - Canals/canal houses  - Theatre and cinema - Loads of Restaurants - Shopping - Nightlife; Leidseplein and the area around is, is the party area of Amsterdam. For example: The Melkweg, Paradiso, The Sugar Factory, Chicago Social Club.  | All at walking distance!! |

column6: The apartment is located in a lively area: many nice restaurants, cafés, shops and the famous Albert Cuyp market and the Sarphatipark. It's a great apartment in a quiet street. Rembrandt Square, the canal area, The Heineken Experience and Museum Square a.o. all within 10-15 minutes walking distance!
column7: The room is spacious and has plenty storage space. It comes with a coffee machine (nespresso) and water cooker. 2 places in the room to sit if you would like to eat breakfast in the house. No TV. Very good fast internet through WIFI.
